text: This is a very clever set for decorating that offers tremendous ease and flexibility. The set consists of three black plastic "frames" that are affixed to the wall using adhesive strips with velcro on one side. This allows the frames to be removed easily for swapping out pictures or repositioning. Each of the three frames can be hung flush with the wall, and you get one base extender that can be added to position one of the frames further from the wall. This allows you to overlap frames for a "stacked" effect or to add a sense of depth. The base extender adheres magnetically and is very easy to add or remove. All of this is kind of hard to explain, so I've uploaded pictures to try to show the pieces and finished display.Along with the 3 frames, there are 3 "pictures" that adhere to the frames magnetically. Two of the pictures are art prints (blue abstract nature prints in our set), while the third is actually not a picture at all but is a white display tile which is used to display a photo or art print of the user's choice.The plastic used for the frames and tiles is lightweight but sturdy. I had no problem setting up the display following the enclosed instructions. Each frame has a built in bubble level which is brilliant. The art prints are pleasant if not quite pretty, though one could very easily wrap tiles in fabric or paste on prints of their choosing to come up with a display more to his or her liking. The ability to remove the magnetically attached tiles super easily is a great idea and promotes changing things up whenever the mood strikes.All in all I just think the whole system is a great idea that's been executed well. Flexible, customizable, easy to remove or reposition, sturdy but lightweight construction, expandable, attractive prints...this gets a big thumbs up!

Got this for my wife and she really likes it.  The product page here uses the descriptive phrase "aquatic floral scent" which is very appropriate.  The scent is primarily floral but maintains a nice light and crisp aura that's more youthful than some floral perfumes.  It's not too strong but lasts a surprisingly long time.  The bottle is also really pretty!  A classy, fresh, delicate scent that lasts all day - wifey likes it!

This is a reasonably good TV stand with a few issues.  First, the good:  The finished piece is very sturdy (and holds my TV just fine despite the fact that it weighs 25 or so pounds more than the recommended 65 pound max weight).  It looks nice with a handsome black finish on the sturdy particleboard pieces and handsome nickel plated handles.  It is large enough to work with large TVs (certainly at least 65"+) while maintaining a pretty compact form factor.  The drawers provide a lot of good storage space too and provide a nice complement to the open storage compartments just above the drawers.There are, however, a few issues.  The instructions are okay overall but a few times it is unclear which side of a piece you need facing up or down.  Even worse, 3 of the pre-drilled holes needed to assemble the unit were not drilled out properly (see photo).  I had to us my drill press to fix this problem and would have been really ticked if I didn't have the tools to correct this problem.  The last issue could be a plus or minus - the storage drawers are supported by caster wheels underneath instead of drawer rails inside the unit.  I have carpeted floors which makes opening & closing the drawers difficult since the wheels don't roll especially well on carpet.  Because of the wheels, this unit will work much better on hard floors.  It is usable on carpet, but less than ideal.  Removing the wheels isn't an option since there are no rails supporting the drawers - they would simply sit on the floor without the wheels.Overall I think this is an ok unit which is priced about right.  I would not recommend it for carpeted floors (unless your carpet has a really short pile height).  If you have hard floors, this is a versatile unit that's sturdy, nice looking, and which provides good storage.  I hope the issues I had with the non-drilled holes was a fluke, but my experience didn't engender confidence.

Our favorite car seat we've owned during our kids' baby years was a Britax model our first child used.  The main advantages were how easy it was to strap our son in and how simple it was to tighten or loosen the straps.  We've owned a couple of cheaper brands & models and they invariably involve more convoluted strap systems.  The downside of the Britax, however, was the high cost.  Enter the Evenflo Titan.  This is a comparably nice & simple to use seat at a much lower price.  Adjusting the straps to tighten & loosen is very easy.  So is strapping in.  The seat has ample padding and looks really handsome to boot (even nicer looking that the Britax).  Overall we love this car seat and the price is right.  Thumbs up!

Back in the mid 1970s my parents had me and my brothers each make one of these plates as a gift for our grandparents.  We were so excited when we got to see our finishes plates!  Decades later, after my grandparents had both passed away, the plates made their way back to us grandsons, and I cherish mine.  I decided it was time for my kids (10 & 6) to make a plate and they enjoyed it just as much as I did!  Hopefully they'll do the same with their kids some day...The plates themselves are durable (my 1976 plate is still going strong!) and the images are bright and vivid.  The kit provides one free plate and others can be ordered for a reasonable processing fee (approximately $10 per plate depending upon how many you order).  There are 7 design sheets included in the kit, so you can create multiple designs from one kit (again, with a processing fee for all except the one free plate).  Everything you need it included.  The turnaround time for getting the plates made isn't too long (a few weeks) though it will seem like an eternity for the kids!  It is definitely worth the wait.I can't recommend this more highly - encourages creativity, gives kids a tangible sense of accomplishment, provides a quality keepsake that will last for decades.  I loved it as a kid, I love it as a parent, and I will love it when I become a grandparent someday too!

My 4th grader son and I read this together and both really enjoyed it.  It is a little creepy & melancholy for some younger readers, but for those old enough to appreciate the emotional pull there is much to like in this somewhat dark adventure.  Our protagonist Anastasia finds herself suddenly and unexpectedly informed of the death of both of her parents and whisked away by two very odd & previously unknown "aunts."  Now residing with the aunts at their home in a converted insane asylum, Anastasia tries to make heads or tales of her new life and its terribly strange trappings.  In short order, she realizes that things are not what they seem and resolves to uncover the truth behind the series of unfortunate events she's experienced.  Yes, the story my not be entirely original, but it's still engaging and a lot of fun.  With a sharp wit, sympathetic characters, and a very well-paced unfolding of its central mystery, The League of Beastly Dreadfuls is quite delightful.

Our 4th grade son, who is a pretty avid reader, really enjoyed this book.  He read through it really quickly, which is always a good sign of his approval.  He gave it 5 stars & particularly liked the alternative Jack & the Beanstalk setting, which was richly detailed and fully-developed.  He also liked the fun spirit and plentiful adventures.  My wife read through some of it with him and she echoed his sentiments almost exactly.  Thumbs up from both kid's and also parent's perspectives!

***Full Disclosure - I received this item free for review purposes***  Having tested the Hoover FloorMate Cordless hard floor cleaner, I can say that I am mostly impressed with it.  It is relatively simple to use, provides good freedom with its cordless design, and  does a good job of what is most important - getting hard floors clean.  The price point is on the high end of what I would consider to be a good value, but overall this thing really works.Operation of the unit is mostly intuitive and dummy proof.  Put the water/cleaner mixture in one tank and you're ready to go.  A single power switch turns the unity on and toggles it between two modes - scrub mode and suction mode.  There is a bank of cleaning brush heads on the underside of the cleaner that spin and scrub the floor surface.  Cleaning solution is dispensed by pulling a trigger on the handle.  Scrub mode simply spins the cleaning heads so that dirt, stains, etc can be scrubbed until loosened and cleaned.  The suction mode activates the vacuum feature which sucks the dirty surface water into a second tank.  Generally I operate the unit in scrub mode at first, cleaning a section of the floor first and then switching to suction mode to remove the dirty water from the area.  Then I move on to another section and repeat that process - scrub, suction, scrub, suction, etc - until I've finished the whole area.  I appreciate that the tanks for holding the cleaner/water mixture and for collecting the dirty water are very easy to remove and reattach.  The only part that really requires some practice is the dispensing of the cleaning solution via the trigger - I took awhile to get a feel for how many trigger pulls I needed as I went and how often to apply the mixture.  A little practice, however, and it becomes pretty easy.I found the unit to be very effective for cleaning both my tile and hardwood floors.  If you have any really seriously pernicious cleaning jobs - set in stains, chewing gum, etc - don't expect a miracle.  This will readily loosen and remove normal dirt, footprint, foodstuff kinds of stuff, but it's not a commercial grade floor stripper.  Overall it did a great job and my floors looked clean, vibrant, and streak-free.The battery life is good but not what I'd call stellar.  I was certainly able to clean at least one large room on a single charge (and our kitchen is pretty large with dedicated dining, cooking, and sitting areas).  I was able to get a little more than the 1/2 hour claimed battery life out of a charge.  Don't expect to do multiple rooms on one charge unless the rooms are smaller sized (such as bathrooms, laundry rooms, etc).  Removing and reattaching the battery is ultra-easy.  Being cord free is nice and made it easy to reach far corners, tight spaces, etc.The suction performance was great.  I loved being able to get the dirty water up quickly and having the floors dry in no time.  This is one of the best features of the unit to me - continuously removing dirty water so that you are cleaning with fresh water the whole time.Overall I really like this cleaner.  As mentioned in the intro, my only issue is the price ($250 as of the time of this review).  I was fortunate enough to get to demo a free unit, but I'm not sure I'd be willing to pay $250 despite my appreciation for the device.  The unit is pretty small and seems a bit steep, costing more than other carpet shampoo vacs I've used in the past.Other than value, I really like this cleaner.  Simple to use, well designed with easy to remove & reattach parts, very effective at getting floors clean, long-lasting enough battery to tackle reasonably sized jobs - lots to like here.  Seems a little higher priced than it should be, but if you're not turned away by the price and are interested in an effective hard floor cleaner, it's definitely recommended.

Our six year old daughter is, like 99% of little girls, a big Frozen fan.  She adores this comforter!  The colors are bold and vivid, the graphic looks great, and it is soft and comfortable.  And the icing on the cake is that the reverse side is quite lovely on its own - perfect if you ever want to make things look a little "older" since it lacks the character images while retaining the pretty color scheme.  As a parent, I was quite happy with how durable and well-made the comforter seems - better than expected for a licensed product that could have probably sold well even if of a lower quality.  Big thumbs up from daughter AND dad!

2:30 Mins ***The video was created using Corel VideoStudio Pro X8 for basic demonstration purposes.  I didn't attempt to demonstrate the advanced features of the software but just created a quick project so I could experiment with it and show a sample clip.  The video was captured with a Contour Roam2 action cam.  Please note too that the video quality here suffers from Amazon's processing - it looks far better natively than it does here."Corel VideoStudio Pro X8 is a relatively powerful and user-friendly video editing program that fits nicely between more advanced programs that are hard to learn and more basic programs that don't offer much flexibility.  I have experience with the much more expensive Sony Vegas software on the higher end and a plethora of cheaper and bundled programs on the lower end, but I love the balance offered by Corel's VideoStudio Pro x8.I won't recap the features (stop motion, motion tracking, etc) as those are readily available in the product description here.  Suffice it to say most amateur home users will probably rely on the more basic features, which are plenty good to make appealing video and slideshow productions.  More advanced users will find quite a bit more power under the hood for more customized editing and production.  As expected, the level of flexibility isn't quite as high here as with more expensive programs.  I noticed, for example, that the fade-in and fade-out effects for audio tracks are not as advanced here as they are on Sony Vegas.  Whereas Vegas offers a large variety of preset sound curve profiles for audio fades, VideoStudio applies one simple straight line sound curve fade (though in fairness, you can manually tweak the fade curve to approximate the more complex ones from Vegas but it's time consuming and not quite as nuanced).  This is an example of the kinds of differences you find between this and more expensive programs.  The majority of users simply won't care about the curvature of the sound wave if they choose to fade in or fade out an audio track.  For those who do, the option is there to customize it to a point which should satisfy all but the most demanding users.I have found the software to be stable and perform reliably and smoothly with Windows 7.  The rendering speeds are very fast compared to other programs I've used.  The quality of the effects and transitions are also really good.  The interface is attractive and very similar to that of other video editing programs.  If you've used consumer video editing software programs before you won't find much of a learning curve.  If you haven't, expect to invest some time learning how to use the software.  Corel's website has a number of helpful tutorial videos to help you along the way.  There are also some basic preset templates included which you can use to make videos very quickly through a kind of "drag and drop" approach - great for entry-level users or banging out a quick home movie.  I haven't really found anything to complain about other than the slightly scaled back feature set - and given the price difference between this and more powerful competitors even that isn't really a complaint.If you're looking for affordable video editing software that nails the sweet spot between price vs performance, this deserves a long look.  Inexpensive, powerful enough for most any consumer level application, accessible for new users and able to go deeper for the experienced user, stable and reliable - VideoStudio has a lot to offer.

Tips on how to use and dilute Neem oil :I have listed some recipes / ways to use Neem oil below - but a rule of thumb to remember is to keep your dilution of of Neem oil to about 2 - 5% of any mixture that you apply directly onto your skin. Some of the recipes below use higher percentages - but keep a lookout for any skin irritation.Cuts, wounds, minor skin disorders and mosquito and insect repellantMix with Vaseline or a carrier oil in a ratio of 1:5 and apply to affected area.Athlete’s footAdd 15 ml to warm water and soak the feet in this preparation.Head liceMix 50/50 with a carrier oil and massage into the hair and scalp. Leave on for 1 hour and shampoo. Repeat once weekly for 3 weeks or as long as the problem persists.Stop mosquitoes breedingSpray or pour oil on all breeding areas. The oil can be emulsified (to mix with water) by adding normal dish washing liquid to it.Plant protectionAdd 30 ml to 1 liter of water and add 1 ml of dishwashing liquid. Mix well and spray immediately for plant protection. Do not store the mixture; make fresh formulation for each spray. Spray the mixture on top of all the leaves and on the undersides where insects often hide – you can also spray it around the roots.Lamp oil to ward off mosquitoesAdd 5 – 10% oil to any lamp oil and burn lamp normally.Dandruff and itchy scalpAdd a few drops to your regular shampoo.Ticks and fleas on animalsAdd a few drops to your normal pet shampoo (ratio should be 30 ml (1 oz.) to 240 ml (8 oz.) shampoo). (Personally we have found that plain baby shampoo works the best.WartsApply 1 drop of undiluted oil directly on warts once per day. Watch carefully for any possible irritation, and should that occur discontinue use. Continue for 2-3 weeks.Psoriasis, cold sores, eczema, athletes foot, skin ulcers and other fungal skin conditionsMix 1 tablespoon (15 ml) with 4 ounces (120 ml) carrier oil such as jojoba or grape seed oil and apply twice a day to affected skin. Should skin irritation occur, discontinue use, or make mixture with less Neem oil.Pet and livestock spray for ticks, fleas, mange mites and other pestsMix 1 ounce (30 ml) oil with 1 gallon (3.8 liter) water and add a few drops of dishwashing liquid (to emulsify the oil). Place mixture into a spray bottle or other type of sprayer, and spray animals once every two weeks. (This mixture can be used on indoor and outdoor plants as well as flowers and vegetables.)Cleaning the houseAdd to carpet shampoos and spray mattresses to kill dust mites.Hand washAdd a couple of drops to liquid hand soap for antibacterial properties.FOR ALL THE ABOVEAs Neem oil has a rather strong smell you might want to add a few drops of your essential oil to any mixture to mask the smell. Lavender or lemongrass essential oils work well – but you could add your personal favorite.I received a sample or discount in exchange for my honest review. I was not required to write a positive review & the opinions expressed are 100% my own.

The active ingredient in the fruit's rind, hydroxycitric acid, or HCA, has boosted fat-burning and cut back appetite in studies. It appears to block an enzyme called citrate lyase, which your body uses to make fat. It also raises levels of the brain chemical serotonin, which may make you feel less hungry.I noticed a change in my appetite right away; I was less hungry and started eating smaller meals. Since my scale needs a new battery and I've been too lazy to get one, I can't tell you if I've actually lost weight, but yeah, the appetite has definitely gone down and I'm satisfied much faster.Unlike most weight loss supplements, since this one doesn't work based on a thermogenic method you don't have those godawful jitters and lack of mental focus. Instead it's a very subtle but effective product. For me though, the best part has been the serotonin boost. I'm sleeping better, I'm feeling more refreshed during the day, I'm not dragging so hard when the alarm goes off in the morning, no tossing and turning (despite crippling bursitis pain at the moment) And I've just been all around freakin' cheerful!While I did get this item to review, this is 100% my honest opinion. (I'm very opinionated!)

If you’re baking or cooking with matcha, you absolutely should not use artisanal matcha — it would be a complete waste of both money and great matcha. But, someone might  ask, wouldn’t the quality of the baked goods be that much higher if an artisanal matcha were used?No, it wouldn’t, and here’s why: heat destroys amino acid structures, so everything that’s great about your expensive matcha — its intense umami, its wonderful acid structure, its phytonutrients, and its long finish — gets annulled. Oh, you’ll still get a great green tea vegetal taste, but you can get this taste with culinary matcha which is much more affordable. Fats and sugars make matcha taste pretty good! And besides, many recipes that call for matcha do so in large-ish quantities (multiple tablespoons), so you need a cheaper, but still decent, matcha to not go broke every time you want to use matcha in your cooking.Lots of people have been asking me for a culinary matcha, and I’ve been testing a bunch of them and doing lots of baking and smoothie-making and we have a leading candidate based on color, taste, and affordability!

First of all, let me point out that I have sensitive skin and retinols are notorious for sometimes irritating some people's skin. I did not have this problem at all. After applying I do feel a slight tingling, but it's not painful, it's actually somewhat refreshing! I even put it under and around my eyes with no problem (slightly stingy here, but very slight and it went away quickly ). I saw an immediate superficial difference on my first application; my pores were tightened as was my skin in general.Fine lines were minimized though my deeper crevasses were still visible; from what I understand about retinols, after about a month of use I'll see a big difference there too.In the morning my skin has a glow after absorbing this overnight. I've been using this over a serum and alternating using this under my eyes with an eye cream. After about 3 weeks use, I'm seeing a vast improvement in my skin's texture and evenness and the fine lines are really lessening across the board. My skin feels soft and plump and looks good even without makeup. The circles under my eyes are diminishing and tightening. To get the best out of this stuff, make sure sure your skin is super clean and exfoliated to really absorb the benefits, though this will help with exfoliating and getting rid of dead cells. You can also use this on areas that you feel need a youth treatment, like gnarly old lady hands! (guilty as charged!) I also recommend applying this to your neck and chest for an even look from your face down. These oft neglected areas are actually the worst for showing our age, so treat them well! This is a HUGE bottle, so don't be shy about applying this liberally.I received this product to facilitate my review, however all opinions expressed are my own

Very simple and relatively pain free way to clean out your first line of defense. So many people don't realize that your digestive track is so important to your entire immune system. If you aren't moving well (inside) then you won't be moving well on the outside for long. I have to take these on the lower end of the recommended dosages as my system is fragile and hypersensitive. But even at the low end of the dosage, I feel so much lighter and energetic. The on-going digestive issues that I have dealt with my entire life, while not completely gone, are gentler. Stomach cramps, intestinal cramps, things not moving along as they should, etc. Now, just like a infant, if I eat a meal, I then have to visit the bathroom. This is how your digestion should work: food in / finished out to make room on the track for the new nutrients.I received a sample or discount in exchange for my honest review. I was not required to write a positive review & the opinions expressed are 100% my own.

This mic bar is well made, it feels solid and the finish is smooth. It comes with two 3/8" female to 5/8" male adapters, so you can use it with any standard 3/8" or 5/8" mic mounts.Pros:----------------------------+ Strong and durable, the construction quality and finish are both excellent.+ Adjustable mic mounts work perfectly, very easy to mount and unmount mics to them or adjust the position.+ Includes 3/8" to 5/8" adapters+ Bottom female 5/8" threaded mount is perfect, large easy to grip textured outer casing+ Great value for the moneyCons / Considerations:----------------------------- Included 3/8" to 5/8" adapters can get stuck in your mic mounts. Taller adapters with some grip below the threads for easy removal would have been better.Note: the item I received differs from the current product picture on Amazon. As of this review, the product picture shows a threaded stud in the middle of the mount. The item I received does not have a middle stud, only two outer adjustable studs. I have uploaded a picture here:http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/permalink/mo1XBMA2SRGWFBJ/B001G43G96/

These clamps are so incredibly useful for many different jobs. They are primarily designed for clamping to light stands, booms or tripods, but will clamp onto just about anything. Motorcycles and vehicles, fence or patio rails, doors, tables, and counters are just the beginning. The included wedges make these clamps easy to use on flat surfaces.The build quality is excellent. The main clamp bodies are made form beefy thick aluminum, with steel and brass hardware. The main tightening handle is plastic, but it is very strong and I have never been worried that it might break. The side pin tightening handle is also plastic, everything else is metal.The rubberized grip surfaces are very durable and won't peel off like cheaper clamps.This clamp has one 5/8" (16mm) hex stud receiver (this version comes with a stud) and one 1/4 - 20 threaded female that is centered in the clamp. The hex stud receiver has a quick release and also a bolt with a plastic handle on the side that can be tightened to firmly secure the stud.There are an limitless pins and accessories you can use with these clamps to mount virtually anything.Accessories that I use regularly:* Joining studs: Manfrotto 061RA Right Angle Joining Stud for Super Clamp and Manfrotto 061 Joining Stud for Super Clamps - Replaces 2913* 1/4" male for the 1/4" threads Smallrig 1/4" Male to 1/4" Male Threaded Screw Adapter (2-pack)* 3/8" Stud Manfrotto 036- 38 Stud for Super Clamp with 3/8-Inch European Thread or Manfrotto 088 Stand 1/4-20-Inch Female to 3/8-Inch Male 20mm Long Adapter - Replaces 3103 for included 1/4" stud* Short stud Manfrotto 037 Reversible Short Stud - Replaces 2907* Perfect fit hex stud grip head Kupo Grip Head with Hex Stud KG202011* Full size pin Avenger E600C 5/8-Inch Snap-In Steel Pin for Super Clamp* Magic arm Manfrotto 244 Variable Friction Magic Arm with Camera Bracket - Replaces 2929You can even use 3/8 to 5/8 microphone thread adapters to mount full size microphones with this clamp.The possibilities are pretty much endless.I have tried a few of the cheaper knock-off super clamps from various vendors, but none of them came close to matching the original Manfrotto build quality. these clamps might seem a bit expensive compared to the knockoffs, but they will last forever and you really do get a better clamp for the extra money.

The nylon washers in this set are excellent. The fiber washers are just ok.The case is a soft plastic which is great. It's not the brittle hard plastic hat breaks so easily, but it's thin and doesn't feel very durable. For keeping these washers organized it's fine, but I wouldn't expect it to hold up forever or withstand much abuse on a job site.The fiber washers are rough around the edges and there's a lot of fiber splintering off them. They're usable but not the best quality.The nylon washers are smooth and well made, I'm very happy with them.

This clamp will come in handy for so many situations.It's fast and easy to set up, can grip to just about anything, and the construction quality is top notch. The jaws are primarily designed for gripping a rod and work beautifully without damaging the rod surface, but will also work on flat objects or tables.I prefer to use a Manfrotto Super Clamp Manfrotto 035 Super Clamp without Stud - Replaces 2915 for anything that is very heavy, but this clamp is perfect for smaller or lighter things like LED lights, GoPro, reflectors, etc.The  combination of 1/4" and 3/8" threads make it easy to mount just about anything to this clamp. The 1/4" threads are on the side of the tightening handle that stays at about 90 to your clamp surface. The 3/8" threads are on the side of the clamp opposite the tightening handle, they will move slightly when the clamp is opened or closed. This gives you the option of two different mounting angles and can be very useful.Compared to the similar Manfrotto Nano Clamp Manfrotto 386B Nano Clamp (Black), this clamp is about one third of the price. It's a bargain and represents a very good value for the money.The soft grip surface does appear to be the weakest point in the construction quality of this clamp. Fortunately, it's easy enough to remove and replace it if necessary.

This short stud will join two super clamps together, back to back. One half of the stud fits into each super clamp, so they fit together tightly.It's made from aluminum and is very light, but it's also thick and very strong.This was designed for the Manfrotto Super Clamp Manfrotto 035RL Super Clamp with 2908 Standard Stud - Replaces 2900 - Black but will also work with Impact Super Clamp Impact Super Clamp with Ratchet Handle, Kupo Convi Clamp Kupo Convi Clamp with Adjustable Handle - Black, KG701511, and all the other other super clamp knockoffs that have the same size female stud socket.There are two versions of this stud available, each will allow you to mount the clamps at different angles to each other. One stud cannot achieve all angles due to limitations of way the studs can fit into the 5/8" hexagonal female receiver on the clamps. This stud (Manfrotto 061) will mount the clamps in parallel, or at 180°, 120º or 60º but not at 90°. The 061RA right angle stud Manfrotto 061RA Right Angle Joining Stud for Super Clamp will allow you to mount the clamps at a 90°, 30º, or 150º offset.It's a good idea to get both studs if you use them often, you can get almost any angle you need with both of them.

A tire repair kit is essential to carry on all offroad trips.Compared to other similar kits, this ARB kit is one of the best but does have some disadvantages.These plug kits will allow you to repair punctures by removing the foreign object, reaming the puncture hole to make room for a plug, and inserting a sticky self vulcanizing tire plug to seal the hole. These plugs work on the tread area of a tire, they are not meant to be used on the sidewall. You will be repairing the tire form the outside only, so it's not advisable to keep this as a permanent fix. For a permanent fix, the tire should be dismounted and the inside of the plugged hole should be treated with a bonding agent. The plugs included with this kit and similar products will get you back home or to a tire shop where you can get a permanent fix.Pros of this kit:------------------+ The best reamer and insertion tools available+ Tool shaft/needles are not powder coated (this makes them much more effective)+ Insertion tool includes a slider to hold the plug in when removing the tool+ Includes internal valve stem parts, something most other kits don't have+ Tire pressure gauge is ok, not great but not a total POS like most other kitsCons / Considerations:---------------------- The orange plastic case is big and bulky- Contents of the case rattle and make noise with vibration- Does not include extra insert tool or reamer blades/needles- Does not include complete valve stems like some other kits- More expensive than most other available kitsThe case is the main issue I have with this ARB kit, other cons are very minor. If this kit had a soft case that was smaller and didn't rattle, it would be the best kit available. The plastic case may not be an issue for you if you are keeping it in a trunk, more of an issue in a Jeep.Comparison to competing kits:----------------------------There are a number of other high quality tire repair kits available around this price point or lower, I have reviewed some of them also, but I'll share a little about each kit I am familiar with here and how they stack up.Power Tank's kit Power Tank KIT-8133 Tire Plug Kit has a far superior nylon roll case. It's smaller and does not rattle. The Power Tank tools are not as good as this ARB kit, and the tool shafts/needles are ridiculously powder coated.Safety Seal's kit Safety Seal 30 String Pro Tire Repair Kit has the best plugs. The case and kit is similar to this ARB kit but with steel tools instead of aluminum. Safety Seal has been making the best tire plugs for decades, get them as replacements no matter what kit you end up with.Rugged Ridge's kit Rugged Ridge 15104.51 Tire Repair Kit is less expensive and includes extra tips for the tools. The tools are decent quality, not powder coated. Has a similarly bulky and rattle-prone hard plastic case.Smittybuilt's kit Smittybilt 2733 Tire Plug and Seal Kit is very similar to the Power Tank kit. The Smittybuilt kit is currently available at half the price of the Power Tank or ARB kits. It has a zippered nylon case that is quiet, easy to carry and pack into your rig. Unfortunately, the Smittybuilt kit suffers from the same powder coated tool issues that the Power Tank kit has, and the insertion tool is also missing a slider. This kit is a very good value for the money.All of the kits mentioned above are good kits, any one of them will serve you well. It's nice to have so many good options available. I hope this will help you choose.

These adapters are inexpensive and work fine, but the construction quality isn't the best I have seen. Don't expect these to last forever unless you are very careful with them.Hosa makes some excellent audio cables and adapters. You can usually depend on the name for above average to extremely high quality products that will take a beating and last a long time. These don't feel up to scratch compared to other Hosa products.A good buy if you need something light duty.

The length of this cable (3 feet) is perfect for desktop or patching applications.This cable combines two 1/4" TS plugs into a 3.5mm stereo TRS (a.k.a. mini headphone) plug.Shielding is thick but the cable is still very flexible. It has a soft rubbery feel, not plastic-y like lower end cables.Feels like it will last for a long time.No problems with the sound.Made in China.

The length of this cable (3.25 feet) is perfect for desktop or patching applications.Shielding is thick but the cable is still very flexible. It has a soft rubbery feel, not plastic-y like lower end cables.Hosa has always made good quality cables, this one is no exception.Sound is very clean.Made in China.

The Global G-16 is an extremely versatile knife due to it's length, blade shape, and weight. It's very well balanced, the weight feels perfectly distributed.This is unquestionably one of the best knives you can get in this price range.This is my go-to knife for almost everything. It's excellent for chopping and slicing vegetables, herbs, greens, and meat.Due to it's thin blade profile and edge, the G-16 is not particularly great for extremely thick or hard things like butternut squash or chicken bones. For those tasks I prefer a thicker knife with more heft to it, or a cleaver.I have owned this knife for more than 3 years and have used it almost every day since I got it. I also own its little brother, the 8" G-2 Global G-2 - 8 inch, 20cm Chef's Knife, a great knife as well. I use the 10" G-16 much more often than the 8" G-2. I could do without the 8" knife, but not without this knife.If you are not a professional chef, this may be the last chef's knife you will ever need to buy. Sure you will need some smaller knives for specific purposes, but this knife will handle almost any job and with proper care the edge will stay razor sharp.This knife will brunoise an onion perfectly with ease, make quick work of a whole bundle of herbs such as parsley or rosemary, cut through large carrots like butter, and finely slice a tomato or anything else with precision.Take good care of your Global knives and they will last a lifetime.
+ Made in the USA+ Works Perfectly+ Fits with all 1" Ram Mount Arms+ Gives a joint that can pivot in any direction+ Durable, High Quality Construction+ Good PricesGet one!

I tried almost a dozen different gaming mouse pads over the past 6 months or so, looking for the perfect combination of durability, control, precision, speed, and non-slippage on my glass desk. The Razer Destructor 2 is it.This mouse pad has a 'control' surface, the texture has enough 'grit' to it give you the perfect combination of precision without sacrificing speed. Some 'speed' mouse mats are faster, but lack control. This one is well balanced.The entire backside is covered in rubberized grip. It does slide a tiny bit on my glass desk, but it stays put better than any other mouse pad I tested. If the grip surface could be improved a little so that it would not slip at all then this mouse pad would be 100% perfect.It's thin which also helps it to not slip so much, but it feels well constructed. It's not completely stiff like aluminum pads, it's made from a slightly flexible plastic.I'll post an update if there's any issues with durability or anything else in the future, but so far this mouse pad is awesome.

This is an oil blend that contains Vitamin E oil and several other oils that are all very good for the skin.It smells heavenly (mostly like almond) and feels luxurious on the skin.Some oils can feel very greasy and unpleasant on the skin. This oil is thinner and seems to get absorbed easily, it feels silky smooth.This product is not 100% Vitamin E oil, but you should know that when ordering. It's clearly advertised as being a 5,000 iU Vitamin E oil blend. Pure Vitamin E oil is very thick and gooey stuff.Ingredients:------------Safflower oil and/or soybean oil, almond oil, apricot oil, avocado oil, wheat germ oil, vitamin E, lecithin, propylparaben, fragrance.

These things are virtually indestructible.Your gear is safe inside, even in extreme weather or if the case takes a beating.I use this 1610 case with padded dividers for video and photo equipment. It's perfect for the job and holds a lot of gear.This size is too large for a carry on with most (or maybe all) airlines. If you need a carry on size, go with the 1510 which is also an excellent case but slightly smaller - Pelican 1510-004-110 Case with Padded Dividers, BlackThe padded divider system is awesome, it can be customized to fit the specific combination of gear you are carrying. Simply detach the Velcro pieces and re-attach them where needed, it's very easy and there is no messy cutting required like the foam models.Possible downside to this case is that it's very heavy, even when empty. The rollers are definitely required to lug this thing around full of gear.I'm very happy with all my pelican cases, they may be a bit expensive but they will last forever. The quality/durability value is actually very good.

This case fits the Neat Receipts scanner perfectly, it will protect it from dust, scratches, etc.The case is good but not perfect.Pros:+ Nice slim fit+ Not bulky+ Scanner easily slides in and out+ There's a slot on the back fro the USB cableCons:- The neoprene material is a dust magnet, and difficult to dust off due to the texture.- Trying to put the USB cable into the slot on the back is a tight squeeze- Price seems high for what you getOverall I am happy with it, and at least it's less expensive than the hard case.

I have several of these on my desk, have been using them for years.This jumbo size will hold larger items like rulers, scissors, large markers, etc. I also use one of them for a mini "laundry hamper" for washable micro fiber wipes, it works perfectly for this.Build quality is excellent, there are no sharp edges.For the price, it's hard to beat this little organizer.

**Update 2014.02.19**My original review was 5 stars because initially this card worked perfectly.Unfortunately, after about 30 days, this card stopped working altogether. It worked just long enough for the 30 day return period on Amazon to expire.I contacted the seller to see if they would offer any help with my dead card, but they never responded.I'm stuck with this dead card and had to order another one. I went with another brand this time, hopefully it will last longer.My original five star review:----------------The drivers on the supplied CD work perfectly on Windows 7.Installation is a snap:1. Turn off your PC.2. Install the card in an open PCI-E slot, secure with mounting screw.3. Boot up your PC and insert the supplied CD to install the driver.That's it, enjoy additional USB ports.Transfer speeds are just as fast as the USB 3.0 ports built into my high-end Asus motherboard.The included Molex to SATA power adapter is a nice touch, making this work with any power supply.Build quality seems fine, I'll post an update if there are any issues in the future.

This is an excellent product that works to keep your ear buds safely stored and tangle-free.My only complaint is that there is not enough room for the cord to wrap around the outside. I don't think my ear buds have a particularly long cord, but the cord just barely fits and sometimes parts of the cord pop out. The 'tabs' on the top to hold in the wrapped cord are very small and don't really do the job.There is a lot of space on the inside where the ear buds themselves go, probably much more than anyone needs. The design of the product could be improved a lot by redistributing some of the extra space on the inside to allow for more room to wrap the cord on the outside.This is still a great product and does work well, better than any other solution I have found.

For the price, I didn't expect much from this mount. Sadly, I was still disappointed.The construction quality of this mount is very poor. The whole mount is flimsy and several parts on it are made from thin brittle plastic that looks like it will break easily, such as the folding support for the bottom of the phone.I would not trust this mount to hold my phone during bumpy rides or even for the suction cup to stay attached.Then there is the smell. Upon opening the box, I noticed that this mount has a very strong chemical smell. It smells like tar/cigarette smoke. Every time I handled this mount, the smell got on my hands. I've experienced similar issues with a few other items made in China before, usually they just need a few days to "air out". After 3 days the smell is still very strong.I returned this mount and ordered a RAM mount to replace it. The RAM mount was 4x more expensive, but feels very solid and makes this mount look like a toy. The extra money is well worth it when you consider it is holding your expensive phone.

These micro fiber wipes are invaluable.I use these for cleaning glasses, camera lenses, monitors, and even my smartphone screen.Most of the time, they work perfectly when dry, without any spray cleaner. When cleaning particularly dirty glasses, adding a spray or a few drops of of alcohol really helps.I have tried many other micro fiber wipes, these are by far the best.

This is an unusual spin on the classic "Alice in Wonderland" tale, with nuances best appreciated by adults. The story is good... odd, but good. The casting was very good. The performances were very good. The set designs and special effects were impressive.Depp brings an interesting interpretation to the Mad Hatter, and while his performance seemed a little restrained (both for him and for what this movie could have been), he also brings magic to this film.It's not quite "great for the entire family," unless your children are 10 years old or older. (Younger ones may not understand what's going on in some scenes, and little children might actually be frightened by some of them.)The "big head" and other physical distortions was amusing, but barely held up as a running sight gag. It seemed almost like filler for a story that needed more substance.Alice... I'm not sure if it was the casting or the direction, but I found it difficult to care what happened to her. Frankly, she was pretty to look at, but seemed rather vapid. I didn't see much character arc there.Tweedledee and Tweedledum were charming, and probably could have had more screen time.The White Queen was confusing. I didn't dislike her, but I didn't like her, either. Her character didn't make sense... but not in the charming, "nonsensical" context that Carroll had provided in his stories.The Red Queen did seem nonsensical and delightfully warped. Helena Bonham Carter can shine in any role, and I think this one -- between the script and the makeup -- probably challenged her more than most roles she's played. I wish we'd seen more of her character's eccentricities.Depp's role was enigmatic, but something seemed lacking; I'm not sure if he was distracted, or not given enough to work with, but -- whatever the issue -- he did a very good job in this role.. just not what it could have been.I know this review sounds as if I didn't like the movie, but I did. It just wasn't as good as it could have been, and not quite up to the standards I expect from Disney, Burton, and the cast. If I'd watched it with lower expectations, I might be giving this a better review.On balance, this movie is intriguing enough to be worth watching, if only as a preparation for the 2016 sequel... which I hope will be more dazzling, stylish, and whimsical. This movie didn't quite achieve what I'd expected, in those terms, but it came close enough that I can say I liked it and I'm glad I purchased the DVD.

I had no idea this was going to be an a shallow send-up of the original TV series, but I would have been okay with that... if this had been a good film. Unfortunately, its deeply self-indulgent and not quite campy enough (or ridiculous enough) to be hilariously funny.Unlike the TV series, there's no attempt to make this believable. Depp's makeup and styling are so preposterous, there is no way anyone would take him seriously. So, yes, it's a parody.The problem is, most of the performances lack commitment and the fun I expect from a good parody. If Depp had brought even half the whimsy and flair of his Jack Sparrow performance -- not the drinking, slurred speech, and so on, but the added style and energy this part deserved -- he could have saved this film, all by himself.Helena Bonham Carter's performance did have some sparkle, but -- with far less screen time -- even her talents seemed subdued. (That's saying a lot, if you're familiar with her work. She has an innate gift for taking roles to an extreme, with so much authenticity, even the silliest characters become fascinating and vibrant.)To be perfectly honest, this movie is awful if you're watching it for entertainment. Especially while sober.However, as a reference for traditional Gothic storytelling, this film excels. The character profiles, sets, and story elements -- while often overdone -- hit the key points expected by fans of Gothic romantic mysteries.If you're an aspiring traditional Gothic novelist, buy the DVD. Watch the film and take notes. Also, the brief list of iconic characters -- and too-short insights in related interviews -- make it worth the low price (and time) you'll spend on this.

I bought this for my husband, who -- on a recent business trip -- left his favorite back brush a thousand miles away.Well, this really is as pink/magenta-ish as it looks in the photo. Fortunately, my husband thinks that's hilarious.And, as a back scrubber, this brush definitely holds up better than the ones with "optional removable head" (that always falls off at the wrong time).It's sturdy, a little shorter than its counterparts we've seen in stores, but it still reaches the entire back. The bristles are fairly soft (not scratchy in a bad way), and seem more densely packed (and in larger supply) than store counterparts, as well.The added nylon (cord) loop is a nice touch, and makes this easy to hang up in the shower.

What made this worth watching (and buying) was the cohesive history of time travel. I expected more bells and whistles, and more "gee, wow" footage, so I can't give this five stars. However, as a solid, documentary-style overview of the subject, it presented good, clear information.As a research resource, it's excellent. As entertainment, it's a little bland in the context of the topic.

From the series' description, I expected a clever premise. Instead, it's another modern Western. For those who appreciate this genre, it might be great... even a wonderful must-see.I'm a fan of innovative concepts and breakout premises, and appreciate vintage Western settings. So, for me, it wasn't daring enough or interesting enough.It's probably a cut above typical cable network fare, and may offer enough to appeal to fans of this genre.

This is a fast-paced, stylish, whimsical movie worth watching over and over again. The story is preposterous. The costuming, sets, and writing are top-notch. Even the most ridiculous leaps of logic are presented seamlessly.If you like Amelie and fantasy, you'll love this film. (And, if you speak enough French to spot the slight differences between what's said and what the captions say... that's an added bonus. Not at all needed to thoroughly enjoy this film, but worth mentioning.)

I was trying to decide between one star ("I hate it") and two stars ("I don't like it") and realized I didn't care enough about it to hate it.It's sort of Gothic, and sort of bellydancing. The performer -- the only one I saw, as I turned this off after about ten boring minutes -- has some bellydancing skills. The music was sort-of good. The costume was a little confusing, but the production was okay. Just okay.This could have been a great video if it had been created with real commitment to bellydancing and the Gothic aesthetic. Instead, I felt that I could probably find better at YouTube.Yes, this is free to watch with Amazon Prime. And, for someone using it as background music/video during a late-night work or study session, it might be entertaining enough. It's also possible I didn't watch it long enough for the video to launch into anything stylish.However, it didn't seem worth my time, and I can't recommend it.

This was okay. I watched it to the conclusion, but it didn't really hold my interest. I felt as if this story would have made an excellent movie, but as a series, it lacked depth. To me, there was a constant sense that things were being held back, and would be revealed in future episodes. However, so much was held back, I didn't really care about the characters. Ricci's performance was adequate; had she been given clearer direction and better dialogue, I think her performance would have been impressive. She seemed to be trying to bring sparkle and whimsy to the role, but didn't have much to work with.The script, the sets, and all those little details that make a period piece stunning... they just weren't there. Instead, viewers were presented with stereotypes that could have been from any "flapper defies her dysfunctional family and community standards" story.The image that goes with this series says it all. It's overly simplistic, cliche'd, and -- literally -- two-dimensional. This could have been a rich, vibrant story, and fascinating, even to those who know the real history. Instead, this show let the audience down -- and probably much of the cast and production team.

This documentary offers far more than the low-key title and DVD cover suggest. It includes insightful vintage photos and film footage, plus interviews with those close to Montagu, past and present. What viewers discover is an overview of history -- from the early 20th century to the present -- highlighting the plight of stately homes, the resourcefulness of Lord Edward Montagu (despite deep injustices), and what really happened to much of the upper class following World War II.This is a must-see for anyone interested in genuine history, stately British homes, and -- oddly enough -- automobiles. This fascinating documentary shows how the efforts of one man saved from destruction and loss not just his home, but also the real history of the motorcar.

For at least five years -- possibly longer -- I've been using the speech recognition software that's built into almost every Windows operating system. Before that, I'd used Via Voice (from IBM) from its earliest days.I wouldn't have considered Dragon (since its Windows counterpart is free), but I saw Dragon demonstrated as part of some training I watched, online. The instructor's results with Dragon were far better than what I'm accustomed to with Windows' speech recognition, even when it's been "trained" for years.I researched Dragon options. I'm using Windows 7, so I was looking for great reviews from people using the same OS.To me, it looked like Dragon NaturallySpeaking 11 was the best for my purposes. (I'm a writer. I dictate my articles and books in my home office.)  Not 11.5 or anything higher, but specifically version 11.So, I bought this. As I installed it on my computer, I panicked. I have 2GB of RAM and the software advised me that was half of the 4GB they recommend.I hoped my Blue Yeti microphone would offset any issues, during use.I needn't have worried. I did use my Yeti microphone, and I did "train" the software with the four-minute reading from Alice in Wonderland.Then, I tested Dragon in my Scrivener software.Results: 100% accuracy, from the start.I'm impressed and recommend this to anyone who wants genuinely smart speech recognition software. Free is good (Windows' alternative), but superb accuracy -- and the time it saves -- is what Dragon delivers. Totally worth it!

This is the second or third of these that I've bought. This newest model is a little clunky. Turning the lid so it clicks (a safety feature) can be difficult if your hands aren't completely dry (they can slip) and strong.The blade on this model is by far the sharpest I've seen. Be very careful when handling it.However, for chopping onions or something like chicken (for chicken salad), this is tremendous. And, if you need to practically pulverize food while recovering after dental surgery -- so no real chewing is required -- this can make almost any food more enjoyable.

My husband and I have used "sensitive" toothpastes in the past, including the leading brands recommended by dentists. After trying this toothpaste, we've each realized that other toothpastes merely numb teeth and gums. That's a short-term solution, at best.This toothpaste addresses the actual issues -- the tooth problems -- while providing non-numbing ACTUAL relief for anyone with sensitive teeth. Hot foods and cold foods aren't an issue now, and between this toothpaste and Dr. Collins' Perio Toothbrushes, my teeth have never felt cleaner or better.

Wow. I had NO idea these toothbrushes would be SO much better at cleaning teeth, with so little discomfort, and do such amazingly good things for my gums.I have and use floss. I have and use regular, soft toothbrushes... even extra soft, when I can find them. I have and use a water-pic device.Nothing comes even close to cleaning my teeth and getting between the gums (for cleaning and better gum health) like these toothbrushes.Despite my previous, usual attention to my teeth & gums, I was amazed at the amount of bleeding during the first week I used this brush. I was also astonished when my teeth felt like they'd just had a thorough cleaning at the dentist's office.A couple of weeks later, I was equally surprised (and delighted) to see how much healthier my gums were.If I'd had this kind of toothbrush years ago, I'd have saved myself a lot of dental work and gum issues.My advice: Stop using grocery store and pharmacy toothbrushes... even the fancy/expensive ones. Try these instead. You'll never go back to anything else.
I bought this for my granddaughter and it's her favorite Elmo, so far. (She owns several of them in different styles and sizes.) Perfect size for a toddler, and soft enough to cuddle.

I bought this when we were visiting Florida and I needed to do some detailed artwork in Photoshop, but I'd left my tablet at home. It does save some time. The design is pretty good. It reduced my carpal tunnel soreness. And, it works fine in tandem with my regular computer mouse. However, the buttons aren't as well-placed as I'd like. (I'm not sure that they had alternatives, though, due to the small size of this.) Still, it feels a little clunky to use and I went back to using the mouse, instead.

The pencils are very good, and the colors are nice. This is a good collection of colors, as well. However, I bought my set as an Amazon Warehouse Deal and two pencils were missing (though the description suggested the only problem was a broken case), which may color my opinion of this set.Frankly, if you're looking for colored pencils for use in coloring books, these aren't soft enough. Get Prismacolor Premiers, instead. Amazon offers them at a great price, and -- for coloring books -- their quality is vastly better than Staedtler's.

If you regularly need quotes and want to find them faster (and better organized) than what's online, as well as some unusual quotes, this book is excellent. It's also thick and heavy and makes a great doorstop. This is the second time I've bought this book. I barely used the first copy and gave it to Goodwill. A year or so later, it turned out that I needed it.

This was a fun trip down memory lane, but this montage of film clips could have been far better edited. Seeing the "Fab Four" in the early days was surprising, partly because they looked so very young, but also -- and this seemed odd -- Paul McCartney looked... different.

Really, David Suchet as himself and as Poirot, exploring the history and character of Agatha Christie... how could any Christie fan not love this? Suchet's clear love of Christie and her characters make this a must-see.

I think I lasted about 20 minutes into this tedious, slow-paced, redundant film. The low budget was painfully obvious and handled amateurishly. Even the moments that might have been endearing or fun and quirky... they were either given too little screen time or neglected for too long to become running jokes. After about 15 minutes, I realized that I didn't care about these people and the story seemed vapid. I gave it another five minutes before hitting the Stop button on my remote, and moving on to something actually entertaining.

This is a modern telling of a classic style of ghost story. It's a little predictable, but -- for me -- that made it kind of endearing.The writing is good. It's not entirely credible, but that's okay. The story elements are a nice mix, anyway. The alternating viewpoints were a little jarring at times, and some of the tale felt rushed, but those are minor issues. They didn't detract much from the reading experience.If you're expecting a nice, tidy ending... this isn't that kind of story. However, if you're a fan of classic ghost stories (19th century and early-to-mid 20th century) that leave you a little unsettled, this is a fine addition to the genre.I read this story in one sitting, and I will read more by this author. His attention to detail is very good.

I tried these because I like their Moon Drops (to reduce insomnia and improve sleep), and I'd hoped these would help me unwind on stressful days when I still had work to complete.For me, they helped a little, but not enough that I'm able to rave about them. And, the relief wasn't consistent, either.When I first tried Moon Drops, it took about four different days (or nights) for me to see results. I've tried Calm Drops a similar number of times, and -- so far -- I haven't seen much improvement.They're good, but not great, and definitely not as helpful as Moon Drops.

Everyone should read this book. No exceptions. For me, it was wall-to-wall "ah-HA!" moments. It explained so much about people who've annoyed me long past the point where I should have walked away from them, and not looked back. I kept giving them a second chance. Or, I thought it was just a misunderstanding, and we could talk it out.One of the most liberating parts of this book was understanding the chilling logic behind sociopathic behaviors. (This isn't always an on/off switch. Many people aren't wholly sociopathic or completely free of those behaviors.)I also liked learning that my tendency to be polite with them, no matter what, is a waste of time. I canNOT offend them. I need to quit looking at them through the "do unto others" filter, and invest that level of caring and energy in situations where it will make a positive difference.The genetic component was troubling, but -- remembering difficult people in my past -- it made sense.This is a fairly brutal book. It's also a book that every person needs to read. If you've ever wondered why someone treated you rudely, meanly, or downright cruelly, when -- as far as you could tell -- you'd only been caring and thoughtful with them... you really need to read this book.I'm about to read this book for a second time, because the lessons in it are so challenging and different from anything I've read anywhere else. This book answered questions that have bothered me for more than 10 years. Some, even longer than that. And, this information becomes vastly more important as we deal with a changing world, online and off.A friend recommended this book to me, and I'm very glad that he did. Finally, I have answers that make sense.

This book was a total surprise. It's an engaging story with well-rounded characters. The author definitely knows how to write. She's clearly a cat lover as well.The plot is simple. I noticed one inconsistency early in the story that led me to suspect the actual villain. However, I wasn't sure enough to put the book down, and read it in one sitting.When I reached the conclusion, it felt a little like an information dump. Then, I realized the author had shown us the clues all along. She'd just explained them -- through the eyes or dialogue of the protagonist -- and I took her explanations at face value. It was a clever, effective, and stylish deception!I'm surprised by how much I liked this book. I had low expectations for such a short mystery, especially one that provides so much information about multiple cats, they're pretty much secondary characters.The author didn't rush anything. This is a well-constructed story told in just a few pages.Cat lovers will definitely like this book, and probably the others by this author. Mystery lovers may be as impressed as I was, and enjoy it as an entertaining read that can be completed in one sitting.

I struggled to stay interested in this book. That's saying a lot since I love mysteries, and I've written a few myself.Initially, I had the feeling this book was outsourced. The writing doesn't have a clear "voice." While I could attribute that to the way the co-authors worked together, I think it's something else.Frankly, I think they took a detective how-to manual and tried to rephrase it so it sounded like they were speaking as mystery writers. For me, that didn't work.For starters, this book has a narrow focus. It's for people writing detective stories and police procedurals, not cozies. Mostly, this book discusses the mechanics of being a detective, interviewing witnesses, and so on. It's not especially stylish, and some of the material... it's rather boring. I felt like they were trying to fill pages, not share helpful insights.While I gleaned a couple of good insights from this book, the writing didn't flow. It was difficult to read.I feel like the authors' assembled this book with good intentions, but the book isn't chatty enough to be fun reading. Maybe my first guess -- that they hired someone to write this for them -- is correct.Others have written better police- and detective-related guides for mystery writers. I especially like the "Howdunit Series" for writers, and give those books my highest recommendations.

I was pretty sure this was part of a serial, so I was fine with the brevity of it. The writing style is good, probably better than most among indie books in this genre. The book ends on kind of a cliffhanger, but she's set the stage pretty well. The story begins like any other blog or journal you might read: a little of this, a little of that, and a pretty good sense of personality. The focus narrows to the paranormal near the end of this book.I'd have liked more paranormal content in this story, and I think many readers will prefer this in a bundled set so they feel as if they've gotten more for their money.However, it's a good start. While I'm not sure if I'll read the next book, I didn't feel let down by this one.

This is a good book for new and aspiring authors. The author covers a lot of territory, quickly, with some good examples that get his point across. More experienced authors -- familiar with story beats and where to get good fiction ideas -- may not be dazzled by this book, but I liked his reminders about the methods and motivations of old-school pulp authors. They were good reminders about staying focused and blasting through "writer's block" to get the book finished.

The cover is great. The information inside has moments of brilliance, but it rambled a little too much to hold my interest.I'm pretty sure the author is a great speaker. If this were a talk (or an audiobook), I'd probably hang on every word and appreciate the humor more than I did. It reads like a really great presentation.A beginner will learn a lot from the advice in this book. Also, it includes many beautifully phrased insights that can inspire almost any writer.It just didn't dazzle me as the cover did. The tone was conversational, not powerful. The information is good, and sometimes great, so I hate to sound critical, but I think this author should consider focusing on audiobooks, online courses, and (offline) personal appearances and workshops.

As I said in my review of her other book (about marketing Kindle books), this appears to be a very weak attempt at parody.It fails, badly. We're not included in the joke.For example, instead of saying "How I Make $40,000 a Month...," it could be "How I Make $4 Billion a Month..." or something equally silly. Then, the reader would expect parody. Then, it has a better chance at being amusing or even zany.I can only assume that this is an inside joke among the author and her friends, to see how many people will download this book and expect it to deliver anything helpful.Or, it's a Dada-inspired attempt at performance-art-as-books, and it's intended to be mundane and annoying.Either way, it's not funny, it's not very creative, and it's not worth your time. It's not bad enough to hate, just a blatant copy of basic writing information, repetitious and peppered with typos.The good news is: At least this book is free. So, she gets a minor nod for being responsible enough not to charge anyone for this very weak effort.

I'm embarrassed to admit that -- despite the title -- I didn't realize this was a parody. Hey, in real life, I know people earning that kind of money with their Kindle books, so I thought this book (and the companion book about writing Kindle books) would offer some fresh insights.Yes, I know. The hyperbolic book description, title, and exclamation points should have been a hint. The shameless use of Amazon's trademarks, ditto.And, before downloading this, I should have looked at her other silly book titles -- "... Get Rich Quick!" and "... Be A Women Magnet Without Doing Anything!" -- to realize these are a running joke.The thing is, I've read other books with similar titles and equally "oh dear heaven" descriptions, and they were by authors who'd stumbled onto some great writing or marketing technique. The rest of us were making things too complicated, and -- by sheer accident -- the author had a breakthrough.But hey, this was a free book. I download nearly every free book related to writing and the arts. More often than not, I'm pleasantly surprised, and buy other books by the best authors.The thing is, this book isn't funny enough to be a parody. The information inside is the same, very basic information you can find all over the Internet. Ha, ha? Umm... no. Not for me.Maybe some people find this funny. Maybe it's a Dada-inspired form of performance-art-as-books? I don't know. For me to laugh, this book needed to be more over-the-top ridiculous. For me to consider it art, it needs to be more clever.I'm pretty sure the horrendous formatting -- every line centered (and no, that's not a setting on my Kindle reader) -- was part of the joke. Ditto how often she "accidentally" uses a lower-case i when she meant the upper-case personal pronoun.So, yes, I'm embarrassed that I opened this book expecting something either insightful or full of zany fun.It delivered neither. If I'd spent money on this, I'd have asked for a refund.The only reason I'm posting this review is so no one else thinks this is a serious book, or one funny enough to be worth your time.It wasn't awful enough to actually hate (a one-star review), just stupid enough that I don't like it (two star).

I have admired Hunter Thompson's writing for years. It has always been a wild ride of fact, impressions, pure fiction, and satire. It has been a source of pride that Hunter Thompson grew up in my hometown, attended my high school and still managed to be a free-thinker and more than a little crazy. And, like so many writers of Thompson's generation and mine, I have wondered what it would have been like without the booze, the weed, the cocaine. Better? Worse? Who knows, and Juan Thompson's book doesn't answer that question either. In many ways, he was as mystified by his father as the rest of us were, and yet he knew him pretty well. Some folks are just unknowable in the long run. This book is the story of a son's love and confusion, adventures with some of the great names of our time, and of a family -- broken, as many families are, but fundamentally loving. Not everyone's love is expressed in the traditional ways, but it remains love -- love of a father for a son, love of a son for a father and reflective of the times we live in.

I love curling up on a rainy day with a cozy mystery novel, and The Fruitcake Murders fills the bill nicely. The story is complex enough to keep you guessing as you read, and the characters are engaging and interesting. There is a sexual tension between the detective and the reporter in the story that also keeps you guessing throughout. I am guessing this is one in a series featuring these characters since there is clearly history here, but I haven't looked into that. The settings are good, the clues and red herrings dished out regularly, and this book catches the mood and character of the postwar twentieth century. And, true to its genre, you can trust the author to keep it interesting without being as explicit as today's crime novels seem to be. It is a great read for a winter evening by the fire!
I had a hard time with the instructions and spoke too soon. The product is as advertised. I have not tested the volume as yet, but it is charging and seems to work.

Olivier Le Carrer will take you for a creepy trip around the world has he tells you about scary places. From ancient times through today these are indeed scary places, described in a light narrative which is easy-to-read and accompanied by wonderful maps that show exactly where these scary spots are on the globe.Some of these spots will be familiar to most people, others not so much. For instance, most of us know that Beirut is a dangerous place to visit and that it is unwise to sail into the Gulf of Aden. War torn or rife with criminals, we do know about them. And most have heard of the Bell Witch and the Lutz house in Amityville, but this book tells us a bit more. Sometimes the author’s tongue-in-cheek descriptions are just plain fun and sometimes they will give you the shivers, but they are always entertaining. This book will send you scrambling all over the internet to actually see some of the places in photographs, but it is a rewarding search, and I adore maps, so the illustrations in the book, which are largely maps, are fun to me. This isn’t a coffee table picture book, but a fun book to peruse on a stormy night as you sit snug by the fire!

The cookie jar I received doesn't look like this one, but is a perfectly lovely Christmas tree shape.  Garlands of holly and subtle gilt edging make this  cookie jar is a lovely addition to our holiday décor. It will find its place on the breakfront in our dining room when we decorate for the holidays, and it will brighten that corner for the season of guests and gatherings. I plan to fill it with traditional treats to share with drop-in guests or with wrapped candies to share with any children who visit during the season. It has the subtle elegance one expects from a Lenox product. I can see it becoming a part of our holidays and becoming a family heirloom for generations to come. It does not seal, however, so we will still keep our holiday tins for treats that need to be kept airtight for freshness.

I love the speakers, but I hate the batteries. Still, I wanted speakers to share my digital music collection on my iPod, and this speaker set is just the thing to enjoy that music with guests when entertaining. I group my music into playlists on the iPod, pair the Bluetooth with the speakers, and, voila, the perfect selections for the perfect mood, ready to go. This worked great in our den, producing a far more full-throated sound than I had hoped, and not as well on the deck where ambient noise and the greater area lost some of the sound depth. However, they would be perfect for tailgating or a party at poolside. The soft light that emanates from them is a nice touch. On an Indian summer evening last week, we set the speakers up on the deck and watched the stars as we listened to Cissy Spacek read "To Kill a Mockingbird" on an audible book. It was very nice. The only drawback is that  I do hate anything that requires so many AA batteries, and they are necessary to achieve the wireless look. The batteries seem to last for quite a while. We listened to the book for three hours the other night, and listened to music a couple of other times, in the house and outdoors as we tested the system and we are still on the first set of batteries. Since we tend to listen to books mostly on earphones, we probably will not use them daily. but to utilize the music stored on a device with Bluetooth capabilities for a special occasion, indoor or out, these are fine.

I just finished reading “The Survivor”, and am glad to see Mitch Rapp back, but find him a bit different than he has been in the past. He is just as tough a customer, and his surrounding cast of characters are as one expects them to be, so it might just be my mourning the passing of Vince Flynn and a mild annoyance at seeing his name used when he is no longer with us. The action is all there, though, and the book is fun to read. It is suspenseful in the right places and properly descriptive of the action, so I recommend it. Reading about Mitch Rapp again is like visiting an old friend that you have not seen for a while, and I think Vince Flynn would be pleased at this continuation of his creation’s adventures.

This is, by far, one of the best products I have received to review. The installation was flawless, easy, and almost fun. The camera is great. We have installed the app on my phone and my husband's phone -- easy peasy to install on more than one device. It can use the ambient light nicely, and the night vision  is great as well.  The microphone/speaker is not something we will use, and that is just as well, for it is tinny and faint sounding, so not the best feature if that is something you rely on. Other than that, this is a great little camera. We are keeping it plugged in, but did test the charging operation and it works and seems to hold a charge and function for quite a long time. It is a great value and we are very glad to have it!

So pretty, but I won't use it. Skeptical of the metal clasp, I tried one end on my watch. It fit, and so I tried to get it back off since I wasn't planning on wearing it just yet. It wouldn't budge! Pulled, pushed, the rubber scrunched up with the metal part holding fast. Finally with forceps and jewelry pliers It came off. Nothing was damaged, although I can't imagine why not. $20 bucks wasted for the hard lesson to never buy an aftermarket band again!!!

Difficult to set! Included instructions did not include this model. Pretty, but it is a watch.....supposed to tell time and date, but no instructions to get the day of the week or month in. Frustrating and upsetting, even before trying to deal with the band. That is another adventure in frustration. Finally have the time and date through trial and error. The band is the next challenge. Still not where it should be with a new watch. It shouldn't be a chore, but a pleasure.
Great history, highlighting a deserving segment of Louisville's past.
Wonderful traditional cookbook

I read through this book last evening and think it will be a great aid to journalling. Sometimes you simply are not up to writing a narrative of events, and a simple list is enough, but these are not simple lists. These are lists that require thought, some actually require soul searching, and many will be ongoing and not delineated by season. In fact, I am not sure setting this book up with different lists for different seasons was a great idea. Actually I will be returning to winter lists in summer and spring lists in fall and vice versa, and so it will be an ongoing endeavor for me. It is fascinating how a heading, such as a heading for a list, starts a process of recollection that will be ongoing. I think the idea of lists is a great one, and I am going to have fun working through this book!

I found this book too romantic for my tastes, and rather disappointing for someone who has liked Trigiani's work in the past. I kept waiting for the other shoe to drop in order to make this book interesting, and it simply did not happen. It seems unfair to put words, perhaps scandalous to the memories real people have of the stars portrayed, in the mouths of those who are no longer living. There is simply no way that a novelist can come close to what happened between two young people in love. It would have served the story better to have made these characters fictitious rather than putting fiction in the mouths of real people who are not around to say, "Yes, that's it," or "No, I never would have said that." I found it disappointing, but for people who are fans of romance novels and gossip magazines, this should be a fun read.

This new version of the Sonicare is wonderful! We have used these toothbrushes for many years. They are by far the best for minimizing plaque and for keeping teeth shining clean and breath fresh, and the improvements in this set are amazing. If anything, the motion of the brush head is more exacting than the previous set we used. Its variable speed is useful indeed and the charging system is a vast improvement over the last version we had. That the brush base keeps a constant charge is such a good idea. The brush is always ready to use when you need it. And the different colors on the brush heads is brilliant. We used to differentiate between our two brushes by leaving the travel top on one and not the other. This is such an easier system.
