And the fact that the brush heads come off the base unit each time says you from getting the whole thing loaded up with toothpaste drips as our old system did. I found the heads difficult to remove from the base though, especially when the handle and tip are damp from use.  With that exception, this a great new system, and I really like it a lot!

Ah, the beautiful people of the golden age of New York. And this golden age is the 1950’s and 1960’s. It was a time of elegant lunches in glamorous settings that no one dared to eat lest they gain so much as an ounce. It was a time of lolling in the sun on yachts and Caribbean beaches without a thought of sun screen. It was a time when chain-smoking was oh-so-chic and took the lovely ladies out just as their hands started to show veins and dark spots. Champagne and Darjeeling tea, finger sandwiches that jeweled hands never picked up. The characters in this book are lovely ladies, these swans of Fifth Avenue. They are rich women who nursed a viper to their elegant bosoms and experienced the ultimate betrayal.In a “To the Reader” from the author, Melanie Benjamin, there is a cautionary note that readers will need to Google the names in the story she relates, but not all readers require that caution, Ms. Benjamin. Some of us remember those days well enough to reminisce with you of this glamorous time. We all wished we were swans in the era when these beautiful people had the headlines!While this is a novel, it is generously peppered with truths and rumors. Some of the wealthy and famous folk will glitter less after reading this book. You may find yourself at a loss if you try to separate fact from fiction. Good luck with that; the author has skillfully knit together a new fabric of story, telling the tale with insight from every possible angle, even that of the viper himself. It is a fascinating read, and will remind you of the gossipy magazines that were everywhere in that era as it sheds a harsh light into a world that no longer exists. It is the ultimate beach read for next summer, and might be a lovely Christmas gift to the women of a certain age on your gift list.

Reading Homer Hickam's writing is like slipping into a pair of favorite bedroom slippers. His narrative style is easy, friendly, and totally engaging. He draws you into this family yarn with ease, and one finds this journey from puppy love to the real thing in a car shared with an alligator and a chicken is delightful to curl up with at the end of a busy day. Along the way, Hickam manages to tell the story with all the surprises his stories usually bring. The young couple runs into literary giants, bootleggers, bank robbers, union agitators, and a few Depression era ne’er do wells as the Hickam’s story. This unlikely story of one strange adventure after another is, in the long run, about love -- the different kinds of love that season our lives, or maybe it is about kismet. It is hard to tell one from the other.Whatever the deeper message you draw from this story, it is told so lovingly that one cannot help but be completely wrapped up in the evolution of these characters. Hickam's regard for the folks who became his parents is evident in every line of this story. A loving son relating a family legend that involves his parents told from a fresh perspective that sheds light on his parents’ view of the events as well. You simply cannot take sides, but have to just sit back and understand all the viewpoints as their lives work out, as lives are prone to do in spite of our best efforts to control things. Ah, kismet!When you read a lot of books, and I do read a lot of books, you seldom finish one and start right back up to read it a second time, but that is what I did with “Carrying Albert Home.” As the cliché goes, you will laugh; you will cry, and I did. I hope you do too. This is a lovely book!
Heel pretty high, rubs more than I like. Heavier and longer socks required.
Flimsy and didn't last an entire summer.

This is a nice standard-weight set of potholders for kitchen use. Nothing fancy, but the charming print and cute trim. However, they are quite serviceable and are thick enough to provide adequate protection from hot surfaces. They wash nicely, losing a bit of the stiffness from the sizing in the fabric, but remain comfortable on the hands. They shrank just a little, but not enough to raise any concerns. They would be a thoughtful gift to the breast cancer survivor on your holiday shopping list.

I cannot believe that the Dominican spin on Spanish has so many sexually explicit words. It wasn't helpful to my sort of visit to the Dominican Republic, but if one wants to be apprised of the meaning of various words overheard on somewhat sordid streets, it would be helpful.

Lincoln Child is one scary writer who takes you for a harrowing trip through an upscale think tank housed in a creepy old New England mansion. Following enigmalogist Jeremy Logan through this maze of brilliant scientists and the sorts of horrors great brains can create is an adventure you won’t want to miss. Weaving carefully several  fields of knowledge, Child will frighten even the boldest reader into turning page after page as Logan struggles to decipher the convoluted path of reason from decades past, resurrected but still not fully understood. It will appeal to the techie in one as well as the detective, and is a very satisfactory read!Anyone who has toured Newport, Rhode Island and speculated about the mysteries of the great summer houses that dot its shore will enjoy exploring Dark Gables and the erudite collection of brillant scientists who populate  the policy institute, Lux. The gothic structure is designed after an English manor house and Child’s detailed descriptions of it will fascinate those with an architectural bent. As the mystery unfolds, Child makes full use of this setting and one is caught up in its luxurious appointments as well as its sinister atmosphere.As with any quality mystery, a few red herrings show up to keep the reader considering the options of who or what is causing the odd schizophrenia that seems to slip into victim’s mind and forces suicidal behavior in even the most stable individual. Logan himself must fight to keep from following this frightening path.Although I am long familiar with Child’s collaborative work with Douglas Preston and the Pendergast series of stories featuring a quirky protagonist’s interaction with the world, I had not read any of the Jeremy Logan series that Child has created on his own until this one. You can bet I will be reading the others in this series right away!

While this 5-Minute Pizza Oven cooks a pizza and frozen snacks as advertised -- quickly and efficiently -- it takes up too much space to be practical in a kitchen with a functional oven already. It cooks a frozen pizza great, but isn't great if you tend to add a lot of ingredients to jazz up the dish before cooking. The bottom crust gets too done before the top is ready if you do. It does frozen breaded fish filets quite well, but watch smaller snacks as this unit heats up to some 600 degrees Fahrenheit, which is why it cooks a pizza so quickly. It comes complete with little pegs to affix to the side of the unit and hang the pretty-darn-cool handle that clamps on to the ceramic cooking shelf like the ones you see in the pizzeria to pull the pizza from the oven, but do NOT cut the pizza on the ceramic surface because it cleans so easily that you don't want to mess up this nice cooking surface.I would suggest using a pizza peel to remove the pizza for cutting and serving. If I had a big enough kitchen or way more storage space, I would love this device, except that  lugging it to a storage space in the basement is going to be a nuisance and I am troubled by the high temperature it reaches. It seems excessive for a countertop appliance, and especially for one that is liable to draw youthful and potentially careless users.

I brought this book on our fiftieth wedding anniversary trip and I have found it a perfect beach read. Annie Barrows has I troduced a charmingly quirky cast of characters that are drawing me into her story. I cannot wait to see what happens next which makes this book perfect for the distracting envieronment on the beach or at poolside. You can easily lay it aside when you take a dip and be easily drawn back into the plot when you pick it up again. It is essentially the story of a poor little rich woman sent out to earn her living through the WPA Writers Project. Her job is to write a history of a town in West Virginia named Macedonia. The narrative voice shifts from one character to another giving insights into the official chronicling of a small town named Macedonia through the varying perspectives. It is a totally absorbing tale with a satisfactory resolution, and certainly speaks again of the skill of Annie Barrows!

I put this seed down in one of our problem areas last month.  I followed the clearly written instructions on the bag, but, whether the seed is simply wrong for this region or whether it washed away from excessive rain hereabouts, germination was poor so a fair judging of its performance in this region is unlikely. Still, the idea of mulch and seed together is a good one, and the seed really wasn't intended for Kentucky anyhow. I have faith in the brand, but tried it in the wrong environment.

Just finished "The Little Paris Bookshop..." about an hour ago, and I am still thinking about it. What reader doesn't love a bookstore?  And a book about a bookshop on a converted barge on the Seine in the heart of Paris was too appealing to not give this book a try. And, to make it even more intriguing is the notion of a bookseller who finds books to heal the reader. Monsieur Perdu doesn't push the latest bestseller, but seeks the right title for the right reader, and his uncanny ability to mend broken hearts through books is a lovely device that Nina George applies deftly to the narrative. Poor Perdu is mending every broken heart but his own it seems until the plot thickens and he begins to sort through Perdu's deep sorrow and the harm it has done him. Circumstances and a found letter take Perdu on a quest for lost love, and a trip on the Seine with an unusual cast of characters who seek elusive love, in its myriad guises, throughout the French countryside wherever the river takes them. Along the way, surprising revelations about profound joy and sorrow. It is an amazing journey. There are so many insightful quotes in this book, that it is dogeared already on my shelf and has drawn me into its pages twice. The most insightful is a summary in a sentence of what the online world has become. So perceptive! After the past is sorted out,  will Perdu move into the future with grace and hope? Read the book,sail away, and perhaps discover a bit about yourself along the way. I certainly did.

I chose the Repositionable Glue Dots with a specific task in mind. I love the wallpaper in our master bathroom, but it has started to peel at the corners. While I want to put the paper back up on the wall, I will one day want to remove it for good. So, the idea of repositionable dots made all kinds of sense to me. And, they stayed for a while. However, they did come loose after several weeks , which was disappointing. For scrapbooking and photo albums, post-a-notes, and other paper uses, these glue dots are fine, but not for reattaching loose  wallpaper.

The Viper Specter Bilingual Electronic Soft-Tip Dartboard arrived on a rainy spring day, and we opened the carton immediately and set the board up. It was so easy to do! We didn’t opt for a total wall installation, although complete and clear instructions to permanently position securely for a proper dart game. Being new to this, we eyeballed the distance and height and chose the recommended simplest game to start. The darts are clearly weighted exactly right, and the soft tips reassured me that I wasn’t going to destroy the house with a wild throw, and they are great to throw.The company that manufactures this system clearly knows what is required for novice and advanced players, as the system is designed with 50 game choices along with rudimentary instructions for play as well as a number of scoring options, since these games can vary greatly as to number of participants. Plus, there are a couple of dozen extra tips for the six included darts. The target lights up and tells you exactly whose turn it is to throw next as well as scoring each throw. The tips lodge properly in the bristle board surface too, so a good shot is there for all to see.Our afternoon session of dart play was great fun, and, while I suspect I will never be a dead shot with darts, I am looking forward to playing it again. It is a great indoor activity for the whole family, and this is just the system to deliver the action!

I am sure the ADS-2500We Document Scanner from Brother is a wonderful wireless device. However, it is totally incompatible with either my wifi network setup or my Mac or OS 10 or something. After an exhaustive afternoon installing and reinstalling and plugging in and replugging in ad infinitum, I surrendered. I connected it as a wired device, and it works fine. However,  I do not have an extra USB port ON THE COMPUTER (it won't work through the hub),The thing is back in the box and I am sad to report that, since I bought it for its wireless functionality, I have no use for it.In my career as an IT and in my retirement, I have installed many, many wired and wireless devices, and this is really the first to completely defeat me. I found the instructions to install wirelessly arcane at best, and the online chat with someone who seemed disinterested was less than helpful. I hate this because from my very first printer (a daisy wheel for pete’s sake), Brother has been my go-to source for printers, scanners, etc. Sad to say, it won’t be any longer since I require wireless connections. I already have a wired-in scanner, and I had hoped to replace it with this device and eliminate some wires, but that is not to be the case, so this is clearly not an appliance for me.

This spreader arrived just in time for us to spread SnowMelt on our driveway after shoveling away 14" of snow, and I love it. The new ergonomic handle is GREAT; it keeps your wrist from wearing out as you distribute fertilizer, seed, or whatever else (this time SnowMelt) you need to distribute. There is a guide on the side of the device to set how heavily you want the material to spread, and that works find. The crank handle is placed for right hand use while your left hand threads through to the trigger on the device so you can distribute when you need to and stop it quickly when you do not need to -- very handy for those turns as you fertilize or seed. Today, a warmer and sunny day occurred and we were able to give the Handy Green II a run with the early spring fertilization of the yard. I couldn't be more pleased at the performance and the end result. The fertilizer spread evenly at the rate we chose, and the job was finished with ease. This spreader is great. And, since this lightweight unit is mostly plastic, we were able to wash it to remove  the SnowMelt material before using it for fertilizer. To see it out again, and put down our first grass seed with it. Worked fine.

Worked great on my 1977 Mercruiser 120 4 cylinder. I had updated the engine to an electronic Pertronix ignition, and saw Sierra had this wireset, and also a 18-8811-1 wireset for "electronic ignition". I ordered both wondering if the 18-8811-1 had different electrical resistance. It turns out it didn't, and instead had different ends that wouldn't work well for me, so I stuck with the 18-8800-1 wireset and it works great! Would highly recommend, excellent quality and 8mm wire.

After careful measurements of the old filter, and using a CARQUEST PDF filter catalog I found online, and a little cross referencing on Wix's website, I found this filter. This was for a 1967 Ford 1000 Tandem axle dump truck with a 6-71 Detroit Diesel, and what I think to be a "Purolator" style air filter housing coming out of the side of the hood. Exact replacement!

I upgraded to a 30 spline Truetrac differential, and 30 spline Moser axles, and needed longer and stronger wheels studs, especially to accommodate my disc brake conversion. I was prepared to cut down the length on these studs, but with the Moser axle flange, LT1 brake rotor, and GTA wheel it was perfect to use as is with the stock style GM lug nuts with external threads for the plastic cap, as well as the plastic cap itself.The Moser axle had .438' diameter holes for press it studs, and 1/2-20 threaded holes as well. I very carefully drilled out the .438" holes with a  31/32" and finally 1/2" cobalt drill bit. I found the 1/2" hole and the .509" knurl diameter on the studs to be a good match, although a bit tight.

The first one star review stating these gauges are not available yet no longer applies. I bought this set for my 1977 Sylvan Skipper I/O with a Mercruiser inline 4 120hp and a pre-alpha "R" sterndrive. I love these gauges. Very sharp, love the polished stainless bezels with the aluminum background, with gold accents on the marks. Oil and fuel worked perfectly with my sending units (and really should on just about any Mercruiser setup and other makes, but I can just about gaurantee it for the inline engines Mercruiser made). Tachometer can be used with 4, 6, and 8 cylinder engines.  Speedometer is mechanical and comes with a pitot tube and a long length of tubing. Gauges all come with a 161/168/194 bulb, but I found them a bit dim, so I bought some 194 led pure white bulbs here on Amazon and love the way they look! These are AMERICAN made by the way! I also emailed the company beforehand to see if I would run into any incompatibility issues and they were very quick to reply, so kudos for good customer service. At the time I bought these I found them on eBay for a little cheaper.

Just plain work. I installed these in my boat gauges, and found them noticeably brighter than the incandescent bulbs I replaced. My gauges really light up at night now! Ordered a pack of 8 and all work flawlessly.

Love this tube. I purchased this to use for a floating down a river with friends, but intend to use it for towing soon. I will update this review with how well it performs, but I see no reason for it to not perform great. I'd recommend some Carabiner bungee cords (http://www.amazon.com/Keeper-06300-12-Piece-Bungee-Assortment/dp/B00PP66AVC/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1439910280&sr=8-1&keywords=carabiner+bungee) for hooking to other tubes/rafts.I've always bought Intex tubes, and was tired of them leaking and only lasting two, maybe three seasons. As with all towable tubes, this has a heavy nylon covering over it to protect against abrasion and punctures.As with all tubes, the measurement seen is the deflated measurement, so 96" across deflated. This held four adults and a cooler comfortably.Would recommend. Love the graphics and color too.
Used this for hanging outdoor lighting. I ran one length 100ft from tree to tree, its holding up well! Definitely get some 1/16" cable clamps for it.
Worked perfectly on my Mercruiser Alpha One Gen One Sterndrive!
Great quality! As good as a Sierra Marine one. I can appreciate the metal thread in fitting.

I just received and assembled this yesterday, and am genuinely surprised that this has received as many positive reviews as it has. The quality is cheap, even for the price of $195 I paid for it.- One of the holes for the fastening studs was misdrilled, or drilled too large. Instead of screwing it in, you could push it in by your finger. Also, one of the six cam locks broke on me instantly.- The wood had large stress cracks in one corner on the table top.- The finish is really uneven. It was missing stain completely by the bottom shelf, above the wine rack. You can tell visually, and by feel, that the stain is not applied evenly.- The two large vertical boards at the end of the fold out? You can easily see that they are both severely warped, or bowed.- The wine bottle rack is made from compressed paper/wood particles. Extremely cheap. It wouldn't be so bad if it fit snugly into the wine bar, but unfortunately it does not. if you put one wine bottle in the left box, it tweaks the other 8 boxes out of shape. I will modify this with some corner brackets.Otherwise, it is nice to look at, but you will quickly realize how cheap it is when you put it together. Its made in Thailand, and its pretty obvious that the assembly workers take no pride in making these!In the end, I plan on keeping it. I'm going to have a piece of tempered glass cut for the top, as I don't think the wood finish would last for long. If you have kids, you should definitely keep it folded up when not in use, as it easy to damage the fold out leaves when they are extended.

Used this on a 19 goat boat with a 5" wide vinyl stripe. I had to use two 4" wheels to remove approximately 40' of 5" wide striping. Worked great! No damage to gelcoat, but a rubbing compound is highly recommend afterward to make it nice.
Buy this over the Vermont American brand. This is Japanese made, the Vermont American is Chinese, and the quality difference is noticeable if you were to receive both.
Excellent fit, and exact replacement for a 2003 GMC envoy, rear upper trailing arm. Would I buy it again? Absolutely.

Works great for my 165 hp Mercruiser inline 6 in my late 70s tri hull runabout. The large gasket did not apply to the inline 6, but I believe this gasket applies to the four cylinders. this gasket set should apply to the inline 4 cylinder engines Mercruiser/GM used in boats.
Great quality, well machined.

These are great quality tools, and have saved me a few times. The user just needs to be aware how to use it properly, and in extreme cases, use heat to help your case.This tap was not what I was expecting, but that's my own fault as I should have looked into what "STI" meant. Anyway, a 5/16 STI tap extractor is intended for the special oversized tap included in a 5/16 heli-coil kit or thread repair kit. The fingers on this one are too large for a standard 5/16-18 or 5/16-24 thread tap.I did find the correct tap extractor for my standard 5/16 thread tap: the part number is 10314 by Walton Tools.
These were great, and all were made in the USA. fit great on a gravely 260 60" cut zero turn lawn mower. Would definitely buy again. At the time I purchased this, it was $50 for a set of 6.
For my 8BA Ford Flathead! Works great.

This is a top quality fuel/water seperator. A previous reviewer mentioned that the npt pipe plugs were the incorrect size for the unused ports, and I disagree completely. They are accurate and top quality brass plugs. Like all npt pipe plugs, a thread sealant must be used.The Atwood company is based in Lowell, MI, and this seperator base and filter are made in Taiwan. Top quality machining/casting. Using this for my Mercruiser inline 6 in my boat. The filter does not look like what is pictured, and has white lettering and conveniently has 10 different part numbers for fuel filters listed on it. The filter has a large warning stating: DO NOT USE WITH DIESEL ENGINES. You might want to do your research and see if a compatible filter is compatible with diesel fuel. The attwood filter that comes with this is 11841. Other equivalents include:20911 seachoice7845 Sierra24940 GLM35-802893T Mercury24950 SMI52113 Valmar7-0873 MarpacMf10 tempoPs3808 FramPrices fluctuate constantly on Amazon, but I picked this up for $22 at the time of this review.

I ordered this Chinese 1/8NPT pipe plug, and was bothered by the fact that something with American pipe thread has a 12mm hex head! It's not 3/8" or 7/16" or 1/2". I bought this for an engine and don't want to have a metric hex size on an engine there every other fastener has a standard hex head.Not a big deal, but I would expect something with standard thread to have a standard size hex.For anyone who is interested, this pipe plug is made in China. It is 316 stainless.

Great quality thermostat. Used this in my 2.2L S10. This is a well engineered piece that precisely meters the engines minimum temperature. It does not include a gasket, but you should expect that. 50% of thermostats do not come with a gasket, as they may apply to many different applications and thermostat housings.This is MADE IN THE USA. If you go to Autozone and pay nearly double for their Duralast brand (which is always a relabeled package of another brand, Duralast doesn't manufacture a thing expect for packaging), you will find that their sourced thermostats are MADE IN ISRAEL, or China, or somewhere other than the U.S.This Stant 13849 I purchased on Amazon was cleared marked as being made in the USA.
Great for testing/troubleshooting automotive gauges, such as coolant temperature gauges, oil pressure gauges, and the like.

Perfect for my 8BA Ford flathead v8. I prefer these over the Autolite 216 only because these are nickel plated and do not show corrosion as readily as the black oxide coated Autolites. They perform great! NGK plugs are another great quality option, but it didn't seem aesthetically correct to install Japanese plugs in a very traditional American engine.
I got these for a killer deal, for about $37 shipped to my door for a set of four. They are outstanding quality, and I feel that the price may have been a mistake. Very, very heavy duty!

Very disappointed with these headers. I wanted to give my 2.2L a slight performance increase to help with towing a small boat. My problems with this header are:1) The header and pipes are painted with cheap, non-high temperature paint. There is even a decal on one of the primaries stating that the paint on it is not high-temperature. So it will burn off readily after some light use. I went through the trouble of stripping this paint, and applying some vht flame-proof primer and flat black paint. You have to sand/strip/blast off the old paint because you cannot use cheap paint as a substrate for high temperature paint.2) The angle of the air injection tube was wrong, and would not allow me to install the air pump check valve that is supposed to thread on to it. The way it was, the air injection check valve would've been right where the oil fill tube bracket is. I would've had to seriously notch the bracket (remove 1" of material) and remove the rear engine hoist bracket on the cylinder head. Instead, I realized the thread for the air injection check valve was 1/2 NPT, so I went to a local hardware store and picked up a galvanized 1/2 NPT 45 degree street elbow to clear the oil tube bracket and engine lifting bracket.3) The two other exhaust pipes slip into each other. The flare was too large on the one and caused an exhaust leak. I clocked the exhaust clamp in several different positions, but the flare was too oversized and would not seal no matter what. By the way, the included exhaust clamp is a super cheap one, with a 5/16 bolt shank. Every exhaust clamp you buy at the auto parts store is a 3/8" bolt shank. I installed a better quality 3/8 shank clamp, but even with the clamp crushing the pipes together, it still leaked. I ended up welding this connection.4) The bung that the oxygen sensor goes into is unbelievably cheap. I expect it to strip out or completely break away from the header collector the next time I change the oxygen sensor. I applied a very generous amount of anti-seize compound to the threads. If I were to do this header install again, I would definitely buy a oxygen sensor bung (M18x1.5 threads) on ebay and weld it in place.5) Performance? Well I definitely feel absolutely no increase, but it is too early to make that call. I need to do some more test driving before I can reach a verdict on that.6) The bolts were too short for connection the header ball flange to the downpipe. Pacesetter includes 3/8 by 3.5" long bolts. I ended up getting two stainless steel m10-1.5 by 110mm long bolts. You could also pick up 3/8-4" long bolts at your local hardware store too.7) The primary tube coming off of cylinder #1 runs very close to the lower radiator hose - about 1/2" away. I definitely plan on fabricating a small aluminum heat shield to go in between the radiator hose and header.Bottom line, would I buy them again for another 2.2L S10? No. I bought this on Amazon for about $180, and even at that price, its a waste of money.  If you are serious about getting a little more power out of your s10, consider swapping to a 4.3L V6, traditional small block Chevy, or even better yet, a LS motor (4.8L, 5.3L, 6.0L etc).
Really nice, top quality forged stainless steel 1/4' npt coupling. Excellent machining.

I bought two, one of them had a large amount of lateral runout (wobble) and I was able to exchange it for another one. I used this to convert a vertical bandsaw from wood to metal. Your first impression is that the quality is cheap, but its just an appearance thing, its the nature of die cast aluminum. At the end of the day, it worked flawlessly for my bandsaw. Use it almost everyday.

So much better than a UV flashlight I had bought before that was powered by three AA batteries with a large head filled with 100 cheap leds.This flashlight is powerful, and is powered by an 18650 lithium battery, which you will have to get on your own. The advantage of the 18650 is higher voltage and greater mah capacity, and it really makes any high powered flashlight.I cant speak for durability, but the housing certainly looks well built and I am very happy with this flashlight.

Good quality seal, this particular national brand seal I received was made in Brazil for those interested. Replaced seal on passenger side on a 2008 Sierra 1500 4WD 5.3L with a 8.25" ring gear in the front differential. Maybe this might help someone but to replace that particular side:1) Remove passenger tire. Remove skid plate underneath front differential.2) Remove strut to control arm bolts. Loosen or remove upper strut to frame bolts. Move strut off to the side a little.3) Remove 6 bolts holding outer CV axle to inner axle shaft. Move CV axle aside.4) Unplug the electrical motor on the front axle and move harness to the side.5) Unbolt the axle shaft tube from the differential. You will loose a small amount of gear oil. Remove slowly and cautiously and pay attention the spring inside.6) Put the axle shaft tube on your bench or in a vise. Remove and set aside shift collar. Remove axle retaining clip with a small pick or pocket screwdriver. Use a soft faced hammer and gently pound out axle stub from axle shaft tube.7) Use a large screwdriver and pry the old seal out. Be careful not to damage or contaminate the bearing behind it with dirt.'Gently install new seal until it is flush with the axle tube.8) You should have it from here :)7)

After receiving this multimeter, I quickly realized that it did not come with an infrared temperature probe, as shown in the picture. I was discouraged by this, but decided that it may just be an optional accessory, but I could not find it anywhere.I contacted ExTech and was told that that having an external infrared temperature probe was a "pre-design" idea that never came about! So the infrared temperature probe shown in the picture does not exist!And get this: Not only are two spots on the multimeter dial dedicated to an IR temperature probe, (which will clearly never have any use) but it an "optional infrared temperature probe" is also mentioned on the cardboard box!Extech, I encourage you to comment or respond to this review.
Used in converting a wood bandsaw to cut metal. Works well with my 1hp motor. Good quality!

Perfect for Disc Slam or Kan Jam! I bought these and threw some LED lights in the goals of my disc slam set (really fun group game you can buy on Amazon).Update: after less than a year, the Led circuit board in one of my two frisbee a became defective. Not too worried about it, I asked nite-ize for a replacement so I will see how that goes. In the meantime, I like these frisbees enough that I bought a replacement on Amazon.Also, for what it's worth each frisbee takes two CR2016 batteries. I bought a pack of twenty Sony brand ones on Amazon for backup. To replace the batteries, carefully use a small pick or tool to pull up on the sides of the waterproof cover/button in the middle of the frisbee.

Perfect fit for my Delta 14" bandsaw, and yes, it does come with the lower angled/beveled guide unique to Delta's. I know by the book your supposed to set up the guides .003 and .005" away from the blade, but I simply butt them up right against the blade, and let the saw rub against them and break 'em in. At the same time, the graphite impregnated in the blocks is being deposited on the blade's surface. Not something you can do with the original steel guides!

Thought it was great for a few days, and I thought I had a better quality light than my Ultrafire flashlight of comparable size, but dropped this light from my hand once on a hard surface, and it quit working. It was a 2-3ft drop. I expect any flashlight to be a little more durable than this.Taking it apart, it looks like the little bit of solder that holds that LED to the circuit board simply gave way. Super disappointed as I though this flashlight was going to the perfect one.Also, the 18650 lithium battery is far superior to use in any of these Cree LED lights, but fits extremely loosely in this flashlight. I see this same flashlight under other brand names and vendors comes with a plastic sleeve to fit over the battery and take up the slop, but I did not receive said plastic sleeve with this flashlight.

Ordered 1000 shipping labels, received 800 from seller. Quality-wise, the adhesive seems good, but the labels are noticeably thinner than other brands. Bottom line, they work and do what they are intended to do.

Highly recommended. Installed this on my Dad's '53 Ferguson TO30 tractor with the 4 cyl continental engine, and the original Delco distributor. The tractor is so consistent now, with starting up and idling. No more points!!The instructions recommend a 3 ohm coil. You don't need to bother getting the pertronix 3 ohm coil, you can use a 12v ignition coil from any old air cooled volkswagen...I went to the parts store and got one for a 69 volkswagen. It's about the only 3 ohm 12volt coil out there, and works beautifully.

I ordered from this seller, and recieved an EMGO 23-92402, which has a 3" pullback and 9" center width. An EMGO 23-12570 should have a 3.5" pullback and 9" center width.The product itself it great quality, just be sure you get what you are ordering. The item description given for this by this seller (rider's needs) has the wrong specs. Please check out the EMGO 2013 controls catalog here and look at pg.3 :[...]

I have a small ebay business and use these about 6-8 times a week. It is an excellent value. As far as the "edges overlapping or not being square", I have yet to see one. These are made of recycled cardboard and made in the USA, both of which I'm a fan of. Will definitely buy more!

Anything you can do to shave weight off any motorcycle is a good thing. Its an easy way to lose 7-10lbs, compared to a lead acid equivalent. And you get a better battery in the process with practical benefits!Weight is 1.76 lbs.Also, no liquids whatsover, so nothing to maintain, nothing to cause corrosion to the battery box or tray.Dimensions are 5.27" (134mm) length x 2.55" (65mm) width x 3.62" (92mm) height.PDF manual for these lithium batteries are available through battery tender's website.At the time I purchased this, I found it cheaper through Summit Racing.

Basically to use it you:1) Put your cartridge in the included holster.2) Peel back the top label.3) Grab the syringe and fill it (at least for my 61XL cartridge) up to the 2.0 mark with ink and inject it into the hole on top of the cartridge slowly. The amount of the ink you inject is not as critical as you would think.4) Take the needle off syringe, put the syringe into the hole underneath the holster and pull a little bit of ink out. This helps pull ink through the sponge and into the printhead of the cartridge.5) Install the cartridge in your printer. I like to give it 5 minutes or so for the ink to evenly absorb throughout the internal sponge.DONE! This will save you so much money, it's ridiculous! Just bought my second refill kit.
Best wallet I have ever bought. Super slim, soft and durable high quality leather. Would not hesitate to buy again!!

These are intended for welding only, and more specifically, TIG welding. These are great quality and allow you maximum dexterity which is necessary for TIG welding. I bought these instead of the local Harbor Freight TIG gloves, and am very glad I did. If you visually examine the ones at Harbor Freight, the lack of quality is evident in the stitching and lining.I would buy another set of these in a heartbeat.

Fits great on my 7/8" or 22mm handlebars. These have an all-aluminum construction, and are of great quality. Nice long levers give you good leverage and allows you to apply the brakes easily. Levers look good on my mountain bike!

Really nice, you have to see it in person to appreciate it. Makes a very pleasant ding-dong, sounds almost like a wind chime. My girlfriend absolutely loves it. It's for the standard 7/8" handlebar.This owl bell is a beautiful piece of hardware! No regrets for buying it!

I bought this for my motorized cruiser bike, and was impressed by the fit and finish of the seat, I thought it looked a little better in person than in the amazon picture. I installed it and rode it, but was disappointed that it was not as comfortable as the original seat that came with the bike (It's a magna-brand cruiser from Target). It is nice and wide, but remarkably flat.I guess your perception of this seat depends on the seat you are replacing, and if you have a thin or hard seat than you will probably love this, but for me, it was less comfortable than my department store cruiser seat.
Great quality, and great customer service from Niagara Cycles. Be sure to exercise caution with the valve stem. Be sure it points directly at the hub when the tire is inflated.

Great quality tire. I use this on a motorized bicycle, and it makes for a very soft ride at it's lowest pressure (22psi, but I keep it at 25psi) and has very low rolling resistance at it's highest pressure. Keep it mind the reflective strip is more prominent than this picture shows.Just use google images to find a more accurate picture.It has a very flexible sidewall, but is very strong where it counts; at the tread. Because of the sidewall, it is unusually easy to slip onto the rim. Thorn resistant tubes (Twice as thick as a normal tube) are a nice complement to these. I've used both Sunlite and XLC brand tubes with great results.

This is a really nice chain, the nickel plating is good quality, and the chain is heavier duty (greater tensile strength) than a normal chain, as the steel is 20% thicker than a normal 410 chain. Awesome!

I use this as a mobile printer inside of my truck. This printer has a "wireless direct" feature where the printer creates its own wifi signal so you can print off your iphone/ipad very easily. I print directly off my iphone 4, easily, and wirelessly.It has clear directions, software that is simple and effective, and takes 10 minutes to set up.It has a very easy to read LCD screen to let you scroll through it's menu, and to let you know what's going on.Awesome! Buy this, and not a Canon. I bought a Canon MG3220, and found out it requires local Wifi, and even when I set it up, it worked intermittently.CHEAPEST SOLUTION FOR REPLACING YOUR BLACK INK CARTRIDGE: Buy an InkTec HPI-1061D refill kit intended for Hewlett Packard printers. I've used their black refill kit, which at the time of this writing is only $11.95 through Amazon Prime. I've easily refilled my black cartridge ten times over with this $12 kit. That's $1.20 per cartridge vs. $30 per HP cartridge. Sure, your printer and computer might say it has low ink in the black cartridge, but it will still print fine. I am completely sold on the Do-it-yourself Ink refill kits.

This headlight is extremely bright! I have been using it for the past few months on a motorized bicycle, averaging 20-25mph at night on my commute from work. It is really fun to take this on the back trails at night. I was lucky enough to get these for $9.99 a piece, with Amazon Prime shipping!It must be used with a 2.0A or higher port, and not the average 1.0A port! If you do, it will shut off due to the internal circuit breaker that any brand/model of battery backup has. For what it's worth, I have used this with a Blackbox Ocho 5000mah battery backup, which is equipped with a 1A port and a 2.1A port (which is just okay but the USB ports are poor quality and will wear out in time. I would recommend a high quality product made by Anker instead, like their Astro2 8400mah battery, which is equipped with a 2.1A port).I bought two of these, and unfortunately on both, the USB connector is starting to flake out after 2.5 months of use. I've verified that with several USB ports on different devices.I was riding home one night and the light started flickered and went out completely. I jostled the USB connector a bit, and it would work until I hit the next bump. Not what you want on a dark road on a moonless night! Luckily I had a backup flashlight.I will exchange it for a new one and try again, but I might just go for a Cygolite headlight, which are EXCELLENT quality, and made in the U.S.A.!

Used this on a vintage motorcycle type project,and for what it's worth to the next guy, the bolts included/used are M4 x 0.7 thread.The machining is not perfect, I've had a few where I have take a file or carbide burr or drill or cut off wheel to slightly modify it, but not a big deal at all.Might be worth your time to check out Summit Racing or Jegs, both had a cheaper price than Amazon and they ship very fast.

Perfect for detail work on your hot rodding project. This product can expand up to 1/2 I.D. It is not split loom, so you must feed the wires through. Excellent quality, would highly recommend. I used marine grade heat shrink (with the adhesive inside) on the ends on the loom to give it a finished look and keep the ends from fraying.

The stock 415 chain that comes with all of the Chinese bicycle 49cc/66cc/80cc engines stretches quite a bit. Most guys uses a 41 chain (and as of the time of this review, is a better buy as you get a 10ft length for about the same price), but in my situation, I had very tight clearances to the rear fender and tire (26x2.35) on a cruiser style bicycle. The 41 chain is about 1/16" wider, but I really needed every bit I could get!This chain is high quality, and if you are buying for a gas powered bicycle, buy two, as one chain is not long enough.
Works great, thermostat works well, flame out sensor (turn off) works well, would definitely recommend. Heats up an enclosed area in a hurry!!
I needed specifically a 1/8 npt female to 3/16 hose barb fitting for some detail work on a motorcycle. Absolutely no store had this fitting within 20 miles.

I bought these for a gas powered cruiser bicycle project, and use the locking pin on the lever to keep the clutch disengaged so I can pedal the bicycle with the engine off.I am very satisfied with the quality and finish! Would definitely buy again.

I bought this chain for a gas powered bicycle because it is a 415 chain, and 110 links long, which is an ideal length for motorized bike applications. The other reviewer mentioned it is lighter than the chain that comes with the Chinese two stroke engines, which is obvious because it is so much lighter duty. The links use thinner steel and are not as tall as the china engine chains. I was replacing the china chain due to its stretching characteristics, but this worksman chain (which is actually a standard kmc chain with 110 links) is suitable for a pedal bike or tricycle, and not a motorized bicycle. You should buy two kmc 415h 96 link chains or the harder to find but top quality diamond 415 chain.
Used this UV light for finding leaks in an automotive A/C system. This light is powerful, better quality and cheaper than any light found locally, and so much cheaper than any tool vendor's.
Very nice chain and price, has nice shiny nickel plating. Bikeworldusa has outstanding customer service. Thanks guys, I'm sure I'll be buying from you in the future.

Great color. That's the first thing to say. Great price! That's the BEST thing to say.I got these to go with other "sparklies" I've purchased my wife over the past year including this recently purchased Sterling Silver, Oval Blue Topaz, and Created White Sapphire Pendant Necklace. These match in color almost to the tee. I'm really impressed with how clear they are. The blue topaz looks almost to be ice blue and I think that's an awesome thing.Since my wife has severe rheumatoid arthritis, these clips are much better for her than trying the manual dexterity of the small backed posts. Again, another selling point to me.

At this writing this is a 5* item  It looks formidable and the jade stones are very nice looking.  This seems a tad darker than the jade necklace I purchased earlier, but I'm not too concerned about that aspect.I'm pretty happy about this purchase and my wife is thrilled about it as well.  So far, I call this a win-win.

I love turquiose and I don't ever see much of it on Lightning Deals.  So, when I saw this I had to get it.  It's VERY PRETTY and well worth it.  Both my wife and I are impressed.The ring fits well but sits WAY forward off the knuckle.  It would definitely put a dent in someone's forehead!

These are very pretty earrings.  One thing though, the posts are both VERY THICK in diameter and VERY LONG in length.  We're talking weapons.  Anyway, both my wife and I like the looks of these and that's enough for us.
Fun, fun, fun!  This is Christmas in two boxes.  By my reckoning, there's 1100 cards based on the use of two 550 count boxes.  Not bad.  And the quality?  All cards seem to be in near mint condition.

I've watched Mad Max since it first came out years ago (1979).  That was a great movie.  This, however, is nothing like it or as good.  Tom Hardy plays an okay character but this is hardly an 8/10 movie.  In fact, to call this even a 5 out of 10 would be giving it credit that it did not earn.Max isn't even the star of this movie.  That honor splits between Charlize Theron and the truck.  Too bad.  I was really looking forward to watching this movie.  I was also really disappointed with most of it.If you've got a couple hours to wile away, this is an okay way to do it. But don't expect anything as good as either Mad Max or Mad Max 2, The  Road Warrior.  As long as you keep that in mind, this will work for you.

These boots were fine for working in the garage for a few hours.  They were water resistant from the start.  The seams are tight and everything felt comfortable about them.  I would certainly buy them again if needed.

This keyboard has a very comfortable grip and streamlined height of the keys.  It has a very responsive touch to the key strokes.  The built in wrist guard is a nice touch as well.  The software hooked up easily to a preexisting account and the computer easily recognized the new hardware.  It is very quiet with the keystrokes!If I were to have to buy another keyboard any time soon, this would certainly be the one I picked.

I was probably introduced to The Corrs while living in Ontario, Canada some years ago.  Celtic music had always been near and dear to me having had spent a good many years living in the UK.  It's good music.  And, as someone kindly noted, three out of four of the members are VERY easy on the eyes.Irish folk music has a sound of its own and each group who introduce and subsequently reintroduce the sound into the US have done a rather fine job.  Sadly, The Corrs haven't really received the recognition they should have deserved.  This fine group have offered the former Commonwealth Countries years of wonderful music.To anyone who has never listened to The Corrs, In Blue is a wonderful way to start.  In particular is One Night, the point-counterpoint song featuring Spanish signer Alejandro Sanz and Andrea Corrs.

I'm not a huge Connick fan but I do own this album of has as well as a few others. This is pretty darn good. He shows style and pizazz in both his playing and singing. This is adult music in all respects of the word. While not his lounge style music, I find no problem into his foray into funk. In fact, it's a refreshing sound for him.She is an exceptional album in that it does all stay in character. Meaning, all the music is funk and it's all pretty funky... in a GOOD way. As far as the lyrics, okay, some are better than others, but it's still all enjoyable which is why I give it only 4*.

I'm not a huge Connick fan but I do own this album of has as well as a few others.  This is pretty darn good.  He shows style and pizazz in both his playing and singing.  This is adult music in all respects of the word.  While not his lounge style music, I find no problem into his foray into funk.  In fact, it's a refreshing sound for him.She is an exceptional album in that it does all stay in character.  Meaning, all the music is funk and it's all pretty funky... in a GOOD way.  As far as the lyrics, okay, some are better than others, but it's still all enjoyable which is why I give it only 4*.

I've bought a fair amount of jewelry for my wife this past year.  Amazon's Lightning Deals have been responsible for that ability.  When it comes to pretty things, I feel my wife deserves them.  This ruby and diamond pendant is gorgeous.  It looks sharp and because of it's heft it sits well on the chest.  The color is sharp and the stone is clear.  To my untrained eye, this looks like a natural product at a greatly reduced price.As we all know, when Mama's happy, EVERYBODY's happy.  Keep your "mama" happy with pretty sparklies such as this.

Love it, Love It, LOVE IT!  A few months ago I wouldn't have said I was a hockey card collector.  Thanks to Amazon's Lightning Deals, that's all changed.  I love buying these cards.  It doesn't matter if they are new issues or new old stock, it's exciting to open these packages and see who is represented.The 2015-16 O-Pee-Chee set has all the current favs.  Heck, I've even snatched up a few of my beloved Make Beliefs (Maple Leafs) in the process.  These are great cards, well colored and definitely a hit in my book!

At first glance I wasn't thrilled at all with this picture.  It looked grainy and ruddy.  What I had forgotten all about, and one of the reasons I bought it, was that this was from the Winter Classic and what was looking grainy was actually snowflakes coming down.Being a Leafs fan is a hard, hard thing of late.  Fortunately they prevailed during this game and this is a fantastic shot of Bozak in action.

This is THE Cranberries album to own. Not only is their freshmen album, but it's got more GREAT songs on here than any of their other albums. Dolores O'Riorden's exceptional voice make this the disc to own. I hate to say it, but if you've got room (or budget) for only ONE album from The Cranberries, this is the one to get.Everybody Else Is Doing It, So Why Can't We? proves new blood in the Aural Soup is not only a good thing but a necessary thing. Like everything else in the world, music evolves. Fortunately, Darwin is alive and kicking when it comes to music. Only the strong survive. In hindsight, it's VERY easy to say but in reality, and based on this album, it would have been easy enough to suggest the Cranberries would be around for awhile.

If you can get past the first 10-15 minutes, you will find yourself drawn into this film.  Because of the hard, slow start, it gets the 4*s.  I'm sure many a potential viewer have up because of it - we almost did.This is a very touching story when it unfolds.  Two opposing forces aircraft and crew , in this movie Nazi Germany and UK, are shot down over Occupied Norway.  They both end up in a hunting cabin, each believing that are the destined captors of the other.What plays out is a story of survival and how if personal differences are out aside you might live to see another day - or salvation.This is a very good story.  The plot is single enough and yet very in-depth.  It truly should have been a 5* film.

To the Faithful Departed, The Cranberries third studio album, isn't as strong as their first, "Everybody Else is Doing it, So Why Can't We?" or their second, "No Need to Argue".  That said, O'Riordan's voice never waivers or suffers.This one is a little stronger in the political arena with songs like Hollywood, Free to Decide, War Child, The Rebels and Bosnia.  The one thing though, just about every country on the globe had them charting.  In the US, they hit 4th, France - 5th, Australia and NZ - 1st, Germany and UK - 2nd.  They are good.

There's something about Dolores O'Riordan's voice that's enough to lull you into a false sense of security.  She's smooth, sweet and will stab you deeply without you even noticing you're bleeding.  No Need to Argue is a fantastic album from the beginning to end.  This is well worth having in your inventory.

Wake Up! will definitely help you wake up.  Compared to Giant Steps, Wake Up! has a totally different vibe.  This is more "mellow" and I use that term in quotes.  It still rocks.  It's still haunting and it's still Boo Radleys.  It's just not as hard.  Maybe that's why I would choose to give it 4 out of 5 instead of the 5/5 that Giant Steps gets from me.Boo Radleys are not for everybody.  If you get them, good for ya.  If you don't, move on.  Nobody will hold it against you.

Listening to this again after it being hidden in the drawers of CDs is like listening to something you'd never expect to hear at all.  Giant Steps starts out like Beatles' Abbey Road.  You can practically find yourself straining to hear, "Paul is dead" being played backwards.This is a different type of album.  I honestly cannot remember why I got it initially.  Was it because I had it confused with BoDeans?  Possibly, same era.  Was it because I heard cuts from their stuff on WKOC (defunct adult/alt-rock station out of Norfolk, VA)?  Likely.  Regardless, Boo Radleys puts up where others would shut up.

I really like David Bowie but Heathen is a hard sell for me.  It's not that it's not technically good because it is, there's just that je ne sais quoi about it.  In fact, it's really awesome when played on a computer as there's interactive stuff to be seen.  Heathen starts out solid and ends that way.  But it just doesn't set me afire like some of his other works do.
Space Oddity is a MUST HAVE in just about any audiophile's library.  David Bowie pulls out all the stops in this album.  There's not a thing bad about it.

This is 80s bubblegum music and yet somehow I have it.  I might have been something left by someone else.  Anyway, this isn't all that bad.  It's definitely not anything that's going to take home Grammy's or other accolades.  It will, however, be something that people will pull out and shake their heinies to.  Boys Club is kind of fun but it's not anything your library MUST have.

I owe a good many David Benoit albums and of all of them, this is my favorite.  Freedom at Midnight, is Benoit's first Grusin/Rosen Production.  It is fantastic from get to go - that's the get-go.  There's not a stinker/bomb on this disc.  I love it.Recorded, mixed and pressed in true digital, this is one pristine album that's sure to knock the socks off of you through either your speakers or headphones.  Personally, there's times for each in my book.  When I'm putzing around the house, it's the speakers.  When I'm working on the computer, it's headphones.Benoit is a master and this album struts its stuff.  Reaching #5 on Billboard's Contemporary Jazz chart, Benoit put his heart into this one and it shows.  Even he has been quoted as saying it was his favorite album to produce because "everything came together".  It shows and it's worth having.  Thank you, Mr. Benoit!

When you are as accomplished as Mr. Benoit is, it would seem you have to work your butt off to get even better.  He did and he has.  Every Step of the Way is an outstanding album from Cut 1, the title song to #11, Saturdays.  There's certainly something in here for nearly everybody.Produced by Dave Grusin and Larry Rosen, (GRP), this fully digital disc will sound good on just about anything you choose to play it on.  Well, that little thing of your daughter's with that rodent's face on it won't likely enhance the disc, but it'll sound good there nonetheless.Benoit is one talented individual.  I'd say he rocks, but he jazzes.

I have to admit, I've always through Maire was one of the better vocalists of the Brennan family.  That said, Misty Eyed Adventures is a fantastic trip into the realm of Maire's voice.As with another reviewer, as much as I like Joni Mitchell's Big Yellow Taxi, it just didn't seem to work for me in this setting.  It is a wonderful song best left to the songstress herself.  As for the rest of the music, it really is something else and something worth listening to.  Ms. Brennan does her family proud in this endeavor.Misty Eyed Adventures is just that, an adventure, albeit misty eyed.

This is required reading for my Career & Technical Education license.  I'm having a very hard time going through this book owing to Dr. Jones' self-centeredness.  He certainly does think a lot of himself.As for the information, any person who has time vested in a classroom, whether that be teaching, as a paraeducator or casual observer, has seen most of this transpire.  Much of what Dr. Jones speaks of is little more than common sense brought to light.  Like any other self-help book, or in this case, help others, the entire subject matter is up for debate.  I am in no way a fan.

My son is a watch geek.  He loves watches and definitely was thrilled to receive this one on his 18th birthday.  The face is a very nice blue, the hands are easy to see against that background because of the white on the minute and hour hands and red on the seconds hands.  The "gadget buttons" are fairly easy to figure out and do not require an engineering degree to make things work.  All in all, I'd call this a great buy.Each time he wears this he tells me of the many comments of awe he receives.  I know he enjoys getting that attention and loves flaunting it.  His biggest thrill, however, is telling his friends what the MSRP was.  He doesn't bother telling them how much I paid for it.

When something says, in essence, you get what we pick for color, you've got to take a chance on it.  I was lucky in that I got blue poles.  These are very good condition, lock well and are comfortable in the hand.  I'm not really certain about the "foot," but I suppose I'll get used to it.  It is definitely not something I've come across before in the poles I have elected to use.Stansport Trekking Poles are known for their locking ability.  I have tried intentionally and unsuccessfully to get them to fail.  They just seem to lock well.  Hikers know, it DOES make a difference.  I've had a pole fail while I was crossing a river with a very heavy pack on my back.I can't wait to really put these things through their paces.

These are some very nice earrings.  They go well with Sterling Silver and 14k Yellow Gold Diamond and Swiss Blue Topaz Trillant Shape Ring.  When I saw them I knew my wife would be thrilled.  She was.What I find especially good is the "snap hooks" on them.  These method of putting earrings on is far more secure than the traditional open ended wire.  Good job!

Brand new, Mint in Original Packaging.  There's some fun cards here.  They might be a tad expensive to some, but to me I'm happy with it.  These are all MVP™ cards so don't get excited when you see the letters MVP stamped on the card.  It's the card, not the player.These are all high quality cards and pictures.  I definitely enjoy getting them and sorting through them.

While I am in no way a serious card collector, I'm really enjoying looking through these cards and pulling out ones that I like.  Is the price worth it?  It is to me and that's what it's all about.These cards are in great condition.  That's far better than the condition of the cases I received them in.  Each of the four plastic cases were broken during shipping.  Thankfully it didn't damage any cards that I wanted.Buggle's Classics have done well by me and I'm very satisfied with the products I've received.

I really, REALLY wanted to love this necklace.  I had never bought my wife a green diamond before and I was really excited to see this offered.  What a bummer.  This thing is so small it makes me wonder why the sellers even bother.  This would hardly be usable for any human over the size of an infant.  And why anyone would want to buy this FOR an infant is beyond me.Much like the light blue diamond earrings PARIKHS Princess Cut Blue Diamond Stud AAA Quality in White Gold (0.07ct), these are totally useless for an adult.DO NOT BUY THIS NECKLACE UNLESS YOU UNDERSTAND HOW TRULY SMALL IT IS.

I've needed a silicone whisk for awhile now.  I have many totally metal pots for which I have a regular whisk.  However, for the couple nonstick pots I have, I've needed something else to use when I make a stock and want to thicken it.This whisk is perfect.  It fits well in the hand and it works well in the pan.  I don't say this lightly as I am a retired chef and expect a lot out of my kitchen equipment.

I would give this one star if I thought the diamond wasn't pretty.  These earrings are barely suitable for a newborn.  On any normal human adult - or even teen, for that matter - these are so small they'd be lost inside the piercing hole.  I am truly sad I bought these.  Worse yet, I bought them as a gift for my wife.  Yes, she's pretty disappointed as well.DON'T BUY THESE UNLESS YOU UNDERSTAND HOW SMALL THEY TRULY ARE

While some say "Underrated" others say "Overrated". I have to say with the exception of No Rain, I'm in the latter group. No Rain is, was, and always will be (to me) the only reason to buy this album. Yes, this is opinion and we all know that opinions are like ...holes and everybody's got one and they usually stink. However, this is MY opinion of this album. Would I recommend it to anybody? Only for No Rain.

Birds of a Feather is exactly that when the listener understands this disc.  Everybody who plays on it is acquainted one way or another musically.  I got this when I was in my Larry Carlton mode.  There are definitely times when a disc like this is exactly what your CD player wants.Birds of a Feather is worth owning just for the mellowness it offers.

I remember this being THE hot thing of the moment in '94. That's probably because Enya was big and B-Tribe had been on the airwaves making their own kind of waves. Chant isn't all that exciting. Personally, I've found that why technically interesting it is overall dull. Buyer beware. It doesn't live up to the hype.

There's something about this album that makes me laugh every time I put it on. Best of all, though, was the single attached "You and Me Baby Ain't Nothin' But Mammals So Let's Do It Like They Do on the Discovery Channel". Being your average older white guy, I probably wasn't the target audience when this released. But the heck with that. I snort laughed when I first heard it on CBC (Canadian Broadcasting Corporation) radio and knew I HAD to get this stupid thing.Everybody's already beat me to it - sophomoric, silly, sexist and sassy. Would that make it S to the 4th power? Could be! Hooray for Boobies is tongue in cheek from the get go. If you don't believe me, read the words printed on the label that aren't part of the advertising rubbish. If you don't laugh, you probably shouldn't have bought this album in the first place.So here's to my bud, F-word and I present the Bloodhound Gang's "... Discovery Channel".

Big Head Todd & the Monsters was one of those groups that occasionally pop up that hit the ground running and then seem to run off the map.  That said, before they go they manage to put out a few decent CD's.  In this case, BHT&tM's third album, Sister Sweetly, was the name of the game.Sister Sweetly in addition to being a pretty decent cut was a pretty decent album.  Here we've got their biggest hit, Broken Hearted Savior in the first position.  The title song rolls in as cut #2, Tomorrow Never Comes - another great one - at #4, It's Alright at #5 and Bittersweet at #9, Circle at #10.  For a disc with 11 cuts, about half of them were radio worthy.  Not bad.Sister Sweetly was probably Todd's best effort of the five albums released.  Sadly, it never cracked above the #100 mark in Billboard's Top 200.  Be that as it may, it was on the charts for over a year.  Todd Park Mohr and crew did a great job here.

If you're searching for a swanky-looking wool/cashmere beanie to show off while munching on après-ski aperitifs in the Swiss Alps, then this ain't it. But if you're looking for an inexpensive hat that keeps you warm and doesn't look too bad, then you should consider the Chaos Men's beanie, which is warm, decent-looking and well-made.For the second straight year, we've had an unusually cold winter here in New York City. Every time I step outside I need a warm hat to keep me warm. The problem is that I keep losing them! I've gone through two already this winter. So this time I decided to purchase a more affordable hat in case my occasional forgetfulness reared its ugly head once more. And that is what led me to the The Chaos beanie.The fabric is comprised mostly of acrylic, with a small percentage of both wool and polyester. Even so, it feels supple, soft and a little fuzzy. It fits my relatively large head quite well, which makes me wonder whether the one-size-fits-all be too large for some people.

Resistance to change manifests itself in many ways --- both large and small, sober and amusing. Sometimes you remain in a job for too long without seeking alternatives. Sometimes you can't muster the energy to unglue yourself from the couch. (We've all been there.) And sometimes, God only knows why, you hang on to the same disgusting ice cube trays you discovered abandoned in the freezer after moving into your apartment three years ago.The inertia that kept those cracked plastic ice cube trays in my freezer for three years was abruptly shattered one day when my girlfriend reached in for some ice cubes. "Ewwwww, gross."My girlfriend had planted the seed of shame that led me to log in and search for something new, something bold, something... something that was at least sanitary. And that is how I came to own the Tovolo King Cube Ice Tray.I love this product. It differs from the typical hard-plastic ice cube trays in that it's made of pliable, flexible silicon rubber. It produces 15 robust, crystal clear ice cubes. The cubes emerge almost completely transparent, which stands in stark contrast to the cloudy-looking cubes produced by traditional plastic trays. In my experience, the Tovolo trays produce cubes that seem to keep their form for much longer, so you don't have to worry as much about accidentally swallowing melted-down chunks. The one downside is that you have to kind of twist and squeeze the tray to wring out the cubes, which are often a bit stubborn about coming out. I bought these trays for my parents because I lick them so much and my mom tells me she sometimes has difficulty getting them out.✔ PROS-Produces 15 robust, crystal clear ice cubes that are perfectly shaped-Trays hold up well with heavy use; they're sturdy-Dishwasher safe-Trays are attractive looking-Trays DON'T crack or stain like traditional plastic trays-Easily stackable in the freezer, even before the water is frozen-Good price point✔ CONS-It can sometimes be a bit challenging to get the cubes out of the tray.✔ FYIThe trick to removing the ice cubes is to turn the tray upside down while twisting it and using your thumbs to push out the cubes. (It's not really as difficult as it sounds, although my mom finds it mildly annoying.)In sum, I'm so glad I purchased these trays. I would never go back to the cheap plastic kind. All in all a good product at a good price point.

Resistance to change manifests itself in many ways --- both large and small, sober and amusing. Sometimes you remain in a job for too long without seeking alternatives. Sometimes you can't muster the energy to unglue yourself from the couch. (We've all been there.) And sometimes, God only knows why, you hang on to the same disgusting ice cube trays you discovered abandoned in the freezer after moving into your apartment three years ago.The inertia that kept those cracked plastic ice cube trays in my freezer for three years was abruptly shattered one day when my girlfriend reached in for some ice cubes. "Ewwwww, gross."My girlfriend had planted the seed of shame that led me to log in and search for something new, something bold, something... something that was at least sanitary. And that is how I came to own the Tovolo King Cube Ice Tray.I love this product. It differs from the typical hard-plastic ice cube trays in that it's made of pliable, flexible silicon rubber. It produces six robust, crystal clear ice cubes. The cubes emerge almost completely transparent, which stands in stark contrast to the cloudy-looking cubes produced by traditional plastic trays. This particular Tovolo tray makes six larger-sized cubes, which are perfect for cooling pitchers of water or soda or ice tea. But I use them just as often for a glass of water or to cool down a warm glass of Diet Coke. The larger cubes keep their form for much longer, so you don't have to worry as much about accidentally swallowing melted-down chunks. The one downside is that you have to kind of twist and squeeze the tray to wring out the cubes, which are often a bit stubborn about coming out. I bought these trays for my parents because I lick them so much and my mom tells me she sometimes has difficulty getting them out of the tray.✔ PROS-Produces robust, crystal clear ice cubes-Larger-sized cubes don't melt as quickly and keep their form longer; perfect for cooling pitchers-Trays hold up well with heavy use; they're sturdy-Dishwasher safe-Trays are attractive looking-Trays DON'T crack or stain like traditional plastic trays-Easily stackable in the freezer, even before the water is frozen-Good price point✔ CONS-It can sometimes be a bit challenging to get the cubes out of the tray✔ FYIThe trick to removing the ice cubes is to turn the tray upside down and then use your thumb to push out the individual cubes. (It's really not as difficult as it sounds. And remember, these are large-sized cubes, so most of the time you'll only need one or two.)In sum, I'm so glad I purchased these trays. I would never go back to the cheap plastic kind. All in all a good product at a good price point.

Let me be very clear: these GoFit gloves break down pretty quickly. More on that in a moment, but first a little background.For several years I've been lifting weights once or twice a week to round out my (running-centric) exercise routine. I use weightlifting gloves for two reasons: to improve my grip and to prevent the development of calluses on my hands. In the past I've purchased Harbinger lifting gloves, which are relatively inexpensive -- $15-30 price range -- and adequately protect my hands. However, I found that the padding on the palms was so thick that it hindered my grip. And so I went off in search of a new pair, which led me to try the GoFit Diamond-Tac gloves.Initially, they were a perfectly snug fit, and the low-profile cushioning offered an excellent balance between protecting my hands and providing a reliable grip. But that didn't last for long. After a couple of months of use, they began to stink up and, as they instructed, I hand washed them using cold water and a small dollop of Woolite. Then I rinsed them and allowed them to air dry overnight. After that first wash, the gloves began deteriorating.With each subsequent workout, the gloves stretched out more and more and the seams and stitching busted open more and more. After the second wash, things got even worse. Within three or four months, the gloves were in rough shape. In an attempt to be fair, it's true that these gloves are pretty inexpensive, but still... They should last longer than a few months and a few washes. In sum, these gloves work well UNTIL you wash them -- after which they start to fall apart.

I ordered these laces to add a little flair to a pair of green Ted Baker dress shoes I own. The laces are well made; the color is a perfect looking rich shade of purple; and they provide a stylish yet unostentatious element to both my shoes and my overall outfit. I've gotten many complements on them -- nearly always from girls. I ordered size 30" and I wear size 12 shoes. They're the perfect length. These kinds of subtle additions to your wardrobe MATTER.

I have several tiki torches on my apartment terrace. I purchased these tiki torch canisters to replace my old ones, which were all rusted out. Unfortunately, these new ones also simply cannot seem to stand up to the elements AT ALL. Even when I place the tiki torch covers over them, which I usually do, the bottoms get rusted out and leak torch fuel after only a few weeks. I live in a city. I don't have the luxury of a shed where I can stash the torches when they're not in use. Of course, I both understand and accept that their being exposed to the elements will inevitably diminish their lifespan. But still, these things are so cheaply made that they get rusted out after only a few weeks.

I have several tiki torches on my apartment terrace. After burning through the rope wicks that came with my torches, I decided to spring for these "Long Life Fiberglass Replacement Wicks." And yes, they do last much longer than the rope wicks -- perhaps twice as long. But they have two other distinct advantages that should be highlighted...1) They stand up to the wind much better. My terrace can get very windy, and when I'm hosting people I hate having to constantly relight the wicks every time a gust of wind rolls through. But these fiberglass wicks rarely lose their flame even during really blustery wind.2) They're more durable after having been exposed to the elements. Sometimes I forget to put the covers over the torches after I blow them out. And they get rained on, or frozen in cold temperatures. And unlike the rope wicks, which quickly disintegrate in the face of the elements, these fiberglass wicks bounce back even after they've been soaked in rain or suffered through below-freezing temperatures -- provided they're first allowed to dry out a bit.All in all, these fiberglass wicks are a significant upgrade. They still seem a tad too expensive, however. And that's why I couldn't give them a five-star rating.

I was searching for something other than an iPhone armband to use when I run outdoors. I wanted something small -- but big enough for my iPhone and also a set of keys and my money clip. (For the record, the iPhone 6 fits in the pouch, but the 6 Plus does not.)The Nathan Runner's Waist Pack is a solid product. With its two pouches, I can easily fit my keys and my small money clip in the tiny mesh-zippered pocket, while keeping my iPhone in the easily accessible larger pouch. (See attached photos.) The material always provides for a comfortable fit. I never seem to have to adjust the strap during my runs. And the stretchy, elastic pouch provides just the right amount of give when you need to cram a little bit more inside of it.Importantly, this waist pack NEVER bops or bounces around during my runs. I wouldn't even notice it was there if I didn't need to occasionally adjust the volume on my iPod.The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is because the reflexive label on the pouch has begun peeling off. Other than that, this is a quality product.

I play in an adult club soccer league and as my team's goalkeeper, I've endured a number of collisions and elbows -- especially when jumping up to contest corner kicks and diving for loose balls in the box.A few months ago I got elbowed hard in the mouth -- resulting in bleeding gums and a very sore mouth. That scared me. What if I had gotten some teeth knocked out?So I purchased these Shock Doctor Adult mouth guards. They work great. They're big enough to fit comfortably around my upper set of teeth, but they're not too big or clunky. For example, I'm still able to shout clear instructions to my teammates.You simply soak them in boiling water, clamp then in your teeth so they get your imprint, and you're good to go. And no one's even teased me about wearing them haha!! Just think about the minor cost of these mouth guards compared to the enormous cost and hassle of reconstructive dental surgery! Easy call in my opinion.

This pump kit gets the job done, and considering its very inexpensive price I think it's a great deal. There is one problem, however, and it's the reason I can only give this product three stars. The incredibly cheap plastic "carry case" -- inside which the small pump, pressure gauge and needles are stored -- tears apart easily. This is a problem because it's quite easy to lose track of the small parts if they're not kept together in some kind of bag or case.

I need to say right off the bat that I only read one other in this series. But because Nina Levine is such an incredible writer, never once did I feel like I was lost or couldn't follow the story-line. In fact, this book has me clamoring for more and there is no doubt I will be playing catch up and reading those I've missed.This beautiful love story between Scott and Harlow made me sigh right from the start. Getting each of their POVs in alternating chapters gave me such insight into not only their journey but those of other members of the MC club. The author gave enough background that I was able to follow along seamlessly. This couple loves hard. They are both patient and hot-headed with each other. Playful yet wildly erotic. They fit so well together and by the looks of things, their past heartache has only made them stronger.All the characters are well-written and completely captivating. No one felt as simply an add-on and each and every character had purpose. The loyalty shown not only to each of the club members, but those that are family whether or not by blood, was truly heartwarming to witness. I liked that they were mature and forthright and no nonsense is tolerated.Scott  is one heck of a President and considering his family tree, he is one of the good ones for sure. Harlow is a feisty, big-hearted, and selfless woman. It's no wonder these two are together.  They handle all of the underlying issues that continue to plague the Club with determination and I loved that Scott was completely honest with her every step of the way. There is plenty of danger for this crew but it's handled sensibly and I loved every word.I'm thrilled to have been able to read this part of the series and honestly can't wait to see what the author has in store for us next. There are plenty of secondary characters that caught my eye so I'm hopeful they will get their time in the sun and soon.A solid 5 stars!!!

At first glance, I thought this would be a very sexy read, full of forbidden scenes and plenty of voyeurism and erotica. But what floored me most was that this book was that and so much more.
