I was so pleasantly surprised at how this story-line unfolded and thrilled at how the author weaved this tale.I loved watching as Heidi and her hard-as-nails persona, completely disappear when thoughts of Ransom filled her mind. From that very first passionate encounter, the woman was a goner. And rightfully so. Right along with Tucker, I was both mesmerized and turned-on at the scene they all participated in. Again, I thought this book would have just been a series of trysts between the trio. But what struck me the most is how we get to witness first-hand just how broken Ransom truly is and the curse (if you will) of being a hot rockstar and exceptional in the bedroomHis life is spiraling downward and Heidi, very surprisingly, becomes his reason for wanting to be better. Heidi's all-consuming dilemma into wanting to stay with her 'perfect' husband and in the meantime, never feeling what she does, every time Ransom is near was quite the roller-coaster ride. I could feel her being pulled in two different directions. She wanted more. She needed more. And Ransom fit the bill. But then she would remember just how wonderful Tucker is to her, accepting of her crazy publicist life and not wanting to hurt him. All is laid out so damn well and the author wrote it beautifully.The huge twist in the story caught me completely off-guard and oh yeah, I gasped loudly at that one!!I found this book to flow seamlessly, and it held me captive until the very end. I honestly didn't know how it would turn out or who Heidi would ultimately end up with but I will say I was both torn and happy at the result. The author very cleverly ends this story with the beginnings of what I hope is more from these characters..even bringing in one forgotten person from Taint.The cameos by Justice were the perfect compliment to this book and gave Heidi that often-needed reality check.A great book that I devoured happily.Huge 5 stars!!!

Like so many other JHB fans, I fell hard for Sebastian and Caroline in the Education series. Their love story is one for the ages and unlike any I've ever read before or since.  With Semper Fi, I was once again with this beloved couple, only this time, getting inside Sebastian's head for a retelling of The Education of Caroline.  And oh how I have missed them.The book pretty much follows the same course as TEOC. However, we get to experience for the first time, all the hurt and sorrow that Seb has endured all the years he spent apart from his one true love. Getting his POV was at times insanely heartbreaking. With all the bravado he shows as a Marine, deep down he's still that 17 year-old boy who so desperately wanted to be loved. For his Caro to find a way to stay with him. To find him when he was finally of age. The hardness he had to cover himself with, in order to survive both his military training and his reluctant hate for his woman, was so sad to read at times. But the glimmer of hope, the small window of light that was thrust upon him when he and Caro reunite in the most unlikely of ways, began a healing process that was glorious to witness.I enjoyed this book immensely and was grateful the author gave us Sebastian's POV. Moments I wanted to know how he felt from the original series are here, present and accounted for and it truly makes their journey complete. The extras at the end certainly satisfy my curiosity as to their lives now and I for one can now let them go.The insight into the horrors of war and the frustration and utter heartache of PTSD is represented well here. I had a bit of trouble with Sebastian's failure to grow up at times but understood how his psyche was still very much stuck inside that 17 year-olds' head. Not to mention his anger at feeling like a failure for his woman. Caro is outstanding in her patience and never-ending love of her man, no matter what the circumstance. THAT is what will always stay with me: this is first and foremost a love that was meant to be despite everyone thinking otherwise. One that will be in my heart forever. A solid 4 stars for one last ride with some old friends.

Oh wow, here we go again. I'm sure anyone who reads my reviews of Lauren Blakely's book must think I'm under her spell or something. No one could possibly love every book an author writes. And I would have to agree with that assumption. But...the way she creates stories that draw me in from the start, the way she manages to continually blend sex with heart flawlessly AND the way she consistently gives me heroines that are both independent and sensual are unmatched in my opinion. With Sinful Longing, every single component I just described is there with the added bonus of a mystery that has slowly been unraveling and leaves the reader with their jaw to the floor at the very last words.Ok so this Colin Sloan's book and his seemingly casual relationship with one Elle Mariano sizzles like nobody's business. Their chemistry is evident from the very beginning. These two can't be within a few feet from each other without the chance touch that might occur between them. They enjoy a purely physical relationship that has certainly become adventurous at times, yet beneath the surface, both Colin and Elle want more. With complicated pasts, there is that overriding fear that more harm than good would happen should they take their relationship to the next level. It's a chance they thankfully take and believe me, it is quite the bumpy ride!!In a nutshell, this is romance at it's best. Not only do you get great passion, but a love that is meant to be. I love that the author doesn't make it easy but keeps it realistic. You do not get whiny heroines who leave at the drop of the hat or make waves just to prove a point. Elle is a strong woman, who not only runs a community center but is a roller derby warrior in her time off. The love of her son, her work, the kids she tries to steer in the right direction and her defender status when she's in the rink as Titanium are what make her soar. It only makes sense to have an equally strong man by her side in Colin.And then, with every new twist to the murder mystery, we get a bit closer to what actually happened. There is the bombshell that was dropped at the end of book 2 in this series and now Marcus is firmly entrenched in both the Sloan family and their pursuit of the truth. It seems that in every chapter, more is revealed that has my head spinning. There is still so much to uncover and I'm hopeful that in Michael's book next, we finally get the whole sordid story.I encourage you to start from the beginning and read both Sweet Sinful Nights and Sinful Desire first. Although each is a standalone, you'll get the whole story and meet all the rest of Colin's family and friends.Well worth your time, this is a book that combines desire and mystery brilliantly.A huge 5 stars.

This book was utterly fantastic. But before I gush about Dearborn, I need to point out that I do not consider myself a PNR fan by any stretch of the imagination. I tend to avoid these stories for the most part but once in awhile, a beloved author of mine will put one out and I take that plunge. This is what happened with Dearborn. And once again, I am so happy that I didn't say no to an advanced copy but took the chance and came out a believe once more.What I found most endearing about this book is that beneath all the magic and supernatural occurrences, that this was first and foremost a love story. Willow and Quinn. Two people who haven't seen each other in 15 years, who remember each other from high school but know literally nothing about the other. Quinn is back in the small town of Woodland Creek after serving time in Afghanistan and no one seems to be able to get through to him, not even his closest friends. A chance meeting in Willow's diner sets their story in motion and soon each of their worlds will never be the same.The gift that Willow has in sensing and seeing color surrounding those in front of her is beautifully described by the author. She'll actually get nauseous if someone is upset or angry or is simply having a tough time. With Quinn, this happens often since he feels so out of sorts. Watching as Willow takes the time to figure out not only what must have happened to him during wartime but why his behavior can be so erratic, had me in knots right along with her. Her power to physically feel the moods of others is meticulously recounted and you're just as anxious to set things right. I loved her dedication and selflessness when it came to now only her magical town but those she holds near. Her best friend Ryan has his own talent for reading other's minds and his comic timing was a welcome relief more times than I could count.Quinn is a complicated character but you get to see the true transformation of a man who was denied his past and his legacy. It's through his blossoming love of Willow that his true sense of worth is finally realized. Together with other key figures in Willow's life, Quinn's future is put on the right course and he comprehends fully that he belongs by her side.I found myself learning all about a genre foreign to me but fascinated just the same. There are incredible scenes concerning 'shifting' that had me completely riveted. Once I realized that love can be found in this genre just like everywhere else, I was more than happy to enter the secretive world of Woodland Creek.This book is a wonderful journey into a magical place that I am pleased to have been able to discover. I encourage those of you who didn't 'do PNR' like I did, to give this one a chance. It is well worth your time. I promise it will put a smile on your face.A solid 5 stars!

My first from this author and it most definitely will not be my last!A tremendously simple yet beautiful story about second chances and the courage to take them.  This poignant love story between Ray and  Holly starts innocently enough: two co-workers in a small upstate NY town decide to share a lottery ticket. And when they surprisingly win a landfall, not only are their wallets now full but their hearts are as well.Ray and Holly fight the pull for one another because they wonder if their lives can fit together, since the attention they now garner has unfortunate consequences.What I truly loved about this book is that it was their story. There wasn't a ton of extraneous side-stories or characters to try to keep straight. Ray and Holly just want to be happy and their pasts may just decide their fate. But the hope that they can conquer that underlying fear that it will all be taken away from them kept their dreams of an HEA afloat. Their hesitance and awkwardness towards each other, no matter how fierce the pull, was a delight to read. Completely genuine kind of journey that I thoroughly enjoyed.I will say I would love to read more of them in the future.Well worth your time.A solid 5 stars.

What wonderful debut! I love discovering new authors who put their heart and soul into their writing and Leslie Pike did just that.A love story between Steven and Bliss that starts quite accidentally but quickly becomes steamy and very sexy. Living next door to each other, Steven's world as a stuntman collides with permanent resident Bliss as he and his crew take up residence in Bliss's small community while making a movie nearby.They fall very fast for one another, there are a few bumps in the road but overall they know they are meant to be and fight the stubbornness each have so fiercely, in order to make things right. There is a great cast of secondary characters including the lead man in Jack and Bliss's bestie Nicki. Bliss's ex-husband is also an important part of the story and it was refreshing to read that exes can still be friends and mean it.I enjoyed reading about a more mature group who know what they want and won't stop until they get the happiness they deserve. There is plenty of humor, together with great moments of tenderness and passion. A very impressive beginning to what I know will be a successful writing career for the author.A solid 4 stars!

Oh wow. Fostered was an utterly wonderful surprise. Recommended by a favorite author of mine, I figured I'd give this new-to-me author a chance and I am extremely happy I did.From the very start, I loved Vanessa Marie's style. Written in Dante Wallaces's POV, we are thrown immediately into his thoughts as he is being driven to yet another foster home. At 17, he has seen it all and it hasn't been pretty. In fact it's been downright horrifying and it's amazing this young man is here to tell about it. With this, his last chance at a real life before he ages out of the system, we are privy to his constant fears, his dread and his resignation that this too won't work out. But as we meet the McKinley family right along with Dante, it is with pure joy that we get to witness what it's like to finally feel like you belong. To feel loved for the first time and to have your soul warmed up like nothing you've ever experienced.I laughed more times than I can count at the complete mayhem that is the McKinley household. Placing Dante with this family should have been a disaster but with the love that they show one another through the constant teasing, swearing and overall concern, our guy didn't know what hit him. I didn't either! I was right alongside him for the ride and it was insanely wonderful. And as much as I laughed, the tears hit hard and fast more than I want to admit. The way the entire McKinley crew had Dante's back when outside forces threatened to remove him from their home was so beautiful I found myself in complete awe of these characters. Holly stands out above the rest for her good-natured, easy-going yet mama-bear qualities. She cares for her brood and made Dante feel like one of her own, right from the start. As this book quite literally chronicles a positive time of a lifer in the foster system, you get to see first-hand how it should be done. How it's possible to love a young man who sadly always got the short end of the stick. The hope that is usually fleeting in Dante's mind is suddenly starting to become permanent and it's thing of beauty to see.There is a sweet underlying romance that made this story even better. Lily gave Dante the softness he didn't know he had and with just a side glance or a small smile, he knew she was special. There aren't any sexual situations or much in the way of physical expression but theirs is a slow-simmering mutual admiration that is delightful to watch. The perfect high school crush.Fostered is very simply put, a look into the life of someone who is given the chance to soar when his wings always seemed to be clipped. A feelgood kind of story that will make you smile.A solid 5 stars.

Yes I finally got to this book. Hearing about it these past few years, I just knew I had to dig it out of the tbr pile on my Kindle and give it a go. I am thrilled I did. And kind of want to slap myself for waiting so long since it was truly a beautiful read.The author's writing is flawless in my opinion. The words flow easily and her writing style is simple. And I don't mean that it's subpar or lacking in any way. I just mean that she doesn't waste time with unnecessary words or scenes. She gives us exactly the right amount of emotion, dialogue and backdrop. I felt as I was on that island stranded right along with TJ and Anna, the descriptions so vivid and well-researched. Every small victory at creating shelter or finding food, to the dire medical situations that kept them vigilant, I felt each and every one of those scenarios like I was there myself.Anna and TJ's love, although expected, never felt forced, pathetic or desperate. Even though they didn't know their fate, I really believe they fell for each other for the right reasons and I give the author huge kudos for making their love official when TJ was of age.Overall this is a story of survival. Not just from a horrific plane crash leaving TJ and Anna cut off from the rest of the world. But to survive in a universe where others may not understand your relationship nor your desire to be together. Especially when you aren't 100 percent sure yourself.This was an absolutely lovely read that everyone needs to discover. Simply wonderful in every way.A huge 5+ stars.

The Predicament is a wildly funny, touching and sexy read. The perfect short book for a lazy day.Casey Rossi, bestie to Emma Fitzgerald is always the life of the party. And when her love life post-baby goes a bit 'south' with her husband, the hilarity ensues when she gains advice from everyone in her tight-knit group. I had forgotten how much I loved this cast of characters and it was a pure joy being with them again.We get to catch up with the entire crew and I was honestly laughing out loud at both the advice and the commentary, especially from Casey and Aidan.A great extra to this beloved series, you won't want to miss it.5 solid stars!

A Lover's Lament is an absolutely gorgeous read. I was hooked from the very start and I honestly did not want it to end. I was drawn into this second chance romance between Devin and Katie due to it's exquisite simplicity. The book is their story. Yes there are many outside forces that dictate their paths and the struggles to get back what they once had. But in the end, I cherished the plain fact that it's a tale about a man and a woman and the love that refuses to be extinguished.This love story gave me all the feels that I crave. Harshly separated after declaring their hearts to each other, both Devin and Katie live their lives the best they can. 10 years pass without a word from either one. Then through a pen pal program, with perhaps a bit of divine intervention and the urging of a well-meaning doctor, Katie finds her newly-found friend to be none other than the boy she loved all those years ago. Finding each other again is evidently the balm both needed to soothe not only their broken hearts but their troubled souls.Told in alternating POV's, these co-author's words flowed seamlessly. You'd never know they hadn't already written together before this debut. The attention to detail, especially from Devin, in describing the daily life while stationed in Iraq was mesmerizing. Never did it feel tedious or hard to understand. Mr. Urruela, with his first-hand knowledge in being a soldier overseas, gave us that hard-to-fathom glimpse into a world that for most of us is unknown. Yet now I feel I have a better understanding as to how our brave warriors live each day away from home. For that I am most grateful.We get to watch Devin and Katie fall in love all over again, suffer immeasurable losses, live each day missing the other and wishing it will all work out for them in the end. Their journey is never easy. It wasn't even when they were young. There are so many obstacles, hurt feelings and the inevitable doubt. But you can't help but get lost in their world and their pain becomes your own.I laughed, smiled, cried and gasped often. There were scenes that ripped me apart and others that made me sigh loudly. Devin and Katie are a well-written and very enjoyable couple. And there are secondary characters that added the right touch and made this book complete. I wouldn't mind their stories in the future should that be a consideration.Lastly I will just say this: if you are looking for a book that will stir up a myriad of emotions, yet leave you smiling broadly through tears upon conclusion, then this is the one for you.A huge 5+++ stars!

With book two in the Girls Breaking the Rules trilogy, Kelsey Burns has certainly proven she is not just a flash in the pan. With Alexa, we get a much more meatier read that kept me captivated from the very first words.The author pairs Alexa with Johnny, a local barkeep, and the sparks are flying off the pages immediately. Their love story is not as simple as it seems and with some mystery surrounding Johnny, our girl might be nursing a broken heart.The entire crew is on board and they provide the perfect addition to this adventure. Get ready for some extremely sexy scenes, together with the usual banter that had me rolling! Tash, Alexa and Shel are a force to be reckoned with and their men have to struggle to keep up! Thankfully the author has given this trio men who are strong enough to not only tame them but love them completely.I am enjoying every new book in this series and just know Shel's turn will be just as wonderful.Well worth your time, these books will make you smile.

This looks like one incredible collection of paranormal tales!!! I can't wait to dive in but in the meantime, I can offer up a review for Strange Magic Parts I & II by Michelle Mankin.My review is for Strange Magic Part One and Two: I was completely intrigued by this book. I am not a pnr fan at all but Michelle Mankin has managed to beautifully combine her love of rock and roll with the spirit world and has made me a true believer!The story, with New Orleans as a canvas so to speak, is actually two in one in that we get Billy Blade, sexy rocker who can sense, feel spirits around him, especially onstage. He isn't quite sure why and it kind of freaks him out just the same. He lays the groundwork for the true crux of this first part of Strange Magic, which is a step back to some years prior and the story of Thyme Bellerose.Thyme Bellerose, the consummate heroine: loyal to a fault, loves her family and only wants the best for her fiance Shane Lamar. But a 'chance' encounter that isn't quite so coincidental threatens both her life and her world as she knows it.Her beautiful yet haunting violet eyes are the key in my opinion to how Billy and Thyme's paths intersect. Their story has only just begun and by the end of part one I was clamoring for so much more!I was riveted by this storyline and the way it caught my attention. I honestly didn't know what to expect and was happily surprised that anything even remotely paranormal could captivate me this much.The author continues to step up her game and write stories with heart that you can't but help fall in love with each and everytime. She pays attention to detail and you feel as much a part of the story as the main characters.As a huge fan of Michelle Mankin's, I will admit I was a bit skeptical about reading this latest book of hers since I am not a paranormal fan at all. I just don't read it. However, I was so pleasantly surprised at how much I absolutely adored this story. It kept me glued to my ereader from page one.Book 2 picks up shortly after the end of Book 1,which is a great backstory unto itself. Our hero, Billy Blade, is touching down in New Orleans for a much needed break and for some time to recharge the creative juices. From the time he stays at the former apartment of one Thyme Bellerose, whom we met in Book 1 and has seemingly gone missing once Hurricane Katrina hit 10 years prior, magical things start to happen. Since Billy has a gift of summoning spirits with his harmonica, he isn't all that surprised when Thyme starts to make her presence known to him when he in the apartment. And so starts a truly spiritual love affair.This book is so engaging. From the minute Thyme and Billy start to spend time together, there is this unmistakable chemistry that you just can't ignore. Even though she is a spirit and he is living mortal, they have more in common that one might think, and as the story progresses we learn more about why Billy has his gift and how he might be able to save Thyme from an afterlife in limbo.The author pays attention to detail and this book was very well researched. With NOLA and Mardi Gras as the background, the book uses many familiar sights and sounds. In addition, the description of the 'spiritual underworld' and those that inhabit it, was uncanny. I often felt like I was really there and have to say was happily drawn into that unfamiliar atmosphere.Although this story is paranormal at the surface, in the end it is a story of true love, fate, hope and resilience. The secondary characters, some kind, some downright evil, had me completely engaged the entire time. There are some incredible revelations and some very magical scenes that truly blew me away.I encourage you, even if you were not a pnr fan like I was, to give this book a chance. If you know Michelle Mankin's work at all, you'll know she writes from the heart and gives the reader story-lines that are truly well written and captivating. I was mesmerized at discovering a genre not familiar to me, yet walked away loving every word.5 magical stars and very highly recommended.I'm telling you, just having both books at your fingertips for the low price of 99 pennies is amazing. You'll love Strange Magic and the rest of this collection is something I am looking forward to reading.

All I Need Is You is the kind of book that simply makes you feel warm all over. A joy to read and a pleasure from start to finish.This touching love story between Neve and Rory had so much more than just romance. Getting to know each other through letters while Rory was serving in Afghanistan, each became the other's sounding board. Neve as a dancer was finally realizing her dream: a tryout with Cirque du Soleil. She craved a new start and was hopeful that she would traveling the world with the famed dance troupe.Rory back home in the States for good, picks up with his pen pal after a most unfortunate tryst while he was on leave, and these two together set off some serious fireworks!What I loved first and foremost was that Neve was her own girl. We always look for that sassy bestie to keep us on our toes in a book. However, it's Neve who is the sassy one and for most of this story, Rory is the one kept on his toes. And he loves it.Their witty banter, their passionate scenes and the tender moments shared between Rory and Neve make for the perfect story. His PTSD, her fear of staying the party girl forever and their constant struggle not to ruin what might be happening between them, are all great components to make this book feel so real. It wasn't just about their love, but about them accepting themselves for who they were and wanted to be and how to go about sharing that with each other.The absolute best thing though? The fact that Wendy Marcus has given us a spectacular man in Rory who is only 5 foot 4!!! Oh how I have wanted a story about a vertically-challenged man. Proving you don't have to be over 6 feet to get the girl. I can't thank her enough for that. It's about damn time.Overall a very satisfying read. One that made me smile, made me laugh and made me swoon. How much better can you get than that?

I can't even express how happy I am after reading Desperate Chances. I have loved this series from the very first pages of Bad Rep and have fallen for this cast of characters with each new book. This is the last one and as wonderful a read that it is, I can't help but be a bit melancholy as well.We finally get Mitch and Gracie's story.  Mitch, the laid-back bass guitarist for Generation Rejects, who has loved his former bestie since they first met. Gracie, who has put herself back together, shedding that party-girl persona and surviving an alcoholic overdose. Struggling to convince her parents and herself that she can make it on her own, all the while determined to be able to be in the same room as Mitch, when all she wants to do is be his friend again. Hopefully more. After a disastrous tryst a year prior, it's all they can do to remain civil.Oh my what a story. I had such a nervous feeling throughout this book, waiting for that ultimate moment where Gracie and Mitch would be face to face and not be able to outrun their past. And when the fireworks started and they were forced to get all of their bottled-up emotions out, I was completely captivated. I mean, seriously, there was no way I could put my e-reader down! You can feel the heartache and absolute dread that both Mitch and Gracie carried with them. My heart broke for them. I just wanted to join in with the numerous pleas from all of their friends to open their eyes and just figure out how to be together already. They were truly meant to be. Their hearts knew it. They just had to convince their minds.The author once again has written a simply perfect book that not only features the unrequited love story of Mitch and Gracie, but manages, masterfully I might add, to update us on all the happenings with the other members of the band and their significant others. Jordan and Maysie, Cole and Vivian and Riley and Garrett are all there. One crazy, loving family who make the right amount of appearances throughout and add just the right touch.As they all move on to new adventures, I am so sad that this could be the end of the road. But being witness to the love that has been the glue in holding this crew together was a complete pleasure to read. Each love story made me smile, made me laugh, made me cry on occasion and overall just made me extremely happy.I'm hopeful that one day we might get an update and see how the Rejects are doing down the road. But for now I will savor the warm feeling I have after finishing Desperate Chances, celebrating the reunion of former best friends who now have that chance to be more. It is a stellar finish that I won't soon forget.A huge 5+++ stars!!!

This is a great short about the sexy and very confident Cyrus Fletcher and Tricia, a smart and beautiful marketing publicist who go on a whirlwind trip to Vegas.Fletcher is a sports agent and lawyer who is desperate to sign the next best thing in the NBA. Seeing as he needs a date to woo his potential client, he approaches Tricia and they come to an understanding, contract and all, about what the weekend will entail.He pretends he thinks she's a high-class call girl and she pretends he's not the arse who drives her up a wall. Together they manage to have some wild fun, tame a witty yet cantankerous chaperone and perhaps even fall for each other.A great funny yet touching read that certainly has me wanting more. Since this is my first taste of Ms. Marx's work, I am confident I will love Binding Arbitration, the full-length novel where Fletcher was first introduced.A solid 4 stars

Bewitched is an absolutely enchanting short story. Daisy Prescott proves she can write New Adult with the best of them!This sweet and witty tale of Madison Bradbury and Andrew Wildes was a pure joy to read. Madison struggles with her roommate Sam's fascination with all things 'witchy' and her sudden interest in the dark, brooding Andrew leads to the use of 'magic' spells that she isn't sure she wants to fully understand or believe in. Yet when time in the classroom becomes more for these college juniors, it's up to Madison to either start believing in the unknown or walk away from the potential love she has craved in Andrew.The author's attention to detail is evident and she certainly did her homework with respect to the town of Salem, Massachusetts. The banter between Madison and Sam kept me chuckling throughout and the charming moments between Madison and Andrew made me sigh.  It is a great cast of characters I definitely need more of and am hopeful Ms. Prescott will be giving a continuation of this story very soon.A definite pick me up that I highly recommend to enjoy during these cool fall days.

Rebecca Yarros has certainly given us the perfect final chapter of flight school. Having read the first two books in the Flight & Glory series, I knew how masterful the author was with her words and her characters. I fell for each flyboy and the loves of their lives and with each ending, felt utterly satisfied. But with Beyond What is Given, the author's writing has hit a new level of excellence and the only word I can use upon reading those last pages, is bliss.This book gave me the feels I have been craving. From the very start this wildly entertaining and beautifully written love story had my heart. Grayson and Samantha. Roommates who feel that attraction almost instantly and it is bursting off each and every page. Watching as they match wits, each as stubborn as the other and both knowing that anything between them will spell disaster. With Samantha trying to put her life together and get a college degree after a very humiliating event in her home state of Colorado, and Grayson, trying to be at the top of his flight class, all the while harboring a secret left back home in North Carolina, these two carry a lifetime of baggage. Yet, they clearly fit together so perfectly and I was downright saddened at the thought that they just couldn't make it work.  But I will tell you this: their journey was nothing short of incredible and I savored each and every word.What is so special about this book and actually this entire series is that you feel as if you could be friends with this crew. From Josh and Ember to Paisley and Jagger to even Carter (!), this is a stellar cast of characters who sincerely care for one another. There is abundant teasing and good-natured ribbing, but in the end they truly have each other's backs. Grayson with his sense of honor and commitment is one of THE best men I've ever read about. Although at times misplaced, his loyalty to those he loves, blew me away time and time again. You can't help but fall for him.And Samantha with her huge heart and unwavering support, she was most definitely the match for the guarded Grayson. Seeing him open up, actually relax for a change and begin to find his way back to himself, was all Sam's doing. I loved their banter, their sexy trysts and most of all, how they needed each other when no one else would do. They simply got each other and you could feel it with each passing page.The author continues to write from her very soul. This is territory familiar to her and it shows. The knowledge of terminology and procedure is made 'human' due to her intimate experience with being a military wife. She makes you comfortable with a world very foreign to most of us. And it never took away nor did it make the story drag.I honestly can't say enough about this book. I couldn't put it down. It is most certainly my new favorite in the series and it will make you smile like nothing else. A job so well done.It will take me a bit to get over this hangover and I don't mind one bit!A huge 5++++ stars.

This book is one that tackles great loss for both main characters. Liz and Tristan, suffering from the tragic deaths of their loved ones. Now finding themselves living next door to each other. Both lost in their own worlds, they form a sort of mutual respect for one another and allow each other to mourn in only the way they each understand. Theirs is a relationship that on the surface seems simple, especially to those in their small town. But for Liz and Tristan, it proves to be the very lifeline that might prevent them from drowning in their grief.The Air He Breathes was extremely emotional. A story that is so heartbreaking, you wonder right along with Liz and Tristan, if there can be happiness found among all the sorrow. I felt for them. I celebrated their hard fought joys. I loved Liz's daughter Emma. She and her bestie Faye were true highlights of this book. But at times I needed more. Some extra details, some holes filled. There were parts of the timeline that felt left out as well as more interactions with those closest to them. Tristan's in-laws, the wonderful Mr. Henson, even the mysterious Sam. I know they had more to share and should have been allowed to. As much as I enjoyed this difficult journey, the ease at which everything fit so perfectly at the end kind of felt a bit cheesy. A bit too coincidental for my tastes. And I'm not sure the wild twist towards the end may have been necessary although I do understand why it was there.Overall it is well-written and I wouldn't hesitate to read more from this author but for now I'm giving this one a 3.5.

Simply a great little bit of time to catch up with some of my favorite characters created by Lauren Blakely.I am always clamoring for more since her words always make me smile.And this one is a truly a great little bonus that I adored.

I was thrilled to know we would be getting more Foster and EJ, the extremely wonderful couple from Renee Ericson's More Than Water.This short certainly had me smiling from ear to ear with the witty banter I have come to love combined with the tenderness that our couple show each other.There is that perfect mix of humor and true love that only the author can deliver.I am now left wanting more and hopeful this is not the last we will here from this delightful cast of characters.A simply joyful read!!

My first from Rachel Blaufeld and I am happy to have finally read a book from her. I truly enjoyed this one. A great look into how two broken people, with very sad pasts find each other and start to truly heal.This love story, although difficult at times, was a soul-grabbing read. Watching as Lane and Bess stumble time and time again, never really knowing what they deserve, wondering if the accidental meeting so long ago would either make or break them had me riveted. Each with painful demons each needs to overcome in order to find that sliver of true happiness they each deserve.Lane and Bess fit imperfectly perfect together yet there is so much underlying doubt, they can often be their own worst enemies. There is a ton of back and forth and I was left many times thinking this just wasn't going to work. Between their own issues, those of secondary characters who can't let go and the wild collision of two worlds, this is one bumpy ride.I did enjoy the flow of the book and the alternating POVs. It gave me great insight into how each character was feeling and the author never held back.  There are some difficult issues being dealt with in this story yet it was still very tender and touching for the most part.Highly recommended and I look forward to Jake's story next.  Well worth your time.

Just wow. I am thrilled to have this novella. As someone who doesn't necessarily figure things out easily when it comes to these kinds of stories, Initium has hopefully started me on the track to finally figuring out what this is truly all about.We get a bit of history, 21 years prior to what is happening now to Calla, and it is exhilarating!! I had forgotten just how wild a ride the Nocte series has been and this pleasant surprise has me all geared up and ready for Lux. There's even a couple of chapters of the last book to whet everyone's appetite.I strongly encourage you start at the beginning with Nocte and experience this journey for yourself. It is more than worth your time.

Somehow, Faith Andrews has me seriously considering changing teams. Once I read Man of My Dreams, I was all about Declan and was more than happy that Mia decided to stay with her husband. Noah was forced to leave town after his ill-fated affair and quite frankly I was glad to see him go. But now 5 years later, the man Noah Matheson is today is one I wouldn't get rid of anytime soon and I never thought I would say that!This touching love story between Noah and Willow has all the feels. They both have scarred hearts and are tentative to ever really begin again with someone new. However, there is definite chemistry between the two and despite the fact that they work so closely together, Noah and Willow couldn't help but fall for each other.What starts out as a comfortable friendship becomes more and both are incapable of stopping the inevitable love they soon feel. Both characters are worthy of happiness and I enjoyed the fact that Noah seemed a changed man and treated Willow with the respect and desire she deserved. In lieu of the fact that she has a sad past, I loved that Noah wanted her no matter what and just wouldn't stop at anything that got in their way. Anything including an ill-timed visit back home where he is face to face with the painful reminder of what could have been. But Noah faces his demons brilliantly and I simply adored how he was determined to get his own HEA come hell or high water! Nothing and no one was standing in his way this time. Not even the stubborn woman of HIS dreams: the sexy, stunning and sometimes silly woman that is Willow James.I am thrilled that the author fully redeemed Noah for me. He is worthy of Willow's love and his capability to not only adore his woman but take care of his friends and family, was quite endearing to say the least. He is most definitely a keeper. I will say that the brief time with Declan was not as expected and I will try not to remember him here but as the man who swept his wife off her feet years earlier.I'm hopeful somewhere down the road, we get Blaze and Sloane's story(s) as well. They were truly great secondary characters that added just the right touch to this story.Overall, After the Storm is a well-written and sweet read. Well worth your time.4.5 stars!!!

When Lauren Blakely says this is her dirtiest talker yet? You listen. Because let me tell you, no one thus far in the author's stable of sexy men has even come close to the one and only Ryan Sloan. In fact, I'm still gasping for air at the absolute pleasure this man delivered. And quite content to stay that way I might add.How this talented author continues to up her game is anyone's guess. The way she seamlessly combines a touching and sensitive story-line with the most sensual and erotic sex scenes completely floors me. Add to that two smart, mature and well-written characters in Ryan and Sophie and you've got the perfect combination for an exquisite book.Ryan, the dominant alpha male, has certainly met his match in Sophie Winston. Although Sophie is herself a very successful businesswoman, she still craves the man that can both satisfy her mentally as well as in the bedroom. Her willingness to submit is never presented as a weakness. Instead the author thoughtfully allows our heroine to enjoy herself while letting go but is never demeaned for knowing what she wants. Ryan attends to her every need and together their chemistry is explosive. Having already experienced a short or two from prior Blakely books, it's a miracle my Kindle is still working!With Ryan still trying to come to grips with a crime that was first mentioned in Sweet Sinful Nights and what it has done to him all these years later, it is beautiful to watch as the walls around his heart start to melt as he and Sophie become closer. However, because this incident and the fallout still being felt could jeopardize any sort of happiness, it will be up to both of them to be honest, be strong and face whatever may come.Part of my love of the author's work is that she will mention characters from previous books, further extending the Blakely family tree. With Sinful Desire we get that and more. I love that Ryan's family plays a prominent role, with Shannon and Brent (from Sweet Sinful Nights) back as well as his two brothers, Colin and Michael. Together, they are all a force not to be messed with and the love and strong admiration they each have for each other made me smile. Even John, Sophie's brother, is a welcome addition to the crew. It's this sense of family, the knowledge that someone has your back, that I have come to both expect and adore. Together with an adorable dog in Johnny Cash, Ryan and Sophie can hopefully have the life they both want so desperately.I absolutely devoured this book from beginning to end and can't wait to see what book 3 in the series will bring. I can't imagine it getting any hotter but with Lauren Blakely, you just can't rule anything out. The woman is the true master of writing sex with heart.You need to grab a glass of wine, some extra panties(!), put your feet up and get lost in this journey. You will be bowled over just like I was.A very solid and wildly sexy 5++++ stars.

Here we are again. I just finished yet another book from Scott Hildreth and I'm sitting here like a fool with a huge grin on my face. I'm continually floored at this author's capability to create new characters that I completely fall for each and every time. Tough guys that somehow worm their way into my heart and leave an indelible mark.What I think I adore most about Blurred Lines is the underlying simplicity of the story: the blossoming love between Blake and Riley. He is the seemingly typical tattoo artist and she is the woman who has escaped a violent lover and wants a new start. Their first encounter was nothing out of the ordinary but you just knew that the seed had been planted and that they just had to become more. I was curious as to how the author would make it his own and not just the same old story about a bad boy and the girl who wants to win his heart. And when I got to about the 60% mark, THAT is when the book took a particularly wild twist and right then and there I just knew this one would become another favorite of mine.With the addition of familiar members of the Selected Sinners as a very unexpected surprise and a smart-mouthed and crazy fellow artist in Stevie, this book, again, kept me glued to my e-reader. I did not know how it would all play out since secrets revealed throughout this journey were some of the most unusual I've ever read. Yet it all fit together so perfectly. The author has developed such a unique style for giving us a tale that is full of heart while at the same time is never, ever sappy. The right mix of soul and bravado. Heartache and hope. Tough and tender. The best recipe for a happy reader.If you are looking for a book that can combine humor, passion, heartache and love flawlessly, then this one is for you. As a matter of fact, if this is your first from the author, you'll want to read about those Sinners who pay our couple a visit and their own quests for happiness. All standalones and all just as wonderful.Another job well done.5 solid stars!

Not having read any of the prior books in this series, I dove head-first into Beneath These Scars and let me just say that I am so happy I did. What a gem. I honestly did not know what to expect but the author masterfully guided me through this less than perfect love story and never did I feel deprived or lost at not knowing the history behind these characters and their close-knit crew. I will admit I'm mad at myself for not discovering this series earlier but now that I have, I can guarantee I will be reading the rest asap!Not wanting to give anything away and who exactly this book is about for those who have read the prior books, all I will say is that I desperately wanted to hurt the 'hero'. Talk about a supreme alpha to the millionth degree. OMG this man was nothing but rude and demanding and stubborn as all hell. Happily though, the heroine is just as stubborn and demanding and even a bit rude. She may be the only woman to be able to tame him. Talk about a match made in heaven! These two bring out both the best and worst in each other without even trying. Their extremely sexy trysts, wild yelling matches and stolen tender moments make this ride one worth taking.The secondary characters add just the right touch and never take away from the our couple or the story-line. With the added bit of mystery surrounding the heroine and her past coming back to bite her, this book truly has it all.It is a well-written and completely satisfying read that I highly recommend.A solid 5 stars!

I literally just finished Anchor and holy hell did Mo Mabie nail it. Like completely knocked it out of the park brilliance. It is THAT good.If you've read Bait and Sail, you already know the how tough of a journey Blake and Casey have had to endure trying so desperately to get their happily ever after. It was almost torture at times having to read the missed chances, the times apart, the wrong decisions each of them made through the years since they first laid eyes upon each other. And then we had to witness the brutal encounter at the end of Sail that almost felt like the ultimate demise of this love story.Starting right up where Sail left off, we are treated to one of THE best conclusions to a trilogy ever. Not knowing what the world still had in store for our lovers, the author masterfully leads us through their star-crossed paths beautifully. Hoping for the best, wanting for Blake to survive her attack, there is no foregone conclusion here. I was on the edge of my chair not knowing how it would all play out. But my goodness, the absolute devotion Casey has for his honeybee stole my breath away. He continued to stand by her side no matter what and was gratefully rewarded with a love that he dared only let himself dream about.The book is written in alternating POV's, which is favorite style of mine, with some thrown in by both Audrey and a possible beau I won't reveal here. Surely something is brewing there and the author gave us a glimpse of what she might have in store for those two in the future. Both Casey and Blake share their deepest thoughts, their lustful dreams and all the joy that each of them give to the other. Getting to witness firsthand how their love continues to bloom was pure bliss. Not only are they extremely passionate about one another, they truly like each other. The author puts us smack dab in the middle of their lives and you can't help but want to stay there indefinitely.This well-written, sublimely delightful book kept my heart captive and I even shed a tear or two towards the end. If ever there was a couple who deserved true happiness, it is Blake and Casey. Maybe the way they went about things was not always the most honorable but you can't deny for even a second that they were meant to be. She truly is the Betty to his Lou.You must read Bait and Sail first, in order to fully understand Anchor. It is a series worth reading. And one I won't soon forget.A huge 5+++ stars.

It truly saddens me that I can't give this book more than 2 stars but honestly it was all over the place. I was anxious to read book 3 since book 1 and 2 had plenty of mystery and angst and I was hopeful that I'd get the closure I needed and the HEA I wanted for Joshua and Natasha.  But instead there are still way too many unanswered questions, inconsistencies throughout, simply silly scenes (toasting the day she would have gotten her period??? I know he was grieving, but c'mon) and everyone constantly yelling or crying non-stop.Although I'm happy that ultimately it turned out ok, it just took too long and I found myself skimming pages. The fact that there will be more in the series does not even remotely interest me. I feel let down and just can't read anymore. Adrian was a bright spot for me and I do hope his book with Nicholas is worthwhile. But I probably will never know.I know i'm probably going to be in the minority but having differences of opinion is what makes the world go 'round. Oh well.

Fade to Red is one phenomenal read. Willow Aster proves yet again how masterful her mad writing skills are at creating a story-line like no other. She continues to give us books that not only entertain but make you think. To me that is THE perfect combination and I was riveted literally from chapter 1!The story follows Roxie Taylor and her hope to be a dancer with Beckham Woods and his upcoming tour. Beckham is a rock god, one who Roxie would rather not have to see ever again, but feels it is her time to try to make something of a career for herself and her adorable son Leo. Upon seeing Roxie, Beckham immediately feels a connection but she'll be damned if she'll ever get involved with him. Even though it is more than obvious that these two were meant to be. You can feel it from the very first interactions, even though Roxie is nothing but cold and hard on her boss. However, there are some very sexy rehearsals that showcase the chemistry surrounding Roxie and Beckham which further prove how perfect they could be together. They seem to have this connection both past and present, and it is with much determination and growing affection that Beckham will stop at nothing to find out what the tether might be, that is strung between both their hearts.But what gives this book that extra pop is that beneath this budding romance is a bit of a mystery. There are chapters written in a woman's POV. Someone who is hell bent on having Beckham for her very own and is obsessively determined to make that a reality. However, it is clear that this mysterious woman is suffering from wild delusion. As the book progresses, you begin to feel that dread that something horrible is going to happen and you start to play a waiting game for when that shoe will drop. The love story between Beckham and Roxie provides the perfect distraction from what most certainly is going to happen at some point down the road.As an added bonus, Ian Sterling and his gorgeous little family, (from the wonderful True Love Story), play a major role in this book. Watching him be truly happy after such a long road to get the life he so desperately wanted, certainly was the cherry on top for me. Ian and Beckham start a tour together, become good friends and along with their bands, extended families and entourages, a genuine camaraderie is formed that was a pleasure to witness. There is no mistaking that this is Beckham and Roxie's book but the author flawlessly combines their journey with Ian's to give us one helluva great ride.I literally want to shout from the rooftops how much I loved Fade to Red. The myriad of emotions I felt while reading this book left me breathless. Then upon the conclusion I had my hand to my mouth to muffle the loud gasp that demonstrated my surprise at where the author left us. Although it is a standalone I wouldn't mind just a bit more at some point. This is one story with supremely wonderful characters that you just don't want to end. My heart was in my throat more than once and I couldn't put my e-reader down.This is a well-written, original and absolutely incredible book. One that will definitely be at the top of my reads for 2015!A huge 5++++ stars for a job extremely well done.

As a debut, this book was quite good. Not rifled with editing mistakes, I found myself drawn to this simple love story of two souls defined by loss.Auden and Aleksandr, both having lost their parents at a young age, are trying to live their lives not completely caught up in grief. Auden, with the help of her grandfather, becomes a translator for the Russian hockey star that is Aleksandr and so begins a delicate dance between the two. Not sure if they should try to be together, and cross that line, they start a friendly relationship that is both witty and playful. Feelings start to change and with it comes jealousy and the constant fear of abandonment that has plagued Auden her whole life.Although these two certainly could have a chance, the chemistry just felt a bit too bland at times. I was convinced they belonged together but I just wanted a bit more angst, a bit more passion and to ignite the flame that each held deep beneath their pain. They had time apart and we didn't get enough of what they were going through while separated. I felt the author could've given us a bit more into the longing and the desire that both Aleksandr and Auden had for each other instead of just relaying that yes they called and skyped but we never were witness to any of it.The storyline needs a bit more substance but overall it was an enjoyable read. It just didn't blow me away or anything. I would read more from this author and hopefully some of the more colorful secondary characters will get their stories told as well.A solid 3 stars.

This review is for "One Night with Harrison" by Heidi McLaughlinYou know, I've always wanted the beginning, the 'backstory' if you will, of how Harrison ended up with a baby he didn't even know about. Well my questions have been answered in this very sexy short.What I loved most was getting inside Harrison's head again and remembering just how wonderful a character he is. The author gave him heart. He knows what he wants, but as a newer band on the LA scene, he and the other members of 4225 West have to go along for the ride at their manager's discretion. But it was really sweet hearing the kind of woman Harrison wanted and from the start of this short, I truly thought that Alicia could have been more for him. He liked the more natural type. Not the typical made-up plastic looking groupies. But with an unfortunate small series of misunderstandings, Harrison certainly got more than he bargained for, he just didn't know it yet.This certainly has me wanting to reread My Unexpected Forever and for those who might be new to the author's work, this is a great place to start! Harrison James is a warm and very loving character who is well worth your time.Now off to read more of this wonderful collection. There are some great authors all together in one place. Such a treat!

Whoa...what a roller-coaster ride full of emotion. Thick Love is one incredible journey through the lives of two broken souls, who manage to find the good again. The right to feel and the desire to love. Yet also find that just wanting to heal is sometimes the hardest part of all.My very first Eden Butler book. And what a beginning this is. I was completely enthralled by not only this difficult love story but by the extended use of all things New Orleans. Aly King and her frequent use of Haitian Creole made me fall hard for this heroine. Her tenacity to survive on her own, her ability to be a bad arse and the determination to create a life for herself was such a joy to read. I was rooting for her from the very first pages and knew that just needed a man just as headstrong. When a'chance encounter' with the man she has been longing for, in the form of one Ransom Riley-Hale, creates such chemistry between the two, I knew then and there this would be a pairing of epic proportions. But it's a connection that is both frightening and fierce and never, ever easy. One that not only had Aly and Ransom tied up in knots but had me just as angst-ridden.The beautiful family that has been given a second chance, that was first introduced in Thin Love (a book I now NEED to read) is ever-present. It's Ransom's parents that provide the family and the intimacy Aly has been craving in her life. I loved that both Kona and Keira and their energetic son Koa were both encouraging and honest about a possible relationship between their troubled son and Aly. With Ransom dealing with an emotional pain that he couldn't shake, they were always there to offer loving kick in the pants he often needed to forge ahead in his life. And with Aly, they seemed to know that perhaps, she could be the one to finally get through to him, when nothing and no one could.I tell you, this very intricate tale had my heart in my throat more than once. Just when I thought things were finally going smoothly, foolish words would again be spoken and our couple would have to start all over again, gaining the respect and trust they didn't hand out so readily once more. Neither Aly nor Ransom made it easy on themselves. And we are right there as they muddle through the difficult waters they can't seem to conquer.Then I was left at a standstill as the epilogue once again threw me for a loop and I'm here sitting and wondering how on earth these two could possibly mess it all up yet again?!! AND I have to wait until 2016 to find out if Aly and Ransom can actually get their acts together.A well-written, very detailed read that I thoroughly enjoyed. I never found it too wordy or too descriptive. This is an author who wants to spread her love of New Orleans and takes the time to allow the reader to absorb all the little nuances and details that make this story stand out. I feel as if I learned a ton about a region that is still very foreign to me.Well done and I can't wait to read the conclusion!Worth your time. Highly recommended.

I am at a loss for words at just how magnificent a book Restless Waters is. I never thought anything could come close to Left Drowning, a book that tore me apart and then somehow miraculously put me back together. We all wanted Sabin's story, the man who both broke and stole our hearts in LD. The man who we all wanted to save, to hug and to treasure. And I'll be damned. Jessica Park gave all of us the journey we craved and did it brilliantly.Written in Blythe's POV, we catch up with the McGuire/Shephard crew and soak up all the happiness this extended family has finally come to embrace. There are the boisterous arguments, the loud commentary and the wild meals that only this bunch can experience. A wonderful summer in Maine before everyone scatters and goes back to school and to their 'real' lives. Sabin, much to Blythe's joy, is staying on with she and Chris, having seemingly trumped his demons and gotten in the best shape of his life. Although the house will be empty, knowing her best friend will be there, makes everything perfect in Blythe's eyes. However, nothing is forever and when Sabin moves to San Diego, the calm that Blythe and Chris try to so hard to cherish, is most certainly the warning of the storm to come.To be witness to the whirlwind, the deep-seeded pain that Sabin continues to endure almost broke me. The bond that Blythe has, her sixth sense that something is amiss with her friend, kept me glued to my e-reader. Even though I didn't want to watch as past pain continued to hold Sabin down, I couldn't help but forge on and swallow the intensity of this story. I knew more secrets would be revealed. More guilt. More hurt feelings. But it is so well-written and so masterfully presented, you just can't help but be enamored by these characters. They become a part of you and for the time that this book sits in your hands, you are grateful you are lucky enough to read it.Never did I imagine a story could stay with me as long as Left Drowning did. And now with Restless Waters, I know the same will happen. Despite all the sadness, there is so much hope. And not just a silly dismissive hope that everything will turn out ok. These Shephard siblings have gone through hell and back and are still standing. The hope for them is a real one. One that they found in the form of Blythe. And even James. Two damaged siblings in their own way that were sent to rescue a family that at times didn't feel worthy of saving. The meant to be factor was never more present than in this book and I found myself smiling and literally gasping at the sweet memories shared.What I loved was the this story could be both raw and tender at the same time. The bond between Blythe and Chris was never stronger and their passion was evident through two very sexy scenes that were gorgeously written. The devastating misunderstandings between Blythe and Sabin were almost hard to read but the deep love these two have for each other never faltered, when it could've so easily. You can't help but be envious of what these two have and the utter glee Chris so selflessly has for them left me teary-eyed at times. Even though this was Sabin's story, Chris was a standout in his ever-present position of protector. I fell hard again for that man, right along with Blythe. He is an outstanding character that they are all lucky to have.I know I rambled on a bit too long but I will just leave you all with this: if you want a book that will make you feel, that will fill you with hope and a whole lot of love, then take the time and read Restless Waters. Savor every word, just like I did, and embrace the joy of reading such perfection. I encourage to start with Left Drowning, if you haven't already and get the whole story. I'm telling you, you'll never forget it.A huge 5+++ stars for a job well done.

Sharla Lovelace knows how to write a great second chance romance and with Loving the Chase, she does not fail to deliver.The story about Zach and Maddi, separated for 7 years because of a devastating event that made her leave and never wanted to look back. Now they are face to face again and the love never died. The passion is still in both their eyes and the chemistry literally burned up my ereader in each and every scene. You can feel the desperation from both of them whenever they are in the same room together. OMG the longing is so evident, it's enough to want to dive into the pages of this story and make them see reason. Thankfully Zach's close-knit family did the job for me.Zach and his family are storm-chasers and if you happen to be lucky enough to love one of them, constant worry is a part of your life forever. What drove Maddi away the first time has come back to rear it's ugly head once again but this time she is determined not to fall back into Zach's arms. She is in the small town of Cody to do a job: be a part of the crew that want to make a reality show about the Chase family and their many exciting adventures. But with the love of her life present at every turn, it's a wonder if Maddi and her heart will once again survive.This book is beautifully written and I was thoroughly riveted from the very first words. Second chance romance is my favorite and watching Zach and Maddi pine for each other, tiptoeing around their actions, their words, made my own stomach do flips. The very passionate scene in the rain was both heartbreaking and joyful. Their journey is never an easy one but with the help of a wonderful group of secondary characters, mostly family members from both sides, there is hope these two will find their way back to each other. I am thrilled there will be more in the series since there are many loose ends and blossoming relationships that I need more of.A wonderful way to end the summer. Highly recommended.5 solid stars.

Scott Hildreth continues to up the ante with each new book in the Selected Sinners series. Each one a story unlike the last and a chance to get to know every member of the MC up close and personal. With Ex-Con, he has really gone the distance and written much more than I ever expected. He has put his heart and soul into every word and it shows.What is so special about this book is that it truly is Jackson Shephard's story. The first 60% or so is set in 2006 and we get to watch the blossoming romance between Jackson and Emily. His dominant side becoming evident and her decision to happily submit. They truly are perfect for each other and seem to live the idyllic life for as long as possible.  However, an unfortunate and underhanded event occurs that threatens to separate them and it's from that moment on to the end of the book that we get into the very core of Jackson's soul. His courage, his strength, his determination to save the ones he loves all the while existing in a world that most could never handle made me fall for the man completely. As much as the other members have taken a piece of my heart along the way, Jackson epitomizes the very nature of what it means to have integrity and a love so deep that his selflessness is at times both joyful and painful to witness.It is a beautifully written book that I wish were double in length! That is how much I adored it. A truly tough journey for a man who never broke his promise to the woman he loves and for the author who gave his all and more. A rare combination indeed. And might I add the intimate scenes between Jackson and Em were unbelievably passionate. One in particular was wildly erotic that I completely forgot my surroundings while reading and literally needed a cold drink afterwards. Talk about powerful!!Ex-Con is a deeply moving story that I will treasure for a long time to come. Scott Hildreth has certainly become a go-to author for me. I'm hopeful he will for you as well.Well worth your time.5++++ stars.

I've only read Sketchy Love by Lila Felix so far and I absolutely loved it! Such a wonderful story about two soulmates who find each other over and over again, only the heroine doesn't seem to remember.Fasta and Saint. Living their 'lives' through the past thousand years, trying to finally make it right and set their destiny to be together forever. Fasta has an extraordinary talent for drawing. And the boy with the green eyes who mysteriously turns up in most of her work, haunts her. Her need to constantly sketch him in hundreds of scenes to the point of exhaustion at times, is the only thing that seems to soothe her. And when Saint is suddenly the new student at her school, everything starts to fall into place.Oh my goodness. I am not usually a fan of other world kind of stories but this one had me from the very start. Lila Felix continues to surprise me with her touching and well-written tales that I might not pick up if given the choice. But I've been such a fan of many of her books that I knew I had to read this one as soon as it went live.As the story comes to a close, there is so much more I'd love to know about this star-crossed couple and I'm hopeful the author will extend their journey and give us a full-length book. Saint touched upon many different time-frames that he and Fasta were a part of and even shed a tear or two for those times when they couldn't be together. I'd love a bit more of both their past and their promised future.Well done and now I'm thrilled to read the rest of this wonderful boxed set.

Great series that I devoured!! Elise Black writes a story of a woman who just wants to be happy. Mia is living the life that most would covet but to her, she just feels trapped.When, Stone a man who is hired as her bodyguard becomes more, all reason and logic is thrown out the window and Mia and Stone want to find a way to not only thwart those who make threats against her, but to be together.This series has mystery, passion combined with tender moments that made me swoon. The perfect read to bring to the beach. You won't be able to put it down!!A solid 5 stars!

I should have known Cassia Leo wouldn't let me down. The Way We Rise, book 3 and the conclusion to Houston and Rory's story, was the absolute perfect way to finish this series. I have to admit I was put through the wringer with these two more than once throughout their difficult journey. Houston and Rory have faced so many bumps, so many detours, could they truly find their way back to each other? I had to put my complete faith in the author and let's just say at times that didn't seem to be enough.What I loved most about this book was the continuing deep development of the characters. We get to watch as Houston, Rory, Kenny, Ava, Patricia, James and even Skippy(!) move ahead with their lives, despite all the tragedy and disappointment that has befallen them. With the thread of Hallie both holding them together and still sometimes keeping them apart, it was almost as if they all experienced a rebirth of sorts. Demons start to be exorcised and truths start the healing process for all of them. The horrific scene that ended The Way We Break is the starting point for this book, and it is almost a miracle that Houston and Rory even have a chance anymore. But the author masterfully lets her characters take their time and thoughtfully figure out exactly what they want. Gone somewhat is the rush to judgement that had befallen them before which was a true joy to see.The love that started with an 11 year-old having a crush on her best friend's brother, has seen more ups and downs then was ever thought possible. But the deep-seeded affection between Houston and Rory never wavers. I found myself smiling more than I thought and oh my goodness, laughing out loud at one of the best epilogues I've ever read. These characters seem to find the right direction this time around yet only time will tell if it will all pay off in the end. Being kept guessing is never a bad thing in my opinion. It just makes you want to keep going until the very last words are read.I thoroughly enjoyed this book and the entire series. It is a love story that will break your heart more than once, give you some heartwarming moments and keep you riveted from beginning to end.Highly recommended and a solid 5 stars!

This well-written book is a good old-fashioned slow burn of a love story. Two people, meeting by accident on the island of Oahu, and not wanting to ignore the feeling that makes both want to spend more time together.Sienna, a very driven young woman, who can't seem to look beyond the fact that she is making a ton of money at a job that most would covet. It's her 'dream' position yet she has time for nothing else. Luke, who is a free-spirited adrenaline junkie, who gave up a very lucrative future for one more laid-back and free. On paper, these two couldn't be more opposite yet deep down in their hearts, they seem to fit together perfectly. Two souls who both battle some inner demons yet together learn the art of letting go.I always enjoy JA Redmerski's writing. It is fluid and deliberate and full of emotion. With The Moment of Letting Go, I was thrust into the storyline immediately and was witness to the budding romance between Sienna and Luke within the first chapter. There isn't much filler, which I enjoy, yet there was still something missing for me. Perhaps I needed a bit  more angst. A bit more of what was going on in Luke's head since his past held the key to whether or not they would make it as a couple. The book is told in alternating POV's , which I enjoy but maybe a little more detail would have made it a 5 star book for me. There just wasn't that 'pop' I expect when reading this authors books.It's a good beach read since you'll want to be on one as the descriptions of Oahu and Kauai fill your senses. Overall it's a beautiful little love story with likable characters and a bit of steam.3.5 stars.

Chasing River. A book that not only transported me to the beautiful country of Ireland, but convinced me I'd never want to leave. K.A. Tucker absolutely captivated my heart and soul with this book. We get the stunning descriptions of a land I am anxious to discover and a love story that I couldn't get enough of.Amber Welles and River Delaney are two people so very different yet somehow are the perfect match. River saving Amber's life was certainly the most unusual start to her European trip, yet that wasn't the most shocking part of her journey through the Emerald Isle. As much as these two belong together, since their chemistry is downright intoxicating, and the pure joy in their eyes whenever each is nearby is simply blissful, secrets held by River threaten to destroy the very happiness each has finally found.The story-line is simply exquisite. We have a gorgeous love story with Amber only in Ireland for a week, falling for a pub owner who she suddenly can't be without. And underneath is a tale about the Delaney family history, some noble, some criminal. The way the author combines the two is genius. With each new book in this Burying Water series, I can't help but praise K.A. Tucker's writing and watch as it again reaches yet another level.Some great surprises in the form of Ivy, the tough tattoo artist, who shared some painful years in High School with Amber and a visit by daddy Gabe,the retired sheriff, gave this book some great highlights. In addition, Rowen Delaney provided some much needed comic relief when moments felt too heavy.I am truly and unequivocally in love with this book. Talk about the feels. I've got them tenfold and still don't want to let go.I can't recommend this book highly enough. I have loved all the author's work but this one now has a special place in my heart. You will swept away in this small-town in Ireland and much like Amber, will not want to move on.A huge 5 +++++++ stars

Blown away. Again. At a loss for words at just how magnificent this latest gem from Aly Martinez truly is. It is such an extreme pleasure to witness how her writing continues to raise the bar every single time.This latest in the On the Ropes series is about Flint. Middle Page brother, the one who was destined for not only greatness in the ring but in the classroom as well. But then, fate intervened and using his body as a shield for his brother Till's wife, who also happened to be the woman of his dreams, everything came crashing down. The hopes, the life Flint saw for himself was now nothing more than just a memory. His life would now proceed from the confines of a wheelchair.We now watch as Flint tries to not only make a new path for himself but figure out how to deal with the feelings he has for Eliza Page. The woman who not only stole Till's heart but managed to crawl inside of his own, when she found her way into their lonely lives. But an unexpected force in the form of one Ash Mabie, a newly-found comrade for youngest brother Quarry, manages to turn Flint's world upside-down. He fights any sort of feelings for this whirlwind of a woman but somehow she seeps into his soul and captures his heart. The heart he had thought was promised to another but with time realizes that he was simply waiting for the right woman to claim it.To say this is a beautiful read is an understatement. As with every one of Aly Martinez’s books, her words are equally touching as they are funny; as heartbreaking as they are heartwarming. There are so many layers to this story. This isn’t just Flint’s journey. Through alternating POV’s we also get inside Ash’s head and see firsthand the deplorable life she has had to endure at the hands of her slimy father Ray; the man who is also ‘married’ to Flint’s mother. The mother that abandoned her sons for her next fix and anyway she could get it. Although Ash is one incredible heroine and her wicked humor kept me smiling, together she and Flint are two broken people. And yet through Ash and her hopeful and caring ways, both she and Flint forge a bond that is as unexpected as it is fated.There are many twists and turns to this story and just when you think it’s nearing its end, there is surprisingly more and you realize just how happy you are at that notion. The secondary characters from previous books are all there in support of our man Flint. It is the character of Eliza, however, who almost steals the spotlight. The way she cares for Flint and serves as the glue that keeps the Page family together was simply incredible. Her selflessness and true love for her Page men and the women they adore was admirable. She embraces Ash even when there are hostile feelings at the surface and is the one to help smooth things even after a painful separation.Overall this is a book about second chances. About the will to change and the faith that love can truly conquer all. It is a love story that isn’t an easy one yet with some much needed humor and honesty; we are treated to one that won’t soon leave our thoughts.A huge 5+++ stars with huge anticipation for Quarry’s story next. I simply can’t get enough.

Follow Me Back, the sequel to the journey started in Lead Me Not, brought me to my knees. This well-written conclusion to Aubrey and Maxx's story had my stomach in knots throughout most of it. The way the author masterfully describes the seemingly never-ending struggles for Maxx to stay clean and off drugs and Aubrey's indecision in whether her man is worth more pain broke me. I was completely mesmerized by the hurt, the torment each of them had to endure to try and salvage not only their relationship but their sanity as well. Although it was Maxx who had the clear voice of reason more often than Aubrey, both needed to find that point where trust would be a given instead of a question.I felt as if every step backward, every doubt, although hard to digest at times, was perfectly relayed with respect to our couple. This was not the easy conclusion where boy and girl see each other and everything turns out ok. On the contrary. Both Maxx and Aubrey had to keep going through parts of hell to even start to find the heaven they both craved.My heart was in my throat more often than not, yet I couldn't wait to keep turning the pages to see how this tumultuous ride would end.
