Here are my other thoughts:ProsThe pattern makes it really easy to spot in baggage areaThe material seems durable but I will need to update this after it has been taken on our trip I think if you are going to carry the seat on this would be perfect, it's making it thru baggage check that I would like to testit's easy to use, it has a wide opening to easily put the seat insidefolds up really small when not in use and is almost weightlessConsI'm not a big fan of the drawstring closure, although the material is waterproof liquid could enter through the draw string top, I'd also be worried about it being torn open during travelThe carrying strap is a great feature but I would cinch it down as small as you can to lessen the chances of it being caught on anythingOverall I am happy with this and it works perfect as a storage bag if you aren't traveling, once I take my trip I will update my review on how this fairs.

I ordered this scree protector at a discount in exchange for my honest review and it is the best I have used. My husband needed a new screen protector and right away we were both impressed with the quality of the protector and the prep pads that are included so that you can really get the phone clean before you apply it. My husband says this is the best he has used. He also said the phone feels more protected than when using his old one. It was very easy to apply we had it on in just a few minutes and the fit is perfect. Overall we are both really impressed with this, I don't think you will be disappointed in this and I would recommend it to friends and family. If I do have any problems with it down the road I will update this review.

I have always wanted a mason jar soap dispenser so I was really excited to try this one. Here are my thoughts:ProsEasy to fill – twist the lid off and fill it up – the mouth of the jar is very wide so I can fill it without spilling anything. My other soap dispensers have a very narrow mouth so I love thisHolds a lot of soap but doesn’t take up a ton of room or look clunkyThe pump is easy to use and dispenses easily and I haven’t had it clogThe pump tube does all the way to the bottom of the jar so you don’t always have the bottom full of soap that you just can’t get out there will be some left but not as much as my other dispensers (I like this in case I am using a different color the next time around)ConsThe pump can sit a bit crooked but it’s easily fixed by tightening the plastic screwThe stainless steel lid is a bit thin so can bend easily (I don't see this being much of an issue with normal use)Overall I really like this and will continue to use it!I ordered this dispenser at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I ordered this probiotic at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I really like them. I started taking probiotics when I developed thrush while nursing and I have continued to take them for general health. I didn't have any luck in clearing up the thrush with them (I had a severe case that was probably too far gone) but they have seemed to play a part in boosting my immune system. I was exposed to  some sniffles recently and normally I would get a long drawn out head cold but I really just have a very slight runny nose. I have also increased some of my vitamins so it can be hard to say but I feel like the probiotics have given me an extra boost. I have a hard time remembering to take them before I eat so half the time I take them during my meal. If I were to take the as directed I bet I would have even better results. Overall I am happy with these, they are easy to swallow and I don't have any negative side effects.

I ordered this turmeric at a discount in exchange for my honest review and so far I like it. I am taking this to see if it will help with my joint pain and for overall health. I'm still looking into what is causing my joint pain (most likely an autoimmune disorder) so I don't know the root cause for sure. This turmeric is a little larger in size but I am used to taking a very large fish oil so I don't have any trouble with this. It does smell and taste like turmeric but this doesn't bother me either, the taste doesn't linger and in spite of my reflux I do not have any aftertaste with it. As far as how well it works I am still not certain. The directions say to take this twice a day but right now I am only taking it once a day. I don't have swelling of my joints so I can't say if it helps with that but the pain/;discomfort has seemed to improve somewhat.I want to ask my doctor first before I take it twice a day. I will update this review if anything changes but overall I am happy with it and will continue to take it.

I ordered this fish oil at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I love it. My doctor directed me to take fish oil the last time I was in for a physical but the problem for me is the aftertaste. Several years ago I tried taking fish oil but just couldn’t deal with the aftertaste. I have reflux so it tends to be an issue. With this fish oil I often have no aftertaste and on the days my reflux is bad it’s very little aftertaste not even much worth mentioning. So I am very happy. I take two per day, one in the morning and one at dinner. The pills are large but easy to swallow, they don’t have much odor or taste while swallowing them.Shortly after I started taking them my husband did too, he was only taking one per day and he asked me if I thought it could be  helping his memory and I told him I believe that is a benefit. He says he can remember details from meetings at work that before taking the fish oil he would have to go back and look at his notes. He said he has noticed that and similar things since he has started taking it. He said it is subtle but he can definitely tell something has changed when it comes to remembering details from conversations and meetings at work. So we increased his to twice per day as well.My bottle came with a free gift which was a travel pill box and I actually use it all the time now that I have it. It holds both fish oil, my daily vitamin, a vitamin d, a probiotic, a Zyrtec, and a turmeric all just on one side (it has two sections). It’s just another thing to help keep me organized and remembering to take all my pills. Overall I am really happy with this and will keep taking it as long as my doctor is ok with it.

I ordered this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I really like it! So far I have mostly used this to gather up leaves from the yard and it works really well for that. It's also a lot faster than what I was doing last year which was putting them in bags. I have lots of trees and 4.5 acres so it's a lot to do. I just lay the tarp down next to a pile and rake it onto the tarp, I have the 6X8 so it's a decent size and fits a lot of leaves in one trip, it does take two people to carry/lift it. I dump my leaves in a compost area of the land and come back for more. I have also used this to cover a window a/c unit that is not in use just to keep any dirt/dust out of it and it works great for that too. I like that the edges are reinforced a well. Overall this compares really well to any other tarp I have used. It actually has more grommets than my others an none of mine have the reinforced edges so I have been really happy with this.

I ordered this LED bulb at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I really like it! The bulb is in my table lamp and it gives off just about the same amount of light as my CFL energy saving bulb did. One reason I like the LED better is that it doesn’t take time to get brighter like the energy saving one does. Another feature I like on this bulb is that it is switchable. If you flip your light switch quickly on and off it will dim the light, if you flip your switch again quickly it will dim it even more (down to the brightness of a nightlight I would say). To have 3 different lighting options on the same lamp has come in handy. So far the bulb has worked great and we haven’t had any issues with it. I also like the color this gives off, I know my lamp shade can effect this but overall it gives off more of the white color vs the blueish color that I don't like. I have used some LEDs that have a blue tint to them, and kind of look like a haunted house. I like the white color best. Overall I am happy with this!

I ordered this Edison LED bulb at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I love the vintage look it creates! The bulb is larger than normal so if you are going to leave it bare it doesn't look like a tiny little light bulb. It gives of a warm color that I like much better than the led bulbs that give off a blueish color. I tried to take a photo of the bare bulb but it's difficult to get a good picture to show how the bulb looks when it is bare. It doesn't seem to get hot which is a great plus if you plan to keep this exposed. Overall I am really happy with it and haven't had any issues with it. I just have it in a lamp that you switch on and off manually and I haven't tested it any other way. If I do have any issues I will update this review.

I ordered this seed heating mat at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I really like it! Last year I began starting flower seeds indoors and had some partial luck. I had read that perhaps a seed mat would help me out so I decide to try this one. I have various sizes of plastic seed starting cells so I choose one that would fit the mat best.  At first I was going to find a good place to put the mat near a window with an outlet but then decided I would try using my grow light because that was a more convenient location. My plan is to get the seeds sprouted with my heat mat and grow light then move them to the window area. I am no expert so just giving this a try! So far the mat works well and I haven’t had any issues with it, if I could change something about it it would be to make the mat just a little more pliable, it's on the stiff side but this isn't a huge deal. I will update this review with my seeds’ progress and with any quality issues I may have.

I ordered this set of leaf bags at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I have found them to be more useful to use while pulling weeds rather than cleaning up leaves. Be sure to note the size of these in order to make the best decision on your purchase. They are more like a large bucket than leaf bags. I have over 4 acres of land with mature trees so this does not work well for leaf gathering but I have discovered it’s perfect for pulling all the weeds we have! Any time I bring out a garden bucket it gets full before I am done with all the weeding but with these I have plenty of room and they fold up flat in my garden shed so I have some much needed space. You push them down and then lock them flat by putting a toggle thru a loop, this feature works well and holds them securely.  They are plenty durable for weeds and leaves but I would not put too many twigs or sticks in them, I would worry that could tear it eventually. The set also includes a pair of work gloves which are handy to have when cleaning up the yard, they are just like the type you would find a hardware stores. Overall I am glad that I found an alternative use for these and I will continue to use them!

I ordered this dress at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I really like it! I ordered the Jersey dress with the tan and blue. I am 5’8 and 140lbs size 36D bust. I ordered the Large so according to the chart I ordered a size up. This dress almost fits me perfect. Everything fits really well except that it sits a little bit too high. Where the colors meet should look like it does on the model in the photo but mine sits a bit higher. I don’t think it is just my height, I think if you are 5’8 but have a smaller bust or are thinner in general this might sit right. Other than that I really love the quality and comfort of this dress, it's very well constructed. I have ordered another dress from the same company and was so happy with it that I decided to get this. It’s very soft and I can truly wear this all day without any discomfort or irritation. I wash this on normal and line dry but I have put it in the dryer with no issues. Overall I am really happy with this and I don’t think you will be disappointed with the quality. If you can get your size correct you will love the quality.

I ordered this set of roll on bottles at a discount in exchange for my honest review and they are great for my essential oils. I wanted to try making my own insect repellent and thought maybe I could try a roll on bottle. I wanted them to be amber or blue glass so these were perfect. Here are some other thoughts:Prosamber glass to protect the oilroller works well, no leakslid screws on tight no leaks so I can carry this in my diaper bagthe glass is studyConsSo far I don't have any cons for these, they work well and I haven't had any quality issuesOverall I am glad I found these and will continue to use them!

I ordered this LED flood light at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I really like it! I installed this in our motion sensor flood light above the garage and it works perfect. The lamp has two bulbs and one of them is this LED light and the other is a traditional incandescent bulb. I was really happy that this actually brighter than the incandescent bulb, I really didn’t expect it to be so I was impressed. I also love that the color is a warmer yellow/light rather than the blueish looking LED lights. It has been going strong and I don't have any complaints. Once the incandescent one blows I will be replacing it with another one of these.

I ordered this shampoo at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I really like it! I have long, very fine hair that damages easily and this has done well for my hair. It doesn't dry it out but I still feel as though my hair is clean. Here are my other thoughts:ProsComes in a pump (my pump works perfect I have no issues with it)Mild lather (probably because it is sulfate free)Mild scentMade in USAGentle on my hair but still gets it clean (if I want a deep clean I wash it twice)ConsSo far I really don't have anything I dislike about this shampoo. By now if I wasn't a fan I would have switched back to my old but I'm still using this and I really like it!Overall I am happy with this and am really happy to find a nice conditioning shampoo.

I ordered this solar light at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I really like it! It's very easy to set up you just spike the solar panel in the ground and place the light where you would like, The cord is plenty long enough that you can get the panel in the ideal place to catch the most sun. I have this light in my garden shining on my birdbath and it looks great. The light is not extremely bright so this would be more for decoration than it would be for lighting a walk area (unless you plan to get several). The only downside for me is the color that it gives off is more of a blue tint rather than a warm white color. Other than that it works great and looks good. It comes on at dusk and it does seem to stay on all night. The place I have it isn't very visible at dawn so I don't get to check to see if it's still on very often. Overall I am happy and really like this for highlighting landscape.

I ordered this bug spray at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I really like it! The scent reminds me of essential oils and I mostly pick up on the citronella. I normally spray this in my hand first then rub in on (it doesn’t spray out as a fine mist more of a thick mist).While wearing it I had one bite but it was on an area I didn’t put the spray, but it was the only bite I had so I think that’s good considering this is an all natural product. Because the scent is so strong I do not use this on my toddler, you may want to try this on yourself first before any children just to be safe (it's a strong scent!).I think it works really well when I spray it all over my shoes and then do the weeding in the garden. I use knee pads and when I am down in the grass like that bugs are all over but spraying my shoes really helps!Overall I am happy with this and really like that it is DEET free option for keeping bugs away.

I ordered this set of string lights at a discount in exchange for my honest review and I LOVE them. They are on a copper colored wire that is very thin and flexible. I assumed the string would tangle easily but I had no trouble at all. It's a wire so you can bend it into shapes and twist it and it holds it's shape. I am super happy with the color as well, it's a warm white and they are SO bright. I love that they are so bright because if you have them on during the day they show up well and you can even use them to light a dark are or dark shelf. Right now I have these on my fire place and the strand is long enough to cover each side and across the mantle. Overall these are exactly what I wanted and I have nothing bad to say about them. They have been plugged in 24/7 for days and they are still going. I love them.

Opolar4 starsWorks great; some minor drawbacksThe Opolar Laptop Cooler does what it claims to do: cools your laptop computer.  It enshrouds the laptop's cooling vent, then by means of its own USB-powered fan, it pulls the warm air out.  When I use this on my Toshiba Satellite, the area around the vent where the laptop usually feels hot is very noticeably cooler.  I can also feel that the air coming out of the Opolar is warm (it's cool, as you'd expect from a fan, when not attached to the laptop).The design of the Opolar assumes a left-sided vent on your laptop.  Mine has a right-sided vent.  This creates a couple of minor but irritating issues.  I am right-handed and often use a mouse with my laptop.  The Opolar measures about 2 x 3 inches; not big, but big enough to be in my way on the right side of the computer when I'm using the mouse.  The mouse is usable but has limited real estate to run around on (see picture, which also shows the Opolar's cable).  Also, using the Opolar on the right-hand side means its plug and switch are facing away from me.  Once I had used it for awhile, I could easily find the switch by touch, but it would be easier to be able to see it.The Opolar does not actually attach to the computer; it attaches to a small pad on which the laptop sits to keep the cooler in place.  This means that every time I move the computer, I have to reposition the cooler.  It also means the cooler cannot be used unless you have the computer on a flat surface where it can sit on the pad; it won't stay in place if you are using the computer on your lap or a shifting surface, such as on top of your bed covers (unless you sit very still).  If you use your computer like this, you'll probably want to look into the Opolar model that attaches to the computer.When on the highest fan speed, the Opolar is somewhat noisy.  It sounds like just what it is, a loud little fan blowing out of the side of your laptop.  However, even though my laptop runs hot, I found I did not need the Opolar on its highest setting to cool it, and on lower settings it's very quiet.The Opolar cooler has two really strong features:  It's very effective, and it's very portable.  I have a cooling fan that sits under my laptop, and it works well, but it's inconvenient to take along when traveling.  The Opolar cooler tucks away into my gear and needs only an extra few inches to use it (room enough to extend off the side of your computer).I would not hesitate to recommend the Opolar laptop cooler, keeping in mind that it does have some drawbacks.  It would make a great stocking stuffer or small Christmas gift.Please note, I was given the Opolar cooler at no charge for purposes of writing a review about it.

I can't say for sure that this credit card holder blocks RFID, but since it's metal I would assume so.  It's lightweight and attractive to use.  The sleeves are just the right size for my cards, and I have no trouble inserting or removing them.  It holds more cards than I routinely carry.  I am very satisfied with this.Please note, I received a free sample of this product for review purposes.

These clippers are very stiff to use compared to my old pair.  However, they are sturdy and reasonably sharp, and the nail guard works very well.  My old pair has a nail guard, but it swivels loosely so often isn't in place when I need it to be.  The guard on this pair stays put.  The little file that comes with them is a bit hard to extract from the handle, but it's just the finishing touch my dog's nails need once they're clipped and it is very handy that it travels "on board" to keep it from being mislaid.  These were a good investment.

These quickly became my favorite summer socks and since I own an embarrassing number of socks, that says something.  The fit is soft and stretchy and comfy, and they do not work their way down into the shoe.  They are exactly the right height for my shoes (Nike Pegasus) for a truly no-show fit.Please note, I received a sample selection of these socks at no charge for review purposes.  I honestly anticipate ordering another pack next summer, though.

I like the size, texture, and color of this rug very well.  However, I have to agree with others who have remarked that it's rather sloppily made.  Only the short ends are hemmed; the long sides are selvage.  It doesn't look as if they will let go or fray, but it makes for an uneven finish that, because it is on the long sides, is particularly noticeable.  The "popcorns" are made by pulling yarn through the weave, a nice effect but in a few places the yarn was cut too short, so it pulls all the way through and the popcorn flattens out.  There aren't a lot of spots where this occurred, but it's easy to see where it did.  I haven't washed the rug yet, but the pulled-through spots and that selvage edge worry me, and I'll probably wash it on the comforter cycle, which uses a very slow spin, and hang it to dry, which is more babying than I really expect to give a bath rug.  Although I do like the rug overall, I really don't think it merits the "luxury spa" description.

I really like this umbrella!  It opens and closes smoothly, and when closed and furled it fits back into its slipcase readily.  I was surprised to see how large it is; despite its "travel" size, it opens up to a good, big umbrella.  The pink flower print is nice and clear and brings a bit of cheer to a rainy day.I haven't used the umbrella long enough or in windy enough weather yet to speak to its sturdiness, but it seems strong and well constructed and hasn't had any problems yet.  At any rate, I wouldn't be too concerned about this, since it comes with a lifetime guarantee.Please note:  I received a free review sample of this product.

Like many people, I take a cranberry supplement in hopes of warding off bladder issues such as urinary tract infections.  As with many herbal and vitamin supplements, it's hard to be sure it's working.  If I haven't had a UTI, is it because I've been taking the supplement, because I've been eating/drinking right, or just luck?  Even so, I do seem to have fewer problems when I take a supplement.However, I like to be “in charge” of what I'm taking by choosing single-ingredient supplements when possible, and that's my first issue with UberCran.  Not only does it contain cranberry but multiple other herbals, as well as added vitamin C and vitamin E.  If I choose to add these to my diet (and as it happens, I don't), I would rather add them individually.  That way, it doesn't become a math problem to determine how much I'm taking, adding up a little from this supplement plus a little from that one plus....  I don't know whether this particular combination of cranberry plus herbals plus vitamins is more effective for bladder health than a cranberry supplement alone; I was unable to find any definite information aside from the manufacturer's assurance that it is.And that leads to my second issue:  There is no real assurance that the UberCran really does contain what it claims.  We all know that this is a big issue, with many supplements containing less than the claimed amount of an ingredient, or even none at all.  I always look for vitamins and supplements with a USP label or other evidence of independent testing that confirms the ingredients.  UberCran lacks this.  However, Ubervita products are made in a GMP (Good Manufacturing Process) certified lab, which does speak well of quality control over the process of making UberCran, if not confirming the ingredients.Finally, UberCran seems to be rather deliberately vague about the dosage.  Pictures of the bottle clearly show that it contains 250 capsules.  A look at the nutrition information panel says that a serving size is 1 capsule, so one might assume the bottle contains 250 servings.  However, the suggested use says this 1 capsule should be taken 3 times a day, so a bottle is really only about 83 days' worth.  I'd note, though, that this is a better way to take many supplements, especially ones with ingredients the body will excrete if a large dose is taken at one time (vitamin C, for example).I have not had any issues with the UberCran supplement.  I find it easy (if not terribly convenient) to take, and I have not had any bladder issues in the three weeks while I've been taking it.  I just wish I were able to get more concrete information about it.

I like this glove and there are many cooking situations where it’s a handy solution.  For example, I often cook with cast iron pans with handles that get quite hot, even on the stovetop.  It’s convenient to be wearing the glove so I can keep cooking and stirring without remembering to grab the potholder or risk burning myself.  In the oven, as well, the extra coverage for fingers and wrists is good to have.However, it is a little problematic in the oven.  If the pan you are lifting is heavy or requires some maneuvering to get it out of the oven, the glove by itself may not be enough heat protection.  When I’m cooking I always have potholders at the ready, but still, it’s not as convenient as it would be if I could use the glove alone.The glove is also a bit bulky to wear.  I usually wear a size medium in gloves, and if you have a larger hand, you may find it fits better.  It has something of a “mitten feel” in terms of dexterity when I’m using it.  However, the dexterity is much better than the usual oven mitts.Please note that I received this glove at no charge for purposes of reviewing it.

This is billed as a “beginner” drone, and that is a very apt description.  It is very easy to set up the drone and begin using it.  At the same time, using it is challenging enough to keep the pilot entertained for a long time to come.I would like to have had somewhat better documentation, and also some sort of quick-start guide at the beginning of the small user manual.  However, getting it together and charging it were fairly easy and intuitive, giving me a few minutes to squint at the manual to make sure I didn’t miss any of the finer points.  I was able to complete setup with my iPhone easily, including downloading the app from the App Store.If you plan to fly the drone inside, I suggest a very high ceiling, like gymnasium height.  Outside, a kite-flying type of area (i.e., no overhead obstructions) with room for soft landings would be ideal.  There is a definite learning curve for steering it, not just laterally but for the height, as well.  I expected it to handle much like those remote control helicopters, but it really doesn’t -- it’s full bore or nothing.  Once you get the knack, it’s easy and fun to make it do flips and barrel rolls.  I’ll note that it’s also easy, although not as much fun, to get the grass stains off after rough landings.Having said that, it’s surprisingly tough—another beginner plus.  It got away from me and flew too high, then crash landed in my neighbor’s asphalt driveway, without a scratch.  I expected to be scrounging the pieces up from the asphalt, but it was intact and ready to go again.  All I had to scrounge up was an excuse for my neighbor to explain why I was flying a drone over his house.The drone is about the size of a square Kleenex box, for the most part big enough to work with easily.  The exception to this is the charging port.  It brought to mind the battery connections on older model cordless phones; it was fussy to get it out to charge and to get it plugged back in just right.  It comes complete with everything you need for setup, even including a tiny screwdriver to replace the blades (replacement blades are included) if you manage to find a place to crash it that’s harder than my neighbor’s driveway.  Its small size and light weight allow the wind to buffet it around, too, regardless of how skilled you’ve become at piloting it.All in all, we have had a lot of fun with this drone, and we’re looking forward to lots more.  I wish we’d gotten it earlier in the summer when we would have had better weather for being outside playing with it, but I look forward to some nice winter scenery pictures.EDIT:  I forgot to mention that I had excellent followup from the seller on this.  I got an email to confirm that I had received it, and another offering tips and tricks for working with the drone.  They seemed very committed to making sure we were happy with it.Please note that I received this at no charge for purposes of reviewing it.

I thought this little lamp would be handy, but turns out I appreciate it w-a-y more than I thought I would!  I work at a keyboard all day, and I'm getting to that age where good light and high contrast are important.  I am really surprised at how much easier it is to see my keyboard clearly, even though my office is well-lighted.  The gooseneck makes it easy to adjust the lighting just where I need it and can cover a sizeable area for such a small lamp.  It's powered by a USB port, but it also has an on/off switch.  The base can hang or sit on the desktop; I've found when sitting on the desk, the base is a little too light and makes the lamp a bit tippy, so I prop whatever's handy on the base and will be installing a little hook for it.  During a long day, every little bit of comfort makes a difference, and my new Daffodil lamp is making a big difference.

I have a Toshiba Satellite laptop and it seems to run quite hot, enough so that I became concerned about premature failure of its inner workings.  This cooler does the trick just right.  It's VERY quiet, so doesn't interfere with my concentration when I'm working, and it makes a remarkable difference in how hot my computer gets.  I also like the small legs in the back; the angle is just right for me.  I like the blue lights, too; they look good and confirm at a glance that the cooler is running, which is helpful since it's so quiet.

My poor old dog has arthritis and can't always remain squatted long enough to finish her business, so she usually gets some dribbling down her legs as she finishes up.  I use baby wipes on her, but before long she just needs a dunk in the tub.  The shampoo I had been using seemed to get her clean but never really removed all the odor of stale urine (ick!)  This one does the job; she smells clean, no heavy cover-up perfumey fragrance, and it's gentle enough to use frequently without drying out her skin or coat.

This is such a fun game.  My granddaughter has been playing it since she was 5; she's 7 now and still likes it.  Once she gets an invention solved, she loves to challenge me to solve it, as well.  I always try to download a few new games on my Kindle when she's going to visit, and it's nice to find one that keeps her interest and is a little challenging, without being too hard or too sappy.  We tried the free version of this initially and liked it so well I decided to get the paid version in order to have more inventions.

I have an elderly cat with a gastric condition that interferes with his absorption of nutrients, so I'm always on the lookout for supplemental nutrition for him.  This one didn't really meet with his approval.  He liked it somewhat but never finished what was offered.  He is one of the rare cats who can tolerate milk without a problem, so I've gone back to offering him milk as an addition to his regular food.

These arrived in perfect condition in the middle of the summer, packed really well in an insulated box with cold packs.  It was great to get all the varieties of Snickers in one selection.  I thought I'd save them mostly for when my granddaughter visits but...uhm...turns out, maybe not.  Enjoyed every last bite!

This rug is just what I was looking for.  I wanted something that went well with the antique style in my living room and that was big enough to use effectively at the living room door, but thin enough not to block the door.  That door is used mostly to let my dog in and out, so it gets dirty quickly, so I also wanted something that could be washed.  My dog is also a big-time shedder, so I wanted something that would vacuum well, and it does.  It is a thin rug, as I said, and not something you'd ever mistake for a real Persian rug, but it does everything I need at a great price.

I was surprised by how well this product works.  I have mostly hardwood floors, but the stairs are carpeted and my dog fits just right on the bottom stair and likes to lie there to nap.  She's an old gal and I pretty much let her have her way about that kind of thing, so the carpet on the bottom stair gets pretty grungy and a bit "fragrant."  I wanted a product that was easy to use for this small area, but effective, and the Resolve Carpet Pet Deep Clean Powder met my expectations very well.  I didn't really see how a powder could do the job, but it does.

Good old Corn Nuts, what are you going to say? They're one of those love 'em or hate 'em snacks and I love them.  These are the regular size ones; my preference is for the ones made with jumbo corn kernels, but those have gotten hard to find.  Both have that good corny, salty flavor, though.  Between the carbs and the sodium, Corn Nuts are only an occasional treat for me, and I hate to be disappointed by getting a stale bag.  The ones I received from Amazon's Prime Pantry were excellent.

I like the pink grapefruit fragrance in the Method Gel Hand Wash, although is is rather faint.  The product lathers well (I know that's not important when it comes to getting skin clean, but I like it) and a small squirt does the job.  I definitely like knowing that Method is not loaded with a lot of suspect ingredients and antibacterials, which is the biggest reason I choose it.

Lamb and lamb meal are the first two ingredients in Solid Gold Sunday Sunrise; both are really good sources of protein.  Other protein sources include eggs, peas, pollock meal, and lentils (the lentils are pretty far down the list, so perhaps not a significant source of protein).  As far as the nutrition, this is a food you can feel good about providing to your dog.Some ingredients I consider iffy because of their nutritional value (or lack of) include lettuce, celery, spearmint, and thyme.  These are far enough down the list that I doubt they contribute much, but I do question their inclusion.  Salt is also listed, but I don't have enough chemistry available to know whether this is to meet a dog's requirement for sodium (valuable) or meant to be a flavor enhancer (useless).  As far as the flavor goes, my dog eats it eagerly.  She is, though, possibly the world's least fussy dog, and I've never tried a dog food she doesn't like.One thing to note is that Solid Gold has had a recall, about 2 years ago, due to salmonella.  I always wonder whether that means the food is less likely to have problems now, since the company has been made aware of possible problems, or whether that puts a company on the suspect list for all time.  I lean toward the former, especially with a high-end food such as this.

The Clean Apple fragrance in these garbage bags is very light; it doesn't continue to scent the kitchen once it's in the trash can.  The bag does actually seem to help block odor, though.  I use a closed top kitchen trash can so odors don't ordinarily escape, but sometimes when the lid is opened, whew!  We haven't experienced that with the Hefty Odor Block bags.The bags are plenty tough for my use, and I do tend to stuff them pretty full.  What I like best, though, is that the stretch tie fits just right around my trash can.  The way the flip-top works on my can makes it hard for most bags to fit (there's an intrusive tab where the top attaches to the can).  The Hefty bags stretch around that spot perfectly, holding the bag open and preventing “bag collapse” when something is tossed in.  These will be my go-to trash bag from now on.

These pads are very thin but able to contain a fair amount of leakage.  For me, they are a bit too narrow, occasionally leaving me vulnerable to some breakthrough at the sides, and they aren't something you'd want to rely on overnight or if you sometimes have unpredictably heavy leakage.  However, for those small “bursts” caused by sudden sneezing or laughing, or to buy you a little time while you make the bathroom dash, they work really well.  What I like best is that they are so unobtrusive.  They are soft, thin, and totally comfortable to wear (really not noticeable) and minimally packaged, making them easy to carry in a purse or pocket just in case you need a change.  They have become my first choice for daytime use.

I have been testing the VTech Kidizoom DX Smartwatch with the assistance of my 7-year-old granddaughter.  When I first saw the watch, it struck me as very large, and I wondered if my style-conscious granddaughter would have an issue with that.  However, it didn't seem to strike her that way at all; she was very excited to open the attractive packaging (very nicely done for gift-giving) and start wearing the watch.  Within moments, she had figured out how to take some pictures and how to access the various features.  The camera has remained one of her favorite features.  One of the games she really likes is a running game that encourages physical activity, so it's not all screen time with this fun watch.I don't care for the watch's actual time-telling functions.  The analog clock faces are inappropriate for someone learning to tell time, as many have only the 12-3-6-9 configuration and none of the initially available ones shows the minutes.  The faces are cute but mostly very cluttered, to the degree that it's often difficult to even discern the numbers from the background decorations. There are several digital options, as well, but I question whether learning to read time from a digital display actually helps a child learn the concept of telling time.  There are several with audio:  press the lips and a not-bad robotic voice will say "It's six forty seven pm."  My granddaughter really likes those options.  There is also a game that features an owl that supposedly helps to teach time, but it's a pretty dull game—set the clock, then ask the owl what time it is.Charging the watch is very simple via a micro USB port, and a child who is already adept at using charging devices (for a tablet, for example) will probably be able to do it unassisted.  Smaller or inexperienced children will need help.  If you're giving the watch as a gift, you may want to charge it first, since it takes a couple hours to charge, a disappointing wait for a child eager to try it out.  The charge does not last as long as claimed by the manufacturer; after fulling charging it on Monday, then putting it back in the case and doing nothing with it until Friday, I found that the charge was about halfway depleted.  I'm not sure what VTech defines as “low usage” when claiming the charge will last two weeks, but I really don't think it will go two weeks under any level of usage.  Setting up a daily charging routine is probably the best bet.Bottom line, though, despite some of the drawbacks I see as a grown-up, my granddaughter really likes the watch and has continued to be enthusiastic about it after more than a week of using it.  She says it is very comfortable to wear.  She particularly likes having it in the car, a time when some screen time is appropriate to avoid the boredom of a long drive but her tablet's demand for a wi-fi connection limits its usefulness.

This seemed to be an unusually “sticky” canned food and it was a little difficult to get all of it out of the can; I suspect this may be due to its being a fish-based food, with no other meat.  My dog liked this food (and so did my cats, who had to be repeatedly nudged out of the way while I got the dog's meal ready), but it really disagreed with her, despite its claim to be a “sensitive skin and stomach” formulation.  Although I tried to introduce it gradually, each time I served it she developed diarrhea and room-clearing, wake-you-from-sleep gas.  She is an old dog but usually has no problem with a variety of foods, including doing very well with the Nutro brand, but this is one I won't continue to offer.

This cat kibble has both wholesome, recognizable ingredients and the most important asset:  Cat appeal (at least for mine—cats being cats, your mileage may vary).  They will actually pick around what they consider less-desirable kibbles to pick out the Nutro pieces.  I have an old cat who is ill with a gastric problem, and it's important to me to offer him especially good nutrition since his system doesn't absorb nutrients efficiently.  Nutro is one of the brands, and this turkey and brown rice one of the flavors, that both he and I like.  Also, I have to say, I am impressed by the “add-on” price of this food at Amazon.com.  I don't often buy pet food online because of the cost of shipping such a heavy item, but Amazon's add-on price is less expensive than what I can buy it for locally, making it an easy to buy option as well as a healthy one.

My dog ate this food really eagerly.  I suppose it's considered “large breed” because it is canned in good-sized chunks, but they are as soft as most any canned food and my medium-size dog had no problem eating them.  In addition, it includes glucosamine/chondroitin to help support joint health, but strong joints are important for all sizes of dogs, not just large breeds.  She experienced no digestive issues at all.Meat products (not specified as human grade) are the first ingredients in an overall healthy and recognizable list, including (in order), chicken broth, chicken, chicken liver, turkey, and beef liver.  It does also contain potato starch, wheat gluten, and rice, so you'll want to avoid it if those ingredients are issues for your dog.I would warn you, though, that if you actually have a large-breed dog, the feeding instructions on this food specify 1/3 to 1/2 can per 10 pounds of body weight (344 calories per can).  That's a LOT of cans to lug in and recycle if you're feeding a big dog!

I was a little hesitant to try this tissue, as I think I have one of the world's most easily clogged toilets.  I was concerned that an "ultra strong" toilet paper would be a really bad idea, but I'm happy to report this has not been the case.  The tissue is strong and absorbent, but it flushes away easily and has caused no problem with the fussy plumbing.  I was also surprised to find that I like this better than my usual choice, Charmin Ultra Soft.  While it is not quite as soft, it is definitely soft enough, and I found I could use slightly less as it was more absorbent.  The one-star deduction is for the "mega roll" claim.  I actually weighed this roll along with a "double roll" size, and this one weighed 1/8 ounce LESS than the supposedly smaller one.  I'm really tired of manufacturers manipulating product sizes in an attempt to fool consumers into thinking a product is bigger than it really is, and toilet paper manufacturers are among the worst in this regard.

I have a job that requires wearing headphones about 75% of the time, so I’ve had a lot of opportunity to try a lot of different kinds of headphones.  These rank right in the middle of the pack.What I like:* They are very lightweight, yet stay in place very well; better than earbuds for me.  I often wonder if I have oddly shaped ear canals, as I can never get earbuds to stay in unless they have some sort of extra fastening device, such as around-the-ear loops.  These stay put on my ears.* The ear pads are cushy enough to make them comfortable for a long time.  I don’t find myself yanking them off frequently to relieve my aching pinnae.* The clip keeps the battery pack from being a drag on the headphones (which also contributes to their secure and cushy fit).* The ability to turn noise cancellation on or off, or pause it briefly.  The noise cancellation feature does work to help mute traffic noise, neighbors’ mowers, and so forth, which is important to me in the summer when I’m working with the windows open.  It doesn’t wipe out all background noise; I can still hear the dog bark, someone knocking at the door, or someone speaking to me.* An adapter is included to make them usable in differently configured plugs.  This isn’t an issue at home but is one I’ve run into on airplanes.Not so much:* Part of what makes them comfortable is that the ear pads move in every direction; up, down, around, even flipping so the padded part faces out.  This becomes an irritation when trying to get the phones settled on my ears without having them flipped up or out in the wrong direction.* The cord is very thin and lightweight.  While this contributes to the headphones being lightweight overall, it also means the cord tangles very readily.  Combine that with the rotating ear pads and it can be a real brain teaser to get everything sorted out to use the headphones.* Although the clip is handy for the weighty battery pack, handier still would be a battery pack located on, say, the headband.  The weight that is such a drag on a lightweight cord would be barely noticeable on the headband or earpiece.* The cord is a little short for my purposes as I have to attach it to a computer near the floor while working at my desk.  I’m not sure I’d want it any longer when traveling, though.As far as sound quality, it’s pretty reasonable for the price.  I wouldn’t choose them first when listening to music except in a situation where I really needed a very portable sound-canceling option, but they’re quite good for listening to speech.

Attempting to stick to a tight budget when unexpectedly finding I needed to replace my home theater receiver, one of the features I sacrificed was Bluetooth.  Therefore, I was really delighted to get a chance to try out the TP-Link Bluetooth Music Receiver.Setting up the TP-Link could hardly be easier.  Both USB and RCA cables came with it; I opted to use the RCA cables.  The hardest part about hooking it up was my decision to re-route all of my electrical cords while I was doing it so I could reposition my power filter (you know how it is when you start messing with your home theater or stereo system; there’s always some little tweak you could do “while you’re at it”).  Anyway, I plugged the cables into my receiver and the TP-Link, plugged the TP-Link into my newly positioned surge protector, and that was it.I first paired my laptop; it found the TP-Link and connected unhesitatingly.  My HTC One M8 phone took a few minutes to decide it could “see” the link, but then paired just fine.  Now, I’m streaming Pandora to my stereo system while I write this review – no dropouts or skips, no lost signal at any time.  The receiver is small and unobtrusive and blends right in with my black components.If you’d like to add a Bluetooth to your stereo system quickly and easily, I highly recommend the TP-Link HA 100.  It is billed as also working for other devices, e.g., a computer, but I don’t need it there so haven’t tried it.  I’m completely happy with the way it works with my stereo receiver, though.

This is a very cool little notebook, and there’s no doubt that the fabric and plastic cover would hold up well in a backpack, desk, or locker over the course of a school year.  However, I was a little surprised to find that the cover isn’t refillable.  When the paper is used up, you’re left with a pretty substantial cover, divider, and ring binder to throw away or recycle.  It really seems wasteful to me.Leaving that aside, this is a handy notebook.  As I mentioned, it’s sturdy.  It’s college ruled, which I prefer, and includes a divider that will hold loose notes and a pen loop.  I often use pocket notebooks to take notes and keep lists while birding, and this will be perfect for that, particularly since it solves the issue of where to stash the pen to keep it handy and the fabric spine keeps the spiral binding from snagging in a pocket.

It’s a little hard to say how well the APC Home Theater Power Filter works, since for comparison I’d need something like, say, an electrical storm that damaged electronics on another surge protector but not on this one, and even then there are so many variables that a side-by-side comparison wouldn’t be all that meaningful.  The unit certainly makes me feel confident, though.For starters, it’s heavy.  Okay, “heavy” isn’t a feature, but it’s likely indicative of sturdy, heavy-duty construction.  The equipment protection guarantee is valued at $350,000, and while even very low-end surge protectors that are really little more than extension cords often claim cash-value equipment protection, $350,000 is pretty substantial.This unit is designed and arranged very thoughtfully.  The glossy black exterior works well with all of the other components in my home theater system, and the plugs can be rotated to the most convenient orientation.  I will admit I laughed a little at the box’s suggestion that it could be placed on top of other components, like it was so good looking that one wouldn’t even notice the spaghetti farm growing out of it, but still, it is attractive as these things go.  It also uses master outlets that can stop the power flow when an outlet senses that a device is not in use, and claims to save up to $40 on your electricity bill with this feature; not sure how they arrive at that figure, but it is an eco-friendly option nevertheless.I work at home and depend on my company’s tech support to keep my equipment working well, and the APC brand is suggested every time power protection is discussed.  I’m not paid if I’m not working, so I sometimes push my luck a little during thunderstorms.  I own two other APC surge protectors and an APC uninterruptable power supply, and they have worked flawlessly.  I expect to be just as satisfied with the Home Theater Power Filter.

This is my first Toshiba laptop, and so far, I am very happy with it.  Windows 10 is new to me (very new – I have Windows 7 on my desktop computer due to work software that won’t play nicely with 8 or 10), but so far I’ve found everything I need either intuitively or with a quick search.Both Toshiba and Microsoft did load up the unit with plenty of bloatware, such as McAfee, AOL On, preinstalled shortcuts for eBay, Groupon, Insteon, and more.  Most irritating of all is the Xbox app that Microsoft is so sure you want that it cannot be uninstalled.  For all of this, though, it didn’t include a user manual.  The quick start guide refers the user to the Toshiba website – good luck with that.  I still haven’t found it.Startup:  It took about 20 minutes for the computer to complete initial startup, first lingering on the Toshiba startup screen, then loading updates for Windows 10 (I will never cease to be disappointed at how a brand-new Windows operating system can need patches within days of its release).  Wireless and Bluetooth connected quickly and easily.Mechanics:  The computer is so thin that when I was unpacking it, I thought the description that said it included a DVD drive was an error, but no, there it was on the left-hand side, a handy location for me since that won’t interfere with my right-handed mouse usage.  I’m still dependent on my mouse for anything I can’t do with key commands, as the touchpad, while better than my old Dell laptop, still doesn’t perform as smoothly and reliably as I’d like.  The fan was relatively noisy initially, but it did quiet down after a couple days, as if it needed to settle into its groove.  I really like the keyboard; the backlighting is handy and, for me, the key response is just right, enough “hesitation” and a slight, nearly inaudible click, although the perfectly flat keys did take some getting used to.The Harmon Kardon music system is great; best I’ve heard as standard issue on a laptop.  The display is very impressive.  It looks good from every angle and I tweak the position only for my own comfort.  Oddly, though, the driver appears not to support Microsoft’s solitaire games, a much ballyhooed return in Windows 10.  The games always display in a pixilated fashion that makes them impossible to play.Multitasking has caused no appreciable slowdown in performance or other issues.  I’ve used it with multiple browser tabs open (in fact, multiple browsers as I experiment with Edge while using my old standby, Chrome) while also playing music and moving back and forth to work with Word, Excel, and Outlook.  I’ve also had multiple browser tabs open while playing music and watching Amazon Prime video simultaneously, again without a glitch.  In fact, the video streamed more smoothly than when using my Amazon Fire Stick on my TV and looked about as good as my TV, as well.Battery life:  Okay, but not a knockout.  I unplugged at 10:46 a.m. and used multiple programs (web, email, Word, music) nonstop until 2:10 p.m., at which time the screen dimmed slightly as the battery saver came on and the icon indicated that 80% of the power had been used; so, just a bit over 3 hours brand new and fully charged.The biggest hitch I’ve run into was when I reset the computer to its vaunted Eco mode.  All seemed to work well until the next time I signed on and found it had dropped my internet connection.  No amount of troubleshooting could fix it (reboot, reconnect with the modem, reset the modem, etc.).  Finally, a Google search suggested turning off the Eco mode and sure enough, the wireless worked again and has worked reliably since.Overall, I really like this laptop, and I would recommend it without hesitation to shoppers in this price bracket.

When dinosaurs roamed the earth and I was still a child, Coke came in 8-ounce bottles, and my parents actually thought that constituted two servings!  My three siblings and I would split two bottles.  No wonder soft-drink obesity was unheard of back then (well, that and all the exercise we got outrunning those saber tooth tigers).  By the time I was a teenager, the 16-ounce bottle had become a standard size, and then we reached a point where one could buy this stuff by the liter.  I really like these mini-cans to help me get back to a reasonable serving size.  I will admit, though, my sibs and I each drink a whole one now -- what an indulgence!

I love my Swiffer WetJet!  I have white tile floors in my kitchen and laundry room, and my WetJet makes an appearance almost every day.  I've tried a variety of reusable microfiber cloths instead of the original refill pads, but I've never been very satisfied with them.  The original pads still work the best and are the handiest to use.

There’s nothing like a gel mat if you spend a lot of time standing in front of your stove or kitchen sink.  The difference it makes for your back, hips, knees, and feet is really remarkable, particularly if your kitchen floor is very hard, as my tile floor is.Of course, GelPro is “the” name in kitchen gel mats, and with this new GelPro Plush model, they’ve finally addressed the one complaint I had about them.  GelPro mats instruct that if they get wet or soiled, all you need to do is wipe them off with a damp cloth.  Well, I have a semi-incontinent elderly dog, and bless her heart for choosing the tile floor if she can’t quite wait to go out, but if she hit my old GelPro mat, believe me, it took a lot more than a simple wipedown to get it clean.  The mat’s sponge bottom absorbs the odor; the mat is bulky, heavy, and hard to wrangle; and it takes God’s own time drying once it’s really wet.This new Plush model, though, is completely enclosed in vinyl – no spongy bottom to soak up accidents!  Although I haven’t had to find out yet (fingers crossed…), it definitely looks as if it really will easily wipe clean.  Meanwhile, they haven’t sacrificed a thing in terms of comfort.  I love to cook and, frankly, my physique shows it.  It’s hard to believe how much more comfortable it is to work on the GelPro mat, not only while I’m working but afterward.  No more hobbling from the kitchen with pain in my back and hips.I don’t know if GelPro mats ever really wear out.  I’ve had one for several years, and it still feels nearly as comfy as this brand-new one.  Incidentally, though, if you allow your old dog in the kitchen while you’re cooking, there’s nothing like a GelPro mat for her to curl up on, either.  I now have one in front of the sink and one in front of the stove, and she and I just trade places back and forth while I work.

This book was a very pleasant surprise for me.  Although Michigan may not be as well known for producing maple syrup as some of the eastern states, we do have a thriving syrup season and I always have maple syrup on hand.  When I ordered this book, I hoped it would give me a new idea or two for cooking with maple syrup.  I really underestimated it; rather than giving me  a couple new ideas, I want to try every recipe in the book!Another thing that surprised me was author Katie Webster’s emphasis on whole grains, low fat, and low sodium in her recipes.  Whenever practical, she specifies whole wheat flour, low-fat ingredients, and minimal added salt.  There are gluten-free, vegetarian, and vegan options, as well.The book itself is very attractive.  It uses a 1-recipe-per-page format, and nearly every recipe is illustrated with a full color photo; Webster’s background as a food stylist serves her well here.  She includes information about how maple syrup is made and resources for obtaining ingredients (although none of the recipes calls for anything particularly exotic).But what about the recipes themselves?  I’ve had the chance to try just a couple of them so far, and they succeeded very well.  Although the recipes go much further than simply breakfast, the first thing I tried was the Lemon Poppyseed Whole Grain Pancakes with Blueberry Maple Sauce.  Both the pancakes and the blueberry sauce came together quickly and easily, and the results were just as scrumptious as they sound.  I also tried the maple glazed carrots, all the while wondering why I hadn’t done this before – it just never occurred to me.  Next up was the Smoky and Sweet Turkey Chili.  I definitely never thought of adding maple syrup to my chili, but it definitely works!  None of the recipes seems overly difficult, and all of the ingredients can be found readily.  I’m really looking forward to cooking my way through this book.

When I first got my FoodSaver, I didn't think I'd find the rolls convenient, but I soon found being able to cut them to size oftentimes makes them more convenient than the pre-made bags.  I think these rolls would be especially handy for storing game, as freezing odd-sized cuts of meat is one of the times custom sizes work best.I'm not sure why the folks at FoodSaver think game needs stronger bags than any other meat, but the material in these rolls is a little more substantial than the standard rolls.  Perhaps the idea is that while game is being transported, the bags may get battered and be more prone to tearing and leaking; however, I do bash mine around pretty good in the freezer sometimes, and I've never had a problem with one of the bags breaking open.  I have this model Foodsaver, not a GameSaver, and the GameSaver rolls fit it with no problem.Something folks may not realize is that sealing meat in FoodSaver bags not only protects it better in the freezer, it keeps it fresh longer in the refrigerator, too.  For example, when I thaw poultry, typically I figure I've got to use it within a day or two after thawing before it starts to spoil.  However, poultry that was frozen in a FoodSaver bag, kept in the bag protected from air while it thaws, stays good at least a couple days longer.

I'm a little surprised by all the 5-star reviews for this product.  I used my bread machine, with which I usually have great results.  This loaf baked up okay, not an impressive rise but enough.  The top was misshapen so not an attractive loaf.  What really disappointed me, though, was the rather bland flavor.  Definitely not the depth of flavor I expected in a 10-grain bread.  If you're trying to convert a white-bread family to something with a little more nutritional value, this might be a good place to start, but if you're accustomed to eating multigrain and whole grain breads, it's a letdown.  It does make good toast, although it takes a bit longer to get nicely crisp.

I like these Mengo Bumps pretty well.  They certainly aren't the most hi-fi earbuds I've ever used, but they are adequate, even for music, and they definitely excel at staying put.The slight tension from their behind-the-head cord is both an advantage and a disadvantage.  The earbuds stay in place partly from the pressure exerted by the cord, which sort of pulls them into my ears when I turn my head.  On the other hand, this constant slight pressure in my ear canals makes them uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time, despite the soft silicone earbuds.  It feels as if this may improve with time as the cord stretches out a bit; it needs about an eighth of an inch.I mostly use them with my phone, HTC One M8.  They charged up and paired effortlessly.  I often listen to audiobooks when driving, and my phone isn't quite loud enough to do this without headphones.  I really like being wireless instead of being awkwardly tied to the phone.  The microphone is somewhat inadequate, though; if I interrupt the book to take a phone call, the callers always complain that they cannot hear me well.  It seems the microphone needs to be somewhat more sensitive to capture my speaking.  So, for listening, I think these are pretty good.  For speaking, not so much.I received these headphones at a significant discount, nearly free, in exchange for my review.

I was offered the opportunity to try this at no charge in exchange for my honest review.  In all cases, it's hard to be sure glucosamine/chondroitin/MSM works for someone.  It's one of those supplements that seems to work for some and not for others, and it's hard to say if there is a placebo effect or a measurable improvement.  I have osteoarthritis, so I take it on a "couldn't hurt, might help" basis.  I can't honestly say I notice a big difference with or without it, from any manufacturer.However, if it is a supplement you find you benefit from, or one that you're interested in trying, the Viva Labs brand is a very good strength at a very reasonable price.  The capsules are large-ish, but they always are for this supplement, and I find the Viva Labs capsules easier to swallow than the large tablet form some companies use.Unfortunately, Viva Labs does not display USP or NSF certification on the label, so there's no way to be sure the product has been tested and found to contain what it says it does in the claimed strength.  There is no country of origin, either, which is always suspect, since most that source their ingredients only from the U.S. feature that information prominently.  This is the reason for my 1-star deduction.

I was initially drawn to the designs on these cute Swedish dishcloths.  Our son's in the Navy, so pretty much anything with a nautical design is going to appeal to me.  I have used similar products in the past, and admittedly I am always skeptical at how well these will hold up.But they do!  I used these to clean up my kitchen counter after my three younger boys decides to do some 'cooking.'  (Who knew making some Ramen and Jello would be so messy?!)  My counters were a sticky mess, and I had jello powder on the floor.  After getting these damp, I used my regular all purpose cleanser and wiped everything up.  They did a great job-didn't rip, and allowed me to easily clean up the mess.  These do take quite a while to completely dry-I'd say about ten hours or so, and when they dry they are no longer flat, so storing them isn't as easy as say throwing  away a paper towel.But I like the cute design, and these are great to small messes.  I did wash them on the delicate cycle in my washing machine, and once again, NO rips!  If you use these consistently, I think they will be great in terms of saving money on paper products, if you put them away and forget you have them, that's 13 dollars not so well spent.I will continue to use these until they give out on me, but I'm not sure if they are going to replace my paper towels completely.

I usually prefer more modern romances, especially ones with a hint of adventure to them, but I picked this up and though I'd give it a try.I'm so happy I did!  This is a lovely book-and yes, I mean lovely.Mary Dare is pregnant-alone, scared and running.  Jesse Morgan finds her body on the shore near his light house, and though every instinct he has tells him to run, he finds he can not.  Jesse is mourning for the wife he lost years ago, but Mary brings something to his life-hope and beauty.  The both have secrets, but their tender and passionate love will triumph!Yes, my review sounds oddly poetic, but that's how I felt reading this book.  There's redemption here, a story about moving on with your life and learning to find a place where your soul is at peace.  Author, Susan Wiggs, did a wonderful job creating these two broken characters, and yet the solace and love they find in one another was beautifully crafted.  More than once I wiped a tear away.I loved these characters, absolutely loved them!  And now I need to go hunt down the rest of Wiggs historical romances.Pick this up, you won't regret it

SO much better than earlier cookbooks for children.  When our oldest was younger (he's 21 now, and I'm talking about when he was 7-9 here) the books were very juvenile. Drawings, almost cartoon like, instead of pictures, and for the most part the 'recipes' were things like fruit skewers-literally just putting fruit on skewers, how easy is that?But this book by DK (Dorling Kindersley) is a whopping 300+ pages, and has colored pictures of every recipe.  And to be clear, there are some actual recipes here-no more fruit skewers, and peanut butter dip (which was yes, just peanut butter)Our 11 and 7 year old helped me with numerous recipes here:+Classic Coleslaw-with summer rigth around the corner, we love cooking out on our trusty Weber grill. And who doesn't love coleslaw with a good burger?  The kids and I made this, and while we prefer a vinegar based slaw, this one was ok.  It lightens things up a bit using some yogurt, instead of just mayo. On the other hand, we found the dressing a bit heavy.+Bell Pepper Hummus-the kids are willing to try just about anything you can dip a chip or carrot into, so why not some hummus?  My 11 year old enjoyed cutting up the peppers-with some help and supervision from me!-and they thought this was pretty tasty.  I love hummus, and I thought it was pretty tasty as well.  Easy to make too+Beef Pasta-my 11 year old made this pretty much on his own.  I chopped the veggies and laid things out and then he put everything together.  I liked that they put some vegetables in here, but overall the sauce was pretty blah.  The addition of green pesto added some flavor, but where is the parsley, the cilantro, the cayenne pepper?  Something!  I wasn't the only one disappointed in this very pedestrian pasta.+ Apple Crumble-during the same meal we made our coleslaw for, we prepared with Apple Crumble for dessert.  YUM! Of course, pretty much any apple pie is going to be a hit in my house, but the boys liked this, and enjoyed preparing it, though I think that's because they stole more than a few slices of apple.+Chocolate Fudge Brownies-Nope!  This recipe calls for 18...yes, you read that right 18 tablespoons of butter.  Ok, we went with it, but there is just too much butter and not enough chocolate.  We mixed everything up, and the recipe said too cook for 20-25 minutes.  I didn't think that sounded right, but again, we're going with it....when we took the cake out, it was still raw brownie batter.  We were able to salvage it, but only after I cooked it for another 20 minutes!  And yes, my oven is working properly.  I'm thinking that cooking time was a misprint.  In the end, these brownies were not tasty.  Just way too much butter.One thing I do like is that each recipe spells out the equipment you will need.  My kids can assemble all the ingredients and utensils they need for any given recipe.Aside from a few mishaps, this book is a wonderful introduction to cooking for kids.  There are step by step instructions and picture, and since my kids are more visual learners I appreciated this.We are pretty adventurous eaters, and nothing in here scared my boys off.  On the other hand, the lack of spices immediately tells me that many of these recipes are, simply put, going to be rather blah.  This is one of the better kids cookbooks I've come across, and it's a good buy for the price, if you want to stick to the basics.

I've read all the books in author, Lori Foster's, "Love Undercover" series, and I love them!When summer in Virginia rolls around, I look for a certain type of book-romance with a twist.  I enjoy my romance novels with an undercurrent of danger and surprise and I've realized that Foster almost always delivers.  One thing I appreciate is that Foster brings back the other characters from her series, and not in a peripheral way-she weaves them into the story in a way that makes sense, but also gives loyal readers an update into their lives-something I love!.Lieutenant Margarent Peterson is a tough as nails cop-beautiful, but deadly.  Not many men can get past her prickly exterior, but for Dashiel Riske that isn't a problem. He sees her for the complex, kind and caring woman she is, and appreciates all of that in her.  Of course, Margo (Margaret's nickname) has a tough time with that. A hard childhood has left her unable to easily recognize love-though both characters quickly fall for the other.  Foster's books, though she often writes about extreme circumstances, don't' usually have the characters follow the typical romance plotline (two characters meet, dislike each other but lust after one another, fall in love, something drives them apart, but they find their way back to one another) rather she weaves in a more believable (for me anyways) courtship between the two main characters-yes, they face hardship, and that brings tension and uncertainty, but it doesn't necessarily drive them away from one another.Trying to take down a vicious abduction ring, puts Margo and Dash right in the crosshairs of the sleazy ring leader.  It's hard for Margo to ask for help, let alone accept protection, unfortunately that's exactly what Dash wants to give her.  In between abductions, shootouts, and attempted murder the two find their way to one another, and though the book is set in a relatively short time frame (from my best guess three to five weeks maybe) Foster crafts a believable romance, rather than one that seems to happen overnight.We get our happy ending, but not before we are treated to some adventure.  The one thing I found a bit tedious is the overly long seduction scenes.  I'm not prude by any means, but two or three long chapters is a bit silly in my book, though they are well written, so I can get over that.Perfect book for a warm summer night!

I'm not a fan-what more can I say? Maybe I'm used to an applicator so that I don't actually have to play with my deodorant, or maybe I just prefer an antiperspirant/deodorant all in one, but whatever it was, this didn't do it for me.I'm a woman and I sweat! There I said it, and while I don't think I smell horrible, I want to keep it that way.  I don't want to smell when I'm outside in the Virginia heat and humidity with my little boys, nor do I want to have wet spots on my clothing.  Sure, if I decide to go for a run in 95 degree heat, I resign myself to the fact that I'm going to sweat and have wet marks, I might even smell, BUT why would I use a deodorant that only controls one aspect of the protection I'm seeking?After reading some of the other reviews, I used this on a day I did not shave-I still found it irritating.  It went on a bit sticky, and I ended up walking around with my arms held out for a good five minutes.  Ok, whatever. But I also felt a slight burning sensation/itchiness, and I'm sorry, I don't want sweaty, itchy pits during the summer.At this price point, I want something easy to use, that is going to WORK.  And while I didn't notice any unpleasant odor, it didn't control the sweat the way my current product does.  For this price, I'm not switching, nor would I recommend this.

We are very pleased with this (sort of) portable air conditioner unit.Packaging: We received a pretty large beat up box, and were immediately worried what sort of damage was hiding inside. We were very surprised to see that everything was in fine shape - which is attributed to the amazing packaging. This unit may be the best packaged item I've ever seen. It's wrapped nicely and tucked in with foam. It could have survived much more than the box damage implied.Setup: Putting the unit together is pretty simple. The instructions are pretty clear with regard to what pieces go where. There really isn't much needed. Connect the adapters to the the exhaust hose, shape the exhaust hose, position the unit, and put the exhaust into a window or through a wall. Side note: The exhaust hose reminds me of the arms of the robot in Lost in Space (TV series), so the kids got a kick out of me walking around with a weird looking arm. After a bit of fun, we snapped it all together, put the unit in place, and let it sit a while, as the directions recommend (Important safeguards section). A couple things I'd say with regard to setup is (1) the unit is pretty heavy, so be careful and have a capable helper, and (2) the window vent does not include any sort of flashing or weatherstripping (It would be nice if it included a draft guard to cover up any gap left between the window and the vent. Even with the adjustable slide that fills the window space, there is still a gap, which of course creates a draft.).Ease of use: The options and buttons are very simple to use. It's a breeze! (Get it?!)Does it work: I see a lot of the reviews make note of the device not cooling or working. Mine is new, so it is working as expected at this time. It cools are room quickly and easily - even on a lower fan setting. I haven't noted any leaking, although a drip pan may be a good idea anyway. I'm very pleased with the cooling function. It's acceptably quiet, and gives plenty of cool air.All in all, I am very happy with the product. Cleaning the filter is easy. Draining the reservoir is easy. I just wish it included something to block draft from the window - rather than us having to buy something to do that or slapping tape across the seam.Update: Soon after my review, we moved this unit to a new location. A few days later, it stopped working. It started beeping randomly, and wouldn't power up. Now it has stopped beeping entirely, and still no power. We reached out to the vendor, knowing we had the unit less than a month, and they require us to mail the entire unit to their service center which is halfway across the country. And they expect us to pay for it. We went back and forth with support, but that's their policy. Steer clear, as shipping this unit won't be cheap.

It was perfect timing for us to receive this. We are redoing flooring in our house, and trying to get accurate measurements. We measured a few long runs with your typical tape measure, but then it would be too short, so we'd have to measure, shift, measure. Accuracy falls short when you have to measure a few sections at a time.This handy device is simple to use, and can handle great lengths with great accuracy. All of the short runs we could confirm with a tape measure were spot on. So we trusted it with our long runs - in the 40 foot range. We bumped it up against a wall, set the device to measure from the bottom of the device (you can measure from the top or bottom), and shot the laser across the room. We held the device steady and pushed the button to log the distance. Bingo.This makes measuring long distances so much easier and more efficient. It can even calculate volume and area on the fly as you measure different angles. It can also store a few of your previous distances, so you don't have to jot them down or remember them.The only issues we noted were the interface being a bit clunky and outdated (but it works), and that the device is easy to shift/bump when pushing the buttons (so be sure to hold it in place tight, or your measurement could be skewed).You may also run into an issue if you need to measure something that doesn't have a piece to aim the laser at. In those cases, just have someone hold a piece of paper or a board at the other end of the object/space you are measuring.It uses two AAA batteries (included), includes a case and wrist lanyard (in case you can't find it, it is stuffed inside the case), and has a 2 year warranty (which is great).No more fumbling with a disorderly tape measure. Get this instead!

This isn't a book that is going to teach you something new. It isn't going to change your world views, BUT it will entertain you.Author, Lori Foster, has created a group of fun and interesting characters-one's that you will enjoy reading about, if not genuinely care about.Rowdy Yates is handsome, fun and a charmer. He's never set down any roots-and that includes a relationship with a woman that goes beyond a one night stand.Beautiful Avery Mullins has secrets, and lives her life one day at a time praying they don't catch up to her. Rowdy hasn't tried to hide his attraction to her, nor his desire to take her to bed, but Avery refuses to just be another notch on his bedpost.And like any other love story, we know how this is going to end, but the ride to the finish line is fun and full of twists.  Foster is a pro about bringing back old characters and deftly introduces new ones.The Love Undercover series is perfect for summer-hot, fun, and yes, a little bit Rowdy.

I have a Contigo water bottle that I use when I exercise and it's great!  I've had it for about two years and haven't had any issues with leaking when it's in use.  I wish it was insulated a bit more, but I'll take melted ice over a leaking bottle any day.So, when I saw this smaller bottle I had to grab it for my 1st grader to use when he's playing outside or when he takes his lunch to school. He has used it for a few days while playing outside and I can say without a doubt it's holding up! He's an active little boy, and he drops it in the grass, sits it on the porch, and not a scratch on it!  The ice melted after a few hours, but the bottle kept the water cool for 4+ hours-perfect for a warm Virginia day!He used it in school yesterday and came home pleased to report that it did NOT leak in his book bag.
