He also got a kick out of his friend's reaction-though I wouldn't necessarily say there's anything special looking about the bottle, the kids got a kick out of the flip top, and the little blue ring you can pull up-apparently this is for holding it with one finger.As a mom I appreciate that this is BPA free, and dishwasher safe (top rack only). Contigo also offers a lifetime guarantee, and though we've had no use for it as of now, it's nice to know a company stands by their products.Great product for the price-less than $15!. Think I'll be buying a few more Contigo's!

This book is tricky for me. I liked the set up-a lot! Interesting twists, some suspenseful moments, but the opening scene and the stock characters made the book very predictable.I do enjoy playing the, "whodunit?" game. When I read a mystery I like trying to figure out who the bad guy is, and then of course I finish because I want to know if I'm right.  My problem with author, Michael Hiebert's book is that halfway through I saw where this was going and by the end of the book I was asking myself if I truly cared?The characters, though rather cliched are enjoyable. Detective Leah Teal is a tough mom. Good at her job, and loved by her kids, unfortunately that's about all we got.  I actually enjoyed the story more when it was told through the eyes of Leah's son, Abe, because the dialogue seemed to track better from a 12 year old.And I think that's my biggest issue-the dialogue felt elementary coming from the characters that are supposed to be speaking.  Some of the slang Leah used, I just didn't buy coming from a tough detective, a 12 year old yes! An Adult? Nope.The psychic bent in the story was interesting, but then the ending basically takes away the mystery of it.  As far as the "deep root of evil" the back of the book promised-it wasn't here.  Perhaps what the killer was doing was gruesome, but the reasoning was so stock, I almost shook my head at it.You can do better if you want a summer mystery.

So far this chair has been very well received by my behind and back. And when it comes to a chair I need to work out of for much of the day, that's what matters.The box came a little beat up. In fact, the top of the base was actually sticking out of the box. Seeing that, I was a bit worried that the chair would be damaged, but all of the pieces were accounted for and everything was in fine shape.Assembly is pretty simple. The wheels snap in, you screw in a few parts and then slip them together. The only pain point I had with regard to assembly was lining up one of the armrests. I couldn't get one of the bolts to bite. After a little arm wrestling, I was finally able to get it screwed in. Because of the padding between the back and bottom of the chair, you have to give it a little force to get the bolts in place. Just be careful not to damage any of the materials.Once everything is put together, the chair looks great. In fact, without looking up close and feeling/tapping, you can't tell that the materials are not "real" - not leather and some of the metal-looking pieces are actually plastic. For the most part, that's fine. But I do wish the armrests were metal rather than plastic. The plastic appears to be sturdy, but only time will tell. The padding is nice and cozy. It's not over-stuffed. And the leatherette seems to be pretty good quality - it has a nice thickness to it. It is certainly easy to clean, without concern of ruining "leather." The rolling wheels work great. It glides smoothly, and doesn't bind, which is a great relief. And the height adjustment, swivel, and recline functions all work smoothly.It does have a strange smell right out of the box. It almost has a petroleum smell to it. I have yet to rid it of the smell, but haven't really put a lot of effort into it yet. I was hoping it would fade on its own.Also, one of the pads on the armrest has a gap in the front where it meets the plastic - almost as if it has pulled up a bit. I don't think it is faulty. I just think it came out molded that way. But it is noticeable when you put your hand at the ends of the pads.The chair is comfortable, works great, and looks great. I'm very pleased with the product. At the time of this review, the price seems a bit high based on the materials used in this chair. There are competing products out there with more substantial materials, and more features (such as adjustable armrests) for a lower price. With that said, the quality of this chair's components are great and seem to make up for it.A quality office chair that I'll get tons of use out of.

GORGEOUS!  That's the name of my review as well, because I can't say it enough!  This color is beautiful!I will say it's brighter in person than it appears to be on here, but the color is just that much better.  In the past, i found myself reaching for lighter pastels or neutrals in the spring and summer, no more!  After wearing this shade, I love looking down and my bright pink nails!  Honestly, they just make me smile.All Essie polishes are DBP, toluene and formaldehyde free, which I like.  Two coats of this gave me a nice even color, with a touch of shine.I'm a stay at home mom and don't wear much makeup, but I love doing my nails, essie is a bit on the pricier side when it comes to drugstore brands, but for me I think the extra dollar or two is worth it.  The formula seems to last much longer-think I went almost a week with no chips!This shade is easily my new favorite!

Book two in the TombQuest series was just as good as the first!I got these to read with my 11 year old, and we both love them!  Filled with details of ancient Egypt-curses, myths, and gods-this book is education as well as fun.  My son reads this and then wants to know more about Isis, Mummies and the pyramids. Any series that can get him interested in history is a win for me, but the stories author, Michael Northrop, tells are rich, complex and full of little hidden morals.But the short answer is: The books are just really cool!Book two takes us to London where strange things are happening: Red rain is falling from the sky, and people are disappearing.Alex and Ren know what's going on. They defeated a Death Walker in book one, but they believe another one has taken up residence in London.  Armed only with their hunches and Alex's amulet they travel across the ocean, in the hopes that they will be able to defeat another Death Walker-if that's what this is.  Alex's cousin Luke joins them as they search for clues in one of the cities haunted cemeteries.  Will Alex find his mom?  And will they defeat a second Death Walker?Sure, some of the things are a bit out there.  I'm a mother, NO WAY would I let my 12 year old go to London for an 'internship.'  But Northrop comes up with plausible explanations for that, and i can overlook that because the book is well written.  It doesn't dumb anything down to cater to children, and yet the story is easy to follow and filled with twists and turns.Like my son, I'm eagerly awaiting book three, and we can't wait to read more adventures from the TombQuest crew!

There is only one thing stopping me from giving this five stars: The first 50 pages.Author, Nancy Thayer, is an accomplished writer and I've read and enjoyed a number of her books before I picked up "The Guest Cottage," But the first 50 pages of this almost reads as a list of bullet points to get to where the real action takes place.-First we do this.-Then we'll do that.-and then we can move on to this.And FINALLY, we get to the heart of the story.Sophie Anderson is a beautiful mother of two, and her husband wants a divorce.. Trevor Black is learning how to handle the loss of his wife andhow it effects their young son. Thayer was able to write Sophie's soon to be ex husband and Trevor's deceased wife as people we could understand them moving on from, and yet still mourning the loss of.  This book is about learning to move forward and understanding that when one door closes, another does indeed open.I enjoyed reading about Sophie and Trevor's friendship and how it slowly morphs into something more.  This book wasn't about passion, though there was that, this was about learning to listen to your heart and accepting that you deserve to be loved.Keep on reading! Don't let the first few chapters deter you from a very uplifting and heart warming book.

I love a good romance, and I always say it isn't the end that surprises me, it's the journey.  After all, it's a romance novel, we know how it's going to end, right?But the twists and turns leading up to that happy ending are what can make or break a book.I've never read anything by author, Linda Goodnight, before and I have to say after reading "The Memory House," I'm certainly going to read more from here now!Julia Presley suffered the worse loss a mother can-her son disappeared, without a trace.  No closure and no answers leaves her in limbo-unable to bury her son and try to move forward, but unable to give up hope.Eli Donavan has a past-one he isn't proud of, but one he has left behind.  When he comes to Julia's B&B seeking employment the connection between the two wounded souls is almost immediate.But Julia's inn-The Peach orchard Inn-has a past, one filled with tears, anger, and love. Can Eli and Julia learn from the past?  Can Julia open her heart to Eli's motherless child, and understand that she isn't betraying her own lost son?  And can Eli learn that his past doesn't mean he isn't worthy of a future?I loved how Goodnight weaved the past into the present and reminded us that some mistakes are timeless.  She also let it be none that a once in a lifetime love is as well.Beautifully written and the tragedies within the story were deftly handled.  I can't recommend this enough!

I'm a little slow to join the Frozen craze. With five boys in the house, I didn't really have anyone clamoring to see it, but my seven year old does like Olaf, so one cold, rainy Sunday we finally sat down to watch it. I enjoyed it immensely!  It won't replace my favorites (The Lion King and Beauty and the Beast) but I can see why it's as popular as it is.I got this apron for fun.  I can always use a new apron, and I enjoy wearing them while preparing big family meals.Sadly, I'm disappointed in this one. My primary issue is there are NO pockets!  None, nada, nothing.  I love my aprons that have large pockets running across the front and will put my spatula in it, a pen, or even slip the recipe I'm using in there for safe keeping.  And while this one is certainly cute and well made, no pockets means I know I won't get much use out of it.For the price I would expect some of these little frills, instead I got a thick, black cotton apron with a print of Elsa's torso on it.I was expecting more.

I haven't bought into a single brand of headphones. I'm willing to give them all a try. And my requirements are rather simple - comfortable fit and clear, enjoyable sound.Over the past few years, Bose SIE2 headphones have been my tool of choice for working out and commuting. They don't include a mic or remote control (the SIE2i pair do, now renamed to the Bose SoundSport). So, when I saw the Sennheiser MX 686G pair available with a mic and remote, I decided to give them a try - and see if they could be my new go-to pair of headphones. I can already say that will not be the case.Note: I know there is a pretty decent price difference between the Bose and Sennheiser, but they are the closest match I have.That's not to say these are bad headphones, but go back to my requirements for a good pair of headphones - comfortable fit and clear sound.Comfort - This Sennheiser set hurts my ears. No matter how I adjust them, they hurt. After only about 20 minutes of use, my ears ached after removing the headphones. And Sennheiser does not include different size adapters. On a happier note, the hybrid fit mechanism is adjustable a bit, and it is well designed to keep the headphones in place. They didn't bounce around or fall out once they were in.Sound - The bass is nice, but the mids and highs are muddy at best. The Bose sound is so much more clear. Bass, Mids, Highs are all crisp and clean with the Bose set. Some of the muddy sounds from the Sennheiser may be due to the fit of the ear adapters, but no matter how I adjust them, the sound does not improve.Remote/mic - While this headset is geared more toward the Samsung Galaxy line of devices, the remote and mic do work with my iPhone 6 plus - sort of! The volume toggles do not work. However, the mic works for calls and speaking to Siri. The track advance, pause, play, and call answer/hangup actions all function. You can even call up Siri without issue.Quality - The build quality is great. I love the flat cable design which helps alleviate tangles. All attachment points seem to be sturdy. They even made the elbow-style 3.5 mm jack plug skinny enough to fit thicker device cases.While I appreciate the effort Sennheiser put into making a quality set of headphones at a decent price, I just can't find myself using this set very much. They are uncomfortable for me to wear for even a short while. The pouch is great, the cable is sturdy, you can wash the headset gently when needed, but if I just can't wear them, I probably won't benefit from any of the positive features. If you are comfortable with the ear bud style headphones, then these may work for you, but I guess I need the buds with a more flexible ear adapter.

Jonathan Maberry is one of my favorite authors (his Pine Deep trilogy and Joe Ledger series are must reads as far as I am concerned!). In fact, my oldest son (21) is a fan of his, as is my 16 year old (he also writes Young Adult novels-Rot and Ruin Series), so when I saw this new series aimed at the Middle school set I jumped at the chance to introduce my 11 year old to such a fun and engaging writer.I will admit when the book came my 11 year old was a bit concerned at the size of the book-it clocks in at almost 400 pages-a daunting task for an active 11 year old, but he was game after he read the description of the book:Milo Silk has a hard time separating his dreams from reality, and this is why he keeps them locked away in his dream journal. He prays that his dreams never come true, but sadly they often do-like his father disappearing years ago. Recently, the Witch of the World has invaded his dreams and keeps telling him he is going to be a hero and save the world.  Milo is scared until he discovers the Nightsiders-magical shadow creatures waging their own war on the Bugs that have invaded earth.My Son's take on this fantastical new book:"It was awesome! I love adventure books and it was just like you're in a game because of the big bugs and the other monsters.  It was cool that it was  dreams and reality with the witch of the world.So, good job and cant wait for part 2!"That's immensely high praise from an active young boy who'd rather be out playing basketball.  The biggest clue that this was a winner for him was the fact that he didn't fight me when I told him it was time to do his daily reading. (He is supposed to read for at least 20 minutes a day, per his school requirement)I think Mr. Maberry has another fan in our house!

This is the first time I've ever used a product like this, and I have to say-I love it!With five boys in the house, five boys that have passed that baby smell phase, I won't lie- I miss it. I miss that sweet scent that all babies have.  So I jumped at the chance to try this.And it works!  I shake in just a small handful, and it gives our clothes, towels and sheets a sweet baby scent.  It isn't overly scented, so it's not over powering, but rather it's a nice, subtle scent.On the other hand, I'm confused at the price here. -$37 for a 13.2 ounce container?  I could be wrong, I searched, and didn't' see that the order includes multiple jars?  On the other hand, you can get it for much less elsewhere, and I would gladly spend the $8 for this product.It has also made me want to branch out and try other products similar to this.

I've read a few of author, Debbie Macomber's, books and though they are predictable, they are also well written and...what can I say?...nice.There is something to be said for reading a book where there aren't murders, kidnappings, etc, etc.  Yes, there is drama, and yes there is pain and longing, but this is a story that I think most people can relate to on some level.Cassie Carter ran from an abusive marriage, and had to scrap herself off the floor to provide a life for herself and her young daughter.  When we meet her, she is struggling, but she has made a life for herself as a hairdresser.  Unfortunately her bad decision to marry her abusive husband estranged her from her family.And this is where I have my problem with "Last one Home." For the storyline to progress, some of the characters almost have to be written as ignorant or oblivious, and yet that's not how Macomber wants us to see these women.  Cassie's sisters, simply think that Cassie abandoned them and yet they have all these wonderful memories of her?I would rather of read them as having some sort of clue as to what Cassie might be going through, and feeling powerless to help as opposed to the idea of abuse or control never crossed their minds.Despite, that plot hole (for me anyways) I enjoyed seeing the sisters reconnect.  I liked watching Cassie learn to trust herself again, and allow herself to fall in love with a good man.Yes, the cluelessness of Cassie's sister bugged me, but this won't be the last book from Macomber that I'll read.

This is one of those toys that I like. I recycle a lot of plastic bottles. One of my dogs loves chewing on the bottles before I put them in the bin. I usually don't give her much time with them due to not wanting her to get pieces off etc. The nice thing about this is you don't have to worry (as much) about them getting pieces off.Yes, you still have to monitor them, but you really should with any toy.The one thing I'm not sure I like about this one is the little "noise making" piece that goes into the top of the bottle. That's easy enough to fix though by taking it out and not putting it back in. Other than that good toy no issues with it at all.

This is a very nice hedge trimmer, it's light weight and battery powered which are both added bonuses. It is replacing an ancient model that I got from my dad, that he very well could have gotten from his dad. That thing is a beast, but did it's job. After using this however, I have to wonder how dull the bits were on that older one, or if it was just lack of power for it. because while using this, it tore through things that typically took some effort with my old one.This is not going to cut through thick branches but it will handle bush trimming, over growth, or just general hedge maintenance. It is battery powered and has a run time of 30 minutes. Truth be told my effective run time was right around 25 minutes. After that as the battery depletes you lose some of it's cutting power. So someone with a real big yard/project you may want to invest in another battery for this so you can switch out on the fly.For most people though this will be more than adequate. I like the feel of it, handles well, easy to use, and most of all it does what it's supposed to do. I highly recommend this one.

There is a lot to like about this car seat.From memory foam, to materials that help balance temperature, and ease of use. It also offers a great deal of side protection that some other car seats I have seen try to skimp by on. The materials and craftsmanship are top notch.This is one of those seats that you can have for several years and not worry about needing to be replaced due to the child getting bigger. It can grow with the child.Easy to use and set up. No fuss in trying to figure out what goes where, or how it needs to be intuitive setup.If you're in the market for a quality, long lasting car seat this is one I'd certainly recommend.

This is one of those things that's really hard to screw up. 4 iconic candy bars all in one box. I mean what's not to like right.First things first, I like the design of the box. Easy to put on a shelf or cupboard. Sturdy enough to last as well.I like that these are the small size candy bars. Grab one, or two on the go and you're good.I'm not sure if it's a production thing, where they were shipped from or what - but several of my normal Hershey bars went bent/broken and maybe somewhat melted. Reading other comments here is seems like this is a common issue. I didn't have any issues with the peanut butter cups. But many broken Hershey bars and KitKats were like flipping a coin.Regardless, I don't much care what it looks like when I eat it. They still taste good. I would have liked to see a more even distribution of the different bars too. This leans heavily in favor of the normal Hershey bars. But such is life I guess.

Dog toys are one of those fickle things in my house. The ones that you expect to last don't and the ones you get on the cheap sometimes last much longer than expected. With two Elkhounds I go through a lot of toys and chews during the year to say the least.When I first saw this toy I had hopes it would last awhile. Only the main body has stuffing and a squeaker. This toy lasted about an hour before the first limp was gnawed off. No worries there, the dogs hadn't officially killed it yet. So it stayed in the bin. Two days later I found another wayward limb.Fast forward one week and yet another limb and some beard fur were promptly removed, but ironically enough it still squeaked so it stayed in the bin. Now two weeks after receiving it, all limbs have been removed, it has no beard fur and only one antler and looks like it has been through a major battle. But... and here's the big but... it still squeaks. The dogs still like it.So, at the end of the day this is a toy that you need to supervise fairly closely so they don't eat the limbs or other parts, but so far even with 2 50 lb dogs it has stood up pretty well.I would have liked to see the limbs more than just knotted fabric and it's a little on the spendy size in my opinion in comparison to other dog toys of similar veins. Overall though a decent toy and it's cute enough too. Not that the dogs really care about that.

I have wanted a puzzle toy for my dogs for quite awhile now but was never able to find one that I felt would take a lot of time. This one, is a great distraction and one that takes some effort.It's the classic wobble toy, but they have to get it just right to get the reward. Lots of batting it around, growling at it and a few barks. But, above all else it kept her attention which is great.The hole for the treats to come out if fairly small so no cheating on the dogs part. I used Mini Zukes for the treat and they came out with no problem.Really like this and will be recommending it to a couple friends for sure.

With the amount of devices we all have in our lives now, and the on the go style many of us live having the ability to charge a device anytime, anywhere is invaluable.I have used a variety of these portable chargers over the past couple years, the two things that seems to hold true to them is either A they never really get a decent charge to my device or B) they charge the device but after a month or two of use they lose the ability to really do much good.This portable charger from UnU packs a good punch being 5000 mAh. To get a full charge into the battery pack is between 3 to 3 1/2 hours. I have put this little charger though it's paces and have had fantastic results.I have been able to fully charge my Galaxy S5 phone twice on one charge. I was able to charge my Galaxy Tab 10.1 (2014 edition) fully. I was also able to get a 90% charge onto my PlayStation Vita. That is the highest I have ever been able to charge the Vita with a portable charger. This is a powerful little guy for sure.I really like the 4 small LED lights that indicate how much of a charge this still has in it. With others it's really rolling the dice not knowing what you have.Size wise it's a nice compact design and I'd be remiss if I didn't say how nice the charge cord is. No matter your device (micro usb or lightning cable) this one cord covers them all with a nice little adapter allowing you to only need one cord.At the end of the day, with all the different portable batteries I have tried this one is hands down the best one. Quick charge both ways, light weight, and really compact. There is nothing not to like about it. If you're in the market for a portable battery charger this is one you really should consider.*** Full disclosure I received a sample for review purposes***

I have two Norwegian Elkhounds and am constantly looking for everyday treats to give them. My younger dog will eat pretty much everything, my older one is a little more picky, but she also has a little bit of a funny tummy when eating new things.When I first got these, both dogs heard the bag open and were quickly underfoot waiting for a sample. I took two out of the bag, let each dog smell them then was amazed that I no longer had two treats in my hand. Both dogs loved them. Over the course of the week I used these treats and the dogs responded well to them.They seem to have a higher value then most store bought treats. I like the ingredient components, and my older Elkhound didn't have any stomach issues at all. I received the bigger of the two sizes and there seem to be a really good number of treats in the box which is nice.Good price, good quality, no complaints at all from me or my dogs.

The review below is based on my sister's experience with this handbag.When it comes to her purse... sorry "Tote handbag" my sister is super organized. Watching her put stuff into it and take it out she seems like a magician with how much she can fit, but she usually complains that her bag isn't big enough. When she saw the size of this bag, it was akin to the look you see from a little kid on Christmas morning. She immediately, and strategically removed everything from her bag and set about putting it into this bag. Watching it was like watching a back and forth boxing match.When all was said and done she fit everything from the first bag into this one and had ample room for more. I'm pretty sure she would love to fit a small car, kitchen and pantry into a bag if she could. the way she packs her bag oddly enough I wouldn't be surprised if she some day accomplishes that.She did remark a couple times how spacious the bag was, and really appreciated the couple compartments inside the bag to put things that she needs more often for easier access.Construction of the bag she was also very happy with. She is very meticulous about her bags and this one was no different. She grabbed it, checked the zippers, and ever checked the stitching on the inside. No idea what she was looking for, as I usually sew stuff with fishing line because it lasts longer. She said they were good seams, and strong stitch work.  That probably means more to you than it does me. :-)Weight of the bag was also good. It's certainly not made of lightweight cheap material. It's nice and sturdy. I'm not sure how many bags my sister has, but I do know she has used this one exclusively since she saw it. Even a couple of her friends have called me and asked me where I got it. So that says something right there. Overall she is very happy with it.***Full disclosure I received a sample for review purposes***

This light may be billed as a BBQ Grill light, but based on my experience with it there are more uses than that. But, before I get ahead of myself lets talk about the light itself.The neck of the light is an impressive 24 inches and it 100% adjustable to get an angle. The clamp at the base of the light is big enough that it will fit virtually anywhere. Easy to use clamp and with the addition of the rubber pad you don't have to worry about it slipping if it's at an odd angle. The light itself is 12 individual LED bulbs which provide an impressive amount of light. All in all this is very solid construction, and seems like it's built to last.So, solid construction, but how does it work? Really well actually. One benefit of LED lights versus normal bulbs is they give you a more "true" color. Especially important when cooking at night. In the past when I have grilled at dusk, or in the dark, I always had to wrestle with a flashlight - usually under an armpit or in my mouth- while flipping the meat or grabbing the lid. I will admit that I have lost food doing that. With this light, it's as simple as clipping it onto something and being completely hands free for other more important tasks. It works flawlessly for that.Other uses.I had to do some plumbing work under my sink and was able to clip the light onto the cupboard, bend it under the sink and had more than enough light. Same thing for working on a car. I know growing up I would have loved a light like this when I was putting models together as well.All in all this is a very nice multi-purpose LED light. High quality, easy to use, and priced right for what you get. This is certainly something I will be getting a lot of use out of. If you're looking for a light of this type I would certainly recommend it.*** Full disclosure I received a sample for review purposes***

I have had dogs my whole life, lots of dogs so obviously lots of toenails to clip. The thing is I made a mistake one time years ago when clipping a nail and hit the quick... that was one of the worst things I have ever done to my dog. The amount of blood was scary and to think I hurt the dog was even worse. Needless to say, since that day I have never been comfortable clipping a dogs nails. I will gladly pay $10 per dog to have their nails done. The reality is it takes about a minute and it's done. Having two dogs it adds up after awhile.Enter the DogBee clippers. Any nail clipper I consider the first thing I look at is if it has a guard. This one does, a nice little guard so that you don't clip too much of the nail and repeat the mistake I made years ago. The grip is a nice sturdy rubber. It has a small lock on it to keep it closed for easier storage as well. Also included is a small file to file down any rough edges.All in all this is a nice nail clipper, it's affordable easy to use and no gimmick to make it more than what it is. Will I continue to use it on my dogs... that's a tough one because of me, nothing to do with the clipper. I did use it on both of my current dogs without issue, but I was a nervous wreck when I was done. I'll keep working at it and maybe get more comfortable with it to where I trust myself. I know that little guard will certainly help with that.*** Full disclosure I received a sample for review purposes***

This is one of those products that a lot of people don't think they need, but after a quick search on the internet for identity theft, and other credit card related fraud reports... it's quite evident that this type of product is needed more than some thing. Me included to be honest. I have to admit I never really gave much thought of what was in my wallet or how I kept my cards. But, reading about some of the ways thieves can get your credit card data.There are a couple different ways to protect cards, from individual RFID sleeves to a full wallet like this one. Each has their advantages, and disadvantages. It boils down to what you need really.For this wallet, if you have a handful of cards that you regularly carry and don't want to invest in multiple individual sleeves this is a perfect solution. You can hold 6 cards in this, I was hoping to get multiple cards in each slot but I'm fairly certain rips and tears would occur. The small size makes it easy to carry in a front or back pocket.The only thing I would have liked to see different with this is a slot for a small amount of cash. Other than that there is nothing to not like about this that I don't like.Doing those identity theft searches those, really shed a lot of light on how bad this has become that we need things like this. It's at least nice to know there are solutions to help curb the growing problem.*** Full disclosure I received a sample for review purposes***

I have 2 Norwegian Elkhounds, not overly big dogs (50 lbs a piece) but not small dogs either. It's a challenge to find toys that they like, and are the right size for them. The toys designed for small dogs they tear apart in no time, while the toys designed for big dogs usually don't appeal to them.This Nerf ball is just on the edge of almost being too big, but my youngest Elkhound still goes after it. Which leads me to the WARNING OF ALL WARNINGS.Do not, and I really mean DO NOT think of this toy as an inside toy. Either you will lose your hearing, you will wish you lost your hearing, or you will break a window trying to get this thing out of your house so you can check to see if your hearing will return to normal. It's loud, and by loud I mean enjoyable for your dog to squeak this at all hours of the day to check and see if you are paying attention.It's dog approved here, but human approved for outdoor use only. :-)

I have waited a little bit to review this grill. I wanted to be pretty thorough in what I cooked on it in order to really have a good grasp of what it does well, and what it doesn't do very well.Before I get into the cooking portion of the grill lets talk about it's construction. It's easy to put together, but once assembled and placed on the stand it's pretty evident that the base could be much more steady. A thicker middle pole, longer feet on the base and a little heavier material probably would fix it.I have two minor complaints about the lid of the grill. The actual dome is pretty thin and I have to wonder how much heat loss is present due to how thin that material is. Secondly, very curiously there is no clip, hook, or other way to hand the lid on the side when you take it off. You have to rest a rather hot lid somewhere where it won't harm your patio furniture or any kids/pets that are around.Lastly, construction wise there is no removable grill plate. The base cooking section of the unit is one piece. This is especially problematic when trying to clean it. With the size of it, there should be an easy to clean feature. My biggest issue with the grill though is the temperature control nob. First, there are only 5 settings numbered 1-5, that's all fine and good but there is no real indication of how hot each one of those settings are. Logically, 1 would be low, 3 would be medium, and 5 would be super hot but that doesn't seem to be the case as the instruction book and the recipes and cooking guide have everything cooking at 4 or above. Even fruits and veggies. So I'm not sure what the purpose of settings 1-3 are. On top of that there is no actual thermometer incorporated into the lid to know exactly how hot it is.With all that said I was able to cook a wide assortment of things on this grill. Here are the results of how things went.Burgers - Setting between 4 and 5 for heat. Easy to do, good amount of grease in the drip tray. Tasted fine, tasted like the typical George Foreman grill burger. More like a pan fried burger than open flame which is to be expected.Bratwursts - Setting for heat right at 4. Didn't seem to cook at fast as a normal flame grill, could be because of my wanting to make sure they were done because you don't get the same "look" on these grills as you do on open flame grills. Tasted fine.Porkchops - Heat setting close to 5, no one wants to eat raw pork. These were fairly thick pork chops so took about 20-25 minutes to cook. Had ok grill marks on them, but overall color seems muted. Overall flavor was ok, but I'm not sure I'll make pork chops on this again.Boneless chicken breasts - again heat set about 4.5 because of raw chicken no-no. Took approximately 12 minutes to cook. Good cook all the way through but, like the pork, had a pale look to it once it was pulled off the grill. Tasted fine and was juicy but the look of it seemed off.Pizza - now here is a quick disclaimer - it was left over pizza and instead of microwaving it I tried warming it up on the grill. Again, heat at 4 (because 1-3 heat setting is worthless). It took right about 8 minutes to get the cheese melted. Crust stayed crispy, cheese was nice and melted. Honestly this was probably my favorite thing that I made on the grill, but lets be honest if you're spending this amount of money to reheat pizza something isn't right.Overall, this grill is ok. It serves its purpose. is easy to use but there are so many design short cuts that they end up taking away from the overall performance of the grill and decrease the options of use for it. I'll probably continue to use it sparingly when I don't want to start up the big grill but I just don't see thing becoming a big addition to my grilling.

This is one of those products that once you use it for a couple of days you wonder why you would ever use something else.There's a lot to like about this 2 in 1 Salt and Pepper Grinder, I'll try to cover everything below.1 - I like that it's a grinder not a shaker. Fresh ground pepper will always, always be better than the mass produced powdered pepper found in many pepper shakers. More bite, fresher tasting.2 - I am someone who likes my salt really fine, but my pepper more "flaky" this grinder lets me have the best of both worlds as you can independently adjust the size of each one.3 - Have a 2 in 1 saves valuable counter space, and saves you from reaching over multiple times.4 - It looks really nice. It's a nice sleek acrylic and stainless steel combination that I'd imagine would fit almost an kitchen/or dining room table.5 It's sturdy but not to the point of being heavy.6 - Easy to use, easy to adjust the size of the grind, and easy to fill.The only thing I would have liked to have seen is a small indent on each of the cap to make it a little easier to pop the tops off. People with fingernails won't have an issue but I chew mine (I know bad habit) so things like this take a smidge of work to get into.Overall, this is a really nice product and one that I have already gotten a handful of comments on. I'd certainly recommend it for sure.*** Full disclosure I received a sample for review purposes***

I love that more and more products are being made with bamboo. The problem is, many are just slapped together and labeled as "from bamboo" and people buy them because they are inexpensive and if they aren't great quality can be tossed with not much thought.This nice pack of 3 sized cutting boards goes against the grain (no pun intended... ok maybe a little) In that yes it's made from bamboo, but they are also very good quality. Light weight, great finish, and made from sustainable material. All priced to a point where you don't feel like you are buying a luxury yacht.If you're in the market for new cutting boards you can stop your search it's over. :-)*** Full disclosure I received a sample for review purposes***

Have you ever seen a product and thought "Oh that looks nice, but it's probably not that useful." Well that's the very thing I thought when I saw this. I had an old, and I do me old, drawer organizer that had three slots and I jammed everything in there. Fought with it when I needed something and just accepted it as my norm.Well, when I received this I was amazed at how much stuff I had in my drawer, but how well this helped organize everything. I love the design and how the sides slide out to fit the size of the drawer. Now, when I go into that big drawer in my kitchen it's not a fight to get what I need it's nicely organized and laid out. I've had several people ask me about it and all are amazed when I tell them how much it costs.The quality is second to none, I like the nice finish on the bamboo, light weight, and like I mentioned before the price makes this a steal. If you're looking for a drawer organizer I highly recommend this one.*** Full disclosure I received a sample for review purposes***

It seems there are people out there everywhere looking to scam someone or steal their identity. It's a sad world we live in, but we can only seek to protect ourselves as best we can. I'll be honest, I was offered these to review and though "Why would I need these?" A quick Google search showed me why, so I jumped at the chance.Realistically, I can't say how well they work, but I have been using them for three weeks now and I can't count the number of times I have had comments about them. Things like "That's a great idea." "I wish I had those" "I heard about scams from people reading credit cards" Evidently I was just naive.What I can say is they are sturdy card sleeves and so far I have no issues with the quality. Easy to use and for the price, a little peace of mind can go a long way. It's sad that there is a need to have a product like this, but it's nice to have one that stops those who are looking to steal things.I fully recommend these for sure.

Here's the thing about earbuds and working out... they rarely stay secure for very long. Obviously it depends on the workout but most earbuds fallout even doing low impact workouts unless you jam them into your ear, then they aren't comfortable. Also, you have the cord connected to your device that can be tricky to manage as well.Enter the Mengo Bumps Sport. Initially I was a little skeptical as to how well they'd stay, but after using them a couple times those concerns vanished. It's just not an issue due to the design which is perfect and lightweight.Being that they are wireless the issue with the cord is non-existent. However, there are two new concerns when you go wireless. Sound quality and ease of pairing. For starters they are extremely simple to pair. It paired on my first try, which is rare for me and wireless technology. Second, sound quality is very, very good. Maybe not as good as a super premium set, but I am no audiophile so I really didn't notice a difference. During my activities all I know is the sound was impressive.The information says up to a 33 ft range from device to earphones so I tested the limits of that and actually held a solid signal at 44 feet in an open area. Pretty impressive if you ask me.Change time I am averaging right about 4.5 - 5 hours which is more than enough for any type of activity I would do with these. Overall I am just really impressed by the sound quality, ease of use, and overall quality of the earphones.If you're looking for a pair of earphones to use while working out and you don't want to break the bank these are at the top of my list for recommendations.*** Full disclosure I received these at a sample for review purposes***

Ok, lets be honest here GoPro cameras are all the rage and not only does everyone seem to have one, it seems like every company is making their own accessories for them. Sure, you can find a deal or two out there on one or two accessories but you run into quality issues.I'll be honest I had never heard of the Zookki brand before, but they reached out to me offering me a sample to review so I figured what the heck. I figured I'd roll the dice on the accessories hoping that I'd like one or two and see what the overall quality was. When I received these my hopes went a little lower to see that there was no real carrying case to protect these. Instead there was a simple bag with a drawstring.Once I got past that initial disappointment I was greeted with an assortment of goodies. I'll save you the time of reading everything that's in this bag  (the above Amazon description is spot on). What I will say is I was really impressed by the quality of the accessories. There is not one cheap plastic "get you by" item in the bag. All are good solid quality that I am completely comfortable attaching my GoPro to.The only item I'd have liked to see in here that's not included is some type of smaller harness I can use for my dog. But, I realize that's a pretty specific piece so I'm ok with that.Looking at the current Amazon list price I am blown away at how inexpensive these accessories are. Bang for your buck you will not find a better deal with the degree of quality. I fully recommend these.*** Full disclosure I received a sample for review purposes***

This vacuum sucks, no really it sucks because that's what vacuums are supposed to do. :-)Out of the box, pretty simple and straight forward to put together. You can be vacuuming in under 15 minutes. This particular vacuum is a good middle of the road vacuum and is perfect for most users. There are a few things I'd like to have seen different.1 - A larger canister. It seems small, and since I have two Norwegian Elkhounds who shed like crazy, I find myself having to empty it fairly often.2 - No adjustable brush height. So, if you have a shorter carpet or a longer carpet there's no adjusting. It is what it is.3 - no ability to adjust suction levels either. Again, it is what it is. So if you have something more delicate (think blinds) then probably better off not using this one for that.Price wise, it's a good price. It doesn't have all the bells and whistles of other (higher priced vacuums) but it has better features than the real cheap entry level ones too.Over all I like it, it does a good job as long as you don't need it for others things aside from the floor.

This is my first true cast iron cooking item and I have to say, I'm impressed.I've often heard the stories about cooking with cast iron, the benefits, and all that jazz. But, I have to say, this is much nicer than cooking a steak in a frying pan. Sure, it could be some placebo effect taking root, but the steak tasted more juicy, and had a more fresh/full flavor to it. No more sitting in the grease and other crap that sits at the bottom.There is a definite weight to the pan, and I really like the color. It's darker than I thought it would be. It's a nice darker green. One thing I didn't anticipate (and this is my stupidity) is make sure you have some oven mitts or towels as this will get hot. Yeah, go figure right.Overall, really like this pan. I can see it replacing a lot of my frying pan cooking.

If you have a dog, you know that you need toys or something to occupy them. I have two Norwegian Elkhounds, one is 9 and doesn't much care for playing. The other a 3 year old loves to play, loves to squeak things, and has lots of energy.She is usually more of a stuffed toy dog, but I thought this would be a fun thing to change it up and if it got left outside it wouldn't be a big deal.It has a good solid weight to it, and is fairly large. (I got the large size). And... it squeaks, and squeaks, and... squeaks. When my dog found out it made noise it was game on. It has yet to "be killed" like most of the stuffed toys (the owner is thinking this may not be a good thing). :-)This may be one of those toys that comes out and then gets put away before bed, because I've already had one 2AM loud squeak right next to my head incident. Properly trained I guess this could be a good substitution to an alarm clock. Will probably work for treats too. :-)

Most people's toolboxes are the same. Jam packed full of things and in order to find anything you have to take a bunch of stuff out and hope that what you need is close to the top. So, I like tool that have cases, but the case for these wrenches is needlessly too big and bulky. It doesn't save any space, in fact takes up more space than needed. I would have really liked to see more of a space saving design.The wrenches themselves are decent. They are by no means top of the line, heavy duty. But they will most likely suffice for up to moderate use. They are on more of the light weight side, but that's fine for what I need them for. Design is nice with a ratchet design that makes it extremely easy to use and quick as well. No more crank, lift, set, crank... repeat. Just crank, crank, crank. (That's probably not the technical definition but hey it makes sense in my head)Overall it's a nice wrench set, the case could be vastly improved. Design of the wrenches is nice and useful. At the end of the day I like them and will continue to use them for what I need.

I have two Norwegian Elkhounds and feed them Nutro kibble, so it's nice to know that Nutro also makes treats.The actual treats are small, and good size for quick rewards and/or training. Since they are fairly soft and have a definite odor to them they are a higher value treat for my two dogs. but, being honest they are Elkhounds and will eat pretty much anything.Good quality, good ingredients - well as good as you can expect from a processed treat.I knocked it down one star because of the price of the bag of treats. At the time of writing this review one bag of treats is $10 which for comparable treats is pretty steep in my opinion. For instance 1 bag of these treats cost 1/5 of a 50 lbs bag of Nutro kibble that I feed my two. The math there doesn't work for me.Other than that my dogs like them. :-)

24 individual servings of Special K cereal in three separate flavors. If you're looking for Special K cereal you know exactly what your going to get.Serving size I really like the portions and the individual cups. they are much bigger and better designed than the ones I had as a kid. They are big enough to pour the milk in and be able to hold the cup. They probably don't have as much cereal in them as I usually have when I have cereal, but portion control is nice too.Easy to store, and sturdy enough to throw in a bag and grab a small bottle of milk from the store to eat at your destination.All in all I like it. I will definitely be looking at other flavors served in these cups.

This is one of those things that's hard to review. As it will be awhile before the true value of it will germinate.My initial impressions.Easy to understand instructions about care and maintenance.A good amount of seed in the bag. I'm not sure exactly how much space it will cover, and fill out, but a 5lb bag has a lot more seed in it than I thought it would.If you are looking for grass seed make sure to look through the options that are available and pick the one that best suits the area of the country that you live in to provide optimal results.Since this is something that will take time to fully come into it's own I will periodically update this review with how things are going, and adjust the Star number accordingly if needed.

This is one of those things that I'm not really sure how to review. It's a serviceable product and for the most part does as it's intended to do. It adds storage to a shower via a tension pole. You can add the 4 shelves and provided hooks to add decent shelf space.The tension bar is just ok. Both of the foot pads could have been bigger and pole sections feel very cheaply made. On top of the the plastic loops to hang the shelves are rather cheap as well. I am wondering over time if they will loosen and become less effective. Due to the small size of the foot pads, if you have any type of slope or non-flat surface this has a high chance of falling/slipping.My biggest complaint with this though is the price. At the time of writing this review it is being sold for $100. For what it is, what it's made out of, and how cheap it feels - it does not feel, or look like, a $100 purchase. I can't in good conscience recommend it for that price. If it was closer to the $20-$30 range than I would give it more leeway. But for a premium price point it's just not there.

Here's the thing about ear buds. There are hundreds of different ones out there. Pick your price point, pick the features that are most important and you can find a dozen or so that claim to meet those needs. The thing is, trusting the claims and how they really measure can be a completely different story.First off the packaging is nice, and it comes with 4 sets of different sized pieces to put in your ear. However, if like me, none of those 4 are comfortable or fit right then you have your first issue.Sound quality wise, these in my opinion, just don't measure up to other brands that are out there for the same or similar price point. For instance BrainWavz makes some fantastic ear buds, better sound quality they handle highs and lows better than these, bass and what have you.These feel like a quality ear bud, but sound output, no matter on what devise I used them on they always seemed to sound flat and have no real volume behind it.If you're looking for a high quality ear bud, I'd suggest something other than these. For the price point it just doesn't measure up.

Really nice quality rug. The thing I like most about it is there's not a lot of fluff to it. It has a nice rubber backing so it doesn't slide at all.The thin pile on it means cleaning is easy, vacuum and spot clean if necessary.It's thin enough that this can be used in a kitchen if needed. In fact that's where I currently have it because one of my dogs has a bad hip and is struggling a little walking on the tile floor. So far it's working well, the chairs roll over it just fine. I will be looking into getting a bigger rug here soon.If you're looking for a low pill rug, that's a good price and quality made, this is one I'd certainly consider.

If you have ever looked at the prices for car seats, you probably made the same faces I have. Many car seat manufacturers seem to think that the quality of seat is a direct correlation of how much they charge for it. So, if they charge and arm and a leg the seat has to be good right... not so much.Enter the Evenflo Titan Convertible Car Seat. For a third of the price as some of the bigger names out there you get just as many features (if not more) for a more cost effective product. It does everything you need it to do. It can be adjusted to fit an infant, to a toddler (weight limit of 50 lbs front facing, and 40 lbs rear facing).There is ample amounts of padding and support. Installation is quick and easy. It is airline approved if you are traveling as well. Adjustments are easy to do and intuitive, there's no need to fight with 10 straps, snaps and contort yourself into position to see everything.I just really like this car seat. It's sturdy, offers the needed support and the manufacturer doesn't try to make you go bankrupt because you need a car seat. Definitely one I will be recommending to others.

This is one of those things that's hard to review. As it will be awhile before the true value of it will germinate.My initial impressions.Easy to understand instructions about care and maintenance.A good amount of seed in the bag. I'm not sure exactly how much space it will cover, and fill out, but a 5lb bag has a lot more seed in it than I thought it would.If you are looking for grass seed make sure to look through the options that are available and pick the one that best suits the area of the country that you live in to provide optimal results.Since this is something that will take time to fully come into it's own I will periodically update this review with how things are going, and adjust the Star number accordingly if needed.

This is one of those products that seems to fit a need, until you realize the number of faults that the overall design of the unit itself has.Anyone who had an Xbox 360 knows about overheating issues. They happened fairly often and at times the results were bad, very bad.The Xbox One is designed to have better cooling, air flow, etc - but Antec is playing off of past generation concerns here. That's not entirely bad, a cooler console is never really a bad thing.Set up is easy, it comes with a 4" USB cable, rests on top of the Xbox One and plugs into the back USB port for power. Easy peezie to set up. There are even little rubber soles to prevent the unit from scratching the actual console.Now the not so good stuff.First off if you can not look down at your console, you will have a difficult time reading the temp as it is displayed ontop of the actual unit.Second, it blows the hot air out the back of the unit. Depending on where you have your console set up, and what type of entertainment center you have, this could cause your console to suck back in that warm air and have very little positive effect.Third, the unit itself is not secure. It is merely resting on the console so any type of brushing against it has the chance to move it and push it off.Forth, there is no way to manually turn it on/off. It turns on when the core temp of the Xbox One is 86 degrees F. Then turns off. Why not have a button for when you know you are going to be playing longer? On top of that, even when it's not on, it still makes noise - which is odd.When my 360 had over heating issues, I looked at all the options out there and ultimately settled on a standard laptop fan that I rested the Xbox on and blew air straight up. If I ever feel the need to look for a cooling solution for the Xbox One that is probably what I would try first. While this Antec unit looks nice, I never got the 30% cooler results. I'm guessing that is in part to the design flaws I talked about above.Bang for your buck, there are probably better options out there for you.

There's something to be said about a complicated program being made so that even an entry level user can get good to decent results. That's the thing with video editing software, it's complicated, there are a plethora of options and it's very easy to be overwhelmed quickly. When I first started tinkering with video editing there were three choices. Adobe Premiere, Pinnacle, and Corel Video Studio. I tried out all three, I quickly threw Pinnacle to the side and was left with the other two. For an end user like me both did the same thing but one was more accessible feature wise, and less overly complicated. So I cut my teeth on Corel and have found a familiar flow to the intuitive layout and design.With this latest edition of Video Studio, Corel packs a lot under the hood. Bonus features not found in the regular version, and some tweaks to some of my favorite features of editions past. The basic overlay hasn't changed, so those who are familiar with Video Studio will feel right at home. Cut and splice videos, make a photo slide show, combine the two, add effects, music, etc. It's all here.Yes, there are a lot of options the first time you load it up - but the beauty of it is, it's ok to make mistakes and learn. I prefer Video Studio over Premiere because it's not as daunting. If there's something I'm unfamiliar with I seem to have a better chance of figuring it out on this versus Premiere. For what I do, and what I need this is the perfect program for me. Add to that it's one fifth the price of Premiere.This isn't a technical review, because there are others that can do that much better than I ever could. With this package you get access to everything in the Video Studio stable, access to online training videos, free add-ons. It can be a little intimidating, and to be honest the Corel training videos aren't always the best. If you are looking for great videos I'd highly recommend searching Youtube for Gripps2211 videos. That's where I've learned the most about this software.You can do everything you will want to do with this program, but not have to pay the ridiculous price of the Adobe software. Once you get the hang of things you can kick out some pretty cool videos. Some of it is trial and error, but for those who aren't too worried about making a mistake and trying it it's a great piece of software.

This is one of those products that you never knew you needed, and once you get it you're not really sure you needed it anyway.I understand the purpose behind the product, but at the end of the day I'm not sure it's as useful as it needs to be to consider it a needed purchase. I've never had a problem with any cord for any device I have used. Never gotten them tangled or broken off at the ends, maybe I'm not in the nor here.I guess if you're someone who has a history of problems like this, it may be a benefit for you. Personally I don't see it.

I have never really been a fan of listening to music, well anything really, well in the shower. That is until I received a similar shower bluetooth speaker. This one is a little bit of an upgrade compared to my other one, I honestly wasn't expecting much of a sound or performance issue but I was dead wrong.The speaker on this is nice and large, and also front facing so there is no distortion due to bouncing the sound off a surface to get to you. Control buttons are spaced around the edge to give the speaker even more space. The skip forward a song and volume up are one button (hold down for volume) and the same with the back/volume down button.Battery life is very, very good. No issues there at all. The suction cup on the back is large and has not moved since I placed it in my shower over a week ago.I really can't get over the sound quality in my shower though. No distortions, no interference, everything is as I would expect it from a more expensive speaker.There is a small downside about this speaker, and it's the same one I had with the other speaker. That being this is intended to be portable, from suction cut to bag clip (clip is even included). However, the suction cup piece that slides onto the back of the speaker is just super tight to the point of it being a hassle to take it off and put it back on. So, I merely leave it in my shower. Honestly, I'm not sure how much use I'd get out of this being a portable speaker, but if that's what you are intending for this be prepared for a battle. (It may loosen over time as well).For me, for what I use it for it's a great little speaker and one I'd recommend to anyone without any hesitation.*** Full disclaimer a sample was provided for review purposes***

I have to admit, I have never really paid that much attention to my vacuum. I really thought they all did the same thing and aside from options and cosmetic stuff there wasn't much of a difference. Boy, how wrong I was.Out of the box it's light weight and very portable. I'm not used to this type of design and thought it would be cumbersome and annoying, but I like it. It offers more versatility and ease of use over conventional style vacuums.Settings wise there are a great deal of power options depending on what you are cleaning. Select the power level, then turn on the brush power and it's actually fun to vacuum. Somewhat self propelled, easy rotating for around corners and under things. Need to clean something up high? Push of a button and it detaches from the base and boom on the go. No more removing a hose, fighting an attachment and then doing what you need.I know this isn't a technical review. I'm honestly not sure how to really convey how much I like this vacuum. i never thought I'd say that but it's true. Easy to use, and very quiet as well.I'm curious how easy it will be (and cost wise) to replace filters and bags when needed but I'll cross that street when I come to it. I have two Norwegian Elkhounds and it handles their fur better than any other vacuum I have had.Yes, it's a spendy vacuum compared to others out there. But, the adage you get what you pay for certainly applies here. I highly recommend this vacuum. If my opinion changes over time I will certainly update this review accordingly.

For a do it yourself business card, these are pretty good.Easy to use, decent customization software provided for free from Avery. They can be printed on both sides as well, either additional information or more of a "next apt" type setting.8 cards per page, and nice looking rounded corners. They are the size of a normal business card.The one thing I don't like is separating them from the individual sheets can be tricky. At times they can leave the little serrated bumps, where as other times there will be a nice clean edge. I found (as others have already said here) that folding it back and forth a couple times before separating offered the best chance at a nice clean edge.Overall though I like them for a do it yourself option.

Do you have a closet, pantry, or other area that light just doesn't really get to? The iHomeSet Motion sensor closet light may be the answer.When I say may be the answer it's because it really depends on the size of area you need light for, and how much light you need. I've tried this is two different areas and had ok results in one, and good results in the second.The one I had ok results was a large closet. Due to the size of the closet and the compact nature of the light, it didn't really do all that much aside from a halo type effect. On the flip side I tried it in a smaller hallway closet and it offered a decent amount of light and allowed me to see everything  that I needed to. So, depending on the size of the area this may be a nice addition.Size wise, it's a little guy small and compact which is nice. It measures 7 1/4 inches by 1 inch. It attaches to a magnetic strip that can be applied pretty much anywhere. It takes 4 AAA batteries (which are not included).As the description says it is motion activated and will shut off after 15-20 seconds of no movement.While it didn't do what I needed it to do with the bigger closet if iHome made a larger model I'd certainly get one for that area. It's a nice soft light and does exactly what it's intended to do. For large areas I wouldn't recommend it, but for those smaller spaces I'd certainly give it a shot.*** Full disclaimer: a sample was provided for review purposes***

Ok, I have to be honest here. The thought of a Mop/Broom/Tool wall mount seemed like overkill to me. I mean, why not just lean them up against the wall like I always have and sort through to find the one I need when I need it right?Well, that's the beauty of this little guy. It's one of those things you don't really think you need, but once you have it you can't believe you didn't get it sooner.For starters this organizer isn't very big. It's about 16 1/5 inches wide and 2 3/4 inches deep. Perfect size to fit behind a door or in a shed.There are 5 "main" slots to hold brooms, mops, rakes, basically anything with a handle. The instructions say up to 7 and a half pounds per slot. I didn't test it with anything that heavy, but the things I did put in there held firm and didn't move or slide. There are also an additional 6 outer hooks for things with straps and loops. In total if you used every available hook and joint you could hold 11 different items.Set up and installation is as simple and easy as one would expect. Find the location you want to put it in, mark a couple holes, drill them, insert the anchors, and walla all done. Simple sometimes is really all it takes, and this is one of those times.Once installed it's really just a matter of figuring out what you use most often and putting it on the holder. Since it's winter here right now I have a couple shovels, an ice scraper and an umbrella hanging up. During the summer I see it holding a shovel, a rake, a broom and some other lawn and garden implements.Overall another sound product from the folks at iHomeSet.*** Full disclosure: I received a sample of this product for review purposes***

Jean Plaidy tells the story of England's great Tudor dynasty! Although technically fiction, her retelling is historically accurate as always. Two great dynasties - Plantagenet and Tudor - merged when Elizabeth of York married Henry Tudor. Their marriage overcame suspicion - was it in fact Henry who murdered the two famous "princes in the Tower"?, threats from pretenders to the throne such as Perkin Warbeck and Lambert Simnel and challenges from other Lancastrian kinfolks to found the royal line that produced Henry VIII and perhaps Britain's greatest monarch, Elizabeth I.The novel is well-paced and puts the reader inside the heads of these great historical readers using archives of the period and often the characters' own quotes. Elizabeth of York, Henry VI and their children come to life and become real human beings instead of pages in a dry history book. If you love historical fiction, Tudor fiction and medieval fiction you will love Plaidy's series of books.The intrigue, romance and grandeur of the royal court come to life in "To Hold the Crown." This novel's realism and history's legendary kings and queens make it one not to miss. Five Stars!

Jean Plaidy tells the story of England's great Tudor dynasty! Although technically fiction, her retellings are historically accurate and well-researched, using surviving documents and rare access to the royal library.  Two great dynasties - Plantagenet and Tudor - merged when Elizabeth of York married Henry Tudor. Their marriage overcame suspicion - was it in fact Henry who murdered the two famous "princes in the Tower"?, threats from pretenders to the throne such as Perkin Warbeck and Lambert Simnel and challenges from other Lancastrian kinfolks to found the royal line that produced Henry VIII and perhaps Britain's greatest monarch, Elizabeth I.The books are well-paced and put the reader inside the heads of some of history's greatest political figures. Elizabeth of York, Henry VI, Henry VIII and his many wives and their children come to life and become real human beings instead of pages in a dry history book. If you love historical fiction, Tudor fiction and medieval fiction you will love Plaidy's series of books.The intrigue, romance and grandeur of the royal court come alive in this brilliant set of novels.  The great Tudor dynasty begins when Henry VI marries Elizabeth of York, but had to continue to fight for his throne against Plantagenet relatives who had legitimate claims and imposter pretenders such as Perkin Warbeck and Lambert Simniel. He married his children into some of Europe's most powerful monarchies, including Scotland and France.Prince Arthur, son of Queen Elizabeth of York and King Henry VI, is kind and highly intelligent and the first heir, but his sickly health causes concern that he won't live to take the throne.  His younger brother Henry believes himself the better candidate for king, and bides his time, learning the arts of government and war to be ready should his turn arise.King Henry VIII seems to have everything - power, money, the throne of England and beautiful wives....everything except a son and heir. His quest for a wife who can give him love AND a healthy infant boy lead him into a string of affairs and marriages.  This series covers his romances with Anne Boleyn, Catherine of Aragon, Catherine Howard and Catherine Parr.  Live the romance and intrigue of the Tudor court and the triumphs - and tragedy - of these beautiful women.Although fictional, these novels were carefully researched using diaries, the royal archives and actual quotes from these people.  Jean Plaidy wrote almost a hundred novels based on the European courts of the Middle Ages.  If you love history but want the feel of the period instead of a dry history book, you will enjoy this series.

This longtime Holt fan was horrified and sickened as well as bitterly disappointed in this novel because (a) it's not a "romance" at all and (b) this is one of the finest authors alive.The "hero" tricks and rapes the heroine, but she falls in love with him? NO! NO! NO! Rape is a violent act committed by men who despise women. No man who does that can EVER be a hero, and Holt's attempt to have him reason out his actions and redeem himself are an utter failure. Equally disappointing is having his helpless, violated victim decide he's worthy of her affection, and worse, fit to be a father to the child he conceived through force.This is a sad attempt at entertainment from a wonderful writer, a slap in the face to real victims of rape, a perpetuation of the myth that it's possible for some rape victims to secretly enjoy their brutalization, and that men who rape really aren't so bad. In wasn't uncommon for romance novels to feature rape-as-seduction in the 1970s (thanks to the dreadful "Sweet, Savage Love" phenom), but Ms. Holt's readers expect her not to use such a sordid - and false - plot deviceRead "The Pride of the Peacock" or "Mistress of Mellyn" instead.

Jean Plaidy thrills the reader with another of her fine historicals. Katherine of Valois, daughter of French King Charles VI, grew up with the title of princess, but none of its advantages.  She grows up in poverty with her brothers, a pawn of her selfish and perhaps-downright evil mother.  After her forced to make a state marriage to England's Henry V, she dared to defy medieval convention and entered a love match with Owen Tudor, a common knight.  Together they spawned a destiny and a dynasty that would be anything but common.This book is more interesting than some of Plaidy's other novels, especially the rather dull "William's Wife." (The story of King William and Queen Mary.) Although Queen Katherine, like most medieval women, had little control over her own destiny, she was quick-witted and a forceful personality.  The story reads as if you are part of it, and the characters step out from the centuries and come to life in this excellent piece.  Well worth a read.

Works as promised! My hair was quite dry from repeated colorings, and this shampoo and conditioner moisturized and "healed" my hair after a couple of weeks of use.  I also bought the jar of "damage erasing balm" for an extra treatment that worked wonders. I still give my hair a coat of it at least once a month.  I recommend wetting your hair, rubbing in a thick coat of the balm and waiting a half hour or so before a shower. Then wash it out using the shampoo and conditioner. If you've got dry hair or split ends you'll definitely improve your hair's appearance.

I wear several different types of foundation because my skin changes in both tone and moisture throughout the year.  This foundation gives great coverage and an even tone all over your face. It does help to relieve the appearance of lines and wrinkles, but it feels heavier than L'Oreal Paris True Match and especially the Magic Nude foundation. It didn't cake or flake, though, and I'll definitely keep using it, probably in winter more than spring or summer. If you like a very light sensation this may be too heavy for you, but it's definitely good quality.

I absolutely love this perfume - and so does my husband! It has a soft, powdery smell that's sexy enough for evening but not too overpowering for the office. I think I smell a touch of vanilla in there among the florals. It's appropriate for all ages and comes in a very attractive bottle.

I was so excited to try Modern Muse Le Rouge, because I absolutely LOVE Modern Muse, but was horribly disappointed.  The scent smelled like VERY cheap quality rose perfume and VERY cheap quality musk mixed together. I was terribly disappointed with this mascara. Cover Girl's mascaras are among my favorite, but Super Sizer's performance is no better than Cover Girl Clump Crusher mascara. I didn't expect to get the lush look depicted in fashion magazines, since the models always use lash inserts, but I thought I'd see SOME difference. The results were insignificant when compared to L'Oreal Paris' Butterfly Intenza and Cover Girl's Clump Crusher.  My eyelashes were no thicker or longer-looking, and Clump Crusher does a better job of separating the lashes. Sorry. Can't give this one more than two stars.

I'm what one might call a purse and tote bag addict. I have a bunch of them in many colors and sizes. This shoulder bag is one of my latest additions that I really like a lot. I use it as a bag to hold all of the stuff I use when I go to meetings. It's professional looking and holds all of my files perfectly. I like that the bag has a zippered closure so I can also carry things in it like pens and other small things in the inside pockets and not worry they will fall out. Inside there is a zippered pocket as well as two open pockets.I really like the riveted cross on the front side of the bag. It gives it a unique look and is very classy. It has a carrying handle as well as an adjustable shoulder strap so I can even carry it hands free. I will note when I first opened the bag this came in it had an odd chemical smell. But after I let it sit out for awhile it wore off and was okay.I ordered this product at a discount through a special promotion and this is my honest and unbiased review. I was in no way compensated for this review.

This is a nice and slim power bank that fits perfectly in the pocket inside my purse. It's small and slim so it doesn't weigh much either. I like to keep dry shampoo on hand for those mornings when my hair isn't doing what it's supposed to and I need to ad a little volume to it so it's not flat and lifeless. I'm loving the size of this cooling rack. It's perfect for cooling off a couple dozen cookies at the same time. I like how it has a center support so it doesn't sag in the middle. Using essentials oils means using roller bottles so you can make your own oil blends. This is a neat twist on a place to charge your cell phone. Most of us already use a pencil cup on our desks so why not have a built in USB charging port too. You can store your pens in the top and charge you phone or other USB device at the bottom.Another twist on this is that you can also use it as a flower pot if you don't want a pencil cup. A neat way to disguise a charger. I was excited to try this Beep Egg from Brainstream.  I was very curious how this worked and it was rather easy. The remote has quite a few features and the instructions are quite in depth.  The plastic drone has some cool lights on the bottom.  We did find that upon trying to lift off the one side likes to start out before the other so you do need to put some speed on lift off. Like many people, I use stock / broth a lot. I usually buy the quart-size cartons for a variety of reasons. My Prime Pantry box was nearly full, and this item popped up when I knew I needed to replenish - so I figured I'd give it a shot. I've used it once so far, and this is a first impression...It's a little less convenient than the cartons. It's more like bullion cubes / powder - you have to boil water if you want it to dissolve. Hot tap water doesn't cut it. Because what I was making (green bean & mushroom casserole) wouldn't be affected, I actually didn't boil the water, or use a the full 3.5 cups the directions say. Decently hot and about 1.75 cups was good enough for what I needed. Before adding to the dish, I took a quick taste. It's at least as good as the "normal" packaged stock.But WOW, it's way saltier than I'm used to. Of course that's partly because I buy low sodium versions of everything I can. Also, I only used half the water I was supposed to. But there's still a LOT of salt in this product. Comparing what I have in my pantry right now:Kitchen Basics Unsalted Chicken Stock = 5% daily value for NaKitchen Basics Original Chicken Stock = 18% daily value for NaKnorr Homestyle Concentrated Stock = 31% daily value for Na(looks like even the reduced sodium Knorr still has 21% daily value)So, the Knorr stock has fully 6 times more salt what I've typically been using. Maybe that's why it tastes so good? (the casserole was fabulous) I am not overly concerned about salt, but I prefer to add salt IF NECESSARY rather than have the decision made for me by a manufacturer. Next time I but I will probably give the reduced sodium version a try if its price goes down to something more reasonable. But in the meantime I will take the saltiness into account and continue to use this stuff.Speaking of price, it's a relative bargain compared to what I paid recently for 1q cartons. On sale the cheapest cartons locally were about double the price per quart. Add to that the reduced space required in my (very tiny) pantry, and I'm willing to compromise a little on other factors.
