I live in a rural area with lots of rabbits and other rodents, dead and alive, so there are plenty of chances for them to acquire one. This medication has proven effective and it's cheaper than going to the vet for treatment.  Since tapeworms are relatively harmless, doing the treatment yourself is fine as long as you're certain it's a tapeworm you're dealing with.  I'm hoping that, as always, it will work again on my current dog with a tapeworm.  I'm confident that it will.

I'm a big fan of natural remedies, but homeopathy has always been hard to understand, and so it took me a while to spend money on homeopathic products for my pets. But Amazapet, as far as I can tell, does work. I have a senior dog who wheezes, and when I give her this product her wheezing virtually stops (although sometimes she'll have more minor attacks). I've noticed that it usually takes a week or more before Amazapet has an effect on her wheezing, but it does kick in. And when I run out and she goes without it for a couple weeks, the wheezing comes back and I order some more.

I really have no idea if this product is helping my dog with prostate cancer stay active and alive longer, but if it is, I'm happy to give it to him.  I've used a number of PetAlive products over the years, but this is the first time I've used this particular product.  I combine it with PetAlive herbal drops for UTI health just for good measure.  I always like to mix it up when I'm treating an animal between the potent and often toxic drugs that the vet gives and the more "natural" herbal/homeopathic remedies, and that's what I'm doing now.  I decided against radiation treatment because of its prohibitive cost and the dog's age, and so I'm hoping this alternative treatment I've devised will give him more months of life.

I've been using this product for probably 20 years, and I'm now 64.  I wouldn't say it's a miracle potion, but my facial skin is mostly wrinkle-free and looks healthy--and I only apply it about every other day.FYI, Unilever, one of the consumer product megacorps, now owns St. Ives, and this product has changed. I happen to have an old pre-Unilever jar which states the product is not tested on animals, but the other day, when I bought a new jar at a local pharmacy, I noticed that that claim was gone and there was a Unilever logo in the corner.  So I emailed Unilever asking if the product had been tested on animals, and their response was a link to a web page that contained an awful lot of PR BS about how they're trying to evolve into a non-animal testing company, blah blah blah. But no specific information about this moisturizer was offered.I compared the ingredients in the old jar to the new one, and I noticed that at least three of the natural ingredients are now missing and the order of ingredients has been shuffled.  So for any of you who are experiencing skin irritation, there may be good reason for that.  It's not the same product it used to be.  Beware.  I'm returning my jar to the store I bought it at and I'll be looking for an animal-kind moisturizer to replace it.Please consider writing your representative in Congress to co-sponsor the Humane Cosmetics Act.  The E.U., Israel, Norway, and India have already banned the inhumane and unscientific practice of animal testing on cosmetics. More accurate results can be obtained from human-based cell and tissue testing methods.If you want more information on cruelty-free cosmetics, check out, on the NEAVS (New England Anti-Vivisection Society) website, the Coalition for Consumer Information on Cosmetics (CCIC), which certifies more than 500 brands that do not test on animals. Another excellent source is Cruelty Free International, which is a global campaign to end animal testing (more information on NEAVS website). You can watch the video by Ricky Gervais and read about actor Peter Dinklage's association with this campaign.And did you know that besides being unethical, animal testing produces severe environmental pollution?  Find out the shocking facts on the NEAVS website under environmental campaigns.Here's a listing of the ingredients in my pre-Unilever moisturizer. You can compare it to the Unilever ingredients (including the changed order) and make up your own mind about it:Water--Mineral oilPropylene glycolPEG-100 stearateGlycerol stearateStearic acidPhenoxyethanolCarthamus tinctorius (safflower seed) oilTriethanolamineCarbomerDimethiconeCetyl alcoholDisodium EDTAFragranceEthylhexylglycerinLinaloolHexyl cinnamolHydrolyzed elastinHydrolyzed collagenCoumarinGeraniol.

I was looking for a practical, warm, non-pretentious winter jacket (I live in a rural area with cats and dogs and run around a lot outside at home).  I found this one and liked the crazy "Aztec" pattern, and it was definitely cheap enough for my purposes.  Fortunately I discovered before I ordered it that it's not made in Women's sizes but in Junior sizes, so I got a large instead of my usual medium.It arrived today and I'm glad I got the bigger size, because even in large there's not a lot of extra room for a sweater.  The hood, however, is so big that it actually covers my eyes, so I'll have to fix that by maybe wearing a scarf around the neck (or not using the hood).  I'm under 5'2" and the sleeves are a bit long, but it looks OK if I fold them back because there are black cuffs sewn on underneath the cover fabric.So I'm giving this jacket four stars because it could be a better fit, but it feels toasty, it's made well, and I like it.

These are such wonderful shoes to have in the winter. They are toasty warm and nicely padded, plus the rubber bottom gives good traction in winter. I keep them near the door, so I can slip them on and be off.Now, they are a bit too casual for the office, but nice for a winter day out and about. Mainly, they are warm and comfy and wonderfully durable.(Review of MERRELL Women's Encore Chill Stitch Shoes)

George Cochran and Harold Gridley are somewhat down-on-their-luck song and dance men who have to leave Melbourne, Australia in a hurry. Before they know it, they are caught up in intrigue and adventure, not to mention romance, on the road to Bali!Road to Bali is the sixth of the seven Road To movies, and it's a good one. As you expect from the films, it's filled with lots of great Hope & Crosby humor, asides, slap-stick, and just about every other type of humor you can think of! It's a great family-friendly movie - clean and yet hilarious. You'll love it!(Review of Road to Bali - starring Bing Crosby, Bob Hope and Dorothy Lamour)

I must admit that I wasn’t expecting much with this spread. I am not a fan of Nutella’s product – I don’t dislike it, I just don’t care for it.This spread, on the other hand, I do like! It has a nice taste that is good combination of chocolate and almonds. It tastes good on toast, but actually tastes best when combined in a sandwich with peanut butter. Don’t put on a lot of peanut butter, or you will overwhelm the chocolate, by the way. But give it a try!So, this is a very good spread, one that really appealed to my picky eater!(Review of Hershey's Spreads, Chocolate with Almond)

Liquid Silk is made by BodyWise Limited, which also makes the excellent Maximus Personal Lubricant. Liquid Silk is a very good lubricant; it is indeed smooth as silk, and less sticky than most water-based lubricants. It also lasts longer than most water-based lubricants I have tried. Clean-up is easy, and the product does not seem to stain bedding – which is really nice!Now, water-based lubricants have a bad reputation because they have been known to cause yeast infections in some women. This is because they are usually glycerin-based. Liquid Silk, on the other hand, is based on propylene glycol, which is more long-lasting, doesn’t get gummy, and is not likely to cause yeast infections! That’s a huge plus!Only one caveat on this product, though. Though Liquid Silk is not silicone-based, it does nonetheless contain some silicone in it. This means, that you should never use Liquid Silk with any sex-toys made from silicone. This is because the liquid silicone makes the skin of the toy dissolve, making it sticky and gross, and eventually destroying it.So, don’t use Liquid Silk with silicone toys. But, use Liquid Silk! It’s actually a really great personal lubricant that works like a dream.(Review of Liquid Silk Lubricant)

These fine soups come from Erlenbach, Switzerland, up in the ancient Alps. They are made with fine oils, honey, goat’s milk extract, and fragrances including wild rose. They really are fine soaps that look cute, smell very nice indeed, and leave your hands feeling soft and clean.The soaps themselves are small – 3.5 ounces, which is a good size for your guest room, or for keeping for yourself and not for the kiddies :-). Two of them come in an attractive box, which is good for giving them as a gift for the woman who likes the very best.(Review of APIANA AP Pictoral, Alpine Milk)

It seems like not all that long ago that coconut oil was under attack as some sort of poisonous food. Now, after more reasoned examination, it has been found that coconut oil is actually a rather healthy oil that, with judicious use, is a very good addition to your diet.I like this particular coconut oil for a number of reasons. First of all, I like that it is organically raised. Secondly, I like that it is carefully pressed and left unrefined. As such, you are getting a product that is about as close to nature as your can get.The first thing I did when I opened the bottle was inhale the lovely coconutty smell, which I love. Then, I made some good old fashioned popcorn. As you have always heard, the best popcorn is always made with coconut oil, as the taste is phenomenal. Since then, I have used it for a number of recipes, finding that it worked very well with my dishes, especially the pork and chicken.I have also used it on my skin, and thought that it did a good job – especially on my feet.So, if you want to get some really good, all natural coconut oil, then consider Island Fresh’s Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil. I think it’s great!Sample provided for review.(Review of Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, Cold-pressed and Unrefined from Island Fresh)

Assembly: This set took me about ten minutes to put together. I did not find it hard to put together, as I have (all too much!) experience in assembling Hot Wheels sets and other toys. It only takes a modicum of mechanical ability, and some patience.Operation: This set is similar to sets I have seen where the cars are lifted up an incline, and then allowed to “race” down the track to the bottom, where they can be lifted up again. Unlike those other sets, though, this one is not motorized. Instead, it counts on the child to pump the mechanism to lift the cars more manually.Cars: This set comes with only one car, which is a bit of a disappointment, but my little guy experimented with all sorts of cars (and trucks and tractors) from his toy box, and found others that worked as well.Conclusion: My little guy loves cars and loves Pixar’s movie, Cars, so he was thrilled with this toy. He sits and plays with it a surprisingly long time. I like that it is not motorized, and requires him to be involved in making it work.I will be interested to see the other Pixar-Cars sets that Mattel is going to come up with, I can’t imagine how they would work together.Anyway, he loves it and plays with it. As they say, ‘nuff said.(Review of Disney/Pixar Cars RS500 1/2 Off-Road Rally Race Trackset)

These leg warmers are cute and very eye-catching. They are nice and long, which means they can fit just about any length shinbone, I should think. Mine shed a bit when new, but it stopped before it became a problem.(Review of Leg Avenue Furry Rainbow Leg Warmers)

You might scratch your head at the idea of washcloths made out of bamboo. Well, when you first touch them you will be absolutely amazed at how soft and silky they really are. Truly, they are as soft as a bunny’s ear!These 10” x 10” clothes are also nicely absorbent. They work great as washcloths, or for baby, or even for babying yourself – I like using them for makeup removal. My young daughter took one and wiped up some spaghetti sauce, after a spill. I was somewhat angered, but I accepted the loss. Imagine my surprise when I popped the cloth in the wash with the towels, and it came out sparklingly white. I am quite impressed!Yeah, these are great washcloths, great for baby, and great for you. Personally, I love the luxurious silky feel of these cloths  and am very glad that I got them.(Review of 6 ULTRA SOFT Baby Washcloths, 100% Natural Bamboo, No-Dyes, from The Motherhood Collection)

Among the propertied classes of Georgian England, life was never simple. This is the tale of Earnshaw family, and those they touched. It's a tale of love and tenderness, and also a tale of greed and cruelty. It's a story as complex as the times it explores and the people who inhabited it.This is an excellent book. Correct, if you want an up-beat book of happily-ever-after, then you will be disappointed. But, if you want a complex book of human lives and loves and passions of all sorts, then this is a book you should read.(Review of Wuthering Heights by Emily Bronte)

Wilson Sporting Goods is the official ball supplier of the NCAA postseason tournaments, so you know that they make good basketballs. I got this one as a gift for a nephew, and he was thrilled. The ball is light and easy to handle, and has great bounce. Now, at 28.5" it is a somewhat smaller ball, but this makes it perfect for young players who still want the feel of a full-sized ball.My nephew was really happy to get this ball, and he has been using it ever since. It was a great gift!(Review of WILSON NCAA Final Four Bracket Intermediate Basketball (28.5))

There's a new rabbit in town, and you have got to meet him!This toy from California Exotic Novelties is a well-designed piece of bedroom hardware. Like most rabbits, it has the rotating head, spinning beads in the shaft, and a vibrating tongue. However, this one goes far beyond the original rabbit in almost everyway.First of all, there is a "Magic Love Bead" near the head. This hard-point is right near the center of the rotation and can really help with G-spot stimulations.Secondly, the spinning beads are locked in place, which means no jamming. If you have one of the early rabbits, you know that that was a problem. This definitely helps prolong the life of the toy.Thirdly (and most importantly!) is the piercing on the tongue of the rabbit. It is a traditional barbell shape, and when the vibrations are turned on, it produces some pretty fantastic clitoral stimulation!I do, though, have two complaints against this wonderful toy. The lesser one is that the lights on the handle are unnecessarily bright. This can be a bit irritating when the toy is used in the dark, dazzling the eyes.The greater one is that while the bead on the shaft is completely covered in plastic, the barbell on the tongue is not. This means that one has to be very careful to clean the hole and the barbell. To make matters worse, the shaft of the barbell has a groove in it that can easily harbor bacteria, and since it is inside the plastic of the tongue, you must work to clean it out.That said, though, this really is a fantastic toy, one that produces a lot of pleasure. Want to get those Good Vibrations? Then get the Pierced Lover! I highly recommend it!(Review of California Exotic Novelties Wild Orgasm - Pierced Lover)

These earrings have a definite `Wow!' factor. The pictures above just don't do them full justice. They are quite elegant, with excellent eye quality. The overall appearance is sparkly and classy, and they go very well with either formal or casual clothing.I have had no problem keeping them in my ears, with the clutches staying on the posts all day. And I must say that I think that the price is quite good for such attractive earrings.Yes indeed, I am very pleased!Sample provided at a reduced cost.(Review of Bamoer Cubic Zirconia Platinum Plated Flower Design Round Stud Earrings)

Scharffen Berger Chocolate Maker is a relatively new company, begun in 1997 by Robert Steinberg and John Scharffenberger. Their commitment to making fine chocolate is obvious in every bite. These particular bars are quite excellent, having that rich full-flavor of the cacao that you expect from extra dark chocolate. And yet, they are very palatable and surprisingly smooth.This is really good chocolate - give it a try and you will be pleased!By the way, just yesterday I used some of this chocolate in making a cake, and the results were wonderful.(Review of Scharffen Berger Chocolate Bar)

This past weekend a friend of mine moved into a rental home that had been closed up for some six months - the house was dirty and had a musty, unclean odor. I had just gotten this cleaner, so I thought that this would be a good test for it. I brought over my bucket and mop, my rags and sponges, rolled up my sleeves and got to work.The first thing I noticed was that this cleaner had a very pleasant smell to it. I cleaned the counters with it, scrubbed the sink and the tub with it, and finally mopped the floors with it. As a matter of fact, when I was done, I poured some down each of the drains.It did a great job of cleaning - exactly as you would expect from a Mr. Clean product. It left everything looking...OK, not new, it's an old house, but it did leave it looking nice and clean. The smell is much better in the house (the basement needs to be bleached, it leaks some and the sitting moisture was not a good thing), and she and I were quite pleased with the results.So, I gave this cleaner what I would consider an acid test, and it came through with flying colors. I am quite pleased with it and give it my whole-hearted seal of approval!(Review of Mr. Clean Liquid Muscle All Purpose Surface Cleaner)

This is a fun piece of bedroom attire, perhaps the most unique piece you've ever purchased. To a large extent, it's two pieces in one. The one piece is a leather harness that wraps around you and puts you on display. It screams, "Take me, I'm yours." The other piece is a ring-gag, with chains that connect to "bull-nosed" nipple clamps. The combined appearance is a really exciting "sex-slave" look.The quality of the parts is generally good. The parts are not heavy leather and stainless steel, but rather a softer and gentler light leather or leatherette with light metallic fastenings. The overall feel is lightweight and reasonably comfortable.The o-ring in the gag is made of plastic, for the protection of the wearer's teeth, and is relatively small. This means that it will not take too long to get used to wearing it. But, it also limits what can be put through the ring and into the mouth. The guys might want to keep that in mind.When the wearer's head moves, it can also pull on the nipple clamps, adding more stimulation to play. These clamps are of the "bull-nosed" variety, and look nastier than they really are. They are coated in some sort of rubber, which provides a certain measure of comfort. Each clamp has a screw in the middle which you can tighten to decrease pressure on the nipple, or loosen to increase pressure. The pressure can be set anywhere from minimal to OUCH! A common technique is to place the clamp with minimum pressure, and then slowly loosen the screen until the pressure reaches the optimum combination of comfort and pleasure.Like I said, this is a fun harness to wear - it looks a lot more sinister and uncomfortable than it really is. Don't be intimidated by it; instead, give it a try, and give him a thrill. He'll love it!(Review of Utimi SM Restraint Bondage Handcuffs Breast Clamp and Neck Collar from UTIMI 10)

Being a gal-on-the-go, I sometimes find myself out and about with a dying cell phone or iPod or whatnot. The worst times are when I am out jogging and really don't have any options. This PowerCard has already proven itself to be a life saver. It is small enough to fit into a pocket along with my cell phone, without being too bulky. And, I can plug in and recharge my battery as I go. All I can say is, WOW!On the downside, though, the silly thing came without instructions - that I do not get. Perhaps they figure you will go on-line to their site for instructions, but that isn't a nice way to go.Nonetheless, once you learn how to use this batter, and it's not hard, you will love it. I think that it's great!(Review of Monster Mobile PowerCard Portable Battery)

Newman's Own is well known as an innovative company - innovative in their products and innovative in their corporate giving. This interesting snack is a "red licorice" candy that has a deliciously sweet pomegranate taste. It's made with all organic ingredients, including pomegranate juice concentrate.I liked it a lot. Yes, it's candy with five pieces containing 32 grams of carbs(!), so it's not health-food. But nonetheless it is a delicious candy!(Review of Newman's Own - Organic Licorice Twists, Pomegranate)

I saw the C-string years ago, but only recently went ahead and got one. When you first see it, your first thought is that it's a joke! But no, this is a series piece of lingerie.First of all, let me describe it. The C-string has a flexible frame with a soft and wide area in the front, tapering to a narrow strip that fits between the buttocks, rather like a thong. Unlike a thong, however, there are no straps connecting the front and back via the sides, instead the flexible frame causes the C to hug your bottom.When worn under a dress or slacks, the C-string leaves absolutely no visible panty lines. Visually it is a stunning success, superior to any sort of panty out there that I am familiar with.You might think that it won't hold on, but it does a great job. When putting it on, especially after a washing, you will want to squeeze it closed a bit to make sure it is good and tight. The feeling of being hugged by the C-string is a bit unusual at first, but it's not uncomfortable and you'll get used to it quickly.Now, if you are going to be jumping around, I would not count on it holding on. I've never had it fall off, even when dancing, but I would hate to have a very public wardrobe malfunction, so I can imagine situations where I would not wear this.As for wearing this for sexual play, it's been quite a huge success for me! Its exoticness and minimalness makes it a hit. Also, when worn under a skirt, it can be quickly and easily removed, and just as quickly and easily replaced. Even just knowing that you are wearing it can drive him crazy.So, I think that this is a great piece of lingerie - functional and sexy!(Review of C-string)

Black pants really suits him, but they never stay truly black for very long, so I am constantly looking for new ones. These pants really, really look good on him. The material is a nice matte black, that looks quite midnight. Unlike with some black pants, these do not seem to be a lint magnet - they collect some, of course, but it's just not a problem with them.The fit is very nice indeed. They seem true to size, and the stretch material means that they hold on comfortably. Being mostly cotton, the pants breathe well and are not unduly hot.These are really nice pants. He likes the way that they feel, and I love the way that they look. If you want some really good pants, then get these Wrangler Premium Stretch Pants!(Review of Wrangler Premium Stretch Pants)

I got these shoes for a party - nude matte.On the down side, I did think that they are a little too large for their size. Also, I found the bottoms to be a bit slick, so I ended up putting on some non-slip grip pads.On the plus side, though, these are very nice shoes. They are very stylish in a classic sort of way. And, with a pair of Dr. Scholl's Dreamwalk High Heel Insoles (see my 7/2/14 review) they are quite comfortable.The shoes looked great at the party and I was very pleased!(Review of Journee Collection Womens Patent Round Toe Mary Jane Pumps)

I use rubber bands all the time, and had a great big bag of rubber bands from years ago. However, dry rot began taking a toll, so I knew that it was time to get some new ones. I got this rubber band ball, and am very pleased. The rubber bands are of a good quality, and the kids think that the ball is hilarious - it has become their newest toy.The ball is useful and fun!(Review of ACCO Rubber Band Ball, 275 Bands Per Ball, Assorted Colors)

The Shibue Strapless Panty is a rather different form of underwear. It is specialized for women who really don't want to show any sort of a panty line, or for those who don't want to show the side of their underwear due to a very high leg or very low side. They also work great for specialized occasions, when you want to maintain your dignity in spite of a minimum of coverage, such as when going for a massage or a spray tanning, or to try on swimsuits or lingerie.They fit on snugly, and you must avoid oils and lotions in the area, so that the adhesive can attach firmly to the skin. Let me be clear, the area must be smooth and clean.Once attached, they are comfortable and hold on well, though they do make going to the bathroom somewhat problematical. They should not be worn for more than six hours, so they are definitely not for all-day wear. Also, I must say I wonder what would happen if I got sweaty while wearing one. I am not sure that I want to find out in public!These are a different sort of panty, and when you are in that unusual situation where you need one, you will be glad that you got it.(Review of Shibue Strapless Panty)

Quite a few years ago we went with microwave popcorn as our popcorn of choice. It tastes good and is oh so easy. So, it was rather on a lark that I picked up some of Kernel Season's Popping Corn.We cooked up the popcorn in a pan, the old fashioned way, and the young ones, who had never actually seen corn pop, were quite entertained watching it happen. (That brought back memories of my own childhood!) The corn popped up quite nicely, with very few unpopped kernels left in the pan.The popcorn it produced was surprisingly tasty, even without adding anything more than some table salt. Yeah, I think that this is a very good popping corn. If you want to pop corn the old fashioned way, then don't cheap out and get crappy popping corn, get Kernel Season's Popping Corn!Let me make a recommendation here: a real good taste combination is this popping corn and San Francisco Salt Company's Cherrywood Smoked Sea Salt. Try it!(Review of Kernel Season's Popping Corn)

OK, when you think of a vibrator, the shape that most readily leaps to mind is the torpedo-shape. The Jopen Vr9 is nothing like torpedo-shaped; instead it looks like a magic wand, and it is one!Instead of using girth to provide a "full" feeling, the Vr9 is designed for precision work, to stimulate the woman's pleasure points. Shaped something like a forte symbol, it has a vibrator at each end. You can use the thick end for some fullness, or the skinny end for more precise work. The elegant curves of the Vr9 allow for stimulation of the clitoris or the G-Spot, or anywhere else.Like all of the Jopen vibrators, the Vr9 is covered with a skin of warm and hypoallergenic silicone. It is fully waterproof, which means that virtually any part of the toy can be used for stimulation, and the whole thing can be washed under running water. It has no removable batteries, only rechargeable, built-in ones.There are two buttons in the middle, one each to control the two vibrators on the end - the buttons are very small, meaning that you will want to familiarize yourself with them, before you use it in your love-making. And finally, while the Vr9 looks like a forte, it is remarkably pianissimo, very quiet indeed.Oh yeah, and don't forget that the manufacturer boasts that all of their vibrators come with a free 1-year warrantee, so if something goes wrong with your Vr9, then contact them right away.So, to summarize, let me say this.Pros: Unique design and functionality, silicone, waterproof, rechargeable, quiet, and 1-year warrantee.Cons: Small buttons.If you want to expand your horizons a bit, try the Jopen Vr9. I think you'll like it!(Review of Vanity by Jopen - Vr9 Vibrator)

These are great running shorts. They are very lightweight and absorb sweat right away. I also like their inner brief, which keeps the shorts from showing off too much.The waistband is good, with an inner drawstring added in. What can I say? Great for running, great for volleyball!(Review of Nike Women's 3)
I got a pair of these as a gift for a recent bachelorette party. They were a huge hit. Did they work? Probably. ;-)(Review of Keep Rubbing Underwear: Bella Hotshort Underwear)

This is a very nice hair wrap. The fabric is nice and soft, and it holds on my head very well. I've worn it after bathing and after swimming, and it works excellently. I really like it!(Review of DII Women's Microfiber Shower Wrap and Hair Wrap Set)

Trojan has recently moved into the sex toy field, and one of their best products is the Tri-Phoria. The Tri-Phoria is an "outie" vibrator - that is to say, a non-insertable one.The Tri-Phoria fits quite easily in the hand, and has three interchangeable tips. The vibrator has eight settings - five different speeds and three different pulse patterns. The handle is waterproof for easy cleaning, and the three tips are made of warm and soft silicone, which means that they can be thoroughly cleaned with bleach or even through boiling. The vibrator is powered with one AA battery.This is a very good vibrator, with lots of good features - it really works! I liked that the toy can be properly cleaned, and I thought that it had a nice range of power settings - one is sure to be just right for you. Now, compared to some toys, this one is a bit on the noisy side, so be careful about using it in a completely quiet house! Other than that, though, it is great.I highly recommend this vibrator for newbies and for connoisseurs!(Review of TROJAN Vibrating Tri-phoria Intimate Massager)

These shorts are excellently designed with the runner in mind. They are made of a nice lightweight material, and have a built in compression liner that hugs the body and prevents chafing. Also, they don't ride up or bunch. The color is nice and understated.The man I got these for is 6'1" and weighs in at about 195 pounds. He is quite pleased with the way they work, and I am quite pleased with the way they look!(Review of Saucony Men's Interval 2-1 Short)

Green Toys, Inc. is a California company that specializes in making environmentally friendly toys. How are they environmentally friendly? The company uses plastic made from recycled milk jugs (recycled right here in the US), forms them into safe toys (manufactured right here in the US), and packages them in recycled boxes (boxes that contain no plastics or metal ties, and are themselves 100% recyclable).Green Toys toys are really great for young children. They are designed to be compliant with all US and California safety tests, and contain no Phthalates or Bisphenol A - potentially carcinogenic materials that used to be used widely in plastics. I also loved the packaging that did not require 10 minutes to undo!It's a fun little toy that a little guy or gal can take outside and roll around in the dirt, one that you can then pop into the dishwasher. My little guy loves it, and we are both quite happy!(Review of Green Toys Red Race Car)

This body stocking is very nice. It's definitely maximally sexy!It's easy to get into, and surprisingly comfortable. The seams are soft and not picky or the least bit irritating.I'm not completely thrilled with doing up the ribbon, but it does give the outfit the look of a present to be opened. Of course, with the lace and the open crotch, no unwrapping is necessary.(Review of Body Stocking Black)

When I first saw these sandals I thought that they were pretty cute, and they are. The problem is that the zipper on the heel is not terribly comfortable. Wearing them all day, I found that the zipper on the back began to chafe the back of my tendon. Also, I think that they could really use more padding in the sole.It's a nice looking shoe, that's for sure, but not great for all day.(Review of Comfortview Women's Wide Stephanie Braided Sandal)

Dawn is a label of the Procter & Gamble Company. It was introduced in 1973 and quickly became a staple found in many homes.This is a nice new Dawn liquid. It has an excellent smell, and works just as well as a dishwashing liquid as you would expect from Dawn. Also, it is antibacterial, and (if you only use a little) it works great as hand soap.I bought a small liquid soap dispenser, which I filled with this Dawn Ultra, and I keep it next to my kitchen sink. My family and I can then use it either hand washing or dishwashing. We really like it!(Review of Dawn Ultra Antibacterial Hand Soap Dishwashing Liquid)

I always thought that any water-based lubricant was, by definition, glycerin-based. Well, Nooky Lube has proved me wrong!Chemical Makeup - Nooky Lube is water-based, which is nice because that means that it does not damage latex condoms and toys the way that oil-based lubes can, and it does not damage silicone-based toys the way that silicone-based lubes can. Also, Nooky Lube is not glycerin-based, which is great, because there is some evidence to believe that glycerin can help bring on yeast infections.Smell and Taste - The first thing I noticed was that Nooky Lube really and truly does not have a smell or a taste. I have tasted some pretty disgusting lubricants and this is a real change for the better!Viscosity - Some lubricants flow like water, which means that when you apply them to skin, they try to flow right off, dripping and making a mess. Nooky Lube is nice and thick, which makes applying it one less thing to worry about.Slipperiness - When first applied, Nooky Lube is hyper-slippery and causes everything to slip and slide! This lubricant really is up there with the best that I have ever used!Durability - Different lubricants tend to have different durabilities, which is to say that some last longer than others. Nooky Lube has a rather limited durability. We found that during play time, Nooky Lube had to be refreshed about every five minutes.Clean-up - Clean-up is always a must after using lubricants - oils and silicone-based lubes require it, and glycerin-based lubes become gummy and gross when left on the skin (plus it's easy to taste them when they are on your hands - disgusting!). Nooky Lube on the other hand seems to simply evaporate. After use, there seems to be nothing left - no stickiness, no taste, and no smell!Also, unlike many lubes, Nooky Lube does not seem to stain sheets, blankets or clothing. This is a really nice plus.Conclusion - Nooky Lube is an excellent lubricant, with a great range of properties. I love the way it evaporates away to nothing. If you need a long-lasting lube, then it will be one that leaves a residue and has to be carefully cleaned-up. Nooky Lube is relatively short-lasting but leaves little or nothing to be cleaned up.So, I say to use Nooky Lube liberally and have a ball! I really like it.(Review of Nooky Lube Sexual Lubricant)

I have a eleven-year-old daughter who recently began learning how to play the Ocarina - a six-hole pendent Ocarina. So, when I was offered this instrument, I was more than happy to get it.This is, by the way, a serious instrument. Yes, it says, "toy" and you can use it as such, or as a cosplay prop, but you can learn to play it.The first thing that I noticed, when I opened it up, was that it is a very pretty looking thing. The one I received had a nice cobalt blue appearance, with no visible flaws in the finish. My daughter immediately switched her practice from the 6-hole Ocarina to this one.She says that the instruction booklet is not very good, but that the instrument itself sounds very nice. Quite often, in the late evening, I can hear her tootling away on this Ocarina, and it sounds surprisingly lovely.So, if you want to "Legend of Zelda" prop, then this is a good Ocarina for you to get - it looks very nice when worn around the neck on its included thong. But, if you want to get a good twelve-hole Ocarina and learn to play it, then you should also get this one as well. Either way, you win!Sample provided for review.(Review of Musicella 12-Hole Ocarina Alto C Musical Instrument)

I am still pretty new to LED bulbs, so I must admit that I don't have a lot to compare this bulb to. Looking at it out of the blue, I find that the color is quite nice, with a warm glow to it. The temperature range is good, but I must admit that the rule against getting the bulb wet greatly cuts down on my ability to use it as an "outdoor" bulb.Nonetheless, it is a nice spotlight, and I like the way it looks.(Review of Sylvania 78691)

I got this shaver for my man, and have used it on him a couple of times. So, I am basing my observations on what he says, and what I have noticed myself.The shaver has a nice fit in the hand, even in mine. The pop-up trimmer is nice, and does a good job around the perimeter of his beard, and on the back of his neck. The rotary heads seem to do a good job, even on his trouble spots under the corners of his jaw and over his Adam's apple.We're pretty pleased with this razor. The trimmer on an earlier razor of his broke in his briefcase (a Scout is always prepared) as it was unprotected. As this one folds in, it shouldn't have a problem.(Review of Remington Products Xr1350 Hyper Series Rotary Shaver)

With this purchase, you get a bag of 300 small-size balloons. They burst somewhat easily, so be careful not to over-fill them. Mind you, having a few burst spectacularly while filling made for a really hilarious time!Anyway, the balloons are nice and brightly colored. You can use them as water balloons or as regular balloons. The fact that you can blow up so darn many, makes them great for a birthday party.We had a great time with ours!(Review of YazyCraft Premium Water Balloons 300 count)

The first thing I noticed when I applied this shampoo is that it has a very nice smell. The second thing I noticed was that it lathered quite nicely. It's quite gentle, and rinses well, leaving my hair shiny and manageable.Does it do anything for my hair color? I am not entirely sure - I am required to write a review quickly, and only time will tell. But, having said that, I really like this as a shampoo. It's salon-quality and I think that it's very good.(Review of John Frieda Brilliant Brunette Colour Protecting Moisturizing Shampoo)

It's hard to give a confident, positive review on supplements with all the news about scams coming out today.Viva Labs seems to be relatively new (founded in 2011) kind of at the height of the nutritional supplement boom and it's difficult to find any legitimate reviews on their products.What I can say is that from the papers I've read most people don't get enough Vitamin C, RDA is less than 100mgs but some of the literature recommends about 500mg/day plus your fruits and veggies. From what I can tell it's safe to take up to 2000mg/day, and that it helps your body with all kinds of repair and nutrient absorption systems.These are 1000mgs so you only need to take 1 a day and you should be getting more than you need. Even if you eat another 500mg's (which is like 9 servings of fruits and veggies) you should be fine.They are in capsule form with a powder inside that, once I popped one open, definitely smells and tastes like the old, familiar, C vitamin tablets I got as a kid, minus the weird smell that always reminded me of pee. So, while not a lab based test, it definitely gave me a bit more confidence in them.The capsules are medium sized so they should go down without to much of a fight, they do for me anyway.The bottle says you should take these with a meal but so far, for me, if I don't eat they don't seem to make me feel sick or anything so I assume that's just to help absorption.So far no irritation in my stomach and it's nice to be able to take Vit C without the bitter taste or the pee smell :)I like em!

Just got the keyboard no more than 10 minutes ago and I already have it paired and working with my Galaxy S4 and my Galaxy Tab.Pairing was quick and functionality is super smooth. Set up is seriously like a 4 step process.Kinda wish there was a way to switch screens (if you have multiple home screens) or at least pull up and browse apps but as is it has plenty of functionality and everything works quickly.The only shortcut that doesn't seem to work for me is the apps button, which is supposed to pull up my active applications. However on my s4 if i hold down the home button it does the same thing and lo! Holding down the home key on the keyboard pulls up my open apps list.I like how the back lighting works, took me a second to figure out how to turn it on since the instructions are pretty much non-existant. Basically you hold down the function key and hit the less than key with an icon that looks like a... rising sun? I dunno, it's a light of some kind.That cycles the brightness and the Greater Than key cycles the color.What's cool is that the light goes off after a few seconds of being inactive and then clicks back on as soon as you touch a key.Back lighting is super important for me so I'm really happy with this feature.I'm not super happy with the feel of the keyboard, the keys don't really have much feel. They are super light and... "clicky"? If that makes sense.The other thing that's kind of annoying is that there doesn't seem to be a way to make it un-pair, I can't even figure out how to turn it off, the power key doesn't seem to do anything. And if you accidentally hit a key it opens the search feature on your phone.There isn't much in the instructions about turning it off and it's definitely not the same method as turning it on.Currently I just turn off Bluetooth or un-pair from my phone and I'm good.Aside from those small gripes this is an awesome little keyboard and i cant wait to use it in my meetings when I'm taking notes.I like using google keep so I'm constantly swyping and then going back through and fixing the auto correct. This will hopefully save me a lot of time.Solid little Bluetooth keyboard

I've only been taking these for a week so far but I have noticed a slight difference compared to the Glucosamine pills I was taking before.Less crunching and stiffness in my joints for sure. I've also been taking fish oil and a couple other supplements so it could be one of those as well but I've noticed a difference and that's what matters.What I can say is that I haven't gotten worse or lost the effects of taking Glucosamine/Chondroitin pills so they seem to be working and keeping me flexible.I lift weights about 4 times a week and at 40 it helps a lot to keep myself flexible and fluid.They are pretty big pills, I wouldn't call them horse pills but they aren't kids chewables either. If you've taken glucosamine tabs before they are pretty comparable and go down smooth with a big gulp of water.They only thing that threw me was they are bright yellow. Normally Glucosamine pills are white so that was a bit weird but checking the ingredients i dont see anything about coloring so I'm assuming its from the other ingredients.At any rate I'm happy with them so far and would recommend giving them a try if you're looking at supplements.

So far I really like it.It's very compact so if you've got a DSLR with a battery pack it's not going to fit very well.It's also not ideal for a 70-200mm or anything that size. I can fit my large speed light but then i can fold the center flap over all the way.Right now I use it for a my Rebel T3i, my 50mm, my kit 18-55 and my large speedlight. It has a zip up pouch in the from with a couple of smaller pouches inside but surprisingly there are no pouches that seem to be dedicated to card storage. I say it's surprising because i have 4 other Case logic camera bags and they all have card pouches.The side pouches are super thin so you might get some small gray cards and some filters in there.Really it's a very compact bag for light use, not for a big shoot or carrying most of your gear around.Size aside, like most case logic bags, it's built solid. The molded base makes me wonder if these aren't the new replacements for the SLRC line.The have the camera sling in them just like those.By the way, the molded base on my SLRC packs has come in handy way to many times to count. I've set them down in snow and on wet concrete so many times. On top of that there's just more between your gear and the ground which I really like and became a bit spoiled by. I set one of my new bags (sand the molded base) down maybe a little harder than I should've because i was used to the case logic base. Gear was ok but the sound made my sphincter pucker for a second. Was no bueno!Matter of fact i have an SLRC-203 and I'm considering selling it now that I have this smaller bag. The 203 was just big enough to be awkward but not really big enough to carry a lot of gear comfortably.This bag carries almost the same amount of stuff but is much more compact and easy to tote.Great for travel or just being out and about with no real goals in mind.Definitely another solid entry in Case Logic's camera bag line.I'm keeping this one!

Well obviously it looks really cool but how well does it work? Not to shabby.Aside from the toasting I love everything about this toaster. And even the toasting is ok.I like how it goes flat against my wall and takes up less counter depth. I like how it looks. The red is cool looking and watching the toaster glow red is kinda fun.My problem so far (I've only had it a couple days) is that it doesn't toast as hot as it's supposed to.If you look at the instruction manual it has a guide to show you what kind of toast to expect with each of the heat settings.By the guide a setting of 4 is a golden, restaurant style piece of toast, but I'm getting barely toasted. At 4 my toast comes out more like a 2.And it's not very even either.I don't get the toast I was expecting at 4 until I crank it to 5.5. In my old toaster this was a 3.Now once you get it up to that it does a great job and it seems to toast more evenly as well. On top of that you can see when the toast is the way you want it so you can just hit big cancel button to pop it out.It also has a reheat feature as well as a defrost and a setting for getting your bagels toasted and cooked through without burning.Overall I really like the toaster, I can speak to it's longevity but as far as a nice looking appliance that fits well on my counter and serves up toast, it does the job and looks good while doing it.It'll only hold 2 pieces of bread or 1 bagel sliced in half so if you're a massive bread consumer or a large family you might want to look at a 4 slot or bigger but for me and my daughter in this little apartment it's perfect.Definitely recommended.

Have just started introducing my 6 year old to the Star Wars Trilogy and was super excited to see these come out.Not let down AT ALL by this model/toy.First of all it's super easy to assemble so my daughter was able to help with most of it. There were a couple of steps in the 9 step process that she needed my help with but beyond that she was completely capable of handling it.Next it has an electronic cockpit with lights and sound effects that is just wikked. The traditional Tie fighter scream as it flies by, the familiar blaster sounds not to mention it's just super cool looking. It has more detail than I expected and the light up cockpit (red led) is sweet.Honestly really impressed by these models. Cool looking enough to be a collectors item, easy enough to assemble to involve your little ones and then it has the lights and sounds like the original toys (I'm 40, used to have an OG X-Wing).Seriously very cool. Model kits are fun and the finished piece is basically like any other toy.It's been dropped twice now (on to carpet) and it's fine.If you're a fan this is a cool toy/model to have

I've been trying this for about 2 weeks now. Never really used much lotion so I've got some wrinkles starting to come in but I'm blessed with some good genetics so I still look pretty young. Still, those laugh lines and forehead wrinkles are starting to leave permanent creases and I figured it can't hurt to try taking better care of my skin.After 2 weeks I'm not seeing much difference as far as anti-aging, but I kind of expected that. What I have noticed is that, after I wash my face in the morning and put it on it does seem to hide/lessen some of the wrinkles and my skin does feel tighter. I can't tell if it's because I have a dry film of product on my face or if it's actually effecting my skin but it does seem to make a visual difference.It does seem to last almost all day but one really interesting thing I've noticed is that during my workout, while I have this on, my sweat tastes very sweet. Almost like I just rubbed my face down with sugar. I don't know if that's a good thing or not. The skeptic in me starts screaming "Ha! You just rubbed a $40 placebo on your face!" the other half of me is thinking, "What's in this stuff? I wonder if maybe, sugar is good for your skin?"As far as brightening my skin, well it does seem to create a more, matte shine, less oily or dry looking..Either way I do see a difference when it's on, but not once I wash it off.At this point (2 weeks in) I'm labeling it more of a moisturizing concealer than an anti-aging/firming cream.I do like it though, hopefully it's helping my skin stay healthy and not just covering up the damage.

While it's made of mostly cheap plastic (i think the center grate may be metal) it still looks pretty nice and works really well.I used the included adhesive strips to mount it to the side of my shower stall and it has stayed attached through about a weeks worth of hot showers now.The one gripe I have is the pumps are really difficult to get started. They even come with a letter that says they may need up to 18 pumps to get started. That is a gross understatement. I probably pumped 100-200 times, seriously, before each one started working. I sat in the shower just trying to get this thing to work for at least a minute on each pump.My recommendation is to maybe get it started with some watered down shampoo or conditioner and then pour in the rest of your shampoo. I think once you get something going through then you create the suction needed to keep it going.Once you get it working though it pumps out a nice small amount and work consistently.I also like the little razor clip and the additional hooks for your washcloths/scrubby's.Nice little unit and works well once you get it going.

This is my 5yo daughters first time on a scooter and in 2 days she has completely figured it out.It's not to tough to put together, allen wrench is provided and if you follow the directions you should be able to get it assembled in about 15minutes.Once it was together we took it to the basketball court and started working on balance which was super easy with the 2 wheels on the front. After that turning, which was also pretty cut and dry, it feels like it turns a little sharper than those old razor scooters honestly.The scooter also has a brake on the back wheel that it took her till the second day to figure out.She's fallen a couple times and the one thing I will bring up is that if your kid doesn't learn to step off and kick the scooter out in front of them to dismount the curved bar will cause them to eat it pretty far if they fall forward. And it really wants to fall forwardEven though we've wrecked it a few times now on asphalt it still looks good, the design causes the scooter to roll more than just crash.But again, that bar will also roll your kid in an awkward way if they fall forward. My daughter actually slammed her collar bone into the asphalt because of the way she fell with it.So, teach em how to dismount and use the brake!Aside from that it's very easy to learn, very durable ( I rode it around for a bit and I'm 215lbs) and she has gotten lots of compliments from other kids at the park while riding it.

I see a lot of reviewers complaining about the plastic taste or smell. I’m guessing these reviewers haven’t bought a coffee maker in a while.Like most new, inexpensive machines you need to run a few brews with just water and then even a couple with coffee in them to get the coffee oils to coat the parts so that you don’t taste the metal, plastic, cleaners, etc. that the brand new machine tastes/smells like. You’ve got to break them in.With this one I ran two water cycles then brewed a couple of throw away pots. By the third or fourth pot my coffee tastes great again. You can see that I’m not giving the coffee machine 5 stars but it has nothing to do with the taste or smell of the coffee.My coffee tastes just as good coming out of this machine as it does from my Mellita 10 cup with the thermal carafe.Overall I’d actually give this machine a 3 star rating but it gains a star for the carafe. Let me explain.Aside from the fancy looks the machine is still just a basic coffee maker, it really doesn’t do anything more than a standard machine with a timer does already. It has a removable reservoir which is kinda cool I guess if your filling from the sink but if, like me, you use a filtered water pitcher to fill your machine then you don’t need a removable reservoir. It has a small carbon filter disk as well, which will remove some of the crud in your water but not nearly as much as a water filter, so again, if you use filtered water, it’s unnecessary.On top of that the machine just feels unnecessarily complicated compared to other machines that produce similar quality coffee. Instead of flipping the top open you pull the filter box out of one side and the reservoir compartment from the other side and then you reassemble once they’re loaded up.I do like being able to remove the entire compartment when dumping the grinds and it does go in and out easily but the whole thing just feels like fluff. The unit is about twice the size of my Mellita and does everything the same with the exception of the added filter.The interface is nice and big, easy to use/read so that is a plus. It also beeps when your brew is done.Some nice little additions.So why 4 stars? Well as I mentioned, originally I was gunna give it 3 but the Carafe is amazing! Seriously.It has kept my coffee warm overnight when brewed in the afternoon. That’s impressive. Compared to the Mellita, which I’ll maybe get 4 hours out of, it’s bordering on magic or alien technology.it pours smooth and the lid is a quarter twist on and off, it’s nice and tight with no drips.Really like the carafe.So if I was going to break it down, I’d actually give it 2 stars as a functional machine. It brews a basic pot of coffee but in an overly extravagant way.1 star for being a functional coffee pot and workingAnd 1 star for the really nice carafe.It looks nice, does the job and keeps my coffee hot without burning it.The carafe is solid and almost worth the buy alone.Beyond that, it’s a coffee maker.

I've actually been keeping this light above a window inside my house as a kind of motion detector night light for now.Honestly didn't think it would get enough sun to keep charging but it has been working flawlessly from the day I turned it on.The lights are bright enough to dimly light up a small room, just enough to see what you're doing, but not so bright that they make you squint at the shock of them coming on.The motion detector works great, picks me up from about 6-7 feet away. The only issue I've had is that right after the lights go off there seems to be a small interval (maybe 30 seconds) where they won't come back on even if you wave your hand in front of the device.Inside the house I really didn't think it would get enough light to charge, especially with all the rain we've been having but it's been turning on and off for 2 weeks now without issue, so if you used this outside above your RV door or any door I'm sure there wouldn't be a problem. The solar cells are plenty efficient to run the LED's even with minimal sunlight.I haven't exposed it to the elements yet but even the off on switch on the underside is sealed up, it's clearly designed to withstand some water. I guess i could run it under the sink and update my review... actually I might do that.In the mean time I can say with confidence that this is a solid little light. Nice balance of brightness, not so bright it's gunna freak out your neighbors but bright enough to see what you're doing. Charges even in dimly lit areas and detects movement from a reasonable and useful distance.I'd recommend it.

Great idea and well implemented.Living in an apartment and being a photographer/designer I love the idea of being able to hang my photo's without leaving a bunch of holes in the wall.You might be worried, like i was, that these use that same sticky tape that some bathroom accessories use to permanently adhere fixtures like towel hooks and such to the walls without screws and anchors. That stuff always pulls the paint off along with whatever you hung.This tape is more like the glue you'll find on perfume ads in magazines that hold the edges together so you can peel it apart. (I hope you know what I mean)It comes off easily and so far, in my tests, it has peeled off the wall without leaving any marks.The reason they can get away with it is that the frames are super light plastic so it doesn't take much to hold them up. Honestly you could probably mount these with poster putty if the backs were flat, that's how light they are.One thing I will warn in case you haven't read other reviews is that if you have textured walls these may not stick at all. My walls are flat matte paint and i have no issues.Anyway,What I really like is that the whole system is really well designed and thought out. The tape has a kind of... vecro-ish material on the back that you can press the frame onto and it sticks really well. Then inside the frame is a small bubble level that you can see from the front to help level out your frame. In the center is a strong magnet that attaches to another that is affixed to the back of the image.The whole thing goes together with very little effort and holds together nicely.My set came with a riser that is just an additional magnetic back that helps the picture sit a little further from the wall, like everything else it simply snaps on to the frame with a magnet.The great thing is that the backs of all of these are that velcro material so you can remove the riser, but still have the tape on the wall so you can slap a non-lifted frame in it's place.Again, everything is really well thought out and simple.In the catalog that came with these there are a wide variety of designs, I got some black and white Parisian Cafe style images that look nice but what I'm most interested in is the photo frames (which I'll be ordering).I can't really think of any gripes and I've tried, I guess maybe the plastic is so light that it feel a bit cheap but you don't see the plastic and it's not like you're going to be beating on it so it's not an issue. I've moved mine around while testing for this review and nothing has cracked or broken yet.I wish they had a larger frame or a wider variety of sizes but I'm sure that will come soon.Make sure you wipe down the walls for best stick. I use TSP and water to get em super clean.Beyond that you really wont need any help, tools, preparation or advice, they're seriously that easy to hang.Again, keep in mind that they may not hang on textured surfaces.

First of all, Medium Tall!? Awesome!Second, soft, fits great, looks great, nice price!Third, durable, and color hasn't faded after 3-4 washes.Man... I was so happy when I found these. Nervous about the way they would fit and feel. I've gotten some junkers from ordering online here before but I really wanted a form fitting v-neck. I started by ordering 1 black one and was so happy I ordered a second black and then a white. I'm 6'4 about 215lbs and I work out 3-4 times a week. I'm still pretty slim for my weight and a large is a bit loose on me, which is nice for dressing baggy/casual, but if I'm wearing a slim fit dress shirt I want a fitting undershirt and I need a medium tall.They had medium tall!If you're my size you know how impossible it is to find nice, medium or even large tall shirts most of the time.These are perfect. Seriously. I've ordered 3, (2 black, 1 white).The tall sizes are nice and long, the fabric is soft, almost buttery, and after 3-4 washes the color hasn't faded at all in the 2 black shirts I've ordered.I just came back to order some looser fitting ones for the summer, unfortunately they are out right now so I decided to write this review.These are great shirts. I just wish they had more colors.

I ordered two of these in September 2014 and they worked awesome. For such tiny speakers they put out surprisingly acceptable sound. They weren't making my neighbors bang on the walls but they were great for listening to music or watching vids on my phone when i wasn't at home or in a car.Last month I smashed one while it was in my backpack and decided to buy a couple more so i could have 2 on my PC and one in my backpack. I really liked them that much.Unfortunately the 2 I ordered this March (2015) have a completely different sound quality and the batteries stopped holding a charge with-in a week.It got to the point that I had to keep them plugged in just to keep them working, as soon as i unplugged one it turned off. Also the sound quality was tinnier and quieter even with the volume cranked.I really can't tell if i got two duds or if the quality assurance or production has changed since the first two I bought.I'd really like to recommend these but after this recent experience it seems like it's more of a grab bag and you may get a good one or you may get a dud.Hate to say it but I can't recommend these anymore.

[UPDATE]I'm leaving my old review intact so that hopefully someone else might benefit from my mistake.Originally i had plugged the adapter into the USB 3.0 port on the side of my monitor. Apparently this was causing lots of interference and I got terrible range on the adapter. I recently moved the adapter to a front port on my PC case and I am now getting at least 16 feet of range from the PC on my bluetooth headset (LG Tone Pro).So moral of the story, if you're getting poor range or signal loss try moving the adapter to a port that is not obscured by another electronic. Back of the PC, Monitor ports or hubs behind your other PC equipment might cause issues with connections.Once you get it out in the open it works great![/UPDATE]Does it's job. Installs without issue.Range is terrible though. I'm using this for a headset and I can't get more than 5-6 feet from the adapter before it starts dropping signal.I can walk twice as far from my phone with the same headset.If you are just using it for a keyboard and mouse on your desktop then this is probably perfectly fine. But for anything with a range beyond 5 feet it might let you down.

I got these as a supplement to my free weight workouts and so that I could carry a workout with me when I travel. In that respect, they have been great!They seem to be very durable, I bought them 4 months ago and use them 3-4 times a week. The Carabiners are solid and all but one of them opens and closes very easily (I have one that sticks sometimes).The set comes with a decent little nylon bag, it's nothing fancy but everything fits in it and it's a nice addition for organizing your gear.The amount of resistance you get from these is dependant a couple of key aspects.The first is that the resistance is partially dependent on the distance you stretch them (with-in their safety limits) so if you are trying to use these with a bench for something like a bench press you're probably going to be disappointed since you won't be able to stretch them far enough to get good resistance. I'm 6'5" (198cm) and on my standard free weight bench I can't get a good stretch unless I go incline.This is the same for any kind of pull downs if you're tall like me. Anchoring the set to a doorway doesn't work for me since I'm so tall and my arms are so long. Even if I get on my knees I can't get a decent stretch out of them.I need to anchor them to the ceiling and since I live in an apartment that's a no-no. I plan to buy a power tower soon though so hopefully that will solve the problem.The second is that you'll most likely need to stack the bands for big, compound movements. You can stack ALL of them on the handles if you want and that's a decent amount of resistance if you can get far enough away from your anchor. I purchased the atomic green band to help get more resistance and when I stack them all together it's very difficult to stretch them when I can get distance from the anchor point.If you are careful, have good form and are deliberate in your movements you can do some solid squats, curls and shrugs with these as well, it's not as satisfying as moving a barbell or a couple of dumbbells but it's a workout and when you can't hit the gym it's nice to have the option, especially for the price and the minimal weight.Where the set really shines for me is in workouts like Incline Fly's, Incline Presses and crossover's or any kind of cable style movements (when I have a good anchor).Because the resistance lets up as you go back down in a press movement, you don't need to worry about the stress on your shoulders as much and you still get that natural movement you get with dumbbells. So you can really stack the resistance and not have to worry as much about getting hurt. Heavier load, less danger, I like it.There's also a lot of stabilizing involved so it encourages you to maintain proper form throughout your movement, another plus.I haven't figured out how to do a deadlift style movement or anything reasonable for calves which is unfortunate but for almost everything else they are a nice alternative when you need them.Again for bigger guys you'll probably want to order a couple of the big green ones and maybe an extra purple. Also, keep in mind that you will need a solid anchor and a space that allows you some distance. If you don't have those things you'll probably be disappointed.A FEW TIPS (some I've already covered).If you anchor to a doorway, you need to be standing on the side of the door that opens away from you. That way the door is held in place by the entire frame instead of just the latch.If you don't feel like the bands are hard enough, stack them, connect several of them together or buy some more big ones and stack those. If you still can't get enough resistance move further from the anchor point to where the bands are just starting to stretch at the beginning of your movement.Don't wrap your bands around anything sharp or abrasive and don't stand on them with cleats or anything other than flat soled shoes (I workout barefoot, but I have flat feet). Even small tears in the bands might cause them to tear and snap in your face. I snapped a band from my uncles set (different brand) and on further inspection the whole band looked like he worked out on a cheese grater or something, concrete floors, un-sanded wood beams, etc. All can be rough on the soft rubber.The nylon on the ends is kind of abrasive so if you're doing movements that will cause them to move across or press against your skin you might want to wear a long sleeve or a forearm guard since they can scratch a bit, they don't really bother me anymore but they did at first.All in all, I really like the set and I'm glad I bought it. I've traveled with it a few times now and it was great to be able to get at least some kind of decent workout in.Definitely recommend them and this brand seems to be well built and durable.

Normally these kinds of kid comforters are a scratchy cheap nylon that's not sewn together very well so I was hesitant to review this item but since it was on Vine I figured it couldn't hurt. At the very least we could wash it, let my daughter drag it around the house and then I could let everyone know what a piece of junk it was.Well, it's not a piece of junk.It seems as though it's actually really durable. We've washed it twice and she drags it out to the living room and lays on it while watching movies.When appropriate I like to put my Vine stuff through the gauntlet and this comforter has come out with flying colors.It's a really cute comforter and it's surprisingly soft compared to your standard "bed-in-a-bag" type bed sets.It's also big, so it covers her whole Twin bed and drapes over quite a bit.She loves it, not just because almost every little girl loves Frozen but because it's actually pretty and comfortable.Solid buy for parents with little fans.

Got this through Vine just before i headed back to Colorado for a week to spend time with family.I've been in the Mid-west/North East for 10 years now (currently in Kentucky) and have adapted to the humidity so I knew i was gunna need something to protect me from the Mountain air.I'll just start by saying this stuff worked wonders for me. While my lips chapped up something nasty for the first few days my skin felt great.Any fragrance it may have is almost unnoticeable or just natural, which is nice since I'm a guy and didn't really look forward to smelling like flowers.I did let me wife try it and she commented that she really liked it and that it wasn't "all greasy or oily", I think we must have different opinions of oily though. To be fair I rarely use lotion but after putting it on I do feel a bit slippery. Still, after a few days it stopped bothering me and I was just happy my skin wasn't cracking.I've been back in KY for a week now and I stopped using it a couple days ago and have definitely noticed a difference, my skin feels dry again even in the humidity.The only brands I can compare it to are St Ives and Aveno. I definitely like this better than the St. Ives stuff that used to burn my skin when i'd put it on, Aveno feels a bit less oily to me but I feel like this works better to keep me from drying out.Honestly I'll probably keep using it unless someone hips me to something better. It's reasonably priced, doesn't smell like a bouquet and keeps my skin soft.

While I think the QA department could use an upgrade I'm actually pretty impressed with this pack. Not only is it designed to be convenient no matter how you need to use it but the build quality seems to be pretty rugged so far. I've walked 1/2 mile with 4, 10lb weight lifting plates with some groceries on top, in it and had no issues... other than it was heavy.I really like the ability to grab it from the top, the side or use it as a back pack or a duffle bag. It's not loaded with a bunch of little pockets, it has a small separator on the inside below a small, zippered pencil pocket and one small zippered pocket on the outside that could maybe hold a cell phone or something. There's another separator on the back behind the backpack straps that could hold a few items like a book or a compact umbrella but that would make wearing it uncomfortable.The only issue i had was that one of the metal clips that is used to tighten the side straps was mounted backwards so i had to take it off with pliers and fit it back on correctly. The clips are very thin metal and honestly a bit sharp but it wasn't a big deal.It looks slick, it's tough and it's actually pretty comfy for me and I'm a big guy, 6'4".Good buy as far as I'm concerned.

Let me say that I've been using this for what... 3 weeks now? And I love it. I'd choose it heads and tails over the old spinning blade nose and ear trimmers. I'm seriously not going back to those. I threw my Panasonic in the trash.It takes a bit of getting used to and at first I couldn't get a decent trim with it but I've figured it out and it works great.Not only does it do a fantastic job with nose hairs but the attachments make it easy to clean up eyebrows and sideburns or edging up a beard.It's definitely the complete shebang and all of the attachments go on and off easily once you get them lined up.Its also water proof so you can wash it off after use but here's the thing, since it doesn't have the standard spinning blades inside a little compartment it doesn't collect all the hair and... shmutz like other trimmers do. So the clean up is easier and less dramatic.I have yet to have a pulled hair and while I've been nervous about it slicing the inside of my nose it hasn't happened yet. At first I thought maybe it was because it doesn't trim as close but honestly I can't see a difference between this and my old Panasonic. As long as you use it correctly (rotate it around the inside and make several passes) it does a great job of cleaning things up.Battery life seems to be pretty good so far but that leads me to my only hang up.Why is this thing not rechargeable? It makes absolutely no sense.I have 3 other trimmers, all rechargeable, waterproof, etc. I just don't understand the need for me to keep buying AA batteries for these things. And yes i know i can buy rechargeable batteries but wouldn't a plug be easier? I even have the Phillips Norelco Bodygroom trimmer and guess what, rechargeable! Same company, same general purpose... I'm sure it was a portability decision or something but man... sigh. end rant.Other than that I have no gripes. I really like this trimmer and will be keeping it with me. It has a nice carrying case that should make it easy to bring on trips and with all the attachments I feel pretty covered when it comes to clean up grooming.Definitely happy with this product. Just wish it was rechargeable.

Some products are just designed to separate people from their money, and this is one of them. The box contains about $3 worth of materials -- some colored pencils, 16 sheets of paper, an instruction sheet, and an envelope. The price you pay for the product also includes an additional service. When your very dedicated child has filled all 16 pages, using only his talent and a box of colored pencils, you can put the papers in the envelope and drop them in the mail. Later, a wonderful keepsake art book arrives in your mailbox, complete with a picture of your kid and a bio on the back cover. Very nice.Do you see the problem with the scheme? Most of the people who buy this very expensive kit will never mail in the pages. Most people's kids are not that talented, or that dedicated, or they get bored quickly, or nothing they produce is worthy of immortalizing in a book. Oh, I am sure some people will mail in the pages and enjoy the book. But I am also sure that a whole lot of other people will not. I will not, because I do not have any particular talent with colored pencils, or the desire to spend hours on such a silly project.The Crayola company is selling an expensive publishing job that only some its customers are going to use. It's a gold mine for Crayola, because they are selling more service than they actually have to provide. Every customer who does not mail in the pages represents a profit for Crayola.This is the kind of toy that looks like it would make a good gift for a kid, but I don't think the kid will like it. If you want to publish your kid's artwork, there are other ways to do it. I would pass on this one.

This is a lovely medium-quality scent that comes in a very nice bottle, but an ordinary box. This would make a nice Christmas gift, but be careful guys. Gifts have meaning, and this one has romantic significance. Do you want your lady love to think you are a inexpensive romantic? This might the perfect gift, or it might be too much too soon, or it might be too little too late. So tread carefully here, and if you are not sure, ask another girl.So, did I like it? Yes, very much! Revlon Love has a light floral fragrance that reminds me of exotic gardens in far away places. Did you ever see that movie Pandora? It smells like that.

It's a nice enough umbrella, but I wouldn't take it traveling! Amazon's targeting was uncanny on this one, since I am heading out for a prolonged winter vacation in the Pacific Northwest. I hear it's raining like crazy right now. But I am not taking the umbrella, because it is just too heavy! I have other umbrellas in the house that are much lighter, and if I felt like I needed to pack an umbrella, I would take one of those. But I'm not even going to do that, because I always try to PACK LIGHT. This device represents a lot of extra weight that I do not need in my luggage. I decided to pack a lightweight rain poncho instead.This umbrella would have gotten more stars if it had not been named a "travel" umbrella. It's a real good umbrella, just not for traveling.

Probiotics saved my life! Or at least they made my life liveable again. I won't bore you with the details of my adventures with C-diff and my long slow recovery. I'll just say that I am convinced I would not have recovered at all if I had not started getting serious about probiotics. My health finally started improving when I tripled the dose. I took a pill three times per day for months. I took probiotics with every meal. I tried every brand I could find. I took different brands at different times of day. I just overloaded my system with all the probiotics I could find, hoping something would colonize and stay in there. It worked! I am, mostly, recovered.I don't take massive quantities of probiotics any more. I just take one capsule a few times per week. I can't speak to the efficacy of this particular brand of probiotics, because it is hard for me to distinguish between them. Here is why I am giving this brand five stars. Here is what it says on the label: "Viva Labs Advanced Probiotics features a wide spectrum of friendly bacteria that colonize the GI tract to alleviate intestinal discomfort and provide optimal digestive relief. Our proprietary 6-strain blend features two of the most clinically validated strains available. NCFM and HN019 valued for their defense against immunity and ability to restore intestinal flora".I applaud the sentiment, even if I am not quite sure what it means. Is "defense against immunity" a positive? Anyway, I am glad that research is being conducted into the study of which probiotics have an ability to restore intestinal flora. That's the kind of information that is useful to know! Thank you, Viva Labs, for that bit of enlightenment on your product label.One more thing I should mention. After my months of intense probiotics, I noticed my finger nails are very hard now. They don't peel or bend like they used to. I attribute it to getting more nutrition from the food I eat. Probiotics are great! Take more of them, and you will feel better.

I am not fond of vampire books where the author tries to reinvent vampires. I mean, vampires are already a perfect literary construct. Vampires follow certain rules. They are destroyed by light, and they can't come into your house unless invited, for example. If you change the rules to suit your story, fine, but why would you call them vampires when clearly they are not?The real problem with this book was not just another butchering of the concept of vampire. The real problem was, it was nearly unreadable. I could not get in to this story. The back story was covered in the first few pages, and it made no sense to me. Gareth was alive and then he was dead and then he was alive again, and all the other vampires are dead, only some are back. Adele had powers and now she doesn't, but she might have some in other places. A confusing beginning.It might have helped if I had read the previous trilogy.
