Perhaps if I had gotten to know the characters I might have liked them. But I didn't know the characters because because right away, they sprang into action. They were running around fighting and solving problems before we had a chance to get acquainted. It was too much. So I would say this book has a problem with pacing, and a problem with character development.

This is a wonderful new invention, and kudos to the inventors who came up with something so needed and so useful. Leakiness is not a trivial problem, many women suffer and stay home alone because of it. To discover someone has been working on a solution is like the sun coming out on a cloudy day. It's like the clouds lifted and here comes the sun.The problems of  old women with an embarrassing problem are usually not of interest to anybody. Most people just avoid old ladies who smell funny. It can be lonely and depressing. But someone out there cared, and tried to help. That means a lot to me. Thank you kind stranger.I fitted myself with the #2 insert, and it fit comfortably and seemed to work as advertised.

This coffee station puts all previous coffee makers to shame. Everything about it is elegant, from the curves and angles to the stainless-steel carafe to the wonderful instrument panel. It has a modern, space-age look. It is shiny and clean looking. This will look awesome on your kitchen counter, and everybody who sees it is going to want a cup of coffee.Not only does this device look cool, it also performs flawlessly. I especially like that you don't have to measure the water. Just fill the reservoir and the machine measures the water for you. You can have any size coffee, from a big pot to a single cup.It comes with a permanent filter, a go cup, a frother, and a measuring spoon. You can make lots of great coffee drinks with the recipes in the included recipe book. I had a big cup of Hazelnut brew with whipped milk and nutmeg. Wonderful!This appliance appears to be very sturdy and reliable. Assuming the electronics hold up, it should last for years. So get yourself a modern coffee maker and invite the neighbors over for a cuppa. Yummy days are ahead.

These are tasty and pretty. The red and green colors are festive. Mine arrived in good condition, and not broken. The red container can be recycled or re-purposed. It is attractive and easy to spot.This kind of candy makes a nice casual Christmas gift. Perhaps you would like to give some to a teacher or your hair dresser, or the guy who delivers your paper. People like chocolate.

I wake up in the morning all congested. I put a teaspoon in 1/4 cup of water and gargle with this. I put a tiny bit on a spoon and inhale one drop into my sinuses. I am immediately cleared up, and stay clear for hours. I don't really drink it because propolis has antiseptic properties and I don't know if it interferes with my gut probiotics. I have problems with that, so I am a little worried about this product sometimes. It sure does clear up the sinuses, though!
It feels sticky, like you would expect honey on your face to feel. It's not really a sensation that I enjoy. I only used it twice. Sorry, this product is not for me.

This is a very pretty incarnation of the classic Claddagh ring. I wear it on my right hand, with the point of the heart facing my elbow. That means I am in a serious relationship, and not available. There are other meanings for the ring as well. Mothers can give these rings to their daughters, for example. It can traditionally be worn as an engagement or wedding ring, but in this century I think it works better as a promise ring. If you give it to a girl, say something sweet, like this:"This ring means I am offering my heart to you. Wear it for a while and get used to the idea. If you decide to keep my heart, we will find you a ring with a pretty stone. For now, let this ring remind you that you hold my heart in your hands.

This bag is practical and cute. I have this one and the onion sack as part of my Halloween decor. I built a diorama with a bale of hay, a scare crow, some pumpkins, and these bags. They fit in with the decor, and they are big without being heavy. You can fill them with something and put them on the ground, or you can hang them up as part of the background. They are easy to hang up, and they make your room look like the staging area for the Disneyland Jungle Cruise.Besides being a great decorating accessory, this bag is also suitable for actually storing produce. There is a center insert lining bag that buttons at the edges. You can take the lining out and wash the onion peels and potato dirt out of it. I think this is a smart thing to do, because burlap does not wash well. It's better to wash just the lining than the whole decorator bag.You can use the bag to store lots of things, like ears of corn, pine cones, apples, gourds and acorn squash. Or, as the writing says, potatoes.

This high quality backpack has the features and fittings of fine luggage. It is large, with just the right number of useful pockets. It is suitable for travel, including trekking through the Pacific Northwest on trains and ferries. There is plenty of room for spare clothes, electronics and snacks. The side pocket is very deep and it can be used for an extra pair of shoes. The large front compartment zips on a curve, meaning the bottom of the backpack is wider than the top of the backpack. This gives the backpack stability when it stands upright.I would say the backpack has a masculine aspect. By that I mean, the heavier zippers and rectangular zipper pulls are a style that men tend to prefer. In my experience, men do not prefer dainty or feminine looking bags. Women are more open minded. Both men and women should like this one.There is an unusual open pocket on the padded side of the bag where the straps are. It is an open sleeve that extends half way up your back. You can use this padded inner sleeve to hold your jacket. Just pull it through and fold it down, and your jacket is hanging nicely and not getting wrinkled. This is a much better idea than tying the sleeves together around your waist. You can also use the padded inner sleeve to attach the backpack to the handle of your rolling luggage.I would say this backpack is very well designed. The colors are a very tasteful gunmetal gray and dark brown. It is attractive with unique features. It seems to have no weaknesses. It should provide the lucky owner carrying satisfaction for years.

This is a nice doll. It has muscular arms and a waspish waist and an interesting personality. This doll fit right into our tabletop drama, and loved getting dressing up. After trying several outfits, we settled on a cocktail-length teal taffeta with sparkle chiffon trim. A borrowed mask completed the outfit and our hero is off to the ball. Will he catch the eye of the handsome prince? Will his secret identity be revealed? Stay tuned.

I have never heard of this character before. I heard of The Rock because of that movie with Sean Connery. But I never heard of Bray Wyatt. He seems like an unlikely super hero. I wonder why he is wearing an apron. Is he supposed to be some kind of cook?

This is a cute doll, but he needs to be taller if he wants to date Barbie. Also, he needs more outfits. His clothes barely cover him and they look ridiculous. Is this supposed to be some kind of action hero? Does he rescue people? Because, dressed like that, I am sure anybody he tried to rescue would be scared to death. Also, "The" is a ridiculous first name. His parents should have named him Rory or Ricky.

The bear company has a dozen styles of youth bow. This is the newest and most innovative. It features a rigid riser, flexible side limbs, finger guides, and a whisker biscuit.The central riser is heavy aluminum. It is uniform around the axis, meaning it can be successfully used by left-handed or right-handed people. There is an attachment for holding four arrows, but only two are included.The highlight of this model is the "whisker biscuit", which is a wonderful invention. It is a circular hole lined with course hairs. You put the point of the arrow into the circle, and the hairs hold it steady as you take aim. When you are ready to fire, the arrow head, and the shaft, and the vanes all whoosh right through the whisker biscuit in a straight line, and the arrow continues to travel in a straight line. It is an excellent way to shoot an arrow.A whisker biscuit is an upgrade on adult bows, but this bow has this very advantageous feature built in. Of all the features of all the bows, it seems to me the whisker biscuit is the most valuable one to a parent. It will give your kids that extra bit of help they need. Kids don't always take to a new sport like archery. They can get easily frustrated, which makes parents frustrated too. So we give them little advantages to get them off to a good start. A whisker biscuit is a little advantage that can mean the difference between giving up on archery and making a success of it. So unless your kids are naturally athletic and competent at things like this, do yourself a favor and buy them the bow with the whisker biscuit.

Like everybody else, I love the trimmer. Hair trimmer technology has moved forward by a LOT since the last time I bought one of these and I'm sort of blown away by the quality of personal care appliances these days. This thing is sleek and streamline. It performs like a fine Swiss watch. It will cut your hair flawlessly, and quietly, and it has enough settings and gadgets to satisfy any odd-shaped cranium.When my kids were smaller, I used to cut their hair all the time. You can save a lot of money (and in my case, barber-shop drama), if you cut your kids' hair yourself. It takes a little practice to get it right, but the settings and guide bars on this trimmer will be a big help. Start when your kids are young so they get used to it, and by the time they realize barbers exist, you have gotten good enough at the task to make them look good.

I have long thought Puma shoes have exceptionally high quality and this pair is no exception. The shoes are made of high quality synthetic materials that are flexible and comfortable. The soles are made from white rubber. The uppers are made from a variety of black textured fabric including a shiny stripe and some strategic mesh. There is a fabric lining with a decorative pattern. Although I have only had the shoes for a little while, they give the impression of being very sturdy shoes that will last a long time. The shoes are designed for running, but they are also great for walking and sitting.Comfort is one thing, but let's talk about style. I just love the look of these shoes. It is not easy to find black sneakers that are as cool looking as this. They have sleek, streamlined curves, mixed textures and subtle colors. The shoe looks grown-up and sophisticated, but it also looks ready for action. I love the "Ignite" logo. Of all the things a shoe can say, "Ignite" is probably the best. That's the kind of encouraging word you want to see when you put your shoes on in the morning.I think the sophisticated look of the shoe will make them popular with the skating crowd, but also with people who just want to look good in a comfortable shoe. Highly recommended, this is a beautiful pair of shoes

I was surprised when these arrived. I wasn't expecting them to be this nice. They come in a useful box with an angular cut that keeps them upright and together. These garden stakes are "craft quality". They are finely cut with perfect angles. They are clean with no dust or splinters. The color is very light beige, almost white. The wood appears to be pine, but I can't say for sure. The stakes are not made from hollow walnut, that is  the name of the company.You can use the stakes in your garden. They are tall enough for pole beans or raspberries. Just place them the right distance apart, and run strings between them. That's the most obvious use.Creative uses depend on the time of year, and the holidays are coming up again, so here are some suggestions. For Halloween, make a picket fence around comical tombstones in your front yard. For Valentine's day, glue big hearts on the ends and put them along your front walk. For Christmas, use the stakes to add strength and support to a nativity scene, or to hold up low strings of Christmas lights. For birthdays, make signs to announce "the party is here". You can also use the stakes to hold garage sale signs.So, there are many uses for these fine high-quality stakes. Admittedly, this isn't a product that everybody needs, but if you think you need them, you can buy these stakes with confidence, because they are very good.

This watch is beautiful. Is it practical? I don't know. It has four dials, one big one and three little ones. Two of the little ones are for the stopwatch, and the other one is to orient you in your day. In case you don't know if it is 3:00 am or 3:00 pm, you can figure it out by staring at the little dial for a while. Why would you do that? Frankly, I think you wouldn't, any more than you will use the stopwatch function. Those little dials are simply ornamental. The whole watch is ornamental. But what an ornament!This watch looks great on my husband. My husband is a big man, but he is not a flashy man. On weekends he likes to wear cargo shorts and one of those tee shirts with the three wolves howling at the moon. He's a casual, comfortable guy. But I see him as something more. I see him as a great man, the head of a family, a good provider, steadfast and loving. He is my ideal man and I love him.He wears the watch because he is in the habit of wearing a wristwatch. I don't think he knows how alpha it makes him look. But I know! I know my great man has a great piece of jewelry, and I glow with happiness when I look at this beautiful watch decorating his beautiful arm.

These are adorable! I have the orange ones, and they look like just the perfect thing for a Halloween party. They look great on my spider web tablecloth. They add dimension and color to a place setting. Your table will look great and your guests will be impressed.When unfolded, the napkins are large and soft. If there are any napkins left after your party, don't throw them away! You can separate them into three sheets of beautiful tissue paper, suitable for gift wrap. So you can reuse and re-purpose these excellent decorator napkins.

We loved this one! Darling daughter and I spent an hour building and rebuilding and reconfiguring our house. It is so much fun! One of the challenges is to get things in the right place, like get the windows on the outside and the furniture on the inside. Even when you get it right, you find another way to do it. It's hard to keep your hands off the building pieces. They are very appealing.The magnetic stickers are really cute and fun. You can put clothes on the girls and pets on the rugs and flowers on the walls and glasses on the table. It's great fun! Skyler and Malia are adorable dolls with cute outfits.This building kit serves as a backdrop to story telling and creative play. This is an excellent toy for girls.

Oh, I wish this story had gone a different direction. I like the writing style, and for the most part, the story was a page turner, but at the end it just kind of left a bad feeling. I found the relationship between Avelynn and Alrik to be unlikely in the extreme. What did these two have in common? Apparently, lust. He didn't rescue her, and for most of the book he wasn't there for her, and he chose his brother over her every time. Extenuating circumstances, yeah. Disappointing circumstances! Who needs a hero who isn't a hero? Who isn't even there? What does she see in him?The middle part dragged. The beginning promised action and Viking attacks and rescue from a forced marriage. But that didn't happen for ages. In between we had pagan rituals, sneaky trysts, and dirty sex. Icky sex. Leave-your-family-and-screw-a-thug-on-the-beach sex. With your best friend and co-conspirator giving you a lesbian hand job to warm you up for it. Yuck.What does Avelynn see in Alrik? I couldn't tell you. What does he see in her? Who knows. Apparently these two are not looking for the same human qualities in a mate as the rest of us.

Little girls love to have beautiful hair. It takes patience and a plan to pull off a cool hair style. This book is full of tips to a more beautiful head of hair. Besides the styles themselves, there are hair care tips and craft suggestions for headbands. These are fun projects for little girls to do with their mothers, and older girls to do with each other.The Frozen characters are popular and encouraging. Who wouldn't want to have pretty long braids like Anna and Elsa? This is a trendy theme and a great way to get girls to take an interest in personal hygiene and hair care. An excellent choice for girls. This book would make a great gift.

The shredded memory foam pillow is an interesting advancement in pillow technology. I had a memory foam pillow before, but it was too stationary. I like this kind of memory foam because it moves around. You can reposition your head during the night. It just feels better.That said, this pillow was too high for me. I am a back sleeper and I like just a little bit of elevation for my head. My husband, on the other hand, is a side sleeper, so I tested it out on him. So far, he loves it. He said his neck and arm feel better in the morning with the extra elevation and support from this thick, firm pillow. I have not noticed much snoring from his side of the bed either, so I'm thinking this is a pretty good pillow.There is a lovely bamboo-rayon pillow case that comes with the pillow. I suggest you use it, and don't put another pillow case over it. Don't worry, you can unzip it and wash it when you need to. The reason it is good is because it is a stretchy knit fabric that moves when the pillow moves. If you put a woven pillow case over it, you get a different feeling, like the pillow is firmer and harder. It sort of ruins the effect of the memory foam.

This is a quality Halloween prop that will help with your decorating. You don't have to put it on your table. You can drape it over a picture frame or a curtain rod or a lamp shade for a spooky effect. It is a higher quality mesh than the spooky cloth you get at the dollar store. If you have creative impulses, there is a lot you can do with this fabric.The picture shows a white lining which isn't actually there. This is a a mesh fabric, and as such it provides no protection at all for your table. If you are going to serve food, then you will need another table cloth under the mesh to protect the table. I suggest white vinyl under the black mesh.It's nice! It's good quality and attractive. Have fun this Halloween and do some decorating. It will put you in a good mood and get your mind off your problems.

I already have a professionally installed alarm system that is monitored by a service, and I also have a camera system plus extra locks plus lights plus dogs. I live in Las Vegas and that's how we like to do things here.I tested the Myfox system, and I have mixed feelings about it. It works, but it does not provide very much security. I would say it provides only a small fraction of the security I am currently used to. I live in a big house with lots of doors and windows, and having a security system that only covers a single door doesn't seem like much of an advantage. I think anybody familiar enough with my house to want to rob it would know which door the system is monitoring and simply choose another way in.I recommend this security system to people who live in apartments. I think this would be useful in a place where you only have one door. Then if one of your disreputable friends decides to make an unexpected visit when you are not home, the loud piercing siren will announce his intrusion to your neighbors, who will assemble in the hallway and hopefully beat him senseless. I can see this device being useful for a scenario like that.For someone like me who needs real security for a big old house in a bad old city, I think it would be better to invest in a professional system.

I have chronic abdominal pain from various surgeries, infections, and IBS. My digestive system is always disordered. Things come out, things bloat up, things hurt. You know what I mean. It is difficult for me to do abdominal exercises. Sit-ups make me burp, and they hurt.This felt great!! It exercised my abs without moving my intestines around. It also relieved the pain of the IBS! I used it during an attack, and it settled things down. My abdomen stopped spasming and started feeling happy. It was wonderful relief.I LOVE this device. I am grateful to Vine for sending me a review copy of this appliance, which I would have never tried for myself because I never would have thought of it. Now that I have tried it, I am completely hooked and I don't know how I lived without it.

This is my first experience with recreational EMS, and I am hooked. I am an older woman who has always exercised, so I have some arm muscles to begin with. I like to row a kayak, so I need strong arms. I find it more difficult to lift weights as the bones in my fingers and hands are delicate now and it doesn't take much weight to cause joint pain. I can't believe there is an easier way to build up your arm muscles! This is great.I found the system to be simple to set up and use. The battery needed to be charged, but otherwise it was ready to go. I had a little bit of trouble peeling the covers off the gel pads. Possibly they melted a bit in my hot Las Vegas mailbox. Be sure to fold the pads in half and peel from the middle. There are orange arrows showing you where to peel.Pads should not be shared because they tend to get icky when bits of your skin stick to them. This is a personal appliance, not something you would share with anybody. Let your roommate buy her own electrical muscle stimulator.The instructions recommend using the muscle trainer 3 times per week. I used it yesterday and my muscles ache today like I paddled 5 miles up the Colorado river. All that benefit while sitting quietly and watching television? It's like magic! I am so impressed by this mysterious but effective technology. What will they think of next?

I have a little experience with these Ultimate Body Presses as I had the Ultimate Body Press Wall Mounted Pull Up Bar installed for about 3 years before I removed it to install the Ultimate Body Press Ceiling Mounted Pull Up Bar, which I also received to review.  While I prefer the ceiling-mounted bars over the wall-mounted bars because of the wall clearance that you can allow for in how far you place the ceiling-mouted bars from the walls, the different Ultimate Press Body Presses for the ceiling each have their advantages.If you want a straight bar suspended from the ceiling, go for this product if you have 8' ceilings or if you have 9' ceilings, go for the Ultimate Body Press Wall or 9ft Ceiling Mount Pull Up Bar.  If you want a foam-padded angled bar, go for the Ultimate Body Press Ceiling Mounted Pull Up Bar.  If you don't know if you want a foam-padded angled bar or a straight bar without foam, I personally would recommend this product.  This one will last you a lifetime, whereas the foam-padded angled bar will require some maintenance in time to replace the foam.  The advantage of the foam-padded version is that it gives you ONE more grip position than this white version.  The foam-padded ceiling bar has wide, narrow and straight-out grip positions, whereas this white version will only allow you wide to narrow grip positions.  However, this product does not have any foam to break down and I can't see anything on this product needing maintenance or attention for the life of the product.  That's the advantage of this product - it's simple and will last a lifetime.  If you usually wear gloves, I find that this un-padded version is preferable.  The textured grip that is formed into the steel pull-up bar is enough to get a firm grip.  I found that the foam on my Ultimate Body Press Wall Mounted Pull Up Bar wore out after 3 years. It just begins to tear from the constant strain put on the foam.  Over time, it also became brittle and bits and pieces would scuff off on hands and gloves.  (It can be replaced with bicycle handle foam, but it's a pain to remove and replace).This is a beautifully constructed and finished product.  I think the white risers actually add a designer touch to the product, which is good if you are installing this product inside of the home as I have done.  It is just a tad nicer to look at over the all-black finish of most of Ultimate Body Press' products.  The welds and paint job are top notch.

I had previously been using the Ultimate Body Press Wall Mounted Pull Up Bar.  I actually took this unit down before I requested this ceiling-mounted version to review.  I found that we weren't using it because it was so close to the wall.  The wall-mounted version only allows you 13" clearance from the wall, which is way too little room and we were just scuffing up the wall with shoes.  I very much prefer this ceiling-mounted version over the wall-mounted version.  You can hang it from the ceiling at your desired location, and I suggest you allow yourself a couple of feet from the wall so you don't kick the wall (especially true for beginners). This way, you don't feel smashed up against the wall, if you care at all about your walls and their appearance.When I first assembled the product, I thought, like others, that the holes were off.  I tested both configurations for 16" and 24" rafters, and tried to "dry fit" the unit before trying to install it up on the ceiling.  When I assembled it for 24" rafters, the installation holes were 24-3/8" on center.  When I assembled it for 16" rafters, the installation holes were 17" and 17-3/8" on center.  This led me back to the instructions, and after reading them and reading others' reviews, I followed the instructions and first installed the brackets to the ceiling, and only then tightened the pull-up bar.  This method worked fine, as others have mentioned.  This is the key to installation - follow the included instructions.As with my previous wall-mounted product, the fit and finish of the product are top notch.  It has heavy duty tubes and plates.  I expect that the foam will deteriorate over time as happened with my wall mount version, but it is replaceable with some time and patience.  (It can be replaced with bicycle handle foam.)  I am very impressed with the clean welds, high quality paint job and what seems like thicker foam than my previous wall-mounted version.

We have 3 cats: one extremely playful who loves every kind of toy, one who loves bird types of toys, and one who doesn't really like any kind of toy.  Well, none of them like this Feathery Fury cat toy.  The extremely playful cat was intrigued for about 5 minutes by the toy, then lost all interest.The biggest problem is that the toy doesn't roll.  Two of the cats like to play soccer with toys, but they can't roll the toy because of it's odd shape.  We tried for quite some time to get them interested in the toy, but unfortunately it's a flop in our home.Update June 1, 2015: The cats have completely disregard the toy even though we have made many, many, many attempts to engage them with it since the initial review.  They are very unimpressed, even the most playful young one.

This is exactly what I was hoping for when I requested the product to review.  It works perfectly to light half of a standard size closet (in an apartment home). (See attached photo, which shows the product in use with no other lighting.)  I think you would need two for a full-size closet.It is sufficiently bright and the auto on/off feature works as you would expect.  When I say that it's sufficiently bright, I do mean that it's bright, but it's not the type of light that is going to blind you!  I actually wish that it would be a tad bit brighter, but it will work for most situations.It comes on when we slide the closet door open. It has a convenient plate to wall mount the light and comes with two very small screws and wall anchors.  Alternatively, it has magnets that should allow you to mount it to metal without adhesive or fasteners, for a temporary/movable light.I can't gauge battery life, but it does come with 3 AA batteries, which I plan to replace with rechargeable ones once they no longer work. I actually like the build quality and feels like a decently built product that hopefully will last.  (I will surely update if it dies, like I do all of my reviews of dead products...)

Update:  I have used this mat literally every single day since it arrived.  It has been many months now and I absolutely love this mat.  It has become one of the most useful kitchen tools and it still looks like it did the day it arrived.Original review:When I saw this drying mat available to review, I thought to myself: "Do I really need this? Am I really going to use it?"  I've used towels sine the beginning of time to dry the cutting board and pots and pans that don't fit in the dishwasher or have to be hand washed.  I have to say though that it is much nicer, handier and effective than I thought it would be.  I didn't really know what to expect before it arrived, but I am pleased with the construction of the mat, especially for the current Amazon.com price if I were buying it myself.  While I probably would not have purchased it on my own at first, I plan on buying one for my parents because it's an improvement on one of those daily household items, which can make life easier.I really like that it folds up to fit different spaces.  I have a small cutting board where I like to dry things and folding it in half works perfectly.  I like the grey color because it is not going to show water marks as much over time.  I have also really enjoyed the fast drying feature.  When my items are dry, I simply hang the drying mat over the oven handle to finish drying before folding the mat up and placing it in the drawer.  This drying mat really is a nice step up from the old dish towel.

The unit I got worked fine for about 5 weeks, then started going off.  The first time was in the middle of the night for no apparent reason (scared the bejesus out of us since the unit was in the bedroom).  I called First Alert and was told that I needed to clean the unit with an air duster monthly.  I went out and purchased a can and cleaned the unit.  I asked the representative if I did any harm by not cleaning it after 4 weeks and she said that I didn't and they have a 10-year warranty.  I reinstalled the unit with fresh batteries and it started beeping within an hour and then proceeded to do it about 3 more times until I pulled the unit off the wall and decided that I am returning it.  Based upon all of the positive reviews, I guess I got a lemon?  Also, the green LED is so faint that I couldn't see it unless I was within a foot of the unit.

I bought this camera several months back even before it was technically available on Amazon and I have a lot to say about it.  First off, I had some prior experience with the previous Sharx outdoor cameras when I installed them several years ago at a family member's house.  Sharx has really improved the cameras over the past few years.  I told them that I loved their cameras so much that I was going to write a review about them, so here it is.You will need some networking know-how to install these cameras.  They are not for those without any networking knowledge at all, or at least not for those without patience or willingness for troubleshooting, as with most IP cameras. Despite how much most claim to be plug and play, you will need to be able to work things out on your own.  It takes some time if you don't know exactly what you are doing.You may be trying to decide between this camera and another one by another manufacturer that looks very similar.  I would highly recommend that you aren't fooled into thinking that saving a few bucks won't matter.  Sharx customer service is by far and away the best technical support that I have ever, ever, ever come across.  (I have been tinkering with PCs since the mid 1980s...)  The folks (I think mostly guys) at Sharx are willing to answer any question you may have and they usually respond within 24-hours, sometimes much quicker.  The technical support that these folks provide is worth the weight in gold.  I can't say enough good things about them.  Their patience, willingness and accurate information has just blown me away, and I am really a hard person to please sometimes.  Their support is especially valuable if you haven't set one of their cameras up before, or any camera up before.  Even though I had experience, I ran into some small hiccups with my network and they helped me work out the kinks.As for the camera itself, the build quality is top-notch.  I absolutely love the wide angle 1080p image.  I am getting 15 fps.  It's so awesome that people have no idea that it is recording such a wide view...very deceptive.  People think that because the camera is not pointing at them that it isn't catching them.  I had to become very creative to pole mount the camera since I can't attach it to a wall.  I ended up getting a PoE injector that Sharx recommended and it has worked out well.  I'll probably come back and add more to this review as the details come back to me in time, but I wouldn't hesitate to buy this camera again. After running it on SecuritySpy on a Mac for a while, I have since migrated to BlueIris on PC.

This complimentary product came along at the right time for me to review as I have been shopping around for a convection oven for a couple years now.  Living in an apartment, we are limited with the regular 1970's gas oven.  For many things, the gas oven is ok, but if you are a baker or even if you just want faster and more even cooking, you often need convection to get the best results.  These types of ovens are great if you also don't want to heat up an entire wall oven for just cooking or reheating something small.  This oven excels at heating up quickly, whereas our gas oven takes about 5-7 minutes of pre-heating to get to cooking temperatures.My heart had been set on the Breville BOV800XL because I had done enough research to know that is really what I would put my own money toward.  I can't compare the two because I never got the Breville, but if price is a concern, the Breville is about 2-1/2 times the cost of this convection oven.  For many, that may be reason enough to at least give this unit a try.The biggest problem we've run into with this unit is just the sheer size of the unit.  It is monstrous and takes up a lot of counter space.  This is the biggest downside for people such as us living in an apartment.  If you are short on counter space, this is probably not the convection oven for you.  It is simply gigantic and I would recommend getting out your tape measure and making sure you have room before considering this unit.  It's great that the unit is so big because you can fit many and large dishes inside, but it's also an inconvenience if you don't have room to spare.The convection works exactly as expected and has provided results as good as we've been wanting from a countertop convection oven.The unit is a little on the light-weight side.  It definitely looks like it should weigh more than it does, but this has not affected the performance and in no way reflects my 4-star rating.  The main reason for a 4-star rating and not 5-stars is the aesthetic design of the oven.  Compared to the Breville's aesthetics, this oven is just not as pretty to look at on the counter.  This oven is functional, effective, if not basic looking.  If you don't want to spend a lot for a Breville, but are in the market for a very large convection oven, this unit is worth good consideration.

I have been through enough digital timers purchased here on Amazon that I've had to replace that I jumped at the opportunity to review these analog timers.  I still had a couple digital timers that I've been wanting to replace that these fit perfectly.  For my case (and I think most others), analog timers will work in 99% of most applications.  Only when precise timing is needed would a quality digital timer be preferable.  I have been through digital timers by Westinghouse, Coleman Cable, and Hydrofarm, among others.  From my experience, I think analog is preferable because there is less to go wrong.  While I no longer have any of the digital timers except the Hydrofarm left, I still have all of my analog timers by Woods and Stanley.Both of the timers in this combo have worked well for me.  My biggest complaint is that the white indoor timer allows you to plug in a grounded appliance or fixture, but doesn't have a ground itself when plugged into the wall.  This is not a big deal for lamps and small DC appliances which do not have a ground.  However, if you want to plug in an appliance which has a ground, and you want it grounded, this could be an issue.  The package doesn't advertise that it is grounded, but allowing you to plug in a grounded appliance is a little strange.  Most other non-grounded timers don't allow you to plug in grounded appliances or fixtures.  The black outdoor timer in this combo passes the ground through, so it's a non-issue for that timer.My only other complaint, albeit minor, is the construction of the black outdoor timer's housing.  I really wish that it had a better closing mechanism.  The timer that I received easily opens from the bottom since there is really no latching mechanism.  It could really be improved with a toggle latch buckle on the bottom, which I may install myself.  I wouldn't let this discourage you from purchasing the combo as the timer works as intended.

As someone who is a little DIY-inclined, I shy away from electrical because of my fear of house fires.  Around where we live, it seems there's a report every month of a house fire starting from suspected bad wiring.  This is enough to make me very hesitant at wiring myself.However, this Lutron MSCL-OP153M-WH Maestro switch was as easy as can be, especially if you are installing it at a single-pole (only one switch connected to your lights) switch location.  For my case, I installed this in the bathroom and after cutting the power, I only had to connect the ground from the current switch to the ground on the Lutron Maestro, then connect one of the switch wires to the black terminal on the Lutron Maestro and the other wire to the brass terminal on the Lutron Maestro.  It doesn't matter which wire goes to which of the two terminals (black and brass). That was the extent of installation for a single pole location.  They include wire nuts as well in the package.The instructions detail installation for multiple-pole locations as well, but I didn't venture into those sine it was more than I needed.  Installation appears to be more complicated for these installations.Lutron made the programming as easy as possible as well.  I also really love the flexibility of this switch.  After pulling out a tab on the bottom of the switch, you enter the programming mode and they made the programming itself very simple.  Each of the features of this switch is easily programmed separately.So far, this switch is performing as expected and I couldn't be happier.  The dim on and dim off function is so nice.  It has been working perfectly with my newer G7 Power Eureka LED 22W (110W) 1600Lumen BR40 Recessed Light Bulb, Dimmable 3000K Soft White Light.

These are a really great way to put a hasty identification on your kids.I use these when we are going out in large public places and these work really well. Ink stays on and doesn't smear, bands are easy to apply to multiple kids quickly.We are on our second order and intend to continue ordering these.

This is super easy to install car vent mount which holds a phone in position well. The cradle is fantastic: it looks great, was a phone tightly and symmetrically, and has two little nibs at the bottom and hold the phone in place. The tightening nut on the back works great, and tightens phone cradle to your preferred angle and keeps it there. There is a little lateral movement due to the design of the item, but it isn't especially noticable.I highly recommend this car vent mount.I received this item in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is a very well constructed car mount. The suction cup adheres to windshield are very well, the tightening nut on the back of this mount is very solid and keeps the phone in place at the right angle very well, and the star of this set is the cradle which not only looks great but has great function and spring and symmetry.This unit also has an air vent adapter which works almost as well, with the exception that the engineering at the air vent allows for a little more lateral movement than the suction cup.I highly recommend this car mount and agree with the previous reviewer that this is one of my favorite car mounts of all time.I received this item in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I'm not a usual listener of New Age music, but I enjoyed this album a lot. Three aspects of this album that I noticed throughout the album:- The tempo is very slow relative to music I might regularly listen to- The piano is prominent: always very clear and bright - there isn't any muddiness to the voices on this album- This album is very consistent with its voices, piano, piano pad, violin, chorale voices, only deviating once that I remember with a lead saxophone voice (that wasn't especially strong relative to the others)Three standout songs on this album that I would recommend listening to first:Track 7. Albinoni's Secret Smile: Albinoni AdagioTrack 8. Memories of the Ice Cream TruckTrack 11. A'la M'ode to Joy: Ode to Joy (this is high praise as Ode to Joy sends me back to the youthful despair of piano lessons)I found the complexity of the playing in the final third of the album to be the most enjoyable part of this album.Make no mistake - this is an album for a specific audience of listeners. And for these listeners, this is a great album which increases in complexity as it progresses.

This is a really great diffuser. The instructions are easy to follow (all you need is an essential oil and water), and it the aroma of the essential oil is effectively spread throughout two or three rooms in our house (depending upon where we put it). It's got an elegant design and the lights are a really nice enhancement.The only caution I would offer is that this is not a super durable item. Our kids are obsessed with it, which we learned upon unboxing and continued when we first used it. I would recommend placing this where little hands cannot reach it.I received this product in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This is a very cool solar lamp. The brightness is good: we could even see the light to the box when the light was delivered. This illuminates a very small area outside, and it would be advisable to purchase at least a few of these in order for it to be particularly useful for most homeowners. That said really enjoy the technology and enjoy the look and intend to buy more. I received this item in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is a fantastic pair of earbuds. The sound is comparable to Apple earbuds, these look nicer, the stay in your ear better, they really great for working out or just listening to music on the go.I will say that I do not think that audio files and especially informative description of this product. The auto quality is on par with most earphone products, but is not anything exceptional.I received this item in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
Is a great sleep mask. It is padded, dark, comfortable, and's very tolerable to wear overnight.I received this item is just my honest and unbiased review.

***UPDATE October 1 2015***I mentioned below that the battery level indicator had not been updated - and while that is technically true, in iOS9 the battery level percentage is given much more accurately in the notification center pull-down.  Simply swipe down from the home screen and right there under "today" it displays both your phone's remaining battery and the Jaybird X2's in percentage points.  Very useful if you are paranoid about running out of juice.*** =ORIGINAL REVIEW***You want the best Bluetooth earbuds? Wondering if these X2's are worth the extra cabbage over the already stellar Jaybird Bluebud X?  At first glance, the X2 seems to be a minor cosmetic upgrade from the Buebuds X and in some senses that is the case.  After testing these out (as much as you can in a couple of weeks) I'm pretty sure they are the way to go.  I was actually sold as soon as I fired them up - right out of the gate the new sound blew me away.  They sound so much richer and are even louder than the old model, and all the other little improvements are just gravy.  Sweet gravy.So, they are louder and sound better.  The battery also lasts a little longer.  My old X's usually last 5 or 6 hours.  I've yet to run these out after 6 and I just charge them every other day out of paranoia.  The second biggest improvement is in the microphone.  Whereas before I dreaded taking calls on the X.  I'm not even sure my wife realizes I'm using these.  The Bluetooth connection is (seems) better - I've never had problems before, but I've had zero drops.  They look better - they are basically the same "Frankenstein Bolts" design, but they've done away with the chrome accents in favor of matte black (that's what I got anyway).The company didn't redesign the physical earbuds much at all, actually.  Of course I wish they were smaller, but this is still the most compact Bluetooth design out there (as far as I've seen).  Once they're in your ears they disappear - to you at least, as long as you don't try to lay the side of your head on a pillow.  Jaybird has improved the "wings" supposedly, but I've never needed those.  I use foam tips and they hold them in amazingly well.  The nice thing is that they've packed in a whole set of foam tips this time around.  In fact, ComplyFoam has designed a new line of tips specifically for Jaybirds.  They do have a noticeably wide "stalk" and it took a little magic to get even the biggest cored tips to fit.  Unfortunately they haven't yet made a Tsx version (my fave), so I'll probably keep on using those, but the new green ones are easier to install.  They are available only from Jaybird as of now, but the folks at Comply told me soon you can order directly from them as well.There is also a case which is just about a as pointless as the old case. However, the included flat micro USB cable is the same great cable that came with the old model.Two more gripes: the instructions are now mostly online.  The packaging is just as extravagant, but somehow they decided to get rid of the nice booklet that had detailed steps to fitting and using the included strap-shorteners and other convenient-to-have info.  Now there's just a tiny card and a suggestion to visit them online.  Second, they didn't update the software to improve the battery level readout.  On the iPhone at least, the battery strength is displayed on the screen next to the Bluetooth symbol.  But it's only got three settings: full, part full, and running on empty.  I've used others that have 5 or so levels, wand it was more useful (partly because the battery didn't last half as long).The voice-feedback works identically to before: a nice female voice tells you when you've connected or if you've powered them on or off and a few other things - it sure beats interpreting beeps.  The controls have changed a little though, they no longer beep every time you change the volume or the track.  I guess it's better?Really, the new sound signature and better battery are enough to make these worthy of an upgrade.  The rest really is not such a big deal.  So if you want to save $40-$50, the old Bluebuds X are still a great option, but these are the way to go if you are starting from scratch or just looking for the best.  If you've never used Bluetooth buds before you are in for a treat - wireless is so much more convenient in every way, especially if you commute or exercise or ever listen through headphones.  And these are the most wireless, best sounding buds there are.I got mine for free, but I've bought so many pairs of the old ones I think it's buyback time.

Metal straws - I use them for drinking smoothies just like the one in the picture.  Haven't rusted or bent after months and months of usage.  I clean them with soap , water, and the included brush.  Saves us from wasting plastic straws or having no straws when we need them.

These tweezers look like the real deal, but they don't grab as well as Tweezerman.  My wife actually likes them better than I do, but I have been frustrated with them because they flex a little too much and it seems to compromise their gripping precision.  The set is nice, with the three types of tweezers and the case is also very classy.  My problem is that they just don't quite work well enough for me.

I really like the form-factor of this portable battery.  The rounded rectangular shape feels great in your hand and fits in your pocket or in a bag without cluttering it up.  It looks better than it should, and the included charging cable makes it so much more convenient than a battery that requires you to carry around an extra cable just to use it.  My only gripe is that the included cable only charges at the lower power, so if you want to use the high-powered port you do need that cable.  Not the end of the world, but it would be nice.I get easily two iPhone charges out of this, but I've actually only rarely run it down to nothing so it's hard to say exactly how many it hold in real life.  Frankly, you might want a bigger battery for heavy travel or a long time away from an outlet, but for a long day or two away from the wall this should come in really handy without weighing you down.

My cats love this more than I ever could have imagined.  It's definitely a little bigger than I expected, but it's about as nice looking as a cat-scratcher can look.  So unique looking, in fact, that it's a bit of a conversation piece.  That, and the fact that the cats like to lounge on it like their own sofa, make it totally worth the trade-off in size versus our old scratcher.  Also, the catnip bag that was included drives them crazier than our old supply.

If the charging dock actually played music, then this would be a near-perfect basic clock-radio.  It would still be bare bones, but it would do everything it looks like it should do.  You are probably still going to want a real stereo, but the sound is pretty decent, it even seems to be stereo from two separate speakers.  Certainly good enough for bedside news podcasts and low volume music.  The clock works as advertised, so do the alarms.  It's small.  It only gets FM, and the lights aren't backlit or textured, so you'll have to memorize their functions in the dark, but at least the snooze bar is oversized.  Best of all, it's $13!  You can buy something nice when you get a new phone with a lightning connector.  It's just annoying to have to plug in that audio cable, and even more annoying to have to unplug it or yank the clock radio off the table.  There's also no battery backup, but it's only $13!

Brand new out of the box, the charging via the USB port didn't work consistently.  I tried it with several cables and several devices, and sometimes the charging would work, but most often it would just sit there and not connect.  We had bought it so that we could use it with the 30-pin connector now and the lightning cable later when my daughter upgrades her iPod, but it's not nice enough to to put up with the lightweight crappy build at this price... for a third of the price you can get a 30-pin only clock radio with the same limited functionality and mediocre sound quality.  I was hoping this one would work but I returned it rather than trying to get it fixed or exchanged - it just doesn't seem worth the trouble.  Weird, since Philips usually makes pretty nice electronics.

This is such a good invention I wonder how it's taken so long to come up with.  The TP comes just like it looks in the picture - six squarish rolls in a package the size of four traditional rolls.  Because there's no center cardboard tube they pack down by about 30%.  It is exactly the same paper as Quilted Northern (luxurious), and once it's on the roller it works about 95% the same.  The difference is that the rolling isn't quite as smooth but it's perfectly fine.*NOTE* The Amazon web page seems to have changed since I received this - it used to clearly say it was "Quilted Northern Ultra Plush Bathroom Tissue", and the sticker on the packaging reflected the same.  If the product hasn't changed you should know it's some of the thickest, softest paper out there.The one minus is the slight difficulty of putting it on the roller.  Supposedly, you squeeze the outside of the roll and it should open up, but that didn't work so well for me.  I had to open it up manually.  Also easy, but I know my 7 year old daughter will be less delicate, and it will probably take a little getting used to for all of us.  It would be nice if there was a tab or something sticking out to make it more obvious.  Again, not a deal breaker, but that's why I'm not giving it the full 5 stars.If you are one of those classy people who forego the roller altogether and just keep your TP in a basket you'd be crazy not to get this.  I hope it saves a lot of trees.

If you are used to using Sonicare brushes these will probably feel a little strange at first.  The brush head LOOKS noticeably bigger than the standard Sonicare brush head.  When put side-by-side however, they are actually just a little bigger - at least the are that the bristles cover is.  The bristles on a Diamondclean head flare out more, while these have a bigger base but come out straight from there.  In your mouth, however, that base definitely feels bigger and bristles so, too.  I didn't have any problem reaching any part of my teeth or mouth, but it does feel very unfamiliar for a Sonicare - which is still half the size of a standard toothbrush.Brushing-wise, it's hard to say what makes these heads different, at least in a functional way.  The packaging has some pretty pictures of the brush head bending (the base where the bristles attach is made of a soft rubber-like plastic), but they don't go into any technical detail, and this webpage has even less.  I can't deny that my teeth feel as clean as they ever have for hours after using these things, but I always feel that way after using my usual "DiamondClean" brush head as well.  This head has longer, stiffer, bristles and it does feel like they got into the crannies between my teeth, so I am happy to have gotten these free for review purposes - they are all so expensive it's hard to justify paying even more than usual just to try something new.  I will try to get these again, but honestly, I would buy whichever brush head was cheaper.

Delicious.  Five large bars of creamy milk chocolate with just the right amount of almonds buried inside.  Classy gold packaging that would make WIlly Wonka proud.  The pictures don't lie, and whoever you give these to as a gift will appreciate it.  Unless they are allergic to almonds.

These are good colored pencils for kids, but they look better than they actually turn out to be.  The lead is actually pretty hard and it's hard to color in large areas - it's better for line drawing - so even though they are designed to appeal to youngsters they can be a little frustrating.  We only got the colored set, but I'd be interested in the black ones to just use as mechanical pencils.  Don't get me wrong - my 7yo daughter was pretty excited when she got them, and we have been taking them along for drawing at restaurants, but she prefers regular colored pencils when she's drawing and coloring at home.

This is a little bit on the small side for a bath mat, but otherwise it's totally worth the $10 if you like the color.  It's not particularly luxurious, and the "popcorn" texture is a curious texture for a rug that you will be walking on in bare feet, but I actually have come to like it.  It's also not particularly hefty and has no grip or rubber on the bottom so that it tends to slide around and bunch up a little.  DII Oceanique makes softer mats for the same price (the cotton ribbed version), but if you like a more raw style than this is the way to go.  Mine's a dark gray that pretty much matches the picture.

Very soft, feels almost silky underfoot. The wide ribs are cushiony and absorbent and also help the mat keep its shape. It's heavier than you might expect but not the heftiest little rug ever - great for outside the shower or in front of the sink. Very white as well. For $10 you can't go wrong.

According to specs, all Sonicare toothbrushes are essentially the same - they all vibrate at the same speed (31,000 strokes per minute) and can all use the wide range of available brush heads (except for the older Essence line).  That is to say, they are all incredible at cleaning your teeth and if you've never used one, you are in for a real treat.  The difference between models is sometimes negligible, and often more than a little vague - all the bells and whistles are of dubious value.  Often, the simpler the toothbrush is, the better it is - there's less buttons to break and less to pay for.In practice however, there are some features that may be worth paying for, but it really depends on your needs and the openness of your pocketbook.  I have been through several Sonicare brushes, and the model I was using prior to this one is the 2 Series, pretty much the barest-bone model there is.  I really like it, but I prefer this new HealthyWhite Plus (AKA Series 5) - not because of the buttons or features, but because I think it is actually built better.  Moving to the Series 2 from the model I had before, I had noticed (as had many other people) that the brush had a loud rattle (or buzzing) when it wasn't in your mouth.  It was a little distracting, but I honestly thought it had to do more with the brush head than the handle.  However, I immediately noticed with this new brush that the buzz is almost gone - and if you look at the photo I've attached you can see that the brush head sits significantly closer to the top of the handle than on the Series 2.  I tried them both with a variety of brush heads, and always got the same result: the new model is much quieter.  It's nice, but I really don't know if it's worth twice the price.This model has a few superior features as well. It has a "Quad-pacer" which alerts you every 30 seconds to change to another area of your mouth.  All the brushes have a 2-minute timer, and you can definitely do without the 30-second alerts, but it is nice just to note the passing time.  It also uses a Lithium battery instead of the NiMH battery, which gives it three weeks between charges instead of two.  Obviously that's better, but honestly, going two weeks is fine.  This model also has three power levels and a whitening mode.  Whitening is really just an extra 15-seconds of brushing that get tacked onto the end of the 2 minutes, and unless you have sensitive gums, you will probably never use the lower power settings. Philips touts this as "6 different modes" which is a really just the math of 3 power levels x 2 cleaning modes, and it's really nothing to write home about.I really like the new Diamond Clean brush head that is included with this set - but you can put any head on you like.  The charger and travel case are the standard-issue Sonicare accessories and will also work with most other Sonicare brushes.Really, it's the better build that has locked this in as my daily toothbrush, but if I had to pay (I was provided both these brushes free for review purposes) I don't know if I wouldn't rather pay $30-$50 for the more basic model.

Amazon basics lightning cables are easily as good as Apple's own.  Having used both, I think they may be even sturdier.  The cabling is slightly smoother than Apple's and a touch less malleable, but my Apple original cables have become gross and discolored and have started to fray.  Granted, they're older and have gotten more use, but I have used these enough to say these are plenty good enough.  They are "certified" so they should be completely safe, and for the price they are totally worth it.

This is a great kit to add to your kid's arts and crafts supplies, but it won't be the simplest or the easiest.  I'd actually give it 3.5 stars, but my daughter is on the young end of the recommended age (just turned 8) and she needs help using it, so I have to give the system the benefit of the doubt and the bonus 1/2 star.  She didn't take to it as quickly as her Rainbow Loom, but I think she will like it more as she uses it.Basically the kit contains a white plastic "spin loom", a lot of colored thread, a few other pieces, and a set of instructions.  The instructions are well done and easy to follow, and there are also video instructions on the web.  It seems like hours of creative fun, and the bracelets are actually pretty nice, although the big knots are a little distracting.The problems we had were twofold - the loom can take a lot of force to turn correctly.  It's almost a two-person job to turn the dials and move the twist threads properly.  Second, the threads are wrapped in such a way that they become tangled almost as soon as you start using them, and we had to throw out several feet of each one we used.  Maybe we'll figure both of these things out as we go along, but they made things a little frustrating.Bottom line: great bracelets, plenty of supplies in  the kit, hours of fun.

I'm basically just going to start with a transcription of my 7-yo daughter's reaction: "What?!  Awe-some!  Look mommy, Shopkins!  This is just like the one that Fiona has, but different!  Thank you, Daddy!"Next, her review: "I would say it gets 5 stars because it has two Shopkins and and a freezer section where you can put frozen Shopkins.  Also, I like the pictures of the ice-cream Shopkins on the inside of the truck, and I hope I can get those Shopkins.  It's awesome."The facts - this is a Shopkins themed Ice Cream truck.  It rolls, and the top opens and there are a few compartments inside that also open.  It comes with two Shopkins exclusive to this set, a couple of "cooler bags" for holding Shopkins, a spinning three-shopkin ice-cream cone stand, and a sandwich-board.  To an adult these look pretty cute but it is a little worrisone that the whole theme of these tows are "shopping".  However, after sitting and playing with them for a while I think I get it a little bit more.  They are about shopping in a similar way to a fake grocery store is - it's vaguely educational on the one hand in that kids are being exposed to "things", and on the other, these tiny dolls are really cute and inspire a lot of imaginative play that has zero to do with shopping.The packaging is heavily decorated but it all has to be destroyed to get the toys out and seems like a waste.  Seriously I needed scissors AND a knife to detach the truck from the cardboard.

This is not my usual cat litter - we usually go with one of the various "Fresh Step" varieties - but I was happy to test this out and have my mind changed.  Unfortunately, I am left unconvinced.  This litter did not seem to be significantly "lighter" than my old litter, and it certainly wasn't any "fresher", and I am dubious about the "unscented" claims as well.  In fact, I'm thinking maybe they need to scent it up a little.The best feature of this litter is undoubtedly the packaging.  The big jug with the large screw-off cap and opening is incredibly convenient compared to the cumbersome box that I am used to.  It's easy to carry and easy to pour, no matter how full the container is.  It's what's inside that's the problem.  The litter itself is a dark to medium gray (darker than Fresh Step), and it clumps perfectly well, but I noticed a poof of dust every time I'd pour some out.  Not the end of the world, but I think the claim for 99% dust free is a real stretch.  The picture that accompanies the "dust free" claim on the jug is of cat's paws, and I will agree that I didn't see any paw prints around the box, so they may have me there.My biggest issue is with the scent.  Even before the cat used the litter I noticed a slightly disgusting acidic smell.  It was worse after the cat had used the litter.  I have never noticed that smell before using my old litter or any other litter that I've tried.  It didn't keep the cat out of the box, but it does really bother me.I will possibly try one of the scented varieties because I do really like the jug, but I will probably avoid this type from now on.

This shampoo/conditioner is just fine for kids of all ages.  My daughter is 7 and has long, thick hair and we used this daily after coming off the beach this summer and it worked as advertised.  It's nothing fancy, and whatever scent "surf's up" is, it is pretty minimal bordering on odorless (unlike the strong grape and watermelon scents of some of the other 2-in-1's we use).  Sometimes it took a second rinse to really get all the suds out, but that is probably due to her full head of hair.  We had no issue with stinging of the eyes or anything else.`

This is a classy planner in the classic style.  Hefty "leather" binding, smooth and pleasant off-white paper, elastic strap to keep it shut, and a nice ribnbon page-holder - it is pretty much exactly what you are hoping for.  The book stays open and lays pretty flat, but won't fold over itself - this is a trade-off I will happily accept over the spiral-bound variety.  My one gripe is the weekly layout, which goes Monday-Sunday, and actually I've started getting used to it.  Otherwise, the monthly spreads are nice, and there's plenty of space for notes and detailed scheduling.it is on the larger side - just a little smaller than a letter sized sheet of paper, and obviously twice that when open.The circle on the cover is just for decoration as far as I can tell.

Not black - it's gray.  It feels like soft-touch plastic.  It works, but I wish they offered it in actual leather like they used to for the full-sized iPads.  Maybe it will last longer than those did.  It's still the best case to quickly and easily and most unobtrusively cover, protect, and turn your iPad mini on and off.  Adds very minimal bulk and folds away and into a stand when you need it.

I got this to replace a truly premium leather case that unfortunately just couldn't hold up to months of use and was coming apart at the seams.  This one sacrifices some premium feel for sturdiness and should last for the rest of the life of the 5s (if I can't find a better one).It is much more leather-like than the Apple official "leather" snap-on case.  That's what I care about - I want something that replaces the cold glass and metal in my hand with a soft supple natural and grippy surface that is a pleasure to hold.  So, it's better and I would give it 3.5 stars if I could - it just about gets the job done.  But calling it "premium leather" is comical.  It does seem like genuine leather, but it's stretched so thin that it is not particularly soft to the touch and it falls short of adding much of the desired grippiness that would keep it from sliding off of your dashboard or center console.It looks nice and the fit is perfect - it also seems to be built reasonably well - the outer ridge/lip is actually capped with plastic, which will probably help it stay in decent condition, but does distract a little from the leather feel of holding the case since your fingers are always touching the hard plastic edge.If looks are enough for you to forgive some lesser leather, then the price is right you will like this case.  Obviously, it primarily protects the back and sides and you should get a screen protector for the front.

It's hard to find a decent leather case that actually feels like leather and gives your iPhone that extra bit of luxurious grippyness.  So many are advertised as genuine leather but feel stretched so thin that they might as well be plastic.  This case is definitely not plastic - it's a thick (almost too thick) piece of suede-like tan leather glued to a plastic shell that protects the sides and back of the iphone 5/5s.  It's not exactly the softest piece of leather, but it is a lot better than most.  The nice thing is that as I've been using it it has taken on a nice patina from the oils in my skin, and I think it's just getting better looking.  It also truly feels like a natural material in the hand, and as it ages will become more unique.The problem I've had with other cases like this is that the top edge is sealed with something other than leather.  Some are rimmed with a piece of plastic, others with a strip of rubber.  Inevitably, this is where the problems start as the case comes unglued.  You are constantly touching that part of the case and, inevitably, this is where the problems start as the case comes unglued.  This case wrapes the leather all the way around the top edge and completely seals the few exposed ends with matching tan plastic.  It SEEMS like a much sturdier option, and there are no obvious places where this thing will start to unravel.That same lip of the case actually rises a hair above the front screen and provides a small level of protection to the front as well.  If you lay your phone face-down, the face will not actually be touching the table.The only complaint I have is that, while the case is very snug and isn't budging as all, it almost seems to be tiny bit too small for the phone.  I mean, it fits, but the edges seem to be a straining a bit, and I can still see a bit of the metal band on the inside edge of the case.  Honestly, this may be the design of the case, and I'm just used to other cases, which are thinner and fold over that strip a little more.I got this to replace another leather case by Waxhaws, which was better leather but just could not stay glued.  I just need this to last another 10 months until my contract is up, and it looks like this is going to last and stay classy the whole time.

Great shoes for golf - not so great for anything else, even though the cleats are removable.  Very lightweight and pretty much waterproof - I haven't worn them in a downpour but on wet grass they've kept my feet completely dry.Fit, obviously, is very subjective, but I can't help but think these shoes run a little small.  I didn't think they ran narrow but I did feel like they are a little short.  I'm usually a solid 11 in NB and these were a little snug in the toe-box.  However, they're "microfiber" leather so will probably stretch with use.Very bright white, but clean off easily.  When you are on the lawn they as comfortable as any sneaker.

Typical Aqua Sphere quality, exact same fit as normal non-polarized Kayenne goggles.  The polarized lenses were amazingly useful in the bright sun and clear waters off of Miami, they cut the sun and glare and left me with a clearer image than the simpler dark lenses.  So comfortable and for all intents and purposes leak-free - I can wear these goggles for extended periods of time.  For me, totally worth spending almost twice as much on these over the Kayenne with "Smoke" lenses as I plan to use them exclusively for open-water swimming.The Kayenne lenses are larger than the Kaiman models, and their triangle shape moves the bridge a little higher so it doesn't pinch my nose (which is of the larger variety) at all.  Obviously, goggle fit is subjective to the shape of your face, but these are quickly adjustable (with the quick/one-handed clasps) and the rubber is supple and adapts to the curves of your face.

Once you get a Sonicare toothbrush you will never go back to regular brushing.  So what makes this brush different than other Sonicare brushes, and why would you buy this one over another?  It's a slightly complicated question but it's worth asking since you will most likely keep and use this brush for years so try to get one you like.I believe all Sonicare brushes (except the "Power-Up" series) have a top vibration mode of 31,000 strokes per minute, and all of the brushes except for the "Essence" line can swap out their brush heads for whichever style you prefer.  So basically, all the differences come down to the handle style and handle features.  Many of those differences are pointless and only a few are really even necessary, so I usually opt for the the simplest model - they're usually cheaper and frankly, there's less buttons to break or deal with.This Series 3 brush is great and has a somewhat unique set of features.  It's got the same newer slim handle, and the main feature here is that it has three cleaning intensities designed for cleaning sensitive gums.  I've never had a problem using the full-intensity mode, but my gums are relatively healthy, but I do like the new lower-intensity settings for just cleaning the gum area.  To set the intensity you just press the button twice quickly and it advances to the next level.  Next time you use the brush it will revert to the last intensity used - not sure if this is a great feature or not, because I then have to cycle through the settings to brush and back again to clean my gums.  BUT, if you have sensitive gums it's probablyu worth it.There are two other significant differences between this model and the basic Series 2 brush.  First, this model uses a Lithium Ion battery, as opposed to a NiMH, which should give it about a third more brushes before it needs recharging.  I have both, and to be honest, I have not noticed much difference.  Both brushes seriously go for weeks without charging.  It's amazing actually, so while a longer battery is nice, the other model is no slouch.  Second, this model has the "Quad-Pacer" timer, which takes the normal 2-minute timer and beeps/pauses briefly every 30 seconds to prompt you to move to a different part of your mouth.  Frankly, if you're a grown up you should be able to keep track of which of your teeth you've brushed, but I like it just because it keeps me aware of how far into the 2 minutes I am.This model does include a travel case and a charger (the same charger that comes with all Sonicare brushes), and one special gum-centric brush head.  Supposedly it's rounder and shaped to be good for your gums AND teeth.  Whatever, I like the Diamond Clean heads, which also claim to stimulate your gums.I have noticed that with these new models there is more rattle noise than I remember in my old (broken) FlexCare model.  Just a little, and it's not in the handle.  With no brush head attached they just emit a low hum, but with a brush attached it gets loud until you put it in your mouth and start brushing.  Once the brush is pressed against your teeth, even a tiny bit, it quiets back down.  It's the same in this model and the series 2, so I think it's a function of the new style of brush heads.Cleaning wise, this brush seems identical to the cheaper Series 2 and the more expensive FlexCare models. Meaning that it's excellent. Only if you need the sensitive-gum treatment modes is this particular model a must-have.  There is a more expensive FlexCare model that also features three intensity levels.Great brush all around.

NOTE:  I actually have both the 7 port and the 7 port +2 hubsThis is a very sleek USB 3 hub, and it works perfectly well, however I might have been hoping for more than it can reasonably be expected to do. The short review: if you need a USB 3 hub this is pretty ideal.  If you want to use it for mixing USB 2 and USB 3 and charging higher-amp items like and iPad, you should definitely get the upgraded model with the two charging ports, but even that is a little problematic and you might need to upgrade to  a thunderbolt dock or something (more expensive) like that.The documentation is particularly minimal and what there is leaves a lot of questions unanswered.  Will attaching USB 2 and USB 3 items together to this hub slow the performance of the USB 3 devices?  What power is supplied to which ports?  When I initially ordered this hub I could have sworn it mentioned two of the data ports could do 2.5 amps (for an iPad), but now there is no mention of it anywhere - not on the device or the packaging (so maybe I was imagining it?).  Do the two "charging ports" on the deluxe model also provide data transfer? (that answer I could test for myself easily: NO.  This leads to a more swapping of cables, which was what I was trying to avoid by installing this hub).Physically this is a very nice hub, but it has a few design issues that make it less than perfect.  It is sleek and slim and nicely built, BUT the arrangement of the ports makes it impossible to really take advantage of it's small size.  Specifically, the ports are on four sides of the hub, meaning that if you use them all ( and you have to use at least three) you get an octupus (octobus?) type of arrangement of cables coming out of it, and it is very hard to get it to stay in place.  The power cord attaches on one side, the input attaches in the back, and the seven USB ports are on the front, and the charging ports are on the other side.  I would have much preferred to have the power and input cords at least attach in the back together, and the charging ports to also be on the front - that would make it longer if you kept the spacing the same, so an even better arrangement would be to incorporate the charging ports into two of the USB 3 ports and mark them clearly.Also, while not as frighteningly large as some of the reviews make it out to be, the wall-wart power supply IS pretty big and will take up two or even three outlets on a typical power strip.  However, this is only the case fr the 7 port hub without the charging ports - the UH720 model actually has an in-line power brick that plugs in with a regular-old plug.  There's still a big power-supply, it just sits in the floor instead of in the outlet.SO - if you need this strictly as a USB 3 hub you are good to go.  I attached two USB 3 hard drives to my iMac and noticed no degradation of transfer speeds from having these attached directly to the computer.  The problem I see is that if you mix USB 3 and 2 they will all work, but it is much harder to determine what happens at that point.  Certainly the USB 2 devices work fine (this hub and USB 3 in general is backwards compatible), but I've heard that on some devices mixing the two will bring everything down to the slowest speed, and the problem is that many of the devices I have are not USB 3 - even Apple's lightning connector cables are  USB 2!  Note that I have not noticed any real slowdown yet, but I'm not really sure how to easily do that.  Add that to the complication that these ports do not supply enough power to charge more power hungry devices like an iPad anyway, and it seems like I'm back to needing a second hub or messing with the cables every time I need to charge or sync an iPad.
