As I mentioned before, the extra charging ports are great for charging, but they don't provide for data-exchange with the computer.One more note, and a contradictory one: it is nice to have the dedicated charging ports in that sometimes you don't want to do a data-transfer (or automatically launch iTunes).As everyone else has mentioned, the hub is very nicely built and requires zero installation beyond plugging it in (with the nice 2-foot long included cable).  I'm definitely going to continue using the 7+ hub, but will keep my eye on it for transfer speeds and charging configurations, which I will update you with here if anyone is interested.  A lot of the problems/issues/questions I have could be addressed with better documentation - and I have looked on the TP-Link website and at the downloadable documentation and I am still not sure - even the wording "actual transmission speed is limited by the setting of the device connected" is unclear (I understand that USB 3 will not speed up USB 2 devices, but does USB 2 mess with the transmission speed of USB 3 devices connected at the same time? it depends on the internal wiring of the hub, which is not mentioned)

Short answer: this basically turns your iPad Air2 into a laptop.  The iPad itself snaps into one side of the case and can then stand up like an open laptop (at one of three possible viewing angles), close like a clamshell, or fold the keyboard behind for a more typical (albeit heavier) tablet configuration.  It works pretty much flawlessly.There's basically two easy steps to setting it up: snap the iPad into the case and pair it to the keyboard with bluetooth.  It took three seconds total, the snapping-in portion being by far the more difficult part.  Pairing was almost too simple - there's no power button and the keyboard went into pairing mode automatically when I had the iPad in the case.  Then, every time I needed to type something I just used the keyboard.About the keyboard itself - it's great.  The keys are surprising solid feeling for such a slim piece of hardware, and have a nice bounce and click to them.  I did find I had to make doubly sure I pressed the space bar, but I quickly adapted to it.  It basically looks like a Macbook keyboard BUT there are a bunch of keys that are specific to an iPad and are incredibly useful.  Among them are the "Home button" which brings you back to the main iPad screen, the "App Switcher" function button, a "screen Grab" function, and volume and track control.  All truly great, and there are probably a few more that I haven't figured out yet.  One thing that is lacking is a comprehensive instruction manual - there's only a double-sided instruction sheet printed int the tiniest lettering and it only covers the basics (but in several languages).Once your iPad is in the case and you've used it for a while you'll find a few other nice physical touches.  The buttons are all exposed and accessible, as are the speaker, headphone and lighting ports.  The keyboard turns on and off automatically when it's closed or folded behind the tablet.  The magnets that hold the ipad up as a stand work very well and there is no sliding or give when in use - but it's also very easy to close, making the whole system very versatile.One excellent thing that I like - and this is a function of Bluetooth, not specifically this keyboard - is that even with the keyboard attached via Bluetooth you can still attach Bluetooth speakers or headphones.  It really just seems like your iPad has turned into a laptop computer.  It seems very sturdy and high-quality as well.There are only a few things that I don't love about this case/keyboard:I wish there was a "send" button.  When I type iMessages the Enter button acts as a carriage-return, and I still have to press send on the screen.  This is one of those things I wish there was an instruction manual for, as I feel like there must be a way to do it that I can't find.I would like to be able to rotate the iPad in the stand.  If I launch a vertical-only app (like instagram) I have to turn the whole thing 90 degrees.  I understand the "Pro" version of this keyboard allows for that, but this doesn't.  There might also be some poccasions where having the iPad vertical would work better anyway, and you really can't do that with this case.  Not a deal-breaker, but it's a little awkward.Lastly, it's heavy.  Or, to be more exact, it turns my amazingly light iPad Air2 into a much heavier device.  I don't actually know that they could do much about it, as the keyboard is amazingly thin and the battery lasts for (up to) 6 months on standby, and the physical keys are great as they are, and the part that holds the iPad is open-backed, so I don't know how they could trim much weight out of it.  It's just a fact that it really adds a lot of weight, which is nice when it's being used as a laptop, but not great when being used as a tablet for any extended amount of time.  The only thing I think they could do about it is make it easier to pop the iPad out of the case - right now it takes a few seconds of fiddling around and twisting and pressing the case with a lot of pressure.This is a great option for a keyboard and stand for your iPad Air2.

This is a nice looking - but not beautiful - sound bar that is primarily meant to improve the sound from your tv and also serves as a speaker system for all your stereo needs in a medium sized room.  It will definitely sound better than your tv's built - in speakers but, honestly, will not beat out a more expensive set of speakers and an amplifier.  It fits pretty much perfectly with a 46" television, but would work with any tv with audio outputs.The pictures here don't lie - it's basically a long back rectangle capped at both ends with a bluish tinted metal section.  The cap on the left hides the power cord and the cap on the right houses all the inputs and the control buttons and (small simple not-annoying) indicator lights. Included in the box is a remote control, a simple wall-mounting kit, and one rca cable.About that cable: my new Toshiba LCD tv doesn't have an RCA output so it's useless.  I can only imagine that a lot of new tv's can't make use of it, either.  That's the audio cable with a red and a white plug on each end.  You can split a headphone output with another type of cable, but I got a TOSlink digital audio cable to take advantage of the better audio.  It would've been nice if one had been included - a basic one is about $7 at Amazon.Three are several inputs on this thing: the RCA input, a digital optical input, a stereo mini/3.5 mm (headphone), and Bluetooth.  So you can pretty much attach it to your tv, your phone, and something else simultaneously.  You can use the buttons on the unit or the remote to switch easily between them.  Depending on the connection and the device you can either use the volume control for the device or the volume control on the remote.  Bluetooth setup was a breeze and the range was great - I had my phone in the next room with no dropped signal.The sound from the bar is great for what it is, and it will be a major improvement for your tv.  It's small for a sound bar, so you could probably get a better one if you had a larger tv, but compared to all the Bluetooth speakers out there it's huge, and it sounds a whole lot better as well.  We use this to play music all the time and it's great.  We have not quite figured out how to control the volume with the TV remote, but I think that has more to do with the TV settings, so we are using the small remote for volume in the meantime .

This is like a buff that they wear on "Survivor".  It's a seamless loop piece of stretchy fabric about a foot long and a foot in circunference (I guess).  Useful for all the things listed in the  product description, but I use mine almost exclusively for snowboarding - fits great as a face mask and a neck warmer, or even a head wrap.This Bob Marley themed piece advertises your love of reggae music and no one will doubt how chill you are.  FOr some reason, no matter how I fold it the maple leaf is always visible.

*POST-SKI TRIP UPDATE*  My wife wore this jacket for a week of skiing in Utah.  Granted - 4 of 6 days were in the the high 30's and sunny, but this jacket worked flawlessly, and even garnered compliments from a hired pro and ski-shop workers and friends.  She also found that the hood is indeed roomy enough to fit over a helmet when adjusted properly, which is not so useful on warm days but is always nice on a windy chairlift.  On the colder days this was a excellent outer layer, and if it had been even warmer she would've gone without the liner so this is a no-brainer for a ski trip. This is a very nice looking jacket if you like the dark-purple color.  The shell material still has a softness to it that belies it's weatherproofness.  It almost feels like suede, and is very nice to touch.  In fact, despite it's purplishness this jacket is quite stylish, and my wife got compliments left and right on it here in New York City's latest wintry mix of snow and ice and rain.She is wearing it for the winter weather now, but really we got it for an upcoming ski-trip.  We've worn Helly/Hansen jackets for skiing for years and were happy to take them up on a free upgrade.  Unfortunately, after wearing it around for a while I think we are a little disappointed... not in the construction or the style, but the I am afraid the design leaves a few things to be desired for real winter sports.Basically, this is a 3-in-1 jacket - the shell and the lining can either be worn separately or zipped together to make an insulated winter jacket.  That part all looks and works great.  It's reasonably warm, and the windproofing and weatherproofing seem top-notch.  The outer pockets are lightly lined and officially qualify as "hand-warmer" pockets, but they could be cozier.  The hood can be operated one-handed and the zippers all have nice long pull-tabs for gloved operation.  Cuffs and the waist are all easily adjustable and cinchable, and zipping in the liner is pretty straighforward, and once it's in it feels like it was built in.All that sounds great, right?  The problems are really that there seem to be some things left out that would make this a better winter-sport jacket.  Mainly, the lack of inner pockets and a detachable powder-skirt are making my wife less than thrilled about wearing this on the mountain.  There's nowhere to stuff your gloves (not to mention goggles).  Even if you leave those out, there is no great place inside the coat to stuff a phone and a wallet.That being said, the coat is versatile and it's nice you can wear it in different configurations and will work in a range of conditions.  And it will definitely keep you dry and pretty warm.It also runs a little small - we'd usually get a small but the medium fit better.

This is a cute tin that looks exactly like it does in the pictures, except you can't tell exactly how flat the characters and props are.  They're basically 2-dimensional cutouts.  I guess the point of the whole thing is to set up a little display scene.  I'm not sure about how safe the fake snow is, and I'm definitely not sure what makes it "re-usable".  I added water and it fluffed up, and three months later it hasn't returned to it's pre-fluffed state.  I guess they mean it's "continuously usable", in that I can keep using it until it's all blown away or poisoned us all and we're dead.  In other words, your kids will love it and it will be a staple of your holiday decorations for years to come.

very nice set of basic markers for your whiteboard.  We use these for my kid's easel, NOT for work, and they're pretty good for that.  Actually, it's nice that they are office products in that they're built for work and not for play.  The tips are tough and stay sharp, and there's plenty of ink unlike some sort of toy marker set.  The downside is that the colors are just basic.  Two blacks (nice), one red, one blue, and one green marker.  They all have no-roll caps and a chamber you can peer into to see the ink levels.The nicest things about this set are actually the extra items.  My daughter immediately remarked on the "awesome eraser" and using the cleaning fluid her white board is as good as new.No real smell, and it all washes off skin pretty easily.

It's winter now, and in New York it's freezing, pardon my French.  I jumped at getting a free tube of this cream because it's exactly what I need for the wind and sun and generally miserable conditions that  await me every time I go outside.The cream is soft and smooth and practically odorless - I don't know exactly what makes it "FOR MEN" - maybe the other Nivea products contain perfumes?  Applied to the exposed parts of my face it has protected my from chapping and sunburn.  It feels great and works really well.  Occasionally I'll use it at the end of a long day if I have dry skin.The 2.5 oz bottle is actually pretty big - if you order three for $20 it seems like a decent, if not great, deal.  I imagine that three tubes would get you through a whole winter.Come summertime I don't know exactly how helpful this will be... SPF 15 doesn't cut it for sunbathing, but it will be fine for daily protection.  I can't yet vouch for the water-worthiness yet but I'll try to get back to you.In short, great stuff, doesn't irritate, and protects  your skin in multiple ways.

This is the smallest printer/scanner I've seen that isn't some sort of weird mini printer.  You give up a few features, like automatic double-sided printing, but all the compromises seem minimal for the smaller footprint, especially considering just how rarely I need to print things nowadays.If you, like me, just need something for the occasional printing and scanning job and not for hard core office work, then this may well be the printer for you.This printer wins the size war by ditching the paper tray for a more old-school pop-up paper-feeder.  Usually, you leave it collapsed and tucked away, and when you need to print something you extend the feeder and drop in some paper.  You can certainly leave it open, fed, and ready to go if you feel like it, but that does make it a little less classy.There's minimal set-up involved - it connects to your Wi-Fi network and can be accessed by any computer/phone/tablet on that network.  I believe you can even print remotely using the app.  Set-up via the front panel was reasonably straightforward, and I have had zero issues printing from or scanning to the computer (iMac).  It's AirPrint compatible, so it will print from an iPhone without any third-party apps.Print quality is pretty good - great for documents, and completely acceptable (if not spectacular) for photos.I hope it lasts forever and I never have to buy another printer.

An incredible little flashlight, you'd have to have no soul to not be a little fascinated by how bright and sharp the circle of light is.  It's tiny, fits in your pocket easily or clips to your belt (although the clip is flimsier than it looks), and I have had no issues with the battery at all.  It's sturdy as they come, too. I literally dropped one into a burning fire pit and fished it out (because I was afraid it would explode or something), and it still looks and works like new.I have one for around the house and for travelling and everyone who comes into contact wants one for themselves - and it's cheap enough to give it to them and just order another!The ONLY shortcoming is that the button, which used to be metal and is now rubber, is a simple on/off switch.  Other Coast models will light up temporarily with a half-press and stay on or off with a full press, which is a nice feature.

Hadn't thought of it before but the first time I used this on fragile wine glasses I realized that it's dangerous to use such a hard-handled brush.  The metal handle was constantly clinking and threatening to break my favorite glasses.  Truth be told, I didn't ACTUALLY break any, but I was being very careful.  The head is pretty big as it is, so when you get it in there to clean out a tall glass you can't help but bang it against the glass rims.Otherwise, it's just like the other OXO Dish Brush, just more expensive and slightly better looking.  Non-replaceable head, bristles that inevitably get bent and discolored, and a small hole for hanging - which is too small for the hooks on my dishrack.Also, even thought the steel is nice looking, it's hollow on the underside, so there are sharp (not knife-sharp, but not easy-on the hands, either) edges.  Water and much gets stuck up in there.

Vacuums, amiright?  So many to choose from, so many compromises, so many gimmicks, and all for something I don't even want to use anyway... and they never last!I want what everybody wants - something that makes cleaning easy, and that means it actually cleans, and cleans as many surfaces as possible as easily as possible.  AND, I've decided not to go for broke and buy one of the ridiculously expensive models because they seem to break just as often as the ordinarily expensive ones.  Also, I want a bagless model, as the last thing I want to do is EVER run out of bags.Enter the the Hoover Wind Tunnel Bagless Cannister...REASONS TO BUY:1. Price is right2. Cannister style (preferred by my housekeeper and easier on the arms than a heavy upright)3. Bagless4. Powered Bush-Head (and other useful tools)5.  Wind-tunnel design with HEPA filters.The early results are in and I think this is a pretty great vacuum.  The power-brush-head is something that seems to be harder and harder to find, especially in this price-range.  A lot of other models and brands feature a carpet-head, but it spins the brush with only suction-power and I have found that inferior to a truly mechanized brush that really beats the dust out of your rugs.Everything works well and is very ergonomic - the extension wand is sturdy and the the whole unit seems well-made.  It took me a few minutes to figure out how to dissemble the dust canister (you need to empty the inner filter as well and it's kind of hidden in there), but once it was back together it snapped right back into place.I have yet to have a problem with overheating as a few other people have mentioned (which worried me), but I do agree that the extension cord is shorter than I would like.  However, the auto-rewind works very well.  I really like that the rewind and power buttons are both foot-operated (big buttons that you step on) and that saves my back a bit.  Also, there's a notch that lets you stand the wand up when you're not using it and saves the thing from crashing to the floor.  There's a strange three-way attachment for corners and curtains that is a little odd - you flip it around and pull it open to use different features.  I'd rather have separate tools, but these work fine.I hope this is the last vacuum I ever buy, or at least it lasts long enough for the next revolution in cleaning to come along.

Job One when making a tissue box should be making sure that tissues can be pulled through the opening.  Unfortunately, that Job One was not really successful with this model.  Look closely.  The opening on the top is a small square.  Now look at your box of tissues.  The opening is probably a long oval split down the center.Looks pretty, you just have to give your tissues an extra tug and and expect them to get a little torn up in the process. The rattan is nice and solid, and seems sturdy.

Functional?  Yes, but otherwise this is a pretty ugly bag.  Maybe ugly isn't the right term - it's NOT stylish, and it's not dorky-chic, it's just plain dorky.First, it's larger than you might think - about the size of a legal pad and more than three inches thick with the external pockets full.  The main compartment is padded and has one internal divider.  As such, it will definitely hold just about any tablet and then some.  Easily fit a magazine and an e-reader as well.  It's much more than a sleeve with a strap.The two external pockets are good for keeping your chargers and other accessories, and everything is built well.  Zippers seem strong, there's fake-leather detailing and reinforcement along the edges, and the strap is long and easily adjustable.It's just very "blah" and utilitarian, and really won't be good for holding anything else.  My wife is strongly suggesting I never take it outside the house.

Does what it says it should do - and does it well.  Attach the little machine to the outside of the grill and run up to four probes (two are included) into your meat and you can then see the internal temperature from inside your cozy home or wherever you might be within reach of the bluetooth signal.  That signal works reasonably well and I had no complaints.  It won't work while you're in the cellar two levels below the grill, but it will work on the other side of outer wall or across the deck.The app will let you configure temperature alerts for individual steaks, all without ever lifting the grill.

This is a "Lightning to USB" cable, designed to work with the latest iPads and iPhones out there, and designed only to work with those.  It's certified to work safely by Apple, even if it's made by Belkin - a company that generally has a good reputation as a competent technology manufacturer.  That being said, there's no guarantee that it's as good as an actual Apple Lightning cable, but in life, are there really any guarantees?PROS:cheaper than an Apple cablemultiple color choices (mine is black/dark gray)A nice selection of lengthsCONS:stiffer than an Apple cableI've had ZERO problems with it, using it intermittently for a few weeks.  The thing look s good as new and my Phone charges up exactly as it does with my white Apple cables.  I've had no problem with breakage or fit - the Lighting end is exactly the same size as the Apple version, so it should be compatible with most cases.  The plastic is definitely stiffer than the Apple cable, and maybe that is what causes some breakage for people after months of use, and it might be a little more inconvenient in longer cables.For a backup or extra cable, I don't think you can really go wrong with this - at least not for the price.

Does your cat like crunchy treats?  Specifically, will your cat shun every soft treat but act like an addict for a Temptations?  Then this is another you can add to the list of treats your cat will love and love you for.Really, these are nothing more than a spherical version of Temptations.  They're basicallequal in diameter to the width of regular treats, but where those are pillow-shaped, these are little globes.  The picture on the bag would imply they are May e marble-sized.  But they're not.  As such, they roll and bounce on the floor slightly more than the regular style, but you would never throw regular treats so who really knows?  They don't roll that well, but they have a knack for disappearing before the cat can find them, only to reappear as soon as you walk by and either crunch into the carpet or jab your foot like a ball bearing.My cat loves them I'll probably get more

This is pretty much a perfect gift for a six-year-old girl who loves Lalaloopsy.  Mine squealed with delight when she saw it.  It's not so perfect for adults though, as I dreaded immediately the thought of her getting those markers and stamps all over herself and things other than the doll.We tore it open and got started - the markers worked but I fear they might not last too long.  The stamps worked too, and there was less color rubbing off than I thought.  Things were easy to erase with the sponge, but the ink seemed easier to wipe off the sooner you acted.It's very cute, and your kid will love it.  We've used it several times and it's still in good shape.

I am a long time beginner guitar player.  I know some scales and chords and can pick out a few songs, and would never pretend to be a real musician.  I play my guitar for fun - and unfortunately this thing was just not very easy to enjoy using, at least not straight out of the box.  It's not exactly complicated to set up or connect to an iPad, it's just a completely different process than connecting anything else.  Also, the included instructions are sparse.  What I wanted was a nice friendly brochure that would really lay it all out : "Welcome to your new JamStick!  Let's get you up and running!!!", but really it took me 45 minutes before I understood what I was dealing with and could get a handle on what I might be able to do with it.  It's very customizable, but the instructions are on the website and you need to download some new firmware and it helps to understand guitar to know how you want to customize it.  I just wish that the default settings were better so I could have played it first and dug into tweaking it later.In short, I can't vouch personally for the advanced user - but reading all the reviews seems to indicate that this is a great tool and instrument for musicians and ambitious beginners.  For a casual player though, I really think it's just a little too daunting.The packaging and build are great, I look forward to taking it on a long vacation where I cdan really dig in, but at home I'm just going to keep playing my acoustic guitar.

This is a very colorful map/puzzle of the USA - pretty much exactly what it looks like.  I was hoping it would help my young daughter (and me) learn about the 50 states, their landmarks, and whatever else might be shown on the map.  It's about 3 feet x 2 feet, which is much bigger than our other 50 states map.There are  few problems here though, that make it impossible to recommend this map:1.  It may have "50 magnets", but they are NOT all states.  There are magnets for the Great Lakes, but a lot of the smaller states are lumped together.  I guess they couldn't be bothered separating them, but it's hard to explain why Long Island isn't part of the New York piece.2. The magnets don't work very well.  Texas and Florida just keep sliding off and everything else wiggles out of place if you breathe in its direction.3.  the board warps.  This probably goes a little towards explaining the magnet problem, but it's a serious design flaw - and it's dry as a bone at my house, so it's not due to moisture.Otherwise, it's a pretty map, with lots of interesting information and you could stare at it for hours and see new things in it all the time.  The quality issues are going to send it to the trash heap sooner rather than later.

Took a little adjusting to settle into the groove of this book and the new selection of characters and viewpoints, but it was totally worth it.  It's a slow burn that builds up to a gripping end that may lack the punch-in-the-gut shock of the Red Wedding, but was incredibly compelling and fascinating.  It expands and deepens the world of Westeros, while completely ignoring the goings on in Esos (except for the Braavos).  If you liked the other books there's no reason not to tear through this one.For the TV fans out there, this is the first book that covers events yet to occur on the show - although there is a little overlap.

I wanted to love this, and really there's nothing technically wrong with it if you're using it a certain way, but it's got a couple of flaws if you - like me - are hoping to use it for cutting down on chargers and cabling while travelling (or even at home on a bedside table).Basically, this is a brick about the size of a big pack of cigarettes.  To it's credit it's very solidly built and feels like a high-quality piece of equipment.  The downside of that is that it's big and heavy.  Even the cable is heavy-duty and takes up a lot of space.  At one end there are four USB ports that are high-powered enough to charge four iPads simultaneously.  You can charge four of anything (that uses USB) easily providing you have the cables.I had read the promo material going in, and understood it was designed for an office or classroom environment, not specifically for travel, but until I  had it in hand I didn't understand exactly what that meant.  It really is a bit hefty to lug around in your carry-on baggage.  I packed it in my checked luggage and broke it out at the hotel, where it worked perfectly well for charging everything - although the charging maybe seemed a little slower than I expected (I could be wrong though, I wasn't being scientific).The other issue I have with it is how closely-packed the USB ports are.  If you are just plugging in USB cables, I don't think it will be an issue.  But if you have anything bigger it will either block the other ports or not fit at all.  For instance, I have a portable battery for my phone and there was really no way to charge it on this without some sort of extension cable.If you don't mind carrying it or don't plan on carrying it or have plenty of space, this will be for you.  You still need your own cables, but I charged up an iPhone an iPad Bluetooth headphones and a Kindle all at the same time, and only had to find one available outlet in the hotel room, which was great.  But not great enough that I would bring it in my carry-on.

Aqua Sphere goggles are clearly quality goggles, built and designed to be excellent for all sorts of swimming.  Still, goggles wear out, and I still manage to go through them, and I always go back to the Kaiman and Kayenne models.This new "EXO" version of the Kaiman is no exception.  Almost exactly the same as Kaiman, but made with a softer-yet-more-durable material that is designed to be worn for longer persiods of time.  They definitely feel softer and more gummy to the touch, but I have noticed very little functional difference.  They don't leak, stay reasonably fog and scratch free, and are very easy to adjust.This model has the new little levers for adjusting the strap - not the little squeeze buttons they used to use - and they hold tight and can be worked one-handed and quickly.  It did seem like the actual strap was shorter than usual, but still fit around my head - just with less extra handle flapping around.

This is the child-friendly version of the normal Sonicare electric toothbrush.  And as such it is an all-out excellent device for cleaning teeth.  If you shell out the money for it, your kid will love it, and will probably like brushing more than with any other toothbrush.  It's hard to argue with brushing when your teeth are so obviously getting clean.The main feature of this brush is a slightly smaller handle than on an adult-sized Sonicare.  It's not small, though.  It's a kid-grip friendly rubbery blue handle, with a removable face plate that can be decorated with one of the included 8 stickers.  There's also a second sheet of stickers that can be used to decorate the rest of the brush or just for further personalization.Ours came charged enough to use right out of the box, which is what my daughter wanted to do.  The included instructions are a little sparse and it was kind of confusing to determine what the lower button was for (the top button obviously turns it on and off).  I really could have used some sort of "WELCOME CHILD, TO YOUR NEW TOOTHBRUSH!!!" guide or pamphlet.  Instead we were digging around on the flimsy 4-language instruction paper, trying to figure the thing out.  Basically though, the brush has two child modes - a one minute timer that vibrates at a lower level, and a two-minute timer that vibrates a little more vigorously.  You can choose one with the the bottom button, and both modes have an ease-in period, where the vibration is ramped up across the first two-weeks of brushing.  At the end of the minute/two minutes, the brush makes a cheerful chaime for a job well done.This model comes with a single brush head.  The stem it mounts to looks the same as the one on my adult Sonicare, and I'm sure you could swap it out/replace it with any Sonicare brush.This is a premium piece of hardware, and it feels as well-made as any Sonicare I've seen.  it should last for years and years, and the charge should last weeks at a time.  You and your child will not regret getting one.
Beautiful quality with rich vibrant color. Arrived sooner than expected. Package was torn but garment was not damaged. Warm, cozy, attractive.

Wonderful, warm, soft jackets - excellent for cold weather. Purchased 4 in small. The dogs love them, like to wear them even in the house. They close with one long strip of Velcro which makes the easy to close but allows less variability in tightness. These parkas are very easy to put on, and have front leg sleeves which make them much warmer and stay on and fit better.  The hood glops over their faces so it works better with them snapped back.  The color is more beautiful than the photo - I would not really call it green, but more of a golden metallic khaki. These jackets are far more beautiful than expected.You really won't know how they fit until you try them on. With 4 dogs who fit small range, the jackets are plenty roomy except for the girth part. They are much too small to wear Mediums. The jackets don't close completely on all the dogs but the Velcro adheres well enough to keep the jacket on. 3 of the dogs have either T-shirts or GOIBY fleece vests that they wear underneath.I can let the dogs out in the fences in yard to do their business and play even in nippy weather without feeling guilty or worried.

These are beautiful jackets, very sturdy and finely made down to every detail. The appliqués are beautiful. They are tighter across the chest and abdomen than other Small GOOBY jackets that I have purchased. I cannot close all 3 snaps, however they stay on anyway and the dogs seem to like them. The denim is very stiff; they wear thin GOOBY T-shirts underneath. I am hand washing them now - hope they will soften up, They may stretch over time.

Adorable shirt, purchased 3 in small red. It is beautifully made. Every seem is good and the "rhinestones" are smooth and well attached. It says machine wash, but I will hand wash anyway to preserve it. I have 3 Chihuahuas under 5 lbs. and they can all wear it. The smallest one is really a size XS, but this still works well.  The quality of these shirts and other GOOBY products is reliably EXCELLENT.  The question with GOOBY clothes is exactly how each item is going to fit.  These are very good for layering with a jacket.

This is a very cute T-shirt, very well made. It has some spandex , is cut tighter than some other Gooby XS.  Even with the size charts, you actually have to try these on your toy dog to know how they're going to fit.  This is snug across the chest but not too tight for my 3 lb Chihuahua. It came with a slight chemical smell, probably due to the plastic skull design. I was able to purchase this as an Add-0n which was a great savings in price.

The color is so pretty that I receive compliments. The material feels like excellent quality and the sewing is good. It washes and dries well.  I am a woman who wears a size 14 jacket. Normally I purchase a medium in men's knitted tops, but chose a large for this so that I can wear another shirt under ur if I want and not feel that my movement is constricted.  Suggest going a size up from your usual shirt size for that roomier fit.  I wear it nearly everyday, and have washed it and dried it a few times and it looks new, no pilling. I have ordered another one in deep pink.

These beans feel and taste as if they have not been cooked much at all. I have to cook them over 10 minutes in the microwave for them to be edible. Black beans from the dollar store at a fraction of the price are much easier to use and better tasting.

Beautifully made, colors are lovely and true to photo.Wash well in machine and dry on delicate.A Design flaw is how unreasonably large are the holes for the front legs.Some of my Chihuahuas wear these all day long in the cooler weather, as well as outside, either alone or with a Gooby parka or vest.I am spoiled by the Gooby quality and simple elegance of design, and choose not to buy other brands. I buy dog clothing fir functionality, not cuteness - though am very pleased that the dogs do look cute. When I let them out in the very large fenced in yard, there is a flurry of vibrant colors .One tiny dog who shivered all the time would not keep any clothes on - except for this fleece vest in lavender. She seems much calmer and happier now, is smiling all the time. She can tolerate being outside longer in the cooler weather.I do wish that Gooby had a size in between XSand S, and S and M. The farmers do not adjust much.These are sized for TOY DOGS.  XS fits my 3 lb dog well though his leg may come out , it fits a 4 lb fits snugly. S is roomy on a 5 lb dog, M is roomy on an 8 lbs. dog.Part of the fit depends on the dogs shape. My dogs are slim and athletic. When I had chubbier dogs they needed a larger size even though the total weight was the same.

This fits great for a very tiny dog. The first day he was a little stiff legged in it, but shortly was able to run and frisk as usual. Sturdy. Attractive. Washes fine in machine.Goody small dog coats, vests and shirts are sized for toy dogs.  The only way to tell if a certain garment will fit is to try it on.The Velcro tends to gather stuff which can be picked off.The hood rooks very nicely and flat into the collar. My tiny dog really likes wearing his coat.He can wear it over the Gooby fleece vest or on its own.My only complaint is that there is nothing in between XS and S, and between S and M.Some of my dogs really are in between. There is not a lot of adjustability.I am going to try the bomber jacket with the stretchy chest area.Be alert for great sales in Gooby via Add-on; the reductions are real.
Works great for storage. Shipping, moving - just wrap around any item including large furniture several times - even kitchen if needed. STICKS VERY, very well. Quick delivery, good price.

These are very nicely made and quite cute. I am moving into a communal living setting, and need to have something proper to wear under my bathrobe when I go out for a cup of coffee or to let the dogs out. This barely buttons over my chest, is tight over the hips. No size 14 was available. This appears as if it would shrink considerably if washed in warm water and dried on high (which is what I like to do).  Good price discount.

i purchased this for a tiny Chihuahua puppy. The size and construction are good - however, unless he stays really tiny I will have to move up a size.  May choose a Sherpa bag instead for the medium. I have another Chihuahua pup weighing under 5 pounds and he is too big for this. It is very light, has nice fluffy padding and a shoulder strap.

I am extremely please with these window shades which come in packs of 2. I was quite suspicious when I received them, and wondered what I had been thinking. They are great! One side is something like a durable Saran Wrap, and that is the side that adheres to your window. The backing to it is black mesh that feels fairly strong, and the entire rounded rectangle is edged by a black fabric frame that must have flexible metal inside. I have 2 sets  - one for each front side window and 2 for the windshield. I don't bother folding them up, just stick the Saran Wrap dudes together so that that don't get lint on them or get damaged, and set them on the passenger seat. Really helps to keep car cool.

I wanted a clear jelly type case for the back and sides of my new iPhone 6Plus. Arrived quickly. Easy to open. Extremely easy to put on the phone. All of the openings match up exactly as they should. Easy to use any controls. The sides are easy to grip. Price is much lower than the stores, though I think that it has gone up $2 already. I pay about $13 per month insurance for my Sprint phone which I am buying on installment rather than leasing with unlimited everything for $50 per month. if I did not have insurance, I would be buying an Otterbox or anything as close to a tank as I could get. These devices cost around $1,000. This way I get to enjoy how pretty the phone is without making it too large. I will probably purchase a tempered glass piece for the front for about $10.
Simply much too expensive fr a drovloyj. Ther ort of the alternatives for a fraction of the price.
This is a good, sturdy bag. Te color is natural canvas, not whte. It only one bag fo the &66 dollars - a reduction gro&99, but still too much They are extremely durable, but hard to keep very clean.

Works perfectly for me. This is my second one. The first one was also without flaw. I got up one night while sleepy and dropped the whole unit on the kitchen floor with a major crashing sound. When I picked it up and shook it, there was a rattle inside and of course it didn't work. Even though I had been satisfied, I decide to try the West Bend "chrome" electric can opener. That opened four cans and then quit on me. Harrumph!!!I went right back and ordered this - what a relief! Feels solid and no problems at all with operation. I eat a lot of food packed in cans that I purchase mostly from Amazon - mostly canned fruit and black beans. It's fun to use and avoids putting stress on my hands. No mess at all. The price is excellent.  This is much better than the $40 can opener that I have to return. I do not use it on cans with a pull tab. Does not take up much space on the counter, and is attractive. It is weighted well - making it more stable during operation and most likely sturdier than some other lighter ones.
Totally delicious, elegantly wrapped, fresh, a major bargain. Nice for a gift or for yourself. Costs a lot more even at discount stores for 48 count. Contains chocolate and ground hazelnuts.

Very pleased so far, have been using them for more than a week. This tip is firm and is covered with what looks like metal mesh. Makes good contact with devices with no marring or scratches. They arrived quickly by Amazon Prime.Metal container is cute and protected them well in shipping. They are not fancy and they WORK. I had just purchased some much more elegant styli for $19 and the tips crushed and then fell off as soon as I started to use them. The utility of these was refreshing, hard to go wrong at $3 apiece. If a problem arises, I will amend this review.As the reviews vary greatly from one to five, I am wondering if they work better with some devices than others.I am using mine with iPad2 and iPhone 5 with excellent results.

I have purchased these several times and like them a lot. I usually pour off the liquid and leave just a little for taste - without some liquid they are very bland if served by themselves. Good protein addition to a meal for vegetarians and vegans. Do not cause (me) any flatulence when the liquid is poured off. The price is good for organic black beans, but does cost more than regular Goya canned black beans from the supermarket. Costs about the same as twice the amount of Goya canned black beans.The main attraction is ease of delivery. The cans do not have a pull tab, and need to be opened with a can opener. Good staple to have in the house.My last delivery was the first time that a can was badly dented. I but it in a container of water to see if any bubbles came out, and none did. I thought that I would be able to eat it, but once the can was opened the thought of eating something that might make me sick made me gag. Once in my life I got food poisoning and the pain was beyond description, lost 15 pounds in a week, and 2 months later lots of hair fell out plus muscle wasting. I will ask company if they are willing to send me a replacement can.Just called Amazon; consultant Tanisha was excellent. A partial refund for this order has been credited to my account. All's well that ends well!

For those viewers who already have interest and some knowledge about the Rosenberg case, this is an invaluable addition. The granddaughter was pleasant to watch and listen to, seemed very open-minded and interested in finding out the truth about her grandparents' activities and motivations before and after arrest. This also shed light on other players in this shameful failure of the US criminal justice system, including Julius Rosenberg's brother who falsely incriminated him (and admitted so later) and a colleague in the Communist Party who was imprisoned for 19 years for refusing to falsely incriminate Julius Rosenberg.  An aspect of which I had been unaware was that the Rosenberg's had been wonderful parents; the son, the granddaughter's father, convincingly shared how happy and loved and safe he and his brother felt during their early years.  Their parents had been very much in love with each other.  SPOILER ALERT: The two young sons of the executed Rosenbergs had to be removed from the care of Ethel's mother because of her cruelty to them. Julius Rosenberg did give or attempt to give technical information to the Soviet Union, but was likely about the angle of a propeller, and could not possibly have been about the atomic bomb, the crime of which he was accused and for which he was executed; Ethel was completely innocent; she was used as a hostage in a power play to try to coerce Julius into making a confession to avoid having Ethel executed.

Just received these this evening. The pens look and feel beautiful, but not working very well. After using it just a few hours with iPhone and iPad, I looked at the nib and it has become dented, twisted and it falling out of the pen. Just tried another stylus - thinking that perhaps the first one was just a dud. Within half an hour the end of the tip is all smashed in. i tried the rest and they all fell apart.I am truly perplexed on how this product received such high ratings. This is simply, unequivocally the WORST stylus I have ever used. And so pretty too!I will have to return them. Usually I can use a stylus for months or even a few years.UPDATE: the sellers saw my review and took the initiative to email me; they wrote that a small batch had been made with flaws, and asked if the tips were falling off, which by this time, a day later, they were. They said that they would send me replacements of the tips which would arrive in a couple of weeks. I am still sitting on the fence about whether to return the whole set or not. I purchased two stylifor $5.99 from another company, and am experiencing no problems whatsoever. ANOTHER UPDATE: At long last received the replacement ends - sent from China I think and SLOW - they sent 4 replacements instead of 7. I spent half an hour and could not get a single one on. Nearly shredded my fingernails. When I emailed the company, they had the balls to send me a Whole list of complicated questions about had I done this or that to replace the ends. I asked if they were going to pay me by the hour. No tools came with replacements.  Am mad as a hornet by this point. I notice that the price dropped $2 since I bought them.  I am glad for those customers who had a good experience, but mine sucked. The company responded promptly to my last email and I received the refund within a couple of hours, and a courteous, apologetic email.

Just received this charger today, so I cannot speak to its longevity. It is far more attractive and better made than the photo shows. It does come with one short cable to charge the charger. You connect the smaller port, which resembles that of an iPhone 4, to the charger and the USB end to your energy source.  You WILL need another cable to charge your device. I charged my iPhone 5 16GB while using it in about half an hour. My phone has been losing charge rapidly recently, so I will carry it with me in my purse. The price is fantastic!UPDATE:Still working. Purchased a pink and a gold and carry them in my purse. Just took a road trip and they really saved the day - forgot my charger and these worked fine.  Had the price not increased,I would be buying more. Still very much worth it at $10 apiece.The little instruction book is easy and worth the few minutes to read it. There is a tiny button on top, if you don't press it, it will not charge your phone even while it is connected by the correct cable.  Works fine with iPhone 6 Plus, though phone does get a little warm. Really makes a difference going on a trip in someone else's car!

Just received cable today for my iPhone 5S 16 GB. It works perfectly, fits snugly, charges rapidly, appears to be well made. It is a bargain at this price.Follow up: have been using for a few weeks - still working perfectly. Purchased 3 more;m they are extremely handy to have around. At this price, I can afford to have several - keep one in my car, one in my purse, one at bedside, one with any device like the RAV recharger.

FALLS OUT OF iPAD 2.  I just received the cable today, so I cannot speak to its longevity.  I am using it for an iPad 2. The fit is snug and perfect at first, loosened up after few days and falls out. It charged rapidly. The construction appears to be significantly more rugged than most, and it is attractive and easy to find.  Please note, there is only one cable included (I had thought there would be 2 due to photo). You can also purchase in many other colors.UPDATE: only 6 days later, connection is loose and falls out of my iPad 2. I may use some tape to make it stay in, or return the item.  Connection is more stable with my iPods. Am disappointed.

Good as room divider but is cheaply made with faults in painting/staining.  The quality is disappointing and almost embarrassing.  The 96 inch length is good.  It ought to have been priced lower. It appears to be machine stamped out out something very thin and cheap like plywood, it is not hand- carved.
Mediocre cookies, chocolate was partly melted on arrival. 2 pounds is a lot of cookies, Not nice enough for a gift.
works perfectly, price acceptable. have used it a couple of months and no problems at all with my Mac Airbook original version.
Wonderful for gray and blond dyed hair - keeps the redness and brassiness out. shampoo is purple in color.leave on longer for more result.
really delicious pasta, very pretty shape with nice chewy texture. the price is good. Barilla is my favorite brand.
junky item, broke it already - do not recommend.
delicious and priced very well; really great to have on hand. helped me through 2 snow storms.
pleased with product, easy to use, good protection, nice array of colors
these work and do not upset my dogs. wish they cost less.
good magazine at low cost.
these were fine; no problems, nothing special. same as in stores but less expensive.

I should have paid more attention to the reviews. These were disappointing. Something was missing from the flavors and texture - they must have changed the recipe. Too starchy and gummy, no thrill to the flavor.

Very pleased with this pillow. Slightly unpleasant chemical odor which leaves in a few days.  The pillow can be used immediately. Unzip pillow case and reach inside to pillow to pull apart compressed clumps - takes 2 or 3 minutes. I have many much more expensive genuine Tempurpedic pillows which have gotten stiff over time. These are great; you can rearranged the filling as you like. Pillowcase is very comfortable. Delivery was very quick.
arrived on time, excellent taste for instant, excellent price
quick delivery and excellent price. not the assortment I would have chosen., okay product

This is the second set of headphones I have gotten from the same brand and I'm pleased with these just as I was with the others. It came in this neat bag and inside of it, the headphones are in a super nice case, which I love. The reason is that I work at my desk full time and it's messy enough as it is. I can use these to listen to movies while I work without disturbing my husband when he sleeps and when I put the headphones up, I can put them in the case instead of hanging them somewhere. They also fold, which is really handy.The sound is good and the look is nice too.I received these for an unbiased review. All thoughts are mine alone and not influenced by the brand.

These are so super nice. My husband only wears Oakley and even he was impressed with everything that came with it. You can the nice carrying case, the nose piece, the frame, five sets of lenses, a cleaning cloth, a cord, etc. I mean really, you get the whole set up. I got these because we have two vehicles we use equally so I did not have a set of sunglasses in the other truck that we got a few months ago.They're perfect for me, they're affordable, and I'm super really impressed. While I received these for an unbiased review, I use them and love them and all thoughts are via my own experience.

Works like it should and it's a simple way of listening to music and enjoying how it used to be before we were slaves to our Smartphones. The 16gb space is plenty for me although some may need more. However, at about 5500 songs, how much more do you need to be honest? If you do though, there is a slot for a 4GB/8GB/16GB/32GB Micro SD Card so you can load up even more songs and increase the memory.I received this item in exchange for an unbiased review.

Face Of Our Father by G. Egore Pitir is a story about Captain Stu Pierce and his wife Angie. She is is chasing down a vengeful Middle Eastern criminal who's escaped justice and he's ready to retire but sets out to protect her after she becomes involved in a worldwide conspiracy.I didn't think I'd like it at first but as I got more involved, I did enjoy it quite a bit. The writing is good and the story is well-thought out and intriguing as well.It's not my usual fare that I read but that's fine since if it's a good book, I'll read it and this indeed – was.  I highly recommend it if you love thrillers and even if you don't, you just might like it too.

Atlantic Island: Revised and Expanded Edition (Atlantic Island Trilogy Book 1) by Fredric Shernoff is about a kid named Theo who is looking forward to the weekend at the shore. That is, until the United States disappears.First of all, I love books like this so I was looking forward to reading it and it did not disappoint me at all. It's Jersey Shore meets Science Fiction meets adventure and romance. I'm also happy it seems to be part of a trilogy since that means I get to read more of this story and I only hope it's as good as the first book – sometimes sequels tend to disappoint but thankfully, not all of them.I haven't checked out the second book yet but it's something I definitely plan to do after liking this one so much.

I like this makeup brush set so far. The case is outstanding and has a real quality look to it - almost like it's a leather case although I'm sure it's faux leather. The brushes are soft and nice an the only part I probably won't use is the silica glove since I've used those before and didn't care for them. However, it's a nice addition that perhaps someone else can use.Everything was wrapped up and packaged nicely and since I always wear makeup, I was more than happy to receive this at a discounted price for an unbiased review.

I'm very pleased with this so far. We have a large grill on the back deck and while we have two lights out there, it's still not bright. Living in Florida, we grill about four times a week and this is the perfect way to see easier since we often grill at night - in fact, we rarely grill during the day since my husband is at work. The other great thing is the waterproof construction since all it does around here is storm, which I love but it's not great for electrical items.It's very quality made and simple to use so I recommend it for when you need extra light at your grill. I received this item at a discount for my unbiased review. All thoughts are through my own experience and were not influenced by the seller.

This is a very cute little mp3 player that makes a great gift, especially for a kid or someone who is new to technology. The reason I gave it a less than perfect review is the price. For just 4gb of capacity, I feel that the price is high. It does what you need it to do for the most part and it's a simple player that doesn't have bells and whistles but if you lost it, you wouldn't lose sleep over it like you would a Smartphone or iPod. However, I do believe that in all fairness, the price should be lowered to be comparable to what you get in capacity - just my opinion.However, it does allow for 64gb of capacity and has Bluetooth so those are extras that reflect the price.I received this product for an unbiased review.

These are super nice - even the box that they come in is high quality.The built in mic is perfect for what I need since I do custom mp3s for customers and I love how they fit. I especially like that they fold up so I can store them easily because my desk has quite a few things on it (I work at home) and I don't need one more thing making it messy. My old headphones did not so I'd have to hang them off of something; this is a nice change.The sound is good and overall, I'm very pleased with them. I received these for an unbiased review but all thoughts are my own and by using the product personally.

A few years ago I discovered adrenal support products. I found that they really helped me feel more energized and overall - better. I got complacent, didn't have as much expendable cash, and just lazy, to be honest, and quit taking them.Recently, I had the opportunity to try Adrenal Support from 1 Body and jumped on the chance. I like this one because it's vegetarian (like I used to take) and has a ton of vitamins I need like the B varieties and C.While I received this product at no cost for an unbiased review, I take it and recommend it. Write me if you have any questions and I'll be glad to answer.

I love this set! First of all, it's super nice with a large serving spoon, meat fork, etc and then your regular silverware.You get a two person set, which is perfect since it's just us - five of each: salad/dessert fork, place fork, place knife, place spoon, and teaspoon. It also includes a serving spoon, pierced serving spoon, meat fork, butter knife, and sugar spoon. It has an 18/0 stainless steel construction and is dishwasher safe. The pattern is simple yet elegant and this will make a great addition to our silverware collection.I received this item for an unbiased review. My review is based on my own personal use of the product and is not influenced in any way.

I've always wanted a water flosser but for some reason, never got one. I've had and use electric toothbrushes and that type of thing but never got one of these. So when I was offered the chance to get the product in exchange for a free review, I took it.The Gurin Professional Rechargeable Flosser with High Capacity Water Tank works well and I use it often. I did learn one thing though - close your mouth when you use it. Having never used one, I got water on my face, my shirt, and the walls. Fun times. However, now that I know what I'm doing, it really works well to help floss your teeth.

We've had wired doorbells in the past and seriously, these are a much cheaper alternative. I like this one because it actually plugs in so you only have to worry about batteries for the button part and those are AAA batteries, which are easy to buy. The last one we had took some weird battery that you can't even find.We put this one on the dogs barking and if you knew us you'd know that this is the perfect tune although there are 52 to choose from.It paired up fast and works great so we're totally satisfied. Now if only the UPS driver will use it.I received this item for an unbiased review.

A Different Breed Book 1: The Beginning by Mary Rowell is a book at which I first thought - “Yeah, yeah – another vampire book – how boring.” This was nothing further from the truth.I immediately liked it. I feel like to me, it had that Interview With the Vampire feel to it, which I loved. The story is about Kate. “The book follows Kate from her early life in Savannah before the Civil War, to Europe, where she meets the real Dracula. Trying to create a new strain of people, Dracula experiments on Kate.”It's different, innovative, and definitely something I enjoyed immensely. From start to finish it had a really good feel to it with rich characterization and vivid background descriptions. If you loved the other book I mentioned, I feel like you'll love this one!

Nine-Tenths of the Law by Glenn Mitchell is right up my alley – so to speak. I love horror and while it's an author I wasn't aware of till now, it's one I'll definitely remember.Ben Ricci is a detective and things aren't going so well for him. “He’s under investigation, struggling to save his marriage and shamefully obsessed with a key witness. To find the killer, he’ll need to control his many compulsions. Unfortunately self-control has never been Ben’s strong suit.”From the start I was intrigued and from that point on, I just kept reading. The description of the house at the start for instance, held my interesting by being engaging and making me feel as if I were there instead of just reading a passage in a book.Horror is my favorite genre and this did not disappoint whatsoever!

The Paradise Series: Paradise Series: 1,2,3 Crazy in Paradise, Deception in Paradise, Trouble in Paradise Box Set by Deborah Brown is not only a real bargain but it's a really great set.First of all, I live in Florida so I could totally relate to how the series started out. The heat, the people dressing casual at a funeral, the concrete set up from an old restaurant, and we've been to the Florida Keys so I felt the entire vibe of the location.Each book in the series was exciting, fun to read, and really honed in on the whole Florida feeling of which I could relate.I highly recommend this set because you get three books for the price and each one allows you to start the next one seamlessly and full of anticipation. I've read Deborah Brown's work in the past and this did not disappoint at all.

0:17 Mins I love Halloween and I love decorating for Halloween so when I had the chance to get this in exchange for an unbiased review, I immediately jumped on the chance.Yes, he's small but he's perfect for our front porch area. Right now we have him hanging on the door but he can hang pretty much anywhere you want. When there is motion, he starts shaking, has glowing eyes, and moves around. He also moans quite loudly. Seriously, the UPS guy will love this - NOT.We're very pleased with him, he was easy to set up (just pull the tab and turn him on) and he is perfect for our Halloween decorations!

Wake Not the Hangman by Deborah Leigh is a story about treachery, bondage, fellowship, and courage.I wasn't sure about this since it's in a different time period than what I usually read but from the start, I was intrigued and actually really enjoyed it.The year is 1834 and in this historical book, Thornton Guthrie's father buys three slaves. Thornton hates this and must convince them that he is with them and wants to help plan their (and his) escape. In fact, Thornton is like a slave himself in many aspects since his is forced to work by a father who is a brutish and abusive man.I found the entire story from start to finish, quite interesting and it kept me reading it. I usually choose horror but I'll cross any genre if I like the book and in this case, I did.

This is a gorgeous sweater I got as a gift for a friend. It's packaged well and looks great but what I particularly like are the unique buttons. They're not like normal buttons that you usually find on sweaters. You would probably have to wear a little top underneath because of this reasons since the buttons fit loose but I think it really adds style to the sweater.It's soft and simple but really elegant looking and at the price, it's a good buy; I know my friend will love it.I received this item for an unbiased review. All thoughts are my own experiences and not influenced in any way.

These bags are quite nice and I love that they come in an easy to use roll where you can just tear one off when you're ready - not more bulky boxes under the sink.Now, they're not as strong as some of the other more well-known brands but they do the job sufficiently. I do wish they came in a scented choice or had a drawstring. However, for the price, it's a decent deal and they'll work for pretty much all of your kitchen needs as long as you don't put sharp or extra heavy things in them.I received this item for an unbiased review.

I've got a few wallets at home, they range in price but this Timberland would be the cheapest of the lot.  In terms of quality I was somewhat impressed with this wallet.  The leather looks and feels very nice, definitely not something I expected for the price (around $20 at the moment).  You've got one bill slot, unfortunately (I prefer two), two ID windows, 5 credit card/card slots and two more slots on each side under the card slot/ID area.  So there's quite a bit of space for your various needs and for the price I'd say this is an easy recommendation.  I doubt it will stand up to abuse or long-term use without showing signs of wear but the price means you're not making a huge investment.

This is a review of the Lenox "This Is May Happy Place" Mug.  This is my first piece from Lenox.  The mug is made from 'stoneware' and to its credit it definitely stands out from the other mugs in my house.  It's light, really light, feels very smooth and is just a really nice quality product.  My only qualm is with the price.  I can understand quality needing to cost more but when you can readily get a mug for under ten dollars and this mug runs close to thirty, I just think it's a bit too much even if you're getting great quality.

This Metabo drill is just right for my needs at the moment, which mainly consists of getting minor work done around the house, assembling furniture, and other odd jobs.  The drill itself comes in a nice case (unfortunately the interior leaves something to be desired) with two batteries, a charger and a manual.  The batteries have power indicators on them and charge fairly quickly.  The drill feels excellent in the hand, the build quality is great and I'd say you definitely get what you pay for with this model.

Easy to swallow with a minor hint of lemon flavor.  Fish oil has been long enough advertised as a great supplement and I try to take them with meals on a daily basis.  These are a great source of Omega 3 fatty acids that will hopefully go a long way to keeping you healthy.  The 'fish burps' are very much present though.

Have used this Eureka heater for a few days now and am really impressed with it.  It's similar in style to some of the "fans" you can get and it's got a very nice aesthetic look, sleek design and it was beyond simple to put together.  You're pretty much screwing the base to the heater and turning on the power on the bottom.  The remote is small and getting to the battery can be an issue if you don't pay attention to the instructions (then again the instructions aren't the greatest as they are on the back of the tiny remote).  You press to the side and the battery slides out easily enough.  The remote works fine although I do have some issues about the fact that once I turn the heater off it takes a few seconds to actually turn off so I'm not sure if it is off from time to time.  The unit itself will give off a bit of a 'smell' initially but it heats up very quickly and will warm up a room in just a few minutes.  Really pleased with this heater and would definitely recommend it.

Considering the price point, this is a good headset for what you're paying.  Setup is not hard, works with the consoles or computers.  The sound quality is good but nothing special, then again it shouldn't be out of the ordinary for a hundred dollars.  The best aspect of these headphones is that they are wireless making for one less cord to be bothered by.  The cord that does come with the speakers is too short though, so if you want to use it with your console or PC it won't be very comfortable.  The headset itself is comfortable enough but I did get some fatigue after a few hours, there is pressure on your ears as you're wearing it although the top of the headphones have a nice foam insert so there's not much pressure on the top of your head.  Overall a good headset I could recommend depending on the needs of the buyer.

My house is multi-story with a basement and I have around two desktops, three laptops, and half a dozen phones/tables regularly attached to my wireless connection.  It's rare that I have issues with the connection as I have an excellent router but the one issue I did notice from time to time is that I would lose the signal when I was in the basement or standing outside my house and in my backyard.  This Amped Wireless TITAN-EX, High Power AC1900 Wi-Fi Range Extender proved to be the perfect solution to that issue.  Setup is quick and easy, once the unit is assmbled and connected to your wifi network you're pretty much off and running.  I ran to the basement to test the strength and walked around my house seeing how far my signal would now extend.  The Amped unit performed perfectly.  No issues in my basement and even outside I still pick up a good signal so I can now enjoy being/working outdoors with access to my wireless.  I haven't had much of a chance to test out the USB 3.0 port and how well that option works with this unit but in general I don't think that technology has advanced far enough to make it worthwhile to share files of anything but music, that is limited sized data rather than large file sizes (which I've had issues with previously when it came to sharing over wireless networks).  Overall, I'm very pleased with the unit!

I've been using this cream for a few weeks now.  Overall it goes on well, has a good consistency, and is very smooth.  Best results I've seen so far from this product are that my smooth has gotten progressively smoother the longer I've used it.  Further results will probably take additional weeks of use to see but thus far I'm very happy with this product.  Price point is definitely good and you don't need to use a lot so it will last for months.

This flash drive is perfect.  It's tiny, offers fast performance, I saw around 30 MB/s on a USB 2 port and over 100 MB/s on USB 3, I would only advise getting the larger version as the price is excellent. The lack of a cover like some other flash drives of a similar size offer isn't a bad thing as it means you don't have to keep track of the cover when you're using the flash drive.  Highly recommended, a great product from Samsung!

"The Confidence Game" is an entertaining read but one that's watered down for a broad audience.  It's engaging, definitely readable, but at times can be quite repetitive.  The author uses her degree and knowledge to weave a story based on multiple studies and experiments done throughout the past century to show the various ways people can be conned into parting with their (usually) hard-earned money.  The ideas aren't new, the examples are abundant (so much so that a few of the stories date from a few years back) and they touch on all aspects of society (be you rich, poor, well educated, white collar or blue collar).  The allure of easy money, the want and sometimes need to trust someone who's just entered your life but has in various ways proven to be "trustworthy" and "honest" leaves a distinct impression on many people that often enough leads to unintended consequences, humiliation, and theft.  The topics covered in each chapter could probably have an entire volume devoted to them alone.  There are many ideas presented and to grasp them all, especially when looking at ourselves from the side (or our actions in hindsight), is impossible from one sitting.  This is in many ways a starting point for readers to take a step back and take a look at their previous actions and how they can avoid making similar or new mistakes in the future.  We have all been conned in one way or another, we've all experienced false hope or tried to believe in something that in hindsight seems preposterous.  Knowing what situations to look for, what to be aware of, and what to avoid will undoubtedly help us lead a life that's more rewarding not just for ourselves but also for those around us.

These things are awesomely addictive.  They taste great and as a snack (2-3 pieces) they are perfect.  This is the second product I've tried from Lancaster and I have yet to be disappointed.  Only issue I noticed was that if you're ordering these in the summer they will most likely melt a little before they get to your door depending on the temperature outside.  Better to stock up in the winter/fall months.

Not very happy with the product.  I can't say I felt "jittery" or "energized" and I didn't see much difference during my work outs.  But the difference that i did see was that these pills completely ruined my sleep cycle (and I took them as directed, in the morning and then 5-6 hours later, which for me meant another 10 hours before I went to bed).  Can't recommend them at all.

I'm not a huge coffee drinker but considering you can make coffee and tea with this machine, I was interested to see what it offered.  Personally, I'm satisfied with the machine as it is.  It's easy to setup, it heats up very quickly, and you can make coffee/tea within about 2 minutes.  Why I'm giving this four stars instead of five is because I'm finding the cost of the 'capsules' to be too much.  More so since I don't like quite a few of them (Cappuccino and Mocha were not great at all, my favorite from the flavors I received with the machine was Chai Tea Latte, so I'm looking forward to trying more of the tea offerings in the near future).  Otherwise, I think it's a great machine to have around the house even if you're not using it on a daily basis.

These toiletwand refills are excellent.  The toiletwand itself helps clean my toilet and gets into most places without you needing to get on your knees while scrubbing away.  The price is great for what you're getting.  30 of these for around $12 and often times you'll be able to use one more than once, so these should last for months, depending on how often you clean your bathroom/toilet.  Definitely recommended.

I'm really surprised at how much I like this product.  I'm not at all a fan of shampoo & conditioner combos (and I just reviewed an Axe product that does just that and wasn't very happy with it).  This one, however, left my hair clean and feeling like it was shampooed and conditioned with separate products.  I've yet to find a product that does both as well as this one.  My only issue with this product is that I'm not at all a fan of the scent.  Then again my hair is short so having to smell it regularly after showers isn't a a problem.  In general I'm a an of Jack Black products and have been using them for years.  Glad to see another addition to their line that works as advertised.

Very nice scent that doesn't linger after the shower.  Works well as a body wash but I'm not thrilled about the shampoo & conditioner aspects of it.  As a body wash it'll leave you feeling clean and refreshed (party thanks to the nice scent) but I think as a shampoo & conditioner it'll work well enough for those with hair that doesn't need much upkeep/maintenance.  Otherwise, I'd suggest keeping your body wash, at the least, separate from your shampoo & conditioner.  The one good thing about this product is that if you're traveling, you might not need all three products for the limited time that you'll be away as this will do a good enough job for all three.

Never had a rice cooker before but like to regularly eat rice when I can.  This rice cooker is great.  It's not huge so it doesn't take up too much counter space, it's easy to open and close and easy enough to operate once you get the hang of things.  You've got a bit of a variety in terms of what you can make (aside from the steaming you can do while cooking your rice) and the finished product is delicious.  I've seasoned my rice a bit with some garlic and salt and pepper but will try out other additions now that I have the tools for the job.  Highly recommended.

Similar to the hand cream from this line, this essential day moisturizer is a very nice product for everyday use.  It goes on well, dries quickly, leaves a non-greasy feel, just smooth skin.  It is pricey though.  Still, one of the better moisturizers I've encountered.

Depending on your needs, this portable generator could be an excellent investment.  It's quite heavy (enough so that the UPS driver asked me to help get it off the back of the truck).  But it has wheels, so once you've unpacked it, moving it from place to place is easy enough (as long as you're not trying to get it up the stairs quickly).  It works on regular gasoline and for up to 8 hours you'll have power once you start it up.  It's definitely limited and portable but, again, depending on your needs it might be the perfect tool for the job (I can see this useful both for house/apartment needs and for construction sites that have yet to have power running).  No issues so far but I haven't kept it running for hours on end.

I've used Burt's Bees Lip Balm for years.  It's a great lip balm and consistently keeps lips moisturized and helps damaged/cracked lips heal and look healthy again.  Much more affordable than many others out there and provide equal, if not at times better, results.
Oh this just tastes awful.  I don't care how healthy it is if I have to treat myself like a masochist in order to get it down.  No thank you.

This wall outlet is a great idea and I'm surprised I have never seen it before.  These days we have tons of peripherals and gadgets that require USB ports to charge.  Computers and laptops can't seem to keep up with all our needs so going right to the source, a wall outlet, is a perfect solution.  Installation is simple enough as removing your existing outlet and installing this new one.  You are reducing your outlet to one but the addition of two USB ports means the previous two outlets you might have been using for them are now free.  I can also see this appearing throughout cafes and restaurants for people's phone charging needs.  Definitely recommended!

Eternity is a bit of a staple from the 1990s.  Similar to Le Male and Cool Water, Eternity has somewhat passed its prime and has become outclassed by the number of fragrances available today and by better quality compositions, at least in my opinion.  I was never a fan of any Calvin Klein scents, my youth was dominated by Acqua di Gio, D&G Pour Homme, Le Male, and a few other scents.  So I'm not surprised that Eternity isn't doing much for me or that's it's quite forgettable.  On my skin the scent is very familiar with green notes seemingly dominating the life of this fragrance.  It's fine but certainly nothing special.

Usually my feet are getting a work out one way or another throughout the day and I thought this would be a good tool to try out on calluses or in general to get some of the coarser skin off.  I can't say I was impressed with this product though.  It works but in a somewhat limited way and it just isn't good enough for my needs.  So far I've found the best results from using Molton Brown's Black Pepper Bodyscrub Bar.

I'm somewhat torn about what I want to give this computer in terms of a star rating.  It's probably between three and four stars at best but really it's a three star system.  Windows 8 helps but overall you're getting a very basic set up here.  Hardware wise, you've got four USB ports (two in front and two in back), one additional USB 3 port in back, and an additional SD slot in front.  You can hook up two monitors (one via HDMI) and that's about it aside from internet and sound.  The keyboard and mouse are the most basic of basics and really aren't even worth mentioning.
