BTW -  The one that came to me is the "US and Puerto Rico" version which means it did not come equipped for 240 volts as the product page states.The clippers have a very nice and clear method of setting the height of the cutting comb.  There are two combs, and the adjusting barrel on the handle clearly marks out which settings go with which comb.  Unlike a previous Panasonic cutter I had, this one allows you to adjust the height without turning the unit off.  Panasonic beard cutters have been the ONLY ones I have owned which do not tug or pull when cutting.  They cut quickly and cleanly.  My only issue with most all beard trimmers is the spot under my nostrils, where the comb cannot go and you have to use the bare blades and be very careful.  Wish there was a better way to get that area.

UPDATE:  I had the chance to use the detachable day pack for a few days on vacation.  It was very hot, and the pack came in very handy to carry two bottles of chilled water (wrapped in a towel, and a couple bananas  We spent a day in Sante Fe, New Mexico and a couple of days in Albuquerque at 90+ degrees.  The day pack was very comfortable to wear and quickly got to the point where I only seemed to know it was there when I sat down and hit the back of the chair.Original Review: I think you need to be specific about your need on this backpack because it has a lot of features and is very flexible, but there are some things it is not.  First off, it is really two backpacks zippered together.  There is a small "day pack" which has a storage zipper-pocket for the straps.  That one will not hold much, maybe a few bottles of water, a change of lightweight clothes, and that's probably it.  The bigger one has a shallow outer compartment, net pouches to hold water bottles, and a largish interior space.  There is another zipper-pocket which keeps the bigger pack's straps under cover.What this pack is not, is luggage.  I don't think the fabric will hold up to any checked baggage situation and I would not see it handling a lot of jetway check bag treatment. It is not an un-wheeled duffel.  There are too many pockets and sections to use it for bulky items.  The pockets which are used to keep the straps stored make it a bit unwieldy.  There's a plastic or stiff board-like divider in it as well, which at first thought made me think it has a metal frame, which it does not.  It does have an aluminum "spine" piece to give it some support.One really annoying thing is the zipper for the day pack will spontaneously un-zip if put under pressure.  It is one continuous zipper, so it won't completely zip off, but it will un-zip completely on one side simply by pushing it.Okay, so why did I give it 4 stars?  I have see a lot worse for more money than this.  I got it on a free trial, but had I paid the listed amount, I would have been okay with it.  It is a decent school backpack with good padding for your back under the straps.  The area for a laptop computer is well padded on the inside, but a bit light on the outside.  It will still give adequate protection in all but the worst cases.  It's a decent bag.

Lots of reviews noting they got a cheaper, generic product.  This came in the Vornado packaging and the quality of the filters is the same if not better than what originally came with the unit.  Can't say enough about my Vornado humidifier.  I have personally come to believe replacing these annually is the best idea.  I use bleach a couple of times per winter season to stop mold and other microbe build up and I think the bleach greaks down the material over time.  It is not much of an annual investment to make sure everything is clean and functioning well.

Huge difference between pay me now or pay me later. I've had a number of Epson "consumer" inkjets in both narrow and wide carriage formats. They had the multiple tanks, all very small and about $15 a tank. My photography work finally expanded to where I took the leap to the Professional grade Epson 3880 printer. At $1700, the up front investment was huge, but I can see where I am going to make it all up on ink costs. The ink tanks in the 3880 are huge.What I found with the other printers was that I'd pay a couple of hundred dollars for the printer, then pay through the nose in the rapid depletion of ink. Besides the wider carriage capability of the 3880, the inks last forever, or it seems. I kept track of what I've printed since getting it. I've printed 150 posters at 13x19, 75 large format prints at 17x22, almost 450 at 8x10, and during all that was experimenting with printing on metal, wood, and canvas. I bought this tank because I was finally down to about 25% on it and wanted a replacement ready to go. The rest of the tanks are no lower than 35%.Yeah, the tanks are $50 each, but when you consider how much longer they last than the ones in the consumer world, it really saves money in the long run. Amazon continues to be the best and most cost effective source for my Epson inks.

We recently were able to get a Silk'n Revit Microderm machine.  As my wife put it for these Proactiv+ pads, "They're better than having nothing or if you are in a pinch."  She did a test by using these to exfoliate and then went back with the Microderm to see what was left.  By her guess, the pads remove about 50% of what she usually gets with the Microderm.  These cost about $45 and the Microderm costs about $100, plus a modest amount for replacement filters.  In the long run, my wife feels the Microderm is the best option.Now, having said that, if you are travelling and do not want to haul the machine around, these wipes would be an excellent temporary measure until you return from the trip.

We've been buying the "normal" Quilted Northern from the local "Discount Club" store.  As a Vine reviewer we welcomed the chance to test the new Ultra-Plush and we were not disappointed by the quality.  Face it, in TP you want absorbancy, resistance to tearing, and a soft touch to the tush.  This stuff is excellent in all three.  As for the Mega-Roll stuff, that one is purely subjective, however it does seem that the Ultra-Plush thickness causes you to use fewer sheets and thus the roll will last longer.  The price is on par with the big box stores, especially if you can get free shipping on it.  Frankly, if I can avoid fighting the crowds at the store and just have someone drop it off at my house...I'm there.  If you don't live near a big discount store, then this will really be a deal for you.

I've done window films on home windows and car windows.  There is no doubt the UV reduction helps preserve drapes and carpets.  The glare reduction is not all that important, however the heat reduction is possibly the best feature, especially on a car window.  This is my first time using a 3M product and I was hoping they had resolved some of the annoying issues of other brands' products.  Unfortunately they have not.After doing a few of these applications, you get used to the far too thin film, working through clearing bubbles out of the film, and maddening task of separating the two layers.  It takes patience for an experienced person to apply and it can be really aggravating for a first-timer.  Can't emphasize the patience part of the process.I have never understood why the film has to be so thin and fragile.  One or maybe two mil thicker and this would be so easy to apply.  Flat, house windows should have a thicker film.  The thinner stuff would be needed for curved car windows and such.The end result is great.  There is a noticeable difference in heat build up and blocking almost all of the UV will help protect the drapes quite a bit.

Works great.  The telescope came with a 32 mm eyepiece, so this is a little over twice the magnification.  It is too much for a full view of the moon, however it does help take close-up photos of craters and seas on the moon.  I bought it largely for looking at Jupiter and Saturn.  I can now clearly see the striping on both planets, and it allows you to see the gaps in Saturn's rings.  For the price, it is an excellent addition to my scope.

Be aware this is a new "hydroquinone-free formula" and not the regular one from before.  My wife claims she can clearly tell the difference.  She started using t he Obagi products many years ago and I will not complain about the results, as she easily looks 15 years younger than her age.  We had to start mail-ordering the products because Texas put strict standards on products with hydroquinone, thus cutting the number of available suppliers and hiking the amount you pay.  My guess is that Obagi is starting to reformulate some products to avoid the restrictions in Texas and perhaps other states.  She will not be re-ordering this product unless she can get "the real stuff".  I can't get much in the way of specifics as to why it performs differently.  She simply claims it leaves her skin flat and dull compared to the previous formula.

This is a chopping, blending, pureeing beast of a blender.  I have recently had the opportunity to test several high-dollar blenders.  As for shear power, speed, and capacity this one is the best.  The carafe is 64 ounces which is between 4 and 8 ounces larger than most.  May not seem like a lot, but when combined with the shorter and wider design of the carafe it seems like a huge difference.  At 2.4 horsepower it has the most torque and probably more important it has reserve power so the motor should last a long time.  Drive is a splined shaft and socket, both large and made of metal.  It has some preset speeds and an infinitely variable speed adjustment.  It is not very stylish and looks more commercial in design.  One of the design features is stated as low-profile to fit under most cabinets on the countertop.  I have an older kitchen and the cabinets are lower than most.  None of the high-powered blenders fit under mine.  This Jamba is lower than most, but not as low as the small carafe Oster or the magnetically driven Kitchenaid units.  The rest of the materials are substantial and made of polycarbonate.  It seems like it will last forever.  The shorter and wider carafe makes cleaning much easier than most.

I know this is a way to add cost to the sale of the dehydrator, but they really should be standard equipment, or the stock trays should have openings his small.  I think these are the same thing as the fruit roll-up trays, but I can't be sure.  We bought these to dry herbs, as to not let the finer ones like dill fall through.  They make all the difference in the world.

Works as advertised except for one small issue.  It states it eliminates the need for deep sockets, which is only partly true.  The pass-through ability of the ratchet and sockets only works on something that allow room on the side of the bolt to allow for the ratchet handle to swing.  Deep sockets are needed when a bolt can only be accessed from directly above (think spark plug) and the bolt extends far past where the nut seats.Aside from that one technicality, the set seems to do what it should.  The time-saving feature of being able to handle all types of bolt heads does not come up very often and almost never when in the middle of a job.  Items with splined nuts are hardly ever mixed in on a machine with hex or square nuts.  Usually one type of design is consistent throughout a product.The material (can't totally tell what type of alloy it is) seems lightweight, but I've really torqued down on some bolts to test it and there is no give or flex.  They seem to be extremely sturdy in their construction.  The storage "case" will not last long and should not be a consideration when you buy it.  It is going to break.  It's just a matter of when.

I am a long-time fan of Citizen Eco-Drive watches, but I have had a hard time getting my wife to like them.  She works in the hospital and needs a sweep second hand for taking pulses and she had concerns about the constant hand-washing and contamination.  I saw this watch model and bought it for her birthday.  This works well in many ways and now she is sold on it.  The leatherette band is easily and cheaply replaceable, and it does not have all of the nooks and crannies of a typical bracelet type band.  The unit is water-resistant to 100 feet and the case has a very durable finish.  The best features are the contrasting color second hand and the large-for-the-size-of-watch markings on the dial.  It is very easy to read when taking a pulse.  Like all Eco-Drive wtaches, it never needs a battery.

After just one use, my wife loves it.  After two uses, she claims she can't live without it.  She is very fussy about what she uses on her face and has skin that looks 10 years younger than she is.  This unit did an excellent job of exfoliating and smoothing out those small wrinkles.  Key to great results is to use light to medium pressure and keep the unit moving continuously.  Stay in one place for any length of time and you run the risk of redness or tenderness.  Except in only an extreme case of misuse can I see this leaving any permanent marks or damage.Update - My wife has used it five times now and claims that small wrinkles around her lips have disappeared and those around her eyes have shrunk.  We ordered replacement filters from the manufacturer and they were easy to get and inexpensive.  She cannot say enough good things about it and compared to what she'd pay to go to a salon to have this done...it is a HUGE bargain.

This is the weirdest and coolest blender ever.  There are no gears used to drive the blender blades.  It uses super-powerful magnets to do it.  It seems to have all the power of the geared models and it is quieter.  Because there is no motor base, the unit is lower than most and would fit under most cabinets while out on the countertop.  Clean up is easy and the unit is super-sturdy.  It can be loaded by pulling out the blender, however it does have a pass-through opening in the top of the unit which allows you to add items while the blender is spinning.  I have three concerns which make me give it four stars,  The first is what effect spinning magnets may have on other items or electronics in the kitchen  The literature says none, however it still worries me.  Second is the locking mechanism for holding the container in the unit.  It appears a bit flimsy, though modern materials can surprise you with how string they are for their thickness.  The last one is the price.  This unit is $500.  I've had units from Breville, Oster, and Vitamix in the $300 range which seem to perform as well.  I got lucky to try most of them on free trial programs.  Time will tell if this is as durable as the others and worth the price.

I am a neophyte with telescopes and decided that for what I want to do, this would be a good entry model for me.  I was mostly interested in looking at and photographing the moon, maybe some planets, and possible use it for other celestial background photo work.  It was also a shot at getting my feet wet before I plopped down thousands of dollars to find out I got the wrong stuff.  Turns out this is a good choice to cut my teeth and learn lessons.The unit is fairly rugged, self-contained, and more or less sealed so you can't accidentally mess something up.  It is heavy...too heavy for even the best camera tri-pod.  Combine that with the Earth's habit of rotating objects out of your field of view fairly quickly, you need a specifically designed tri-pod to handle it.  I got the one from Celestron with the azimuth controls so once I get the moon in the telescopes sights, I can rotate some knobs and keep it in view.  That works well without having to invest in a "clock" type mount.Photography can be done a couple of ways without investing in those purpose built units which are big on price tags and low in resolution.  The first way is to use an adapter to mount a digital SLR body to the unit. The second is what I did, which is another adapter from Celestron that allows you to mount a point-and-shoot type digital camera behind the eyepiece.  I used an Olympus TG-2 which worked really well, once you got everything aligned.  In some ways, using the rear display of the camera is easier to find and keep your subject in frame.As for the actual quality of the image, I am not an expert.  It seems very crisp to me and I don't seem to see any color issues.  What is important is setting the unit up correctly.  You need to use some local object to "sight in" the cross-hairs in the spotter scope to match what you see in the telescope.  Once that is done, it is far easier to find your astronomical targets.  It is still weird getting used to the idea of getting my eyes aligned directly behind the eyepiece and about an inch away from it.  I also like that the image is "right side up" like a binocular view rather than the flipped over version most telescopes have.  This will allow me to use it for nature viewing as well.This unit will get me through my learning phase until I know better what I want and how much money I am willing to spend.  I have attached two photos.  One is of the telescope on the tripod with the digital camera adapter.  The other is the first photo of the moon I took with it.

Interesting, fold-up design, but I wouldn't consider it a space-saver.  Basically the handles fold upward toward the nipper end.  So it goes from somewhat long and narrow to short and twice as wide.  Most tool boxes are longer than they are wide, so you may have situations where it fits your toolbox unfolded, but is too wide when folded.Some people said the latches for locking it in the usable position were weak.  That may happen over time, but initially they seem sturdy.  Fortunately, when applying force to cut bolts, the lock-out tabs do not come into play and everything works fine.  It seems to cut well, so long as you stay within the duty range of the cutter.  Bolt cutters come in different sizes for different types of bolts and chains you need to cut.  The angled nose does help you get into tight places.

As a worker in the hospital, my wife cannot wear typical perfume, so her use is off days and evenings we go out.  This scent is light and airy.  You have to get fairly close to the skin to really smell it, which is nice both from the proximity and the scent.  It is subtle enough she might actually be able to wear it to work sometimes and not be noticed.  She really likes the scent, as it is different than most she has.

Love the scent but it doesn't have staying power.  Other spray-type men's colognes I have spray a larger burst of mist where one maybe two are enough for the whole day.  This sprayer has to be held within 3 inches from the skin to actually get it on you and then it takes three or four sprays.  I also find the scent does not last as long as others I have.  Luckily I got this on a free trial.  Had I spent the money they are asking, I think I would have been disappointed.Those points aside, it is a fresh and different scent.  Seems to be a bit like the seaside for me, crisp and clean without being over-powering.  I don't see myself using this as a daily cologne unless I was able to reapply it mid-day.  I can see it as an evening spray for a few hours of need.

What I love about this spray gel is that it holds my hair all day, even in the high winds of West texas, yet it does doe make it look "plastered" down.  I am thankful to have hair in my older years, but it has thinned some.  This product seems to add thickness and volume to my hair.  I wash my hair, spray this on while still wet, brush my hair into place, and brush it out when I get to work.  The brush out eliminates the plastered down look, yet there is still enough hold to last the day.  After trying many others, this is the one I settled on and have used no other for the past couple of years.Alas, all of the local stores who carry Aussie products seem to have stopped carrying this particular product.  So, I was joyed to find it online and ordered several.  It did cost more than I paid when it was carried locally, however having the right product that works for me was certainly worth the few extra dollars I spent.

In our offices, we have flat-screen TV's for our conference rooms, however they are in very large and heavy cabinets on wheels.  They take up a lot of room, are heavy to roll around, and invariably scratch doorways and halls as people move them from room to room.  Most are 32-37 inch models and we are in the process of upgrading to 55 - 60 inch models for better viewing, which will render the old cabinets useless.In researching mobile stands, we settled on this model and ordered for to test on a 55 inch TV.  After assembly and testing, this will be the rolling unit we will use on all of them.  The key features we considered were how sturdy the saters were, how stable the unit would be, and how well could we secure it using a lockable cable system.The casters are very sturdy, roll well, and have locks on them.  We have no reason to think they will not hold up over time and they lack the "flutter" you sometimes feel in cheaper built casters.  As for the sturdiness, the central, twin tubes are quite large and thick walled, with cross-brackets which serve as reinforcement gussets.  These gussets also provide the attachment for extra shelves beyond the one it comes with.  The height adjustment of the mast and the variable adjustments for mounting the TV itself seems to be able to fit all TV's and all applications.  As for security, there are several ways and places where a security cable can be mounted to help keep the TV in a room from which you do not want it to leave.My only complaint is the very high shipping cost.  The box is large and weighs 85 pounds, so I guess it makes sense.  The weight is really something that attests to the sturdiness of the construction.  When one combines the cost and the shipping, it equates well to the same combination of other models where the unit costs more, but the shipping is much less or free.

I am a big fan of this kind of wall anchor.  When I was a few dollars short of making my free freight threshold, i added these to the order.  They are a good size, not overly large for what is used with a #6 to #8 screw.  They do have something different than other types, which is the open design of the tail.  Others like this are solid from one end to the other.  This sometimes is a hassle if the only screw you have to use is longer than the anchor, as it has no where to go.  This one has a gap where it goes into the wall, so screws longer than the anchor just end up passing through.  So far it does not seem to have reduced its ability to stay in the wallboard.

I don't know how much value my review is, as these are my first experience with turning tools.  I saw a video on making vases out of pencils and wanted to try it myself, having never used a wood lathe before.  My first attempts were a bit of trial and error, but pretty good.  As a newbie, these tools seem very sharp and durable.  I did give them a quick honing before using them right out of the box.  I had no problems cutting the wood or controlling the cut.  As I gained confidence, I soon realized that there wuld be benefit in having a longer "reach" on the blade.  I would call these a mid-size, and the projects I am doing seem to fit this side okay.  If I need to replace these, I might by a full-size tool for a bit more reach and a longer handle for more control.

This is a pricey, third-tier of filtration that has not been available locally.  I've had the under-sink GE filter for many years, as a last stage filter for municipal water.  The water in West Texas is hard, filled with minerals, and the city water has a funny taste.  Though I know it is "scientifically certified" to be drinkable, bottled water beats it for drinking...hands down.  Normally there were only two choices available at local hardware stores and those were becoming more inconsistently available.  When I went online, I found this filter which was a step higher in function than the other two.  I thought I would try it and I was really surprised how much of a difference this one made.  We use the filtered water for cooking and coffee, but now it is very, very close to being the same as the bottled water in taste (or the lack there of).  Through Amazon, the price was high, but not much more than what I was paying for the second-tier of quality at a local store.  SP far I am impressed with what it does, so now the question will be how long it lasts compared to the others.  That will take months and up to a year.

I am fortunate to have never had much need for lip balms, so most of this review comes from my wife.  On the other hand, I do have an opinion about how this balm is to kiss.  Some of the stuff my wife uses is waxy and somewhat annoying, but this balm is silky smooth and not waxy at all.  She says it melts into her lips instantly, and I agree.  The scent is very pleasing and not medical smelling or tasting at all.  Some of the stuff she's used in the past was medicinal and nasty-tasting.  It also has little or no taste, which is much better than some of the so-called medicated balms she has had from time to time.  She loves how it melts into her lips without a waxy residue.  I like not having to recoil from a medical tatse or wipe the "goo" off my lips after she has used it.

I have always wanted an answer to this question, "If Febreze kills odors, how can it have a scent?"  With that odd point aside, this is a handy product for tough odors, which for us is dog odor.  We tired pre-treating their bedding, blankets, and sweaters.  With most washings there was still a trace of dog, but with this pre-treatment with Febreze there was none.  We did try one other reviewer's idea of spritzing our own bedding and it did give us a nice scent to fall asleep with in the air.  Another dog issue which it did an excellent job on was dog vomit.  They seem to like to up-chuck on our micro-fiber sofa which is stain repellent and cleans up well, however the vomit smell lingers.  This version of Febreze knocks it right out.  Who knows, maybe we'll just spray the dogs.

My wife was not thrilled when I ordered under the Vine program, however when it got here she loved it.  The material is substantial and holds its shape well.  The size is good and the stripes are very fashionable.  We have an open shelf in the guest bath that now is the home of this for holding spare towels rolled up vertically in the bag.  I've been told that we will now be ordering more.

This is a really slick design that allows a "sipper" to learn how to use a regular cup instead of using one of the cups with a spout.  In the new condition it does not even leak a drop.  What it will do after a month or two of use/washing is yet to be seen.  My guess it may seep a little bit, but then again the spouted ones drip like crazy.  The three part system is easy to take apart and clean, and it works really well.  Sipping anywhere on the rim breaks the vacuum and liquid comes out.  Very easy to use.

This review was originally posted at 4 stars, however the more my wife used this hairspray, the more she loved it.  I got it free on a sample program, however I am being told we will now be buying this stuff regularly. When she first tried it, she thought it was not strong enough to last through the day. She was surprised to see what she thought was only a medium-strength hold, turned out to be holding at the end of a busy work day.  She loves that it is "combable" if that's a word, yet it stays where you put it.  She says the fragrance is nice, but not over-powering like some sprays, and it is easy to control direction.  Her hair stays in place, yet when you touch it, it feels softer and more flexible than other sprays.

My wife loves this.  She thinks the color is amazing.  According to her, it seems to moisturize her lips.  It does not run into those tiny cracks and furrows that normally makes the lipstick line fuzzy.  It seems to last a long time and does not have the "funny taste" that some lipsticks can have.

My wife loves L'Oreal products and though she feels as if she needs to wait a month of using it to make a firm review, she likes it so far.  She uses it on her neck.  She likes the fact it melts into the skin and leaves no greasy feel.  She likes the scent.  She's been using it a week and claims she can see a difference in the texture and tone of her skin.  We got this on a free trial, however she is currently saying we will have to buy more when this supply runs out.
It works in my Xerox printer - And it's much cheaper than the Xerox brand!

Hallicrafters was an important American company that mostly specialized in short wave and amateur band receivers and transmitters. Their product line ranged from inexpensive equipment for youth starting out in the hobby to sophisticated first rate equipment. This book starts with a brief history of the Hallicrafters company and products. The majority of the book lists the Hallicrafters products (with pictures) from radio receivers, transmitters, transceivers and, similar accessories and finally the more consumer oriented products such as TV sets in the 1950's. It is obvious the author has a love for these products and the company that created them.

As others have said, this is a real 2" diameter shirk tubing. It's shipped flat.it does appear to shrink to 50% of its original size. As it shrinks it gets a bit thicker. The clear shrink tubing is nice that you can see the item underneath the shrink tubing.

There is just something about using brass hardware that I like - It's less prone to corroding than common steel, it's strong enough for most purposes, and brass screws and nuts are usually well made. I just like the looks of brass hardware.This is a standard large pattern brass nut. It seems to be well made. It threads perfectly onto the mating screw. And they arrive in a sealed plastic bag and are fairly shiny. While brass will eventually darken as it gets light surface oxidation, it doesn't "rust" and the oxidation almost never goes deep so that it still mates well with the naming screw even after many years of exposure.

Brass rod just like you would expect. It appears to be something like "half hard" meaning it's fairly stiff and a little springy. It comes with a smooth but not polished surface. It will take a good finish.

Aluminum - just like you would expect. It's silvery colored and machines pretty well. Alloy 6061 is harder than pure aluminum but still machines fairly well. The surface is smooth but not polished. It can take a good finish.

Our spa tub is 6 years old and we use it frequently. This is not a miracle worker but it will clean most of the gunk out of your tub or spa bath. I run it for 15 minutes with the air off (air in the jets makes too much foam). I place my hands on two jets and release and repeat to cause turbulence in the other jets. This helps break loose stubborn alge film in the plumbing. I repeat this around the tub while it is running and then let it run for 15 more minutes. Then I drain, refil the tub and add about 1/2 bottle of peroxide and repeat the process to rinse and sanitize the plumbing. After that's all over we use Scrubbing Bubbles and paper towels to clean the grit and gunk that wound up stuck to the sides of the tub. This keeps the tub pretty clean for a couple weeks or a month depending on usage.By the way this has a nasty chemical smell in use - be sure to run the vent fan.We used to use bubble bath and baby oil in the tub, but apparently oils provide food for the gunk that grows in the plumbing. So we no longer do that. Now we just add baking soda (3 fluid oz cup full) to each bath. It's not as nice as the bubble bath and oil but it's good on the skin and somewhat less conducive to growing gunk in the plumbing.
Good quality - Exactly what I expected. And it's shipped well protected in a plastic tube and that in an oversized box.

This is a simple but well-made magnifier. The lens is just under 3" in diameter. The magnification by my estimate is about X2 for an item flush against the back skirt of the magnifier. This magnifier appears mainly intended for reading printed material and photographs - And it does a very good job of that. The LED lights go on when you press on the top silver colored ring and goes off when you press again on that. The lens is made of glass which means it should be less prone to getting minor scratches which plastic lens are prone to get. The entire field of view appears to be well illuminated and the magnification appears to be fairly free of optical distortions except right at the edges.The large lens and field of view are very useful - It means you don't have to move it around as much as you would a smaller magnifier. And the magnification appears quite adequate for use in reading fine print or looking at pictures.Update: I left my magnifier out and my wife put it away for me in the case that came with it. If you are not careful that case will hold the light switch on and run the batteries down. Solution - hide or discard the case. When I replaced the batteries I found it had two each CR2016 lithium coin cells. When I replaced those with my own fresh CR2016's I found the battery contact was intermittent. I discovered that two slightly thicker CR2025 cells will just barely fit into the battery compartment and give a more secure connection. If you do this place a little piece of scotch tape or a piece of paper on the back edge of the first battery that goes in to prevent it from contacting the terminal that touches the outside edge of the top battery. If you don't the second cell will be shorted out and the light won't be as bright as it should be. The batteries go in positive end up. The CR2025 batteries should also last longer as they have greater current capacity unless you carelessly use that cover and run the batteries down.The case issue and the battery compartment issues reduced my rating by two stars - but it's still a good magnifier.

The threaded brass Rod is what it is described as. However the price is terrible for a single 6" threaded brass Rod. Since the description had no information on the quantity per order and the picture showed two rods and the description described it in the plural I took a chance and orderd hoping that it was for more than one 6" threaded brass Rod. But I was wrong - there was exactly one threaded brass Rod in the package.The quality of the Rod itself is OK, but the fact that the quantity per order was vague and misleading causes me to rate this with only 2 stars. Amazon sells other versions of this that are much longer for about the same price. Do not waste your money on this one.

Noah Gordon is one of my favorite authors.  His writing is superb and his subject matter is always totally absorbing and well researched.  In this novel he gives a wealth of information about the diamond trade and incorporates it into a very human story of lives and loves in an effortless style that holds your interest all the way to the conclusion.

This book was written before the Monash University studies on the low FODMAP diet for IBS.  I assume that this book is based on the foods that Ms Van Vorous can tolerate but unfortunately her list of tolerated foods doesn't apply to everyone with IBS.  FODMAPs are the type of sugars that cause inflammation in people sensitive to them.  I found  garlic and honey which are both high in FODMAPs used a lot in the recipes in this book and the recipes are not gluten free, and with gluten being another trigger in intestinal inflammation that makes no sense.  If you have the same sensitivities as the author you might do well with this but be aware that research and a scientific approach to the problem has come up with different conclusions.  Check out the Monash University information on the low FODMAP diet if this book doesn't give you the answers you need.  I do have a Masters Degree in Nutrition so I am somewhat knowledgeable.  I think it might be helpful to many if the author were to write an updated version taking the latest research into consideration.As for her other products, the Heather's Tummy Fiber ( acacia fiber ) and Heather's Tummy Tamers,  ( peppermint capsules ) are excellent products and very useful in managing IBS .

I've been looking for a pullover bra in this style for ages so I was glad to find these.  I am not really happy with the quality.  The cotton is rough and there is a chemical odor to them that was quite strong when I opened the package.  I have washed them 3 times now and can still smell a slight odor.  The price was great but I'd be very happy to pay a few dollars more for a better quality product.

A very enjoyable mystery.  The 4 stars instead of 5 mean that I think it was really very good and I would certainly recommend it, it takes a lot for a book to get 5 stars.  I read a few of the negative reviews by obviously prudish reviewers and it's their loss that they made such a quick judgement about one scene that was I'm sure was not out of character for the times, but was out of character for the Detective who who turned out to be very kind and caring.  Given that the book had absolutely no sex scenes and only what was probably normal behavior for the times it portrayed, the scene that had other reviewers on edge was truly insignificant.  I'm a woman over 60 and I took no offense.  I'm looking forward to the 2nd book in the series.

This is a beautiful skirt with enough flare that is isn't pencil tight.  Really nice fabric in a nice weight.  I ordered a size larger than normal thinking it might be snug but it is truly a 2X size so a bit large on me.  It washed really well.  Love it.
I found the trigger too hard to push, very awkward.  I returned it.

This is a nice quality skirt - the fabric is a nice weight and not too thin.  I normally wear a size 16-18, or XL to 1X.  I ordered a 3 X knowing this style skirt usually runs small and I don't like my clothing too tight. .  The 3 X was too large on me, I'd say it was more like a 2 X though so actually maybe a bit small for the 3X size.  I sew so I just took it in at the waist and I love the way it hangs loosely.  Very pretty fabric.
Predictable and shallow.  One of the worst books I've read lately.  Maybe some good recipes.  I suggest the writer switch to writing cookbooks.
Not worth the time to read.  I suspect the author is a better cook than a writer.  Predictable, saccharine, and boring.

Heavy fabric and the sizing is way off.  Like many sizes meant for the larger woman they try to cheat and make you think you wear a smaller size by sizing everything too large.  I'd rather have the size fairly accurate for ordering online.

We had the more expensive version of this clock for quite a few years but it was larger and unbalanced - kept knocking it off onto the floor which finally killed it.  This has all the same features ( except adjustment on position of overhead display ) for about half the price and it's a much better balanced clock with rubberized feet that doesn't tip over easily. It is also easier to deal with the alarm settings in the dark as the alarm button is in a place of it's own instead of in a row of buttons.  Love it !

I have extremely sensitive skin, I'm even sensitive to the finish on some thread and have had to throw away clothing because the seams give me a rash.  And I have to have gluten free and unscented.  This is the only lotion I've found that really works for me.  It isn't too sticky and it rubs in well. I keep a tube on my desk and can use my computer quickly after using the lotion without getting everything messy. I use it after I shower on my whole body, when my hands are dry after frequent hand washing, keep it by my bedside, in the bathroom and the kitchen.  It does add the moisture my dry skin needs without irritation and I'd be lost without it. I'm a bit confused by one reviewer saying hers had changed because I have the more recent product labeled Fragrance Free and there is no fragrance odor I can detect and it doesn't irritate so perhaps she is just sensitive to one ingredient changed.

These are a great fit for an average figure and I'd say they run true to size.  The waist is low enough to be comfortable when sitting but not so low I'm afraid I'll lose them when standing..  The fabric is really nice quality - a fairly heavy cotton sweatshirt fleece that washes like a dream - no shrinking no pilling no wrinkling.  The pockets are deep enough for a cell phone or keys.  The waistband is a comfortable  cotton ribbing and seams don't chafe anywhere.  The drawstring ties on the inside of the waistband for a smoother look.  The only thing I'd change at all would be the drawstring itself, it is nice quality and looks like it will hold up well but it is round and rather bulky.  A flat drawstring made like a shoelace would be better.  But that is minor and changeable.  Overall the best sweatpants I've found in years, I'm buying several more .

I really had to force myself to continue reading this book.  Mark Helprin is a wordsmith - beautifully written descriptive sentences but there was nothing but perhaps the joy of a well written phrase to make me want to continue turning pages. The characters lacked depth, I never could feel connected to them. The story, while obviously meant to be fantasy, was too strange to meld with the realism, the tapestry was not well woven, and there seemed to be no point in many of the events in relation to the story.I enjoy a mix of fantasy and realism, George R.R. Martin did this masterfully in his Song of Ice and Fire Series.  Shirley Hazzard in The Transit of Venus tells a story of 2 sisters that is a beautifully constructed web that draws you in and holds you until the end, her characters and story are compelling.  Both are consummate storytellers who write with depth and insight, and by comparison Mark Helprin is a one trick pony.  Pretty words alone do not constitute a well written book.

This is a great formula for diabetics or those who don't want to become diabetic.  Both my husband and I take it and his diabetes has actually gotten better. The price is really good for a multivitamin too.  I like NOW Foods because their entire line of products is Gluten Free which I need.

This is the only cat food both my picky cats will really eat well. It always smells good when I open the can.  They also like the Friskies Seafood Pates but only when they are very moist. I find the only problems with subscribe and save are that sometimes the cans are damaged, and also that if I get a case of food that is not really moist my cats don't want it.  Still beats the high prices at the grocery store and  nice to just have it delivered to my door.

From the negative reviews it sound like people have gotten old product.  I used to manage a Nutrition Dept. in a Whole Foods Store and what they are describing with the smell and hard product is expired or rancid product.  It should be returned.  This is a great lip balm, I love that it colors like lipstick while giving me the SPF I want.  And when it is fresh it is as soft as any chapstick etc.  It is a waxy feel compared to some but that's ok with me as I've had skin cancer and the SPF is important to me. A tube does last a long time, I have 2 now that I know I've had for several years and they aren't rancid.  Just be careful who you buy it from and if it's bad make them take it back.  They can return it to Unpetroleum for credit if they are a legit vendor.
I first tried this tea at PF Chang's restaurant and it was such a good, mellow and not bitter green tea I asked the waiter what it was.  Best green tea I've tried.

This may sound strange but I buy this for my dog. It is a very similar formula to Vets Best Aches & Pains and much more affordable.  I just use the dosage amount that correlates to the Vet's Best formula and mix it with her food every day.  It really does help my older dog with hip pain.

Because I have to eat gluten free (celiac disease) I am very careful about the products I buy.  I have never had a problem with these, love the taste, and they are enough to fill in for a meal when I am out and about as I don't risk eating in restaurants.  The other flavors are also good but I find the Nut Delight to be less sticky than the ones with fruit in them and this makes them easier to eat on the run.

I was really pleased by the color of this sheet set, true to the photo and a really pretty sage green.  The sheets are nicely made and so soft, really wonderful to sleep on.  My husband loves them and so do I.  The only reason I gave them 4 stars is because they wrinkle terribly after washing and drying.  The instructions say to hang them on the line to dry to prevent wrinkles, but really, who has a clothesline anymore.  The wrinkles do stretch out when on the bed so they are comfortably smooth to sleep on, just the top hem that shows is wrinkled.  If you don't mind wrinkled sheets then these are great.  I did notice that the tag sewn on the sheets says 100% Bamboo, not Bamboo and Cotton as described but that didn't really matter to me.

I ordered my normal size but the cups were too full which made them wrinkle at the top.  Also the bra straps are not adjustable and as I am 6 ft tall they were too short.  Probably ok for an average height woman but I'd recommend ordering a smaller cup size than normal unless you are very full busted.
I only got to wear these once as the heel on one of the socks came apart in the first washing.  They are pretty thin for a fuzzy sock and certainly not great quality but they are cute.

The nutrition in this cereal is undoubtedly good but the taste is pretty non existent.  It might have been ok when fresh but after being packaged in a plastic pouch it was a mushy mess that was almost inedible.  And expensive.  Do yourself a favor, save your money and cook some quinoa at home if you want this type of cereal.

While this can be a bit hard to read because of the dark colors used it is really helpful for older zones and instances that are not on the downloadable map.  When there are multiple layers to a zone as in Deathfist Citadel or Palace of the Awakened you can see all of them on one page which helps to know where to go up or down a level. After 7 years of playing EQ2 I still pull this out sometimes to help find where I"m going in the older zones.

I buy NOW Foods supplements as I have celiac disease and their entire product line is gluten free.  I also have a master degree in nutrition so I know not only from personal experience that L Glutamine is healing for a damaged intestine as it helps to rebuild cells. Celiac Disease destroys the intestinal villi.  The gentleman who took it for a spastic colon apparently had a problem that wasn't helped with this product, and if indeed his problem was spasms it wouldn't be.

Enzymes occur naturally in foods to break them down.  A ripe banana gets soft and mushy because of the plant enzymes breaking it down.  When you cook and process foods the enzymes in that food are lost and you must rely on your own digestive enzymes which come from the pancreas.  Not everyone produces enough enzymes to properly digest their food.  So if you are having digestive problems,  taking supplemental enzymes makes a huge difference.  These are a good formula because not only do they provide the necessary enzymes for all types of food, they also include anti-inflammatory and healing nutrients to calm and heal an overstressed digestive tract.  An excellent formula for the price.

These pants fit my husband really well, His belly is where he carries his weight and so often when pants are large enough in the waist the legs and seat are much too large.  These aren't, The legs and seat fit well.  Somehow the designer got these right for a mature man's figure.  They also washed really well, still look new out of the dryer with no wrinkles, and a classy look to the fabric.

It's too bad that Amazon does not require vendors to list product ingredients.  I had used this product before and still have an empty bottle, wanted more because it contained plantain which is really effective.  What I received was a totally different product, same name and sku number but reformulated with ingredients that are in dozens of other products and I don't believe will be as helpful.  I was very disappointed in the company for selling another product entirely but using the same product name and sku number.  Check the ingredient list somewhere before you buy.

An easily read book because it is written so simply and there is not much to think about, even the story is average to boring.  I kept reading because several reviewers raved about the book, but I was kept wondering what they were raving about all the way to the end.  It does touch on emotions common to most of us and perhaps that is what caught some readers, and even though poorly written, may make it a halfway decent movie.  But having just finished a Shirley Hazzard novel this was so pale by comparison it was rendered invisible.

This may be a very good product for people without sensitivities to some of the many ingredients not listed on the Amazon description.  I really believe it should be mandatory for Amazon to fully list ingredients.  It contains chamomile which I an sensitive to, and also contains wheat protein.  I am not only so severely allergic to wheat that it gives me a rash in topical products, I also have celiac disease and can't risk using any products containing wheat or glutens as what is on hands can sometimes find it way to my mouth.  Shame on Amazon for selling products with incomplete information.  Hard for me to rate an item I couldn't use but I gave it 3 stars because I see no need for all the extra and possibly harmful ingredients.

Melatonin works well for me, helps me to fall asleep easily.  I use several products from Wonder Labs as I trust the quality and I have to have Gluten Free because of Celiac Disease so knowing I can trust that this is gluten free is important.

We have a very large ( 120lb ) older dog who gets stiff and will sometimes limp painfully after lying down,  She also struggles to get up at times.  When I notice her limping or seeming to be in pain I give her these.  She loves them, will take them as is and thinks they are a treat. They really do make a difference for her.  She does get glucosamine and MSM in her food every day but these tablets work well for more immediate pain relief.
This would have been a comfortable bra if the sizing was right.  The cup size was accurate but the band was way too small for the size range given.

Love this gum.  Just want to note that I have purchased it both in the 100 count jar and the 10 count packages and there is a difference.  The gum in the jar was stiffer and harder to chew - like it had dried out some.  The gum in the blisterpack type 10 count package is much softer and fresher.  I'd usually rather buy the product with less packaging but in this case I'm buying the smaller packs from now on.
This is a good formula and I like that it has 1000 mg calcium in only 2 pills a day. They are not too large and shaped and smooth to be easy to swallow.

Was a waste of money buying these.  I like the cotton version so ordered the same size in the microfiber but they are much smaller and the waist cuts in which is neither attractive or comfortable.  Jockey needs to size their products more consistently.

We take this when exposed to the flu, or someone with a cold.  It really does seem to make a big difference.  The only time one of us has become ill in the past few years was when they didn't take it.

When our local water company started adding flouride to our tap water we decided it was time to start drinking bottled water.  This has been the best solution.  A very dependable unit that we have run several times a day for 2 years now.  I wouldn't want to be without it.  I was a bit dismayed to find the original bottle was polycarbonate, but then found they have a safer bottle available now.

I looked to find these as they are my husband's favorites.  The are short enough in the leg that they don't show under shorts, and the covered waistband is comfortable.  The few pairs he has now have washed well and are still in good shape after several years of wear.

SILENT CITY was an excellent mystery story. I really enjoyed the main character who is coming back from cancer treatment. She had an aggressive form of lymphoma and it was treated aggressively. She still has nerve damage in her extremities and other side effects of her treatment. The first day back on the job she is called to a murder scene. A popular elementary school principal is found dead in his apartment with a broken neck. His body has been posed like Christ on the cross.As Codella investigates she finds a plethora of suspects. Beloved by the families of his school, Hector Sanchez was not beloved by his staff or central administration. Many of his legacy teachers resented his approach; his assistant principal was bullied by him. He was opposed to his Superintendent's plan to buy a huge technology program.Codella has to get back up to speed quickly to solve this one. She is in a new precinct which she transferred to just before she began her battle with cancer and the precinct commander resents her ability and is constantly trying to undermine her activities. She is paired up with a new partner who has just transferred from Vice and who is a gay man getting his own harassment from bigoted colleagues. She also has to deal with her relationship with her old partner. They had a fight just before she transferred because he wanted a more personal relationship with her. She was caught off guard by this and, before they could resolve this, she was in the hospital fighting her cancer. She was also angry that he never came to visit her when she was undergoing her treatments.So Codella investigates. Is it one of the legacy teachers that Sanchez was trying to get fired? Is it the Superintendent who has her own secrets to conceal? Is it the salesman who is having an affair with the Superintendent and who wants his commission on this huge software scale? Is it the actress or her lesbian partner who has been pouring money into the school and who might have an inappropriate relationship with Sanchez? Is it the assistant principal who had been bullied by Sanchez?This was an engaging story. I educational infighting and politics rang true to this long-time teacher which was unsurprising since the author works in the education field. I liked Codella because of her desire to prove that she is back to form but who is forever changed by the battle she won.Fans of mysteries and police procedurals will enjoy this fast-paced, engaging story.

This is Evie and Zane's romance. They were childhood friends who sheltered and protected each other from the bad home lives they both had. Zane was abused by his drunken and drug addicted father. Evie lived with her alcoholic mother and her police officer father who was always gone. After their first sexual encounter was interrupted by Evie's father, both Zane's father and Evie's father were shot to death and Zane would have been a suspect if he hadn't run. He disappeared from Evie's life leaving her pregnant with his son.Nine years pass and they reconnect. Evie is now an artist who customizes motorcycles and Zane is the Vice President of an outlaw motorcycle club. Unfortunately, Evie has attracted the attention of the President of a rival motorcycle club which makes beginning a relationship with Zane very dangerous both for her heart and for her life.This story gives a good picture of life in a motorcycle club - a life I wouldn't choose for all the money in the world. Like me, Evie isn't sure that she can ever accept the way things are inside the club. When Zane is beaten for disobeying the club president, he accepts it as a logical consequence but Evie is ready to break up with him over it.I enjoyed the romance as both had to learn to trust each other again and forgive each other and themselves for the things that happened in the past. They also had to find a way reconcile their different lifestyles in the present.This wasn't a sweet romance. It was dark and gritty. Both Evie and Zane have sexual kinks that, luckily, they both share. Between murders, fires, and kidnappings the action in the story was gritty and dark too.Fans of the series and fans of dark romances will enjoy this intense story.

This was an entertaining romantic fantasy which is the third book in a series. I do not recommend beginning with this story because there are only references to events that happened earlier in the series and I found them more confusing than helpful. Living among us but hidden from us are immortal being from Welsh mythology. They are fighting a war between those who are pure-blooded and can shift between their human and wolf identities and those who intermarried with humans who are not all able to shift. Some are born able to shift, others are born human and can't shift, and still others are born as wolves with human minds.This story centers around Elen who was born human but who has substantial and unique magical powers which have made her very attractive to the leaders of the Guardians - the pure bloods. Pendaran who leads the Council of Guardians wants to control Elen and use her powers. Cormack is her romantic partner. Apparently he was one of those who was born wolf and couldn't shift to human until Elen did something to him in one of the earlier books. Cormack has lived with Elen as a wolf for three hundred years and loved her all that time. Now he has to learn to deal with a human body and has to learn if Elen can also love the man as she had loved the wolf.I liked the relationship between Cormack and Elen. I thought their scenes together, at least once they cleared up their misunderstandings, were very romantic. I thought the book had lots of adventure too as Elen has to deal with betrayal and imprisonment. I liked that Cormack never gave up on finding her after she was taken by Pendaran.This was an interesting story with wonderful world building. I would recommend reading the first two books in the series before reading this one though.

Bex Adams is planning to spend the summer before her senior year working on her entry for an art contest that will provide some scholarship money for college. She wants to become a medical illustrator and has plans to draw cadavers. After being stood up by the doctor who runs the anatomy program, she's waiting for a late bus home when she meets a boy.Jack Vincent is handsome, charming and mysterious. She suspects that he is the graffiti artist who is painting words in large gold letters all around San Francisco. When they meet again they begin to form a relationship. Each finds the other fascinating. But Jack is keeping some secrets.Both Bex and Jack have difficult family issues that they have to resolve. Bex's parents are divorced and her mother is still very angry at her father. Her attitude has tainted her kids' relationship with their father. Bex hasn't seen him for three years and, when he surprises her, she has a screaming argument with him.Jack's father is the mayor of San Francisco. He has a busy political life and Jack feels that he isn't very high on his father's priority list. Jack also has a twin sister who has been hospitalized with schizophrenia though everyone believes she is away at a school in Europe. Jack is doing his graffiti for her.I really liked the romance in this book which was realistic in its depiction of teenage awkwardness. It was also realistic in its portrayal of Bex and Jack's sexual relationship. I loved the way that both Bex and Jack fought for their relationship.Fans of romances will enjoy this story.

Jennifer Donnelly has written an engaging historical mystery and coming of age story in THESE SHALLOW GRAVES.Josephine Montfort's world changes dramatically when her father dies. Her sheltered life as the daughter of one of the first families of New York didn't prepare her for what she learns. But Jo doesn't really fit into her sheltered life. She wants to be a newspaper reporter like the famous Nelly Bly. She doesn't want to spend her life married to a rich man she doesn't love, caring for his home, and raising his children.Jo has a handsome potential fiance in Bram Aldrich whom she has known since they were children but she has no romantic interest in him despite knowing that she should.  When she meets reporter Eddie Gallagher, her future certainties are challenged. As she and Eddie investigate the murder of her father and she falls in love with him, she questions more and more the future that has been planned for her.Eddie introduces her to parts of New York that she has never seen and people she would never have gotten to know. She becomes friends with Fairy Fay, a young woman who has been raised by the local Fagin as a pickpocket and who has outgrown it and is to be sold to a madam as a prostitute.Jo makes discoveries that shatter what she knows of her family and her father. I had figured out who the villain was pretty early in the story and had some ideas about the secret that was being hidden but enjoyed discovering the truth along with Jo. I also enjoyed the glimpse into the 1890s for both the rich and the poor. Seeing what a woman's role and choices were made me very glad that I am living now and not then.This was a great story that was as much a mystery as an exploration of a time in history that is thankfully past. Readers will enjoy both the mystery and the strong character of Jo Montfort who finally makes her own choices.

Jack Logan isn't a big fan of football which is too bad since football is king at his high school and his father was the school's all-time record holder in many categories. When the school gets a new principal, his first change is to require all seniors to be on some sports team. Jack is recruited to be on the team by the new principal/head football coach but declines. Jack learns that the coach once dated his mother until she chose his father over the coach. He also learns that the coach - Muhldinger - is the type of guy who holds grudges.Jack teams up with some of his non-athletic friends and the girl who is going to be his girlfriend to form a soccer team. First they have to recruit a coach and their choice is a part-time Latin teacher from England. The team has decided to rebel against the win at all cost mentality of the school by trying to lose all their games.When a video of the principal/coach berating the team after their first game, in which they were blown out by a group of junior high school girls, goes viral. The Loses small time quiet protest gains more momentum than anyone was expecting. It is even picked up by the national press and the kids are being hounded by reporters. Then things escalate. One of the kids on the team is attacked and beaten up, sustaining a concussion and a broken wrist. Another kid has his car set on fire in front of his house.The simple protest that the kids had in mind soon becomes something that is almost out of their control. There are tensions between Jack and his dad who is also losing in construction job because of the bad economy. Jack's girlfriend Becca is also going through stress at home as her parents are divorcing and her dad has a new, younger girlfriend.This story was very readable and very engaging. I liked that it was about more than just sports. I also thought it realistically portrayed what social media can do to make a small fire into an inferno. Sports fans will enjoy the hapless performance of the Losers' soccer team and will enjoy seeing Jack discover a sport he enjoys and is good at. People who aren't sports fans will still enjoy the humor in the story.

Wren is a homeschooled astronomy buff whose academic rival is homeschooled Simon Barker. Their parents are friends. When Wren and Simon are recruited by the magical Fiddlers, both enter a world they didn't know existed.There was a recent civil war in that world between the Alchemists and the Magicians that has left lots of distrust between the adults and fear that the leader of the Magicians, Boggen, will someday return. Wren, Simon, and another new apprentice named Jack are all being mentored by Fiddler Mary who was Boggen's mentor.This story is told by Mary. So we get to learn most about her. We see a young girl who knows she is smart and who is sometimes envious of her rival Simon. There are some things he is quicker and better at than she is. She is not used to that and doesn't like it very much. What we see of Simon is a more easy-going kid who wants to be friends with Wren. Jack is more mysterious. He's always cracking jokes but is very secretive about his past while both Wren and Simon come from happy families.Wren learns that she has some unusual magical talents including that she is a Weather Changer and Dreamer. When she loses her temper, everyone learns that she is a Weather Changer which is worrying because Boggen was also a Weather Changer. She manages to keep the fact that she is a Dreamer secret. It is in her lucid dreams that she meets Boggen and other of the Magicians.This story was entertaining and exciting as the kids need to stop Boggen from finding his way back to Earth and starting his civil war again. I liked that the magic the kids did used nursery rhymes as their base. I liked that each chapter began with an altered nursery rhyme. I liked the relationship that grew between Wren and Simon. I liked the world building.Middle grade fans of fantasy will enjoy the sympathetic characters and fast-paced action of this engaging story.

DEAD INVESTIGATION was an engaging mystery told from two different points of view.Murray is a high school senior who lives in a cemetery and can talk to the dead. He is staying in the equipment shed after leaving the home of his prostitute mother. Murray believes that the dead people he talks to in the cemetery are his only friends but he fears that being able to talk to them means that he is mentally ill. Murry does have a couple of living friends too. Pearl and her father Janochek also live in the cemetery. Janochek is the caretaker.Deputy Roman Gates is an investigator for the local sheriff's office and is the second viewpoint character. Gates is dealing with a gambling addiction which caused him to be jailed and to lose his job. Now, reinstated but at a lower rank, he is trying to rebuild his life. He is also feeling guilty about the suicide death of his only child.Gates and Murray met before in a previous case. This time Gates is investigating the disappearances of a number of homeless people from the local area. He is also investigating the disappearance of a young man whose father is the CEO of Trask Engineering.When Murray begins hearing voices outside the cemetery walls, he first tries to ignore them. He doesn't want any publicity or any more suspicion from the police if he reports more bodies. Pearl wants to investigate though. And finally Janochek convinces Murray to contact Gates.Lots of action, excitement and danger happen before the case is solved. My one quibble with this mystery is its classification as YA. Since at least half of it is told from the viewpoint of 40-ish Deputy Gates, I wonder if it will appeal to YA readers.Fans of mysteries and characters with strange powers will find this one entertaining. Fans of the first book will definitely want to read this one to find out what happens in Murray and Pearl's lives.

NEWT'S EMERALD was a delightful Regency romp with magic. It reminded me of the best of Georgette Heyer.Lady Truthful Newington has grown up in the country with the company of her cousins and the supervision of her Admiral father. Now she has reached the age when she will be sent to London to make her presentation to Society and find herself a husband. However, before she can embark, her father shows her the Newington Emerald which will be hers when she reaches age 21. The emerald is a magical object which has been in the family for many generations. But a sudden storm and an unknown intruder arrive and, when things settle down, the emerald is missing. Her father is taken ill and in moments of lucidity he tells Truthful that he fears the loss of the emerald will destroy the family's luck.Truthful travels to London to stay with her Great-Aunt Ermintrude and locate the emerald. Her great-aunt reveals hidden depths and encourages her to dress as a man to search for the emerald. Luckily, her great-aunt is a talented sorceress who places a spell on Truthful's false mustache to encourage the deception.Truthful, now Henri de Vienne, runs into Major Charles Harkness who is convinced that Truthful is a French spy. Having been disappointed in love, Charles says some rude things about Truthful which makes her eager to live down to his opinion of her.However, the two of them need to work together to defeat the evil sorceress who stole the emerald and along the way, and despite many misunderstandings, the two fall in love. What I especially enjoyed in this story was the Truthful saves Charles's life at least three times. She is no fainting, helpless heroine.The characters were engaging, the plot was fast-paced, and the setting was intriguing. Other similar books include Georgette Heyer's Regency romances, Jane Austen's novels, and, for readers who want some magic with their Regency story, SHADES OF MILK AND HONEY by Mary Robinette Kowal or SORCERY AND CECILIA by Patricia C. Wrede and Caroline Stevermer.

This is the middle book in the trilogy that began with SNOW LIKE ASHES. As a middle book, we are left searching for resolution. However, the journey is exciting and we get a chance to see three of the other kingdoms on Primordia.The story begins in Winter, Meira and her fellow survivors from Angra's captivity are back home trying to restore a country that has been neglected for at least sixteen years. They are being helped by King Noam of Cordell. His son Theron was once engage to Meira and was a fellow prisoner of Angra. He and Meira are at odds because they want different things for Winter. Theron wants magic to be available to everyone and Meira wants to end all magic.King Noam is demanding repayment for his assistance and is requiring Winter to reopen its mines. He is really looking for a chasm of magic that he believes is hidden in one of Winter's mines. When a door to the chasm is discovered, it is guarded by three locks.Clues lead to three neighboring kingdoms. So Meira, Theron, and their companions set off to find the keys. Meira is also looking for allies in her quest to throw King Noam out of her country. Theron is looking for rulers to sign a treaty to foster peace.They have all sorts of adventures and Meira learns that on old enemy isn't nearly dead enough and is still creating havoc. After reading this one, which leaves our heroes in very perilous positions, fans will be very, very eager to read the final book in this trilogy.

Jori Garrison trains dogs for wounded Veterans. She learned how when she was in prison. She was convicted of drug pushing via circumstantial evidence. Her cheating ex-fiance had set her up before dying in a car accident. Now, she is training dogs and trying to rebuild her life.Lauray Batisse was a military policeman whose K-9 companion died at the same time Law was hurt by an IED. Law lost his left leg and had other injuries. He's trying to get back to his job as an Arkansas State Trooper but PTSD has made him a candidate for a service dog.Samantha is the dog. She is a mix of golden retriever and poodle, has a rusted-red coat, coal-black nose, floppy ears, and an enormous curling tail. Law notes that it looks like a cheese doodle. He is very reluctant to take her as his service dog partly out of loyalty to his K-9 Scud and partly out of his feeling that he ought to be able to deal with his PTSD without her.When Law and Jori meet they are attracted to each other but Law makes it clear that it can only be a one-night stand. He was raised to believe that he couldn't do relationships. But it seems like Law and Jori kept getting pushed together. Jori has to go to him to give him and Samantha some more training. Also an investigation that Law is during intersects with Jori's court case. Law agrees to help Jori find out the truth about how she came to be convicted.The story has a lot of action and some sizzling romantic scenes as Jori and Law learn to take a chance on each other. This was an excellent romantic suspense novel. I really enjoyed the chapters that Samantha narrated about her alpha too.

This second book in the Noctis Magicae series was as wonderful as the first. Sophie Marshall is a second year student at Merlin College and married to Gray who is a lecturer there. While she very much enjoys the chance to learn about magick, she does not enjoy the prejudice and attention that is paid to her as one of the few female students and the long lost daughter of the King.When Gray is offered a position as a visiting lecturer at the University in Din Edin in the country of Alba and Sophie offered a position as a student there, they are eager to accept. However, Alba and Britain are separate countries and relations between them are somewhat tense. Sophie loves the university and is glad to meet and make friends with other female scholars. But the political situation isn't good. The land is suffering from some ills - crop failures and illness in some animal herds - and magickal interference is being blamed.Tensions escalate when it is learned that the next Chieftain of the clans, Lucia MacNeill a fellow student of Sophie's, has become betrothed to Roland, Sophie's half brother and second in line to the throne in Britain, there are protests that threaten to grow into riots. The political factions that see this as Britain's attempt to conquer Alba are very unhappy.Meanwhile, Joanna who is Sophie's sister is busy in London learning diplomacy from her guardian Sieur Germain de Kergabet who is an adviser to King Henry and Lord President of His Majesty's Privy Council. Joanna is on the inside knowing about the marriage plans of Roland, who has a monster crush on her, and Lucia MacNeill. Joanna is also planning a visit north to visit her sister and Gray.Shortly before Joanna's arrival, Gray is kidnapped though, at first, it is assumed that he has been called home because of his father's illness. Time is lost because of the need to give him time to travel from Alba to the south of Britain but when a second letter is received, Sophie knows that something is very wrong. She learns that other foreign mages have also disappeared. She is determined to find her husband. In fact, she must find her husband because the longer he is away from her the more sick she becomes. Their marriage had linked their magick together. If she can't find him, they will both die.This was a wonderful story. The world building was amazing. I loved the combination of magick and political intrigue. I also loved the growing relationship between Gray and Sophie as they adjust to being married. Sophie is a wonderful character who has immense magickal talent but no desire to use it for political gain.This book will be going on my Keeper Shelf along with the first book in the series - THE MIDNIGHT QUEEN.

Move over, Amelia Peabody, there is a new Victorian eccentric in town. Veronica Speedwell loves to go on adventures hunting butterflies and attractive foreign men. Now that her aunt has passed away, she has no ties keeping her in England. But when she returns to her aunt's cottage after the funeral, she surprises an intruder who is searching the place and who attempts to kidnap her. She is rescued by Baron Maximillian von Stauffenbach who offers her a ride to London and answers to her questions. He is convinced that she is in deadly danger and deposits her with an old friend of his Stoker.Stoker is grouchy, disheveled and living in a warehouse down by the river surrounded by his natural history specimens. He isn't eager to be a refuge for Veronica but owes Max and thus agrees. Veronica and Stoker clash for a number of reasons. She questions the accuracy of his labels on some of his specimens and, worst of all, cleans the place up because she prefers a tidy organized environment. When the baron is murdered, Veronica and Stoker want to solve the crime but the police have decided that Stoker is a suspect in the crime. The two wind up fleeing the city.On their way out of town, Veronica is approached by Edmund de Clare who offers to save her from Stoker. And while they are in hiding at a traveling curiosity show, a groom with suspiciously soft hands and refined speech named Mornaday also offers to rescue her from Stoker. Veronica wonders why she is suddenly drawing so much attention.Orphaned, illegitimate Veronica has a secret past of her own. Those secrets are very threatening to some people who would either like her dead or who would like to control her. Veronica has to find a way to neutralize the situation to save both Stoker and herself.Veronica is a wonderful character. She is a free thinker. She seems oblivious to the danger she is in. In fact, she acts likes she's ten feet tall and bullet-proof. She has a confidence that borders on arrogance and absolutely no tact. She is quite smart and has no need or desire to be under any man's protection. She is anything but a typical Victorian woman of the gentility.I loved the relationship between Veronica and Stoker. Their arguments and other conversations were filled with wonderful dialogue. I liked the way he came to treat her as an equal partner and I liked the struggle between them until he did. Stoker is a man with secrets that Veronica would love to probe but she is giving him time to share them.I can't wait to read more books in this new series to find out how their relationship grows and find out what new mysteries they solve.

The summer before her senior year brings big changes to Westlin Beck. Her best friend Trudy is off being a camp counselor and her boyfriend Elliot is working full time on the family farm to save up enough money for a car. West is feeling kind of lost and at loose ends.She tags along when her minister father brings communion to the new family in town. She takes one look at Silas and things start to change. First, her father invites him to join with West in her car detailing business. Then they start hanging out together. Silas in turns intrigues and annoys her but he always fascinates her. But West has a boyfriend, a boy she married under the jungle gym when they were in second grade.Despite holding on with both hands, West can't stop the changes that are happening to her this summer. Her older friend Gordon is losing his memory. Her father is putting everyone else's needs ahead of the needs of his family. Her friend Whit is drinking more and more.And then there is Silas's sister Laurel. Silas's twin has severe mental issues. She has Solipsism Syndrome which means that she believes that she is living in a dream. Some days she's all right but other days she has screaming fits. This disease has caused problems for her whole family but it seems especially hard on Silas because he's her twin.This was an amazing story about falling in love, growing up, and deciding what to believe in. Both West and Silas are readers so there are lots of references to great thinkers and poets. Silas also writes poetry of his own and some of his work is in the book.This was an excellent, touching story. I can't wait to share it with my students.
