Watch for the photos by 9/2012This is a nice kit with 6ea 30 minute flares - thats 6 flares spaced out 300+ feet behind your vehicle to get cars to slow down, move to the left, and watch out for people.  double up with 2 kits of 6 flares and you can go out 600 feet behind your disabled vehicle for 30 min (enough time for towtruck to arrive)If you are on sceen for over 30 min, you can lay one flare's tip at the end of a burning flare for 1 hour.  While not a timekeeping mechanism, the flares offer you the ability to track half hour approximations.These are far brighter than led products or unlit products e.g. triangles.  Their visability and red color shine for > 1000 feet.In addition to the flares and zipper case a reflective vest is included in the zipper bag free of charge.Finally some construction and delivery notes.Flares are claszified ORM-D which usually tags on a 25 buck hit for hazmat shipping plus ground charges. You will not get them 2 day air or next day - be thankfull you can get the product for less than the typ. ORM-D charge.Finally these are not made like flares from the 60's.  There is no wax coating on them to protect from moisture.  There is no nail in the back to stick in the ground for verticle burning, but flare stands are cheap.  The nice velcro bag is a good plus to keep 6 flares from rolling around in your trunk.Summary: for 3 hours of bright red burn time this is a great price and a deal, as more vehicles come without flares, and the ones in the auto stores are 15 min 3 packs for a higher price.  I would keep a set of matches with the flares - they have a match type strike surface, but a very small red phosphorous cap to strike the flare and start it.  A good trick to get them to light is to put the cap on another flare's NON burning end with the burning end capped and use it to strike the exposed flare you want to light.  I keep a box of matches in the car as they can be used to quickly start a flare once lit.  Ideally you would have 6 inches in which to strike the flare but the cap is only 3/4" diameter and circular.  Often times this means not enough movement to get the flare to light.  More pressure helps or a 2nd flare to put a stirker cap on and use flare against flare lighting method.  Matches are the best!

I keep a few 4GB sticks hanging around for one main reason  - I've gotta move files and I don't want to burn a DVD.  The 4GB size is just about perfect (although dvd-r's are 4.7 gb) for most tasks about the size of a dvd-r.I've used this stick for multiple applications including giving a finished video product to a client I suspected would not return their "preview" I gave them to look at on a stick.  Although I lost the stick, they won't be pressing dvd's from it (it's outside their ability set!) so I figure the stick will make it home someday when they want discs.I also use a few 32 GB sticks for large volume work, but with win7 and NTFS becomming picky above 4GB they are still usable.  Yes, you can format a data  device for ntfs - its not fun but it can be done and even made bootable.  Why waste your 32GB drives when a 4GB will work just fine?  keep a few hanging around to move drivers and misc data between systems.

A few years ago it was HDsomethingsomething.  Now HDMI is as common as VGA or yprpb.  I use it everywhere - and its not just for 1080-1920p 30hz video.  I run 1200x1920 @ 60hz on dual displays into my nvidia 590 card with HDMI cables just fine.  With dual displays comes dual cables.  If I want to connect an alternate input from, say, a tv tuner, then I might want a single display with an option to switch to video.As a prime backed product, you are getting two video cables for computer or video (blu ray, dvd, etc) that right now cost less than 8 bucks a piece.  Good deal on a good cable, and it includes soundnote of a nitplus on this - For people doing flush mounts on samsung type tvs these cables lack the round ferrite on both ends making flushmounting MUCH easier.

The OSPHF-ITW delay / sunset light is a highly functional (see the leviton cutsheets) option.  It handles 120-377 volts, which means they have sister products for 24 vac and 480 vac.Nitpick #1 - it would be nice to only have to stock ONE leviton sensor in my stockroom - a 24-480VAC model (or better yet for solar installs which are becomming more common a 12VDC,24VAC-480VAC combination unit).  If you wanted to cover 24VAC, 120-377VAC, and 480 VAC with one product you'd need 3 p/ns to put on your shelf in inventory.  That's 3 times the amount of inventory I'm willing to stock for a well made 1/2" nipple motion sensor to cut lighting costs.Cutting lighting costs is not an easy task - motion sensors alone don't often handle the whole problem.  What about contribution from natural light during the day?  Leviton did a good job incorporating a photosensor that would look for daytime lighting as well as night so that lights would not activate when ambient lighting was sufficicent and occupancy was there.  The product also does an excellent job of giving you multiple lenses and isleway shades that can be rotated to make circular sensitivity from a roof location, or have 20' x 60' isles.  With the rotation you can get alot of flexibility.Nitpick #2 - on most of my installs I look at the IP number (e.g. IP-65 IP-66 and others.  This would be an ip-00 - it has holes in the plastic case an exposed compoents for the photosensor.  It should only be used on indoor installs, while it's feature set is great for outdoor work.Leviton could have made a more professional device by just adding the outdoor ability.  I would have to enclose this in something to use it outside thus raising my cost and probably making the product not work as designed.In summary it could be improved by incorporating 12-60 VDC and 12-477 VAC as well as making it at least IP-65 or IP-66 rated.For climate controlled indoor lighting with windows its fine.

For those electricians not doing low voltage work and familiar with the leviton decora system, this is their low voltage equivalent.  In fact, they make a quickport plate that will go into a wall box and take up a decore slot allowing you to have power on one side and low voltage on the other (while you could cover this with a 4 opening decora cover, I'd recommend 2 separate boxes inside the wall so that you do not voilate any codes and have inspection problems!)Quickport allows you to stuff a box (literally) as full as you want with phone, ethernet (colored too!), fax (same as phone), antenna (rooftop type 75 ohm), CCTV (BNC barrels - female to female), and now we have the option of HDMI.I did take off one star due to pricepoint.  I bought a female to female HDMI connector here on amazon (even think it was a prime item) for $3.95 - that means the retail price on this has about $11 markup for the quickport compatibility.In the end however, while it adds to the job parts cost, it makes a professional view instead of a "bunch of cables to wall port" outlet with everything comming out of one tiny dryer vent looking connection.  If you have to lowbid a job - those parts tend to get used alot with splices like the 3.95 female to female hdmi.  For a multi million dollar home, quickport is the minimum you should use!

This product has some really nice features and has undergone recent redesign which is why I am updating the review.  Note that the included tripod is a promotional item now and not meant for this dolly (when I ordered mine they did not include the free tripod, but I spoke with the manufacturer who said it was a promo item).  Other redesigned features are the multiple leg grips.  The wheels are large and smooth running on flat surfaces, about like medical wheeled carts.  At 39 bucks instead of over a hundred its a great buy.Nice:  Everything is adjustable.Nice:  Wheels are big and smooth - the system folds up 2 of the 3 arms and had locking pegs that snap in/out to keep it that way.  It's as compact as it can get be and comes with a gear bag to fit.Nice:  Adapters to "grab" your tripod leg are adjustable in length from center and also in size of the tripod leg tip.Nice:  smooth rolling with the big wheels without setting up track or other professional systems.I was anxious to get it out of the box, which seemed a bit small on the porch, and I found 3 boxes - the amazon brown box with the swosh logo, a white inner box, and then a color printed box inside the white box. It was well protected in shipment at a time when many amazon shipments arrived damaged.  That tripple packaging is nice to see again at this pricepoint so you do not have to re-ship a bent or damaged product.Hope that helps - while it fits most midsize tripods, it is lacking an inch for a fully stabilized Manfrotto 190CXPRO3 3-Section Pro Carbon Fiber Tripod without Head which is called a 3 section tripod, but that means 1 section is permanently part of the tripod and 2 more drop out - that's why I call it a 2 section  - you only have to adjust down 2 quick release pieces.  I don't consider the permanent piece at the top a "section" since it sets the fixed angles you can adjust to - all the way down to 90 degree splits if you want, but manfrotto's locked angles are too rigid to use with this dolly.  One size larger would fit.

I wrote the review below these 3 nitpicks and one nice feature were discovered in the actual install.  (the review was based on our choice of cameras from all the available models and features, plus compatibility with our NAS and thus was anticipated - what really happened deserves a second mention)  While no major changes, there are a few gotchas we felt worth mentioning after the project was running.  The 3 nitpicks are in ascending order of severity.  I've taken photos of 1 and 2 and can upload them after I finish playing with the new toy.The camera is now running on the public net at camera dot uwave dot com.  If you would like a guest tour, look me up in the reviewers page and email me for a login.Nitpick 1 - the USB jack is designed for their wireless version and while all other connectors go out the "back" of the camera, the usb plug has a permanent right angle so it goes "up" (if the camera sits on a table, then it is up - on a ceiling it would be down).Nitpick 2 - the cutsheet showed the nice screw connector array that is common on alarm equipment to hookup external alarm inputs and use the units' outputs - we've seen this on alot of products.  Tha actual product used a heavy metal funky connector (that could be a song title for geeks) that you can not find the mate to it anywhere.  I was a tad irritated because our choice of this camera was partiallly based on how easy it would be to add a PIR motion sensor.  The 12VDC, 2A supply does have a 3 pin green connector like I mentioned (if you want to use 24 vac from a transformer, you use the center and opposite unused pin from the 12V DC side - this allows both ac (from a transformer) or dc operation - nicely done and not a real nitpick there but they should have used the same connector for the I/O ability!Nitpick 3 is probably the most serious--------------------------------------They advertise that you will be able to see your images on your iphone or android smartphones.  As I have one I thought this would be great.  Well not quite.Actually you can download the FREE software to make it work.  Inside the carton there is an activation code.  DONT LOOSE IT.  Also, it expires in 12 months from when you activate it.  As we had not planned on using this feature as our NAS does it natively its not a big deal, however I would have liked it if they said "free 1 year subscription to handheld phone software" which would have been much more honest.  I may dock them one star for this gimick.  (BTW the boxes come with seals on both edges to make sure they have not been opened and had the license removed - otherwise you gotta buy it)  After evaluating our NAS's viewer and the custom viewer/ptz controller for the camera, it's worth having their custom app for your phone.  I'd like to have it for more than 12 months though.A note on power - this comes in an external power and POE  version with differing prices. For those inquiring minds - I will check pins 4,5 and 7,8 on the connector after it is powered up (we bought the external power supply instead of POE) to see if there is any difference other than the connector.  I seem to recall the POE models cost more and did not come with a poe insterter so you had to have a hub - don't quote me on that as prices vary as to included kit contents.Pleasantry:  They included a 5 foot network cable in the box.  That will get us through testing but is not long enough for final planned installation location.(review below was written from the cut sheet of the product and the plans and approvals of our NAS - a synology DS1511+ Synology DiskStation 5-Bay (Diskless) Scalable Network Attached Storage DS1511+ (Black) which comes with a free POE license.  After the unit finally arrived we got a chance to do the installation.  At least synology's POE camera license is good for 1 unit FOREVER and does not expire in a year!Old CCTV systems usually relied on power line 24VAC - 60 hz power - to synchonize all cameras to the 30 line video siglal(or 25 hz if overseas).  Next came DVRs which used a 1/2 to 1 TB disk to store CIF level images on disk for 4-16 cameras at 30 fps.  Now with just an ethernet cat5e cable and plug you can send hdtv quality digitial images instead of the old signals we've grown accustomed to with interferance and fuzzy resolution.  This model supports IR illumination for 0lux visibility and has multiple internet connectivity (to NAS raid arrays, to a PC with a hard disk array, or to a smart phone / tablet) with the added plus you get notified right away and you can steer the PTZ only when necessary - this also cuts down the wear on the parts compared with the outdated NTSC cameras that did a "patrol" watching separate spots for a given time, then moving to the next one in a predictable pattern.  With some of the high MP (5-10 megapixel) cameras and fisheye lenses you can "patrol" with zero moving parts just by selecting which pixels get read from the sensor, then correcting for the lens aberation.  Axis makes a sophisticated model that amazon sells with this ability - ptz and no moving parts to wear out.  This model is much less expensive yet still has ptz (pan 340 degrees, tilt, and a small zoom)Compro has brought alot of features to an indoor camera (ptz, IR, alarms, cell phone, etc) at a very low price point.  I'll put some snapshots up after I get it wired into my nas and working.  I use a Synology DiskStation 5-Bay (Diskless) Scalable Network Attached Storage DS1511+ (Black) with 3TB x 5 drives for 15 TB internally.  It also accepts the alarm video feed from the camera and records it to disk with phenominal length of recording depending on how many frames / second you want to capture.  The system even captures sound and can deliver sound with the custom software!Previously with CCTV you had to run a separate coax line for a microphone, and typically the DVR would only accept a line level input so you had to have a mic to line amplifier plus a microphone for every camera.  Doing this digitally accepts a mic level input - but you must put your own speaker on the speaker output 3.5mm plug.  With the configuration software there are virtually an infinate number of configurations of the camera, along with up to 63 more units.  The synology 1511+ Synology DiskStation 5-Bay (Diskless) Scalable Network Attached Storage DS1511+ (Black) will talk to the camera directly without a pc in between running their software which is helpful in environments where you dont want to leave a pc running all the time but want 24x7 camera coverage.On the cons side,The sound quality is not quite as good as the old cctv unit, but it also digitally stored the audio so its really a tradeoff.  One part I did not like is that you get a pink and light green jack for mic/speaker - which means you need an amplified speaker and a microphone with a 3.5 mm jack to use it.You need to decide if you want a wallwart powering your camera, or if you want to power it with POE (different models)The old CCTV systems cameras were generally more vandal resistant than this is but given a big enough baseball bat you'll break either one.On the pros side,The picture size and quality of the digital system is far superior to the old 540 line (best!) CCTV analog system.  You can get 720 lines in one resolution, and some cameras support 1080P full HD.  Anyone with a nice HD TV would really appreciate the HDTV quality.With POE installation there is only one cord - it carries power into the camera and data out of the camera to the monitoring station and storage array. (POE units have a P at the end of the p/n)sound is carried over the data line (but see cons above)with a well engineered configuration all you will need is a camera and an ethernet cable to install it (assuming it is run from a POE hub) saving the extra wiring cost ofsumary:-------Digital surveilance cameras such as the IP540 create sharper end results which have much more detailed results and are easier to install on NAS or PCs/Apples.  As an added benefit, installing a surveilance camera is no more difficult than plugging something into the network (esp if you have a POE network port).

The decision of a SR90 or SR92 (2200 lm vs 1700 lm  - but 1 emitter vs 3) is tough.The factors I considered before settling on the SR92 versus the SR90 were:1 - failure modes.  If the single emitter in the BEAUTIFULLY focused SR90 were to fail - then thats it - no light at all.  At least a single failure in the 92 gives you 2/3 lights working2 - price.  The 90 is almost $80 more, but MUCH better focused (to the point the air lights up) - the 1700 will do that too, but for people who want a wide beamspread to the side it's the better choice - for people who want one bright spot in the center, then the 90 is the only way to go.They were having a sale at the place I purchased mine for december - buy a light and get as many battery packs (handles) as you want for 30 bucks ea.  That's alot better than $110 which is why I did not purchase it from amazon.  Otherwise there seems to be some price fixing with about 5% leeway.  Had amazon done the 30 buck handle deal I would have bought it here instead.3 - 18650 cell - I've absolutely fallen in love with this battery since it came out in some of the cheap $10 led single light units.  I quickly bought the fenix TK30 Fenix TK30 630 Lumen LED Flashlight which is a pleasure to charge with just 2 18650 cells and runs forever with the ~9-10V output from the 2 18650 cells stacked feeding the digital regulator.  In fact I think the TK30 was the light that finally drove battery mfgrs to make button topped 18650's.  At the same time the 3000 mah (3AH!) 18650 came out from ultrafire which make the tk30 a long time performer.Now O-Light uses 6 ea of the 18650 cells, but instead of the 3000 mah cell they are using the 2200 mah (cheap) cell and housing them in the handle which changes as a single unit.  For $60 I bought TWO extra handles on their december sale, which gives me 3 total with the one that came with the light.  That handle has 6.6 AH at 7.4 Volts, almost 49 watt hours!Basically if you want pros/cons there are plenty of bothPros:the 1700 lm is well distributed across a broad areathe 6 cell 18650 pack is swapped as a single unit saving time (same for 90 and 92)the 92 is a tad smaller giving a more compact unit with no lack of total outputIf one LED fails, 2 of the 3 will still work in "limp home" modeWeighs a little less than the 90's huge focusing headConsthe spread out beam is not nearly as concentrated in the center as the -90's tightly focused beambattery packs are the same (a wash) (but the 30 buck sale is just december)it's Just Not the brightest light out there, but still plenty brightEvensBattery packs are the same 90 vs 92digital regulator is the same (pushes to get modes, etc) 90 vs 92Personally, with the drop in the handle price and the less expensive head, it crossed my threshold of buying ANOTHER light, with 2 backup battery packs.  As always personal factors are the most important in buying these things - I like the fact I can charge a handle / battery while off the head and use another one - it's one of olights' neat features I appreciate.  If you must have the brightest throw forget this and buy the -90 head with 2200 lm and a nice tight spot.  I'm just not confident enough yet to put all my lights in one basket with the heat dissipated in that single led chip in the -90.  If it dies, alot of $ go down the drain.

The Axis Q19 series cameras use an uncooled system of thermal detectors arranged in a 384x288 array.  While this is nowhere near the high resolutions possible with HD POE IP cameras, the picture (black and white) is unaffected by day/night/smoke as it is purely based on thermal data.  This camera should not be thought of as a method of identification (facial, license plates, etc) but rather detecting movement.  All people will appear the same since the human body is roughly the same temperature.  Against a background that is a different temperature, people stand out, as do vehicles with hot exhaust and engines or machinery in operation.In a well designed security system using digital cameras, the Q19 offers the ability to DETECT motion over a wide area while other more conventional IP cameras can be used to identify faces or license plates with high definition optical systems.  In effect, the Q19 is used as a trigger to record the output from multiple other cameras.  In this role, it is best ordered with the 10 degree lens which gives you the widest field of view.  While long distances can be monitored with the 60 degree lens, no identifying features will ever be made out, so the longer telephoto lenses are just giving you the ability to detect movement at 3000 feet, if your job requires it (e.g. boarder patrol systems)Most conventional usage with the 10 degree lens over a wide area would use the reliable thermal images from the Q19 camera to detect motion and start recording data from multiple other conventional IP cams inside its field of view.  This triggering ability can be configured in the IP monitoring and logging software.  Essentially the Q19 is a motion detector covering a large area if equipped with the 10 degree lens option, and the other cameras are positioned within the q19's field of view, up close with higher definitions and color feeds to give identification.  Each motion event from the Q19 can cause 4-6 IP cams to record their sectors during the event giving usable pictures of what happened.Don't expect to identify one person from another with this camera as all people look the same in a thermal image.  Teaming it with a well layed out IP cam system and software will yield at least one IP stream of color HD data that can clearly make out the person or vehicle that entered monitored space.  In designing the Q19's position, it needs to be behind all other cameras that record high quality video when the Q19 senses motion - the 10 degree lens will cover a wide area.  The Q19 is immune to falling leaves, insects, and other moving objects that are at the same temperature as the background - this makes it an ideal camera to reduce the number of false alarms, e.g. from moving tree branches near a roadway.  It will only sense motion on the vehicles or people.Although the Q19 is still an expensive IP camera, it's price and feature set are still far better than previous thermal options only 3 years old, which would run 30K USD or more.  Teamed with the proper software and storage it dramatically reduces the false alarm problems with regular IP camera systems and saves disk space with fewer events recorded in a day.  This is a special purpose product designed to be part of a complete IP camera system (see example images in pictures)

Xantrex is most noted for their INVERTERS - changing DC power into AC sine or pseudo-sine wave 110/220 volt output.  Xantrex also makes a nice line of 12/24 volt high amperage chargers for those batteries that need a charge after providing 110VAC for beach parties, portable DJ work, and tailgate use, among other applications like power tool operation etc.Xantrex uses a switch mode charger which is A) efficient, B) Quiet, and C) gets the job done fast with 60 amps of charge current.  Most car batery chargers in this price line are only 7 amps or so and take forever to recharge a deep cycle battery.One note, however,  be sure that you have enough batteries in parallel to split the load amongst them.  If you had for example, a 12V, 80AH, single cell battery - this charger would recharge at a rate of 0.8 C - not healthy for long lasting cells.  If you parallel 10 ea of the same 80 amp hour batteries, you would only deliver 13.3333 Amp to each battery making a twice as fast as the 7 AH charger and maintain the efficiency.  Plus this charger would not boil off the electrolyte - a common problem with wet cell storage.  Besides, 10 x 80 amp hour batteries would make a great ballast for your boat!just dont try to pump 60 amps into a single battery and you'll be fine!

I use the rca to TR all the time on my mixer to go to powered speakers or do send/returns.  This is just a basic stereo set at 6.5 feet that has no hum even though single ended (non differential).I really like hosa's build quality and heavy duty cables.  Never a bit of hum even on the single end <> differential mixer connections.I use a 25' version made by another company and they are just as good going to speakers, however these are laminated making for a convenient cable set.for the price and cable quality I've never gone wrong with hosa.  Try a set - the price is right ahd the quiet sound.  I'm really impressed.

These adapters with a 20 or 25 foot hdmi male male cable give you the means to extend oddballs like the 3 foot micro hdmi for droid phones to full size hdmi to reach the tv set from the a/v adapter and charger and sound and usb output device motorola makes for the bionic.The odd thing is I waited this long to buy one!  I've tried to use hdmi proper length cables to prevent the need for the adapter, but its integral to the hdmi system.  Don't run your hdmi too far and things will be OK in the digital domain.  I bought a 25 foot optical cable to extend my sound on fiber to where I need it also - that worked out very well.Anyhow not alot to say here except they are well made and do the trick.  If you want to make a 25foot oddball hdmi to regular hdmi then extend it 25 feet - this is how to do it and have signal at the end - note some oddballs dont always have sound but most do  I had one without sound and had to get the optical extension instead)

funny thing about UV light - it breaks down the DNA/RNA in bacteria for sterilization and imparts energy from the light to nullify viruses.  It does the same thing to the surrounding holder - and there isn't a UV-PROOF plastic that can take a year's worth of exposure before breakdown (where water squirts out of the crack in the plastic making a big mess)So if your SYSTEM came with a plastic uv light holder - watch out! someday the plastic will fail and you'll have RO water (at least it is clean) running all over the place.But if your inside of the holder shows signs of yellowing or discoloration at the time of relamping (yearly for most of this size UV system) consider just replacing  your plastic housing, bulb, and ballast that came with the unit with a new one.  They plug right in and you don't need to be a plumber to insert the tubing.Stainless steel is unaffected by uv exposure and should last for years!

To understand this review you must know a simple thing about injection molded plastic parts.  Virgin plastic pellets are always the best source material, they are heated up to melting then a plunger squirts a needed volume into a mold through a channel while forcing the air out a hole at the back.Knock off the piece of plastic that was the input channel and the whole for air to escape and you have your part.Those wasted pieces go via a vacuum tube off to the regrind system and are chipped up into, well, chips that resemble the virgin pelets used to make the part.  Only these chips are not virgin, they have been melted once. Good mfgrs make the best parts from all virgin material, but that is not cost effective.  NON-OEM (aftermarket) mfrgs take the regrind chips and mix in some percentage of regrind with virgin pelets to make a lower grade of plastic.  In the end it all works, but customers of those products may notice an off-taste to the water through the plastic filter?  Why?  Every time the plastic is melted oils come out to the surface, and eventually they make it into the water - after 20 gallons of washwater the aftermarket will taste the same as the OEM filter does with virgin plastic and just 1/2  - 1 gallon of washwater.Some people can not even detect the taste, so for them aftermarket filters can lead to 40% savings.  Others can taste the difference (even the appearance is visually different from the regrind in plastics)Buying a 2 pack saves some money - not 40% by any means, but since my dad and I use the same filter, and at about the same rate, we buy the factory OEM filters by the 2 pack for savings and good taste.There are many more factors in doing injection molding I've left out - oils, release agents, FDA approved material being chosen overseas, etc - but it all plays into the part price and overall quality in the end.  It's a personal choice one must make.  I hope this helps - google "injection molding" regrind for more information about strength and other factors.

3M never ceases to amaze me.  The M's are Minnesota Mining & Manufacturing.  So many of their products were products set out to be superior yet became inferior.  Take the post it restickable adhesive.  It was originally supposed to be a super strong spray adhesive with permanent setup!  Whoops.  Didn't hit the target with that one, but sprayed on a strip of paper and made into a pad it becane the POST IT we know today.Who knows how the command adhesive came about - a puddy based adhesive that allwed you to pull on the strip to remove it and replace it (if you kept it clean of dust where you used it, i.e. wipedown before application will extend the usefullness.I am amazed at the strength that command offers - the harder you pull the stronger it grabs on after an initial setup period.  And If I want to reloacte it - pull slowly on the bottom tab until it releases and its reusable.I may never know if command was an accidental puddy paste designed to stick forever or if they designed it to release "on command" - obviously MMM is not going to say "another screwup that works better doing something else from our clever marketing department!"  I'm betting command was designed for its purpose - it just works too well and holds on too strong.  I seriously doubt it was a mixup - probably designed to work this way from way one.It's great on the front door, in he kithcen , and the bath - just be sure to clean the application location so you can reuse it later and everything will be happy.

I've used roller cutters and fixed blade cutters before but this one really just worked well.  My wife and I had to make notes for our photos online to include in the thankyou notes that we handwrote to all our guests and I guess there is nothing more fustrating than writing [...] over and over and then telling them to click on the album and choose to download it or use the slideshow builtin.  besides that not everyone had a computer, so it would not be prudent to do it universally by hand.It might be etiquite faux pax but we included a slip of paper with the preprinted instructions to view the WONDERFUl photos we got (all 980 of them) from my on site business server.Making the slips involved cutting a page with the phrase pasted several times across and down into little pieces that could be dropped in to the thankyou note- the swingline smartcut did the job with no complaints even as the paper got 8 sheets thick in places to do the final cut.We also used it on some of the invites and some cards we had to stik into letters that needed a quick trim.Using the product we found that the production rate went up fast with two people using it - one person would lock down the paper and say go, the other person would slide the cutter upon hearing the word go.  We sliced through alot in no time.Overall, I'm very happy with this compared to the smaller 11x8 sizes from xacto that I have bought and used.  Xacto did not use a rotary blade but went with a poker sharp point on both sides - great for the first few usages bit after that  a new blade would sure cut better.  The swingline design is more like scissors with a moving cutting edge, so the wear is distributed over a longer area.  Besides that its huge!

My only nitpick with these is they are a tad too small, and not being a rubbery foam, they do not conform really on the first insertion, where they take on their shape and size.  I do wish I had longer units to put on to my ear speakers so that they could conform to my ear cannal, but as only the very tip conforms, i was having a hard time re-inserting them.  The problem seemed to be that I did not always insert my speakers the same rotation, and as a result I would crush the charcoal foam a second time rendering it, well, with no memory of the canal size and shape...If they were 3/8" longer and continued the taper they have today, then the product would really rock.  On first insertion I found they got the seal I wanted but a gentle tug and a haphazard re-insertion meant that they got deformed.These would be ideal for people with latex or foam rubber allergies or for people who prefer the rigid properties of the carbon foam.  I'd be in that group - but want them 3/8" longer to get my taper of the canal and then I'd be REALLY happy.  As they stand now all 3 sets included in the package are the same size, so its basically 3 chances to get it right and learn that there is not the "memory" concept found in other products like this.I may take some of the roll up earplugs from the range next time and carefully drill a 1/8 sound hole through the center, then adhere them to the speakers with some rubber cement and finally squeeze them down, push them in and let them expand.  I dont do this today because my shooting "ears" have an electronic impulse noise cutter and an ambient sound amplifier or attenuator that I can use to speak to the person next to me even if large caliber handguns are going off  - you loose a few sylables here and there but you get the message across without loud noises.  It would be relaxing to listen to music on my phone before a contest with ears over the top of these and my ear speakers inside.I think the product has some further development to make it perfect - but overall I liked the material and if made in a longer size i'd buy them for use.  I'd also mark an up orientation bump so I could find out which way is up if they fall out.  That would be easy to do if made longer - just squeze a bump into them.I hope that helps explain why they do not fit my deep ears..  Keep in mind that the sound tube extends 3/16 of an inch into the carbon foam so that part is useless leaving you with only the very end tips with are too small.I plan to add this product to my watched products and see if it changes over the next year.

The evga 480 gave you 3 outputs - 2 by dvi and a thin little opening for a hdmi-mini connector.  I bought this to use that 3rd port and after a  year of strain on the hdmi-m it broke and I had to weight down the cable to get a bend that would make connection or else suffer green lines in the picture from bad attachment if pushed straight on into the card.Finally I had it with the deal and noticed that the evga 590 EVGA GeForce GTX 590 Classified 3072 MB GDDR5 PCI Express 2.0 3DVI/Mini-Display Port SLI Ready Limited Lifetime Warranty Graphics Card, 03G-P3-1596-AR used the more robust displayport connector instead.  I'm much happier with the display port design for longevity and the lifetime warrantee from evga than the hdmi-mini port I had before on my evga 480 card.  besides, now I get 4 monitors instead of 3.

for a long time we have had some color standards.  blue meant analog 15 pin d sub 9 vga, white meant digital dvi, black was anyones guess as to how the ends were wired, etc.This complies with the white = dvi digital rule.  It works great on my evga 590 card EVGA GeForce GTX 590 Classified 3072 MB GDDR5 PCI Express 2.0 3DVI/Mini-Display Port SLI Ready Limited Lifetime Warranty Graphics Card, 03G-P3-1596-AR to hookup to one of my 4 monitors (the 590 has a display port and 3x dvi connectors on its dual housing)Strange though that if you leave the 6 foot size the colors change - I wish they would keep white/white when making a dvi to dvi cable. that's a personal nitpick - nothing wrong with cables to go - I just like white to identify DVI.

i've been using the d31 blue top for a long time now and noticed the price on the  yellow top dropped.  Optima says the blue is for deep cycle trolling motor use while yellow is for deep cycle and starting use  - however I have it on good authority from optima that the d31m marine battery is the same inside both the blue and yellow tops, so if the yellow is cheaper today, I'll buy it instead!

I was about to buy an HP toner cartridge (black) for my 1518NI printer when all the reviews warned that the single packs were knockoff problem cartridges that had been re-assembled and refilled with the wrong toner for the 1518ni's color system.  I wanted genuine Hewlett Packard toner, but a good price at the same time.Answer?  Buy 2 and save that way.  I'm always using alot of black on my 1518NI because with the N suffix it's on the (N)etwork.  Now I have 2 REAL HP toner's in black for my printer.Be real careful about those refills - they can ruin a perfect printer in no time at all - i've seen it all too often servicing prniters.  People try to save 10 dolars on toner and end up with a $200 repair bill to send to china for a refund (yea right like they will ever get it)

On my mixer, I have send/returns on the same plug using a 3 wire TRS with send on the tip, return on the ring, and a common ground.  But my effects boxes like to have separate 1/4" TR ins and outs.This is the perfect cable for just such a hookup of things like the behringer shark Behringer Shark FBQ100 Automatic Feedback Destroyer to the 1202-vlZ3's send/returns Mackie 1202-VLZ3 12-Ch. Compact Recording/SR MixerI probably will order a second cable having seen how well the first one worked out on a send/return.

I have probably close to a dozen hosa adapter cables by now - and they are top notch quality cable.  These are just as good, it just happened that my only 1/4 TR to 1/4 TR male to male connectors were 25 feet long and mono (separated meant to make the run from the mixer to the amped speaker) - well I use speakon connectors for that anyways.  I've been using the coiled up 25' lines too long to patch in a device on my mixer and finally broke down to buy a set of these.  At 6.5 feet they are ideal for interconnecting 1/4 TR devices to my stereo inpus on the mixer.  And being a dual cable they don't get tangled into a mess.  Finally hosa's lable on the plugs for left/right keeps all in order instead of mixing up the same color black cables meant to head to speakers.I'm glad to have purchased this set - now I have a more complete pathcord kit for audio mixing.  Hosa's quality stands head and anltlers above the rest.

Basically this product looked like an absolute win in regards to what my niece loves to play with, and she truly was excited when she opened the package and pulled out the Yummy Nummies Mini Kitchen Playset.  And what's more is that the fun and excitement didn't really end there.  She immediately zoomed in and opened the box, pulling out the small playset, with the dropper tubes for the drink flavors, the flavor packets, the three little cups and three little straws, utensils, and in less than five minutes we had it set up, and she was already mixing her first batch.  But what came of the batch was totally gross.  I can't even pretend that it tasted decent, and after we both stared at the kind of goopy mixture, we pretty much dared each other to try it, which...in all honesty...turned into a riot of laughter for both of us, as we ended up getting the whole family involved in drinking the nasty little mixtures!  In the end, we opted to put soft drink and koolaid in the droppers, and she definitely had fun with that!!!  This was a very cheap product, so I don't expect much, and I didn't get much out of it, but my niece still loved the laughter of us daring each other to try the drinks, and ended up liking the set once we used a different drink source.

My husband absolutely loves watches, and loves one's that really go with his dress clothing, and the Invicta Men's Analog watch definitely fits the bill in that regard!  Upon opening the package, you're met with a finely packaged product that really does give off the feeling of a very expensive watch as it's boxed up nicely, and has the majority of all the bells and whistles that make up a good product.  The black color itself is spectacular with a black chain linked band, and so far, even wearing this to work, has proved no scratches yet, which is amazing in itself as my husband manages to get anything scratched in less than a few seconds.  The Invicta watch also came to us with the time set already, so we did not have to fiddle with the buttons on the side; however, it did come with instructions that were very clear on how to get all areas set and ready to go.  I will say the fit leaves a lot to be desired though, and my husband is not a small man in any regard, as he's 6'2 and 245 pounds, but this watch was still way too large for his wrist!  It just dangled all over when completely closed, so we ended up having to get links removed in order for him to fit it correctly.  Otherwise this is a really nice watch, that has so far withstood my husbands work environment, and yet, still provides functionality, form, and a class that speaks volumes.

This is the cutest toy ever!!!  I have a niece whose almost three years old, and couldn't decide what kind of toys she would be in as she loves everything her sister has, and seems to leave toys her age bracket sitting there.  But when I came across the My Little Pony Pinkie Pie remote control vehicle I knew she'd instantly love this, and I was right on target!The toy itself isn't that large at all, but it's so cute!  The colors really pop, and she loves all things pink, so this was perfect.  It comes with the instructions, the cute little butterfly remote control, two off brand batteries, and the vehicle with the pony on it.  We had the batteries in in record time, and as a side note I did purchase name brand batteries that we used instead so she'd have a longer play time with this toy.  She immediately started playing with the horses mane and tail, using her Barbie brush on it, but once we pressed a button and the wheels moved she freaked and attached the remote!  While very young, she definitely got the handle of the three button remote, and next thing we know, we had to be very careful where we stepped due to the little pony zooming around the living room and kitchen followed by a laughing two and a half year old!  Her older sister and cousin couldn't help themselves, and even they wanted to play with it, and started making "obstacles" that the little horse had to go around.The My Little Pony Remote Control vehicle was a huge hit with all of my nieces, and it seriously was one of the best toy's she received!

The Hallmark angel necklace is absolutely beautiful, and truly defines a faith or inspiration piece that anyone would be happy to have in their jewelry collection.  When you receive the package, it's nicely contained in a pretty deep purple box with the Hallmark logo on the front of it, and inside is a small drawstring pouch in off white, with the Hallmark logo on the bag.  Again the presentation of the actual piece is very nice, and speaks of quality.  Once opened the angel necklace is in a small plastic bag, and while not the best for gift giving I still love the fact that this plastic bag keeps the necklace chain tangle free, and also keeps the pendant piece as the first thing seen.The chain itself has a good clasp on it, and I have no fear that it would break or fall apart, and the length is perfect for falling below the collar bone.  The actual pendant itself is very sparkly, with small stones that flow around the outline of the angel.  The gold heart the angel holds is one smooth piece, and flows so well with the silver hue.  I also love that the pendant isn't horribly big, but just the right size to showcase what it is, as well as look amazing with any attire.I highly recommend this angel pendant, and it would seriously make the perfect gift!  I would, personally, take it out of the plastic pouch before gift giving, but again I do love that the first thing they would see when opening it is the angel itself.  It's definitely a beautiful piece of jewelry, and seems like it would keep for a number of years.

I searched high and low, and read multiple reviews on car seats before deciding on the Graco SnugRide Click Connect 35.  What I loved about this one is first of all the safety measures, the look, the quality, and the big winner was the fact that it was easy to unlock it from the base and go.  My husband and I already had an expensive name brand travel system given to us very early on by a family member so the thought of getting a new one wasn't in our minds.  However, now that our daughter is almost here we took it out of storage, and much to our horror the beautiful gift turned into a nightmare when we tried putting it together. I won't go into long detail, but let's just say it had a little too many parts, it was very heavy, there was no padding, and we struggled with trying to unlock it from the base as well as connect it to the stroller.  So needless to say we decided to go in a different direction, and that's when I started really hunting down a good car seat.Upon opening the package, I was truly amazed at the quality of the Graco SnugRide.  From looking at the super expensive one to the Graco, I was seriously stunned that this car seat looked that great just out of the box!  You can easily tell this wasn't something thrown together, but thought over, and the end result is something that I am very happy about.  The canopy works easily, just a tug to get it up or down, again great quality, the handle itself has a nice grey rubber grip, and the car seat as a whole feels very sturdy in my grip as well as light.  The boot is a wonderful addition since I'll be having my child during the cold season, and it comes off easily, but stays on perfectly.  The insert is beautiful in appearance, but I could see where I would need a better head support as it's not as fluffy, and I could imagine her little head flopping a little bit.  All the belts were easy to maneuver in and out of the slits provided, and they were also easy for us to unlock.  The big red button on the front of the base is where you can make sure your car seat is level, and I really did appreciate the level indicator as it was on point, precise, and easy to read and understand.  This car seat also includes a silver latch that is used in vehicles to help literally latch it in, and it was a breeze for us to put the base into the vehicle.  Once we got the car seat into the vehicle I pressed the red lever in the back of the car seat, and it popped out just as easily as could be!!!  After fighting with the other car seat, this was such a blessing, and I knew we had made the right choice in our selection.I feel our daughter will be very safe in the Graco SnugRide, and I truly do love the quality of it!  I did purchase the Nyssa color, and there are two warning labels built into the top side of each above her head, but that doesn't distract any from the beauty of the car seat.  And the last thing that I truly love is the fact that this car seat can be combined with any of the Click Connect strollers.  I already have my eye on the Graco Modes Stroller, as I love the fact I can take the whole seat out of it, and click the car seat in it's place.  No need to put the car seat on the stroller tray, and it's all basically as described...just an easy click of a button to pull it out or put it back on as I've already looked at it in store.Again I truly do recommend this car seat, but if you are a new mom, and totally confused by all the choices, just remember one basic tidbit...your child will more than likely outgrow the car seat very quickly.  Some people opt for a larger car seat that goes from infancy to toddler, but I like the fact that I can take the car seat out of my car, click it into the stroller, and not have to disturb her.  I also have an infant to toddler car seat, but again, I like the simplicity of this, and she'll use the bigger car seat later in life.  With how tiny I am, I feel she'll be able to use this for a long while, and after owning two car seats (Graco not included), I still think this one has the best quality, safety, and is the better choice for my little girl.

I wanted something simple, and yet something that still invoked little girl for my newborn, and this set was right on target!  As there weren't many reviews I could find on this set, I went ahead and purchased a swatch of the materials, and quickly fell in love.  Upon receiving the set, I did get the three piece which includes a sheet, crib skirt, and the comforter, I was blown away by the sweet simplicity.  I do have a steamer, and managed to use it on the skirt to get the minimal wrinkles out of it, and after having it on her crib the rest of the wrinkles fell out in a short time frame.  As for the sheet itself, I washed it in baby detergent, and it came out fine before I placed it on the crib.  The sheet is very durable, with strong elastic, and while it does have a sheen I was worried about how silky it would be as I am having my child in the cold months.  Luckily the sheet does have a sheen, which makes it so pretty, but it also isn't thin at all.  It's pretty thick, and while it isn't cotton, I don't think I'll have any issues as it wasn't made up fully of true silky material or polyester.  The comforter is truly nice, and again I did pause before I bought this due to the netting that goes over the comforter.  But it's stitched on very well, and, again, looks great.  The underside is made up of a nice slightly fluffy material that shouldn't bother my little one's skin at all.  Currently I'll probably use the comforter more of a decoration than in actual use, as I can imagine cleaning spit up out of netting would be a hindrance, but, again, I don't see any issues with washing it.All that being said, the actual colors of this is not truly pink at all.  If you put a soft pink material up to this you will immediately notice that it's not the same color.  The pink on this three piece set is actually a soft peach color that has just a hint more of pink.  And while the skirting looks white, it completely isn't.  The hue is a soft cream color, not white.  I have a cherry wood crib and furniture, and the colors look great in her room.  I also did not use the curtains that you can purchase with this set, and opted for cream ruffled curtains that I purchased on Amazon, and it turned out beautifully!  I will order the bumper from another site, but in all the set looks beautiful.  I did notice some people commenting that the comforter doesn't feel great on the skin, but like I said, I will more than likely use it as decoration over the glider, or folded around the crib, and even if I would like to use it, I still feel that it would work just fine.

Even the cover of They All Fall Down looked so creepy that I knew I had to read this book pronto!  Especially after reading the synopsis, and for the most part it did deliver.They All Fall Down starts with our heroine Mackenzie who is just your average type typical girl next door, whose striving to get through school so she can get on to better things, such as college, to where the memory of her beloved brothers death, and split family might be a thing of the past.  But everything turns around when she finds out that she is part of the schools much anticipated "Hottie List."  A list that only has ten of the hottest girls in the school, and Kenzie is still struggling to figure out how she managed to land on it...that is until the ultimate hottie himself, Josh, rolls up to her with a wicked smile that melts her brain.  Figuring the list is stupid, but could put her in the vicinity of Mr. Hottie Kenzie just goes along with it.  That is until the girls start having accidents...accidents that can't be explained, and when deaths start to occur rumors fly of a curse on the girls on the hottie list.  And if that isn't unnerving enough to Kenzie the bad boy at school now has his eye on her too, and while her blood may run hot at the thought of Josh, it's absolutely an inferno when Levi looks at her.  But all these thoughts go flying out of her head once the girls numbers start to dissipate, and she realizes she's next.  It's up to her and her loyal friends to help figure this mystery out before her time is up.This book truly had so much going for it!  Great characters that you rallied for, and each supporting character had a great personality that matched their actions, and were totally believable.  The main character was written well, and the plot was very good!  I love a great mystery, and this book really did hold my attention until the end.  The love interest wasn't actually bad at all, and I liked how it was written.  There was no true insta-love here, and I enjoyed that immensely!  I get so sick of that or a total love triangle, but Kenzie knew exactly what she wanted, and wasn't afraid to go for it, and yet, she understood some things needed to wait as the death of the girls on the list was more important, so the author did a great job there giving Kenzie a logical head.  That being said...the ending.  Wow.  I didn't see it going there at all, and it did get cheesy for me.  Totally cheesy.  Was it still a great read? Yes.  It truly was.  It had me on edge trying to see if it was a curse of it someone was behind all these deaths, and then how the other clues could fit in to the rest of it.  And I really did not see this going in the direction it took.  Which were all great things.  However, the end was just way too silly for me, and the author left the end open for a series.  I wont' give the ending away, but if you are expecting ghostly encounters, look elsewhere than They All Fall Down.  With all that being said, I still do recommend reading this book as it did have a lot of the elements I love, with a mystery thrown in, a little romance, adventure, and a girl who will try her hardest to kick butt or think herself out of a situation, plus a great set of characters.  The ending sucked, but it's just because I was waiting for a ghostly ending or someone who wanted revenge.  Even without that element and the weird line it took it was still a great book!

The Wrangler Women's Denim Jacket was exactly as described! This jacket is a darker wash, which I love, and has pockets, something else that I find a lot of other denim jackets do not offer. I'm always carrying something, and pockets are my dear friends, so I'm excited to have that luxury in this jacket.  As for the look, it truly looks great, very stylish with long sleeves, collar, silver buttons, and pretty stitching.  I also adore the fact that this jacket, while it will definitely protect my skin from cooler weather, is still so light!  The weight is barely there, and the jacket itself is so soft that it feels like a blanket for your skin!  It is long sleeves, but again, it's so soft and super light, that it's a breeze to fold up the sleeves to mid length. No issues there at all, and once you do roll the sleeves up, they stay all day!  No slippage at all.  I am a very short and tiny female, so I will say if you are super tiny, think extra small, the small still won't fit as well as it would on someone who is a true small. I'm currently eight months pregnant so it fits fine, but I know that after I have my child it will look a little large on me.  Otherwise, this is a great jacket, super chic, and I highly recommend it!

The Gypsy Ruffled Panel curtains are absolutely stunning!  I was a little cautious after reading some of the reviews, but went ahead and purchased them for our baby's nursery room.  I ordered the cream color, and a lot of people were saying these were more white, and I really needed cream to match her crib skirting, and I was so happy when I got these in!  I ordered two panels to cover her window, and as a side note we do have blinds up as these are sheer, and they worked perfectly!  Not only were they the same color as her crib skirt, again totally cream colored, not white, they were both the same size, with no loose threads or pulled threads.  I immediately put them up as I got home, and used a steamer to get out the wrinkles.  I did purchase the 84 length panels, and they fell to the floor exactly as pictured, and looked just like the picture (again, the picture shows more white than cream, but I assure you my panels were cream colored.)  The only thing I did not know before purchasing is that the material isn't fully smooth.  I don't exactly know how to come out and describe it, but the whole curtain has a texture to it versus a smooth fabric.  It still looks great, and from the short distance from the door to the curtains in her bedroom you honestly can't tell unless you're farther into the room.  I actually like the texture, and everyone who has seen my curtains seriously thought I spent a lot of money on them!  The ruffles are full, perfectly even from one panel to the other, and they have really tied her room together!  They're gorgeous and I totally recommend them!!

We live out in the country, and have beautiful trees surrounding our home...beautiful trees that love to shed their leaves on the house, in the gravel drive, and basically everywhere.  Raking is almost laughable, and our drive, and pretty much the whole yard is covered in loose crumbled leaves that love to stick to the soles of your shoes.  Which means my house, no matter if all shoes are properly left in the mud room, somehow ends up having little leaf pieces strewn about leaving me with a vacuum that almost always stays out.  I've tried numerous rugs, but even the strong bristled rugs can't seem to manage to keep the leaves on the rug and not on my floor.  It's so bad I have a rug on the outside steps before you walk in, and in the mudroom, still to avail.  So this time around I used the DII Industrial rug, and let me say this rug is very big, which I liked as more people can use it at once, and there's a larger area to stomp or rub your shoes on.  My husband put this outside to see if it would help, and after using it for a few days I've noticed an immense decrease in foliage in my house!!  Finally!!  The rug itself is more a deep blue/grey color with zig zag lines through it, and it's actually soft.  So soft that I scoffed at first that it was going to be one of those useless rugs.  Little did I realize the fibers seem to cling to the leaves on your shoes leaving my house almost fully leaf free!  My husband even moved the rug to the top step as our top step is very wide, and the grip on bottom has proven wonderful as it hasn't moved an inch, even with all the shoe rubbing before entering the house.  My inside rug is now nice and pretty without the additional leaves all over it, and my floors are staying clean for once.  This rug is definitely worth it, and we're already considering buying another one for the front door.

This is definitely one handy, and beautiful espresso machine!  The red color truly pops in any kitchen, and it's a breeze to use!  Upon opening the package, I found the espresso machine to be fully and well packaged into the box, and there is literally no set up with this!  Everything is already done, and the only thing you would need to do before using is do a dummy batch of water through the system filtering any dirt or debris out of it.  The package also includes a manual, an order form plus shows the various espresso cups they have for purchase, 16 espresso cups, and it's supposed to have a milk frothier. Mine did not have one included at all, and that was a huge disappointment especially considering the cost of such a device.  As for using the espresso machine, again, that is highly easy to do.  Although I will say before use, I did take off the back water area, and washed it before we filled it with water.  Once we filled the tank up we put a large cup down, and I do love that there is a small area for a little cup that can be pushed up so a larger cup can sit on the bottom.  Once our large cup was in place, we easily rotated the silver button to put the max amount of water through it, and we waited a second while for the blinking light to stay on.  Once that was done all you need to do is push the button, and it heats up in seconds!!  I thought it would take a minute or so like our Keurig, but this bad boy was in literal seconds!  And talk about a steaming cup!  Wow!  The espresso is super hot when it's finished!  Once my husband and I finished pushing water through it (we did this three times), we were ready to go and brew our first cup of espresso!  I pulled down the little cup stand, got our cup ready, and pulled the lever up to open a small area on the top of the device where the cup goes in.  Unlike a Keurig the cup goes sideways, and I pressed the lever down, which closes the little area, and I put the silver dial on the setting I wanted, waited for the light to stop blinking, and then pressed the button in the middle of the silver dial.  Viola!  Instant espresso!  I love how it has a draining tray for those just in case spills, and the pure quality of this machine is perfect.  It's heavy, feels highly durable, and the espresso is delicious!  This is definitely a great buy for all those caffeine loving people, and, again, I truly do recommend it!

I found that the Pantene Pro-V Weekly Rehab Creme works as it says.  It made my hair super silky, it did feel revitalized, it was definitely smoother than it normally is when I finish blow drying my hair.  In fact, I didn't even have to flat iron my hair it was so super straight.  But let me tell you about my hair before you make a snappy decision.  My hair is definitely long, reaching down to the middle of my back, layered all over from razored bangs to the sides being tapered, and my hair is also crazy straight.  But also crazy frizzy.  This is most likely a lovely combination of my heritage (Spanish, French, etc. so I do have a mix of wiry hair mixed in with super fine strands), the humid weather I live in, and the fact that I have to wash and dry my hair every morning which has damaged it.  Not to mention I do highlight my hair, and that has also helped the damage along.  So I thought I'd give this weekly creme a try to see if it could help my ends any keep my frizz at minimum.  And it actually worked!  After drying my hair it was definitely soft, smooth, and silky.  But unfortunately for me it was also unmanageable, as the creme made it so silky and fine that it didn't want to stay up, curl, or do anything but lay flat.  And I'm one of those people who need volume.  The totally flat look just doesn't do it for me.  I tried sprucing it up some, but my bangs were having none of it, and just fell flatly in my eye's instead of doing a cute swoop.  I eventually had to clip them up on one side to even make it look presentable.  And if you ask me how long does the product work, well let me start by reiterating that I do wash my hair every day, and I'm on day five after using the product, and my hair is still softer than it normally is.  The only thing I need to flat iron at the moment is just my ends. I do believe I will continue to use this product, but only on my ends, and not once a week, but perhaps once every two weeks, as it really does work, and makes my ends softer than they usually are.  However, if you do have fine hair, then I don't truly recommend it unless you have products that really help add volume.  Otherwise you will be left with super flat hair that sticks to your head.

The quality of this dress is superb, and even after just a day on a hanger the few wrinkles that were in it fell out with ease.  I'm a 5'2 adult, weighing a whopping 93 pounds, and went with an XS, which is my normal size; however I am three months pregnant.  So I have a small bump, but nothing major.  That being said, yes this dress was too long for me, but most things are, and I just wore four inch wedges, and that did the trick since I got this to wear at work on even flooring.  It does almost drag the floor even with the wedges, but I'll probably hem it later as I have to do with most of my clothes.  As for the fit, it was great, with the crochet area hitting exactly where it should, and it looks amazing.  The slit is pretty high, and I can imagine if someone was the proper height for the dress that it would show a lot of thigh.  As it is, on my short frame, the slit does come up higher than I like,especially for work purposes, about mid thigh, and I'll probably sew a few little threads to get the slit a little shorter.  I can still easily wear a strapless bra with this, and it can't be seen so the arm areas, and around the back are all very secure and not so showy.  I did read other reviewers who said you need to be stick straight to wear this, and this truly is point on.  Yes, I'm pregnant, but I barely have a baby bump, and my hips are still about the same size as before (I wear a 00 in  American Eagle...although I can't button my pants anymore. :0) )  and the dress was just a smidgen snug on my hips.  Once I got the material past my hips it was fine though, and I had excess room to maneuver, and it wasn't tight at all.  Very easy to sit, and move around. The dress also is not see through at all, and has two layers of material, the top layer being the pretty crinkle sheer material, while the material underneath is a smooth black that feels great to the touch.  I truly love this dress as it's easy to wear, looks great no matter the setting, work, party, an outing, beach wear it's highly versatile and comfortable! Due to the hip area being a bit snug, if you are pear shaped, you definitely want to go with a bigger size, but beware the top portion might not fit as designed.

Talk about a shocker when I opened the package!  This beautiful tennis bracelet looked pretty online, but in actually looking at it in person you'll be blown away by it's sparkling gems!!  This tennis bracelet is housed in Amazon's normal packaging, which includes a nicely designed dark blue box that opens with a little blue tab to reveal the actual black box that the bracelet is housed in.  Upon opening this box, you'll find the bracelet nestled within the two grooves that hold it secure.  The bracelet itself is pure stunning as I truly did not expect the opal hearts to glisten like they do!  It's like someone poured glitter in them!  They sparkle and shine in any light!  The actual clasp is one I've always loved, and felt to be highly secure where it locks into place first by pushing one side of the clasp into the other, and then on each side there is a small area that comes down to latch on to a tiny ball.  Again, it is highly secure, and I don't feel like it would accidentally come off.  The silver that encompasses the bracelet is Rhodium plated, which I am very sensitive to nickel, but I haven't found any issues with wearing this bracelet in skin sensitivity.  The only issue I honestly have is I have very skinny wrists so I have to be careful the bracelet doesn't accidentally slip off when my hand is down, but I have this issue with almost every bracelet.  Otherwise this opal tennis bracelet is a stunning gift, and every female at my work has asked where I've gotten it from as they all love the sparkle deep within the opal!  This is definitely one of my go to pieces now!

I love the Avent bottles, as every one I have bought seems to all work as directed, and has helped my child during feedings.  The Philips Avent Classic Plus bottles for babies three months or older is definitely among the best out there for babies in this age range.  For starters these unique bottles have a concentrated air flow valve which helps so much in preventing gas, less burping, and helps to reduce colic.  In using these bottles I have found that my little one has a lot less gas than previously, which is great!  The nipples on this bottle are also designed for babies around the three month age range, and have an awesome little air valve in each one.  When my child is drinking, I find there are no issues at all, and burping afterwards is not the process it once was.  These bottles are also easy to clean, and they truly work great!!  I definitely recommend them as I find they do not spill, close easily, are durable, and work just like it's described!

The Evenflo Convertible Car Seat is definitely made up of great quality material for a low cost, which is something everyone is looking for.  It's a great size, with enough room for small babies to toddlers, and I love the fact that it is fully padded, and seems to be highly comfortable for baby.  It does include an adjustable harness, which is great depending on the height of your child, and even the padding for the head can be lowered and is fully adjustable.  It also comes with a massively padded insert for smaller babies, and works pretty well.  I did find that it is pretty floppy on the sides, and not 100% stable for the babies head.  But it still works as it should.  The only thing I found relatively misleading is that I thought it would be able to recline, but it does not.  Which means it doesn't fully meet my needs yet as my child is still a baby, and it needs to recline.  And don't get me wrong, the car seat can recline up to a point, but not the recline that I thought it would be.  It's more manual in that regard.  And also, if you have an infant, you definitely want a carrier that comes out of the vehicle easily with the baby inside while he or she is still sleeping.  Otherwise you'd have to carry an additional car seat or bassinet style stroller while out and about.  So I would totally give this 3 1/2 stars for an infant to baby use.  Now for a toddler, this is actually quite perfect!  I found the headrest that is already connected in the seat to be great, still a little floppy on the sides, but nothing horrible.  It's durable, cleans easily, and I feel my child is totally safe!  As for moving this car seat around, I am a tiny female, and find that it is a little difficult for me to move it around.  Another feature I love is that the car seat, while it doesn't have a built in drink holder, did come with a little travel cup holder that fold up easily.  This was a cute little feature, although I do wish it had one built into it.  And lastly, I did order the blue color, and wound up with a tan/black color instead.  It still works for my purposes, but I thought that was odd considering there are only two colors on the actual website, blue or red.

My husband is avid into sports, from fishing to hunting, and loves to workout, which means a lot of running outside.  He's been complaining lately though that the sunglasses he currently had kept slipping down on his runs, and ultimately hurt the bridge of his nose after long periods of time.  So when I saw the Under Armour sunglasses, I thought this would be perfect for him, and it truly is!  These glasses, for starters, are the perfect shade for outdoor activities!  Not only do they cut the glare tremendously (I know because I stole them for a little while, while I worked outside in the yard), but they aren't so hideously dark that you can't see where you're going.  They are the perfect color, giving a bit of a yellow cast that still enables a person to see clearly, effectively, and yet helps sensitive eyes out tremendously by cutting glare. There also is no frame under the glasses, which I find helps out on seeing everything clearly also.As for the fit...I have never seen a pair of glasses fit my husband so exquisitely! The description read that it has rubberized grips on the frame area that goes above your ears, and I kept thinking that really rubberized silicone type material, but that is so not the case!  The rubber is rubber, yes, but it doesn't feel rubberized in the lest.  In fact it feels more like a hard plastic, yet has the flexibility of rubber.  There are also little grooves in the rubber like material along the inner sides that would help to conform the glasses to your head as well as provide airflow.  In the inside of the glasses, there is also another square type rubberized piece of material that fits on the bridge of your nose so the glasses do not fit flat on your face.  These ridges help secure the glasses to his face, while also providing a good amount of airflow from between his eye's and the glasses.  Our weather get's highly hot, even around Spring time, and yet he has had no trouble running in these as they do not slip at all, nor has sweating caused an issue with the glasses or his eye's.  And the factor he does love the most is the upside down glasses on the hat.  He wears a hat all the time, and it's very easy for him to place it on his head, so it doesn't accidentally get crumpled in his pocket or hooked on his shirt. We've also found the Under Armour glasses to be pretty darn durable, as he did accidentally drop them (by hooking them in his shirt), onto hard concrete, and there was no damage whatsoever.  And he is a tall man, 6'3, so it definitely fell from a good distance.And lastly, the overall look of these glasses is fantastic, and I found, after a few family members "had" to try them on, looked good on everyone!  It's a basic design, but has so much flair that you can tell immediately they are made of great quality material, and will last a good long while.  They're perfect for exercising, and any outdoor sport activity, and I definitely recommend them as well as want a pair of my own!

I've been eyeing Panic for a while now, as I loved Oliver's Delirium series, but kept seeing the reviews that were so/so.  In the end I decided to go for it as I do love her style of writing, and I had a free credit for an audio book.  (FYI, Sarah Drew does fab on narrating if anyone chooses to listen versus read the book.)Panic definitely is something different.  It focuses on Heather, and her small group of friends that mainly consist of her best friend Natalie, a new friend/ally Dodge, and Bishop, her other best friend whom she's also secretly in love with.  Not to mention there are a slew of other characters that help set the tone for the book. But Panic, to Heather and her friends, is a game that is played by Senior's in a series of anonymous texts, calls, and messages for the duration of the summer all for a huge lump sum of money for the winner, or last one left standing.  Heather always thought the games were stupid, but in a sudden rush she joins in alongside Natalie.  And soon it's only will that makes her stay, and the drive to win the money to help her take care of her little sister.  But in order to get to the end Heather will have to learn to rely on her instincts, learn to trust more, and especially to trust in herself.Again, I am glad I did read this book, but the ending!!!  I felt like I waited forever to finally see how it ends, and when it happens it's over and done with in barely a few pages!  Yes, explanations are given all the way around so there is no cliff hanger and everything is nice and neat and tidy, but the fact that the ending was very anticlimactic really put a damper on the book.  The characters were all written well, and I liked how we were able to see Heather grow in maturity, but some of the other characters actually put me off. Natalie was rude a lot of the time, and I didn't like her demeanor at all.  She was very weak, and should never have made it in the games in the first place.  Dodge was even wishy washy as his motives weren't great, and while there was an ending, it just didn't really clear everything out about Dodge.  Did he forgive the guy?  I mean, what happened with that?  I did like Bishop's characters, and of course a few other secondary characters as well, and as for the plot it truly was good. I can even see how a dangerous game would be played, and kept secret from adults, meaning the plot wasn't horribly farfetched. I did enjoy it, I just wish the ending would've answered a few more questions, and perhaps been drawn out a little more than it was.

I had some very severe misgivings about this device as I know tons of people who have had something similar, and it didn't get such a great response.  In fact, more of them opted to use a regular curling iron or hair straightner versus a three in one heating tool.  But I love to curl my long board straight hair, and it just takes so long to do it in the mornings that I decided to give it a go.And I am so happy I did!  For starters I have long layered hair that's incredibly oily, which means I wash it every morning before work.  That being said once I finish blow drying my hair does resemble a frizzy poodle (because seriously, who in their right mind has the time to dry section by section salon style?). On top of all this my hair is super baby fine, loves to get tangled, and I mean rat's nest tangled in less than five seconds with minimal head movement, and it's thinish.  Which also means I hate using the tangle free sprays (such as It's a Ten) as it normally makes my hair stick to my face with no volume at all. And let's not forget the fact that I am horrible at fixing hair.  But with this InStyler Max with two way rotating iron, I am seriously the queen of hairstyles right now.The InStyler comes in nice packaging, with everything tidied away in their own little plastic baggies.  It comes with the rotating iron, a plastic barrel guard that easily clicks into place (for all those of us with butterfingers), instruction manual, small heat shielding mat that you can lay the tool on, wide comb with separator on the end for easily separating hair, and a little nib that goes on top of the barrel.  The InStyler tool itself is made up of two parts.  One side features the rotating barrel, and below the barrel towards the bottom is the power button, and above that is an area that glows.  You press the power button once for max heat, and three more times for lower settings.  The next time you press the power button, it turns the device off. That being said the instructions are pure useless.  They show you little diagrams, and I ended up looking online for different uses.  I also followed along with the InStyler off so I could first get a feel of how to curl or straighten my hair.Once that was done, I was ready, and put it on the lowest setting.  In my first try I decided to straighten, and literally had about five minutes before I had to leave for work.
